We booked this room at the last minute because we decided to stay an extra day.  This is what I would call CLASSIC Las Vegas!  Definitely old Hollywood Glitz and Awesome!!!  When we arrived we paid extra for VIP treatment...which essentially consisted of bottled water, roasted peanuts and M&M's.  Granted it was an easier checkin there wasn't anything major that made it worth the additional expense.  Then we get to the FIRST room.  There are no robes as stated on the website.  So then we go to use the bathroom and find what I can only assume is puke or fecal matter all over the bottom of the outside of the tub...OMG DISGUSTING!!!!!!!!  Seriously I was horrified!!!!!!!  Then we go to log on to the WIFI which was spotty at best and find out there is a freakin $12.99 charge PER DEVICE!!!!!!!!  WTF are you joking?!?!?!?!  So we go back down to VIP checkin and show the woman pictures of the craziness we found in the room and she is unable to upgrade us to a suite so she discounted our room rate to $30 and gave us a new room!  Awesome right?!?!?!  Well yeah til we got in the SECOND room and there is GUM on the wall!!!!!  What the actual F????  We go back down and the woman apologized but really didn't seem all that concerned with our problem.  We were able to find a cleaning woman who removed the gum for us but seriously....this place needs to have a serious chat with the cleaning staff here!!!!  Overall the beds were comfortable and the experience wasn't heinous.  It is right on Freemont Street which was AWESOME and a perfect way to end our trip!  My experience at the Nugget ended with a FABULOUS SURPRISE...when we went to check out using the TV in our room our bill was - $ .58....so basically the comped the room!!!  They really did go the extra mile to try and make up for some of the issues we had!  If you are looking for a place to crash, this place is perfect...it is stumbling distance from all the action and for the most part a great place to stay as long as you can get past some of the cleaning problems or get them to fix it for you.

I love this hotel. I usually stay in the Gold Rush Club. The rooms are VIP and you need a card to access the floor. The room is spacious. The King bed is large. There is a         safe and mini fridge in the room. I am not big on gambling but I enjoy the downtown scene it just enough drama for me.  

Room service is not good. The food is always dry\/overcooked.  I had leftovers in the fridge from the oyster bar but there was no where to warm it up.

Golden Nugget Casino:

Right in the heart f the Freemont Street Experience and it adds in to the feeling of Old Las Vegas. The decor was old and so was the crowd but that kept out the drunk crazy young people that paraded the boulevard and casinos. We had a great time at the roulette table with our dealer, Kai.

OK hotel. good location. great deal. we got $37 rate on thurs. $62 fri\/sat. cheaper w\/ AAA or AARP.

fremont st light show is cool. room nice size, but shower handle was hard to turn on & off. room service took our towels, soap & didn't replace. don't drink coffee-its $10 charge yet hard to read. 

font desk service was good. valet parking never answers phone, yet they say to call 1st.

The Golden Nugget Hotel has an issue with the toilets in most of the rooms in the facility. When a man sits down, his junk floats in the water. A call to the maintenance department to report this problem got the following information. We've had this problem for two years, ever since we installed the new lowflowI'm mop water flushing systems in the toilets. These devices are not adjustable, and the water level is to high because the bowls are to small. It appears they do not get enough complaints for management to fix this issue. Their solution to solve this problem is to provide any complainers a custom made seat riser. It is a riser made for handicapped or disabled people complete with arm rests. By the way heavy set people may not fit in this seat. Otherwise be sure to bring a towel to dry off with.

I had to stay in Vegas for one night, traveling for a freelance work project. I generally loathe everything Vegas stands for, so I searched for the cheapest casino that wouldn't leave me with bed bugs or worse. The Golden Nugget was a surprisingly good value. My room was clean and tasteful. The center pool\/shark tank made for an interesting scene at night. And I won $102 on the first dollar I gambled. I won't be coming back unless I have to, but for a night in Vegas, you could do a lot worse than the Golden Nugget.

our stay was great! hadn't been to fremont street in many, many years. had this visual of the golden nugget from moons ago, expecting a cheesy hotel, but it was pretty cool and more modern, definitely planning on staying here the next time we're in Vegas. 

cons:
- shuttle drops you off at a side location and you're greeted by what you think is someone that will check you in, but it has nothing to do with check in, it's a time share spiel. 
- there are many time share people throughout the hotel casino that are constantly wanting you to stop and talk with them. 
- the carson rooms are unfortunately not the nicer renovated rooms, so the tub would occasionally get clogged and the room overall looked outdated and sections of the carpet were wet (wtf?)
- the carson room we stayed in has a view of the street, where there is a pretty big parking lot, where chris daughtry decided to have a really loud concert for what seemed like 20 hours! (maybe 2.5 - 3). 

pros: 
- really big hotel
- 2 starbucks in the hotel, plus claim jumper, and many other nice restaurants, including vic & anthony's steakhouse 
- on Fremont Street, which is pretty awesome
- huge 3 (or 4) level pool, centered around a shark tank!
- lounge area with live music that has a pretty fun environment 
- casino is full, but never crowded enough that you can't walk around 
- felt like we never had to leave the hotel if we didn't want to, as we really did have everything there
- there's a spa, although I didn't have a chance to use it, it's nice to know that it's there

Best beds in Vegas!! Good rooms, affordable pricing, free parking, friendly staff, and a great location. 
Normally we have always stayed on the strip when in Vegas, and yes off-course, the Strip has to be experienced, but fact is, that downtown Las Vegas is much more lively, and you totally get an "bar street" experience that the strip simply didn't have. : )

Last time I was at this hotel is when Michael Jackson was still black! That's right, back in the late 80s! To my recollection, nothing new has really happened to this hotel besides a 2nd floor which is where the buffet is at now.

The Tank makes this place, without it, I surely would have nothing else to do during the day in vegas.  To me, vegas is full of wasted energy, resources and space.

Grateful I was staying here.  A clutch note ** If the main deck is full, there is a sun deck open to the public on deck three, you do not have to pay for the lounge chairs there.
If it's REALLY hot out, a nice place to hang out is behind the water fall or in the "grotto" section of the pool.  There are also "seats" on either side of the tube exit to hang at.

My only complaint was on my last evening, the pool was closed for "cleaning" - obviously somebody dropped the pooper... not cool.
Not too keen on allow babies in the pool with diaper bathing suits either.

This was our third staycation and we decided to stay in Freemont this time. We chose Golden Nugget for the pool. The pool it self was small, but it does have the tank in the middle of it. It's nearly impossible to find a chair during the day, never mind needing two in a row for your family. 

We stayed in the golden tower. The room was ok. It had a musky smell in it. More than likely it use to be a smoking room but isn't any more. The beds weren't the best.  The a\/c barely kept the room at a desirable temperature. The bathroom was your standard hotel bathroom. It was clean and had granite counter tops. The room did have a nice big flat screen tv, but not a lot of channels offered. It was a good stay, but we probably wouldn't stay here again.

I had the worst experience while I stayed at this hotel. They are not in the business of customer service , more like making customers miserable. Upon arrival we waited for over 20 minutes just to check in . Why ? I don't know because there was 3 people standing behind the desk not doing anything while 2 associates checked people in. We booked a king size bed and were given a 2 full size . When telling the girl that we booked the king the only answer she could give us is that THEY over booked and she could only offer the other more expensive room with NO discount. We paid more and the room was nice but again an unexpected expense . Onto the WORST part of our trip ...... Lyft and Uber are the way to go when getting around in Vegas! It's cheaper , nicer and faster. Taxis hate lyft because you can get it so cheap. Worst part ? Hotels are getting money from the Taxi company's to make it almost impossible to use lyft . We were getting ready to leave for the airport and had all of our bags (HEAVY bags) we were standing at the main entrance and the men working the front door said we had to walk to the OTHER side of the hotel because we couldn't get picked up from lyft there. That's a joke. Something needs to change with lyft and the hotels are the hotels are going to lose out on great customers . I will NEVER stay at the golden nugget again for that experience !

If your high school friends force you to stay in downtown Vegas, then this is the place. Decent rooms, fun pool and nice tables\/poker. Crowd is definitely less attractive\/hip than on the Strip but much cheaper overall.

Bad, bad, bad experience! We were in Las Vegas 10 years ago, the Golden Nugget had been remodeled and was incredible. It is obvious not much has been spent on maintaining this hotel or casino. It was difficult to find electric outlets in room outside of the bathroom. The ONLY wall plug was behind the bed!  Lighting was minimal, as the corner lamp wasn't plugged in due to no electric plug in the area. Housekeeping didn't changed the sheets, even after we requested it during our 3 day stay. And the worst part of hotel, valet initially couldn't find our rental car. After 45 minutes and having to involve hotel management and security, our rental car arrives with a broken windshield!!! Loss prevention is suppose to be contacting us the next business day. DONT STAY HERE!!

Stayed at GN for a weekend visit with my GF.  This hotel is terrible with even worse service. They advertise free valet but we could not get in as they were full And ended up parking in Bridger St lot 3 blocks away. Management just gave us some lame excuse but no real help. The room was nice but slightly dated. No refrigerator microwave. And the room was not really clean.  We found dirty clothes in the couch cushions. Also got charged a Fremont charge. Would not stay here again.

We stayed at The Golden Nugget in July of 2017, and I cannot tell you how disappointed I was.  First of all, the room we had was advertised as a "suite" and it certainly wasn't!  It was a fairly large, outdated room with one smallish window overlooking the pool area.  The room was fairly clean, but very beaten up.  $169.00 during the week was WAY too much for this room.  We went to The Orleans to investigate wedding options for our daughter, and their rooms are head and shoulders above anything we saw at The Golden Nugget.  I think the biggest disappointment with our stay was I really feel we were deceived by the online photos and the advertisement as a suite.  We will not stay there again.

So let me start by saying this has been our go to Vegas hotel for years. Most of our family heads that way annually to blow off some steam and soak up some sun after our long Minnesota winter. I really have had some great times in this hotel. That being said it seems like with each passing year the customer service here slips a little more and the ways they use to get an extra dollar from you goes up more each year.

The VIP check in service is now only for customers who reserve a suite. If I was willing to pay the additional fee to check in early why in the world would they take that away? There is a daily fee if you would like a refrigerator in you room of $25.00. Wi-Fi you say $20.00 if you want that. Do you prefer not to get up at 8:00 in the morning to sit in a chair in the shade by the pool to make sure you have a spot for the day? Well then that will be anywhere from $35.00 to $300.00 a day (NO REFUNDS) for a chair, daybed or cabana rental.

Have a question or want to order room service? It's a crap shoot. You may get someone friendly and helpful or you may get (as we did several times) someone who really could not care less what you need. Several times I got the feeling that we were a major inconvenience when we called for room service.

Several of our party stayed in the Carson tower because, shame on us, we are smokers. I know filthy habit but for now that's the way it is. The rooms in this tower are just o.k. I don't think there has been any effort at all to modernize or update in a very long time. I realize it's not going to smell like a field of wildflowers or anything but geez talk about outdated. On top of that every time you head to you elevators you are zeroed in on by the people trying to sell you time share. These people are not at the Gold tower entrance and I have never seen them at the Rush tower. Apparently the smokers are the only ones who deserve this harassment. After the fifth or sixth time believe me it feels like harassment.

We rented a daybed for "four" people. Four people if you sit. Do not plan on laying down and catching rays. The circular bed will not fit four adults unless you sit. I knew this going in so not a big deal. Our waitress was there right away trying to push bottle service. I know it's their job but I do not need a $200.00 bottle of vodka and all the pop and water we want. After that the jumbo drinks were heavily pushed. We indicated that we would like the regular size drinks as the large ones tend to melt or get warm before they can be consumed. That should have been enough  but each and every time  we ordered another the larger more expensive drinks were pushed.

In general the service has gone way way down. The quality has gone down.  The prices on the other hand continue to climb. We have always been loyal to the Nugget as we have always had a lovely experience. The last few years however have not been anything special and the expense continues to rise. For the first time in many years I believe that our next family vacation we will be patronizing another establishment.

The ONLY place to stay in downtown Vegas.  Period! Just went under an almost complete remodel.  Rooms are fresh and spacey.  New pool is really neat (reminded me of the Maui resorts).  Fabulous. 

Casino is laid out well, and easy to navigate in.  Buffet is worth it, and other restaurants are of higher quality 

You can walk to the Fremont experience and see all of what you want to see in downtown Vegas from the Nugget.  

Search their website and other internet sites for great deals. This is definitely a 4 star hotel, and some great bargains for stay can be found at certain times in the year. 

Sure, its a long way from the Strip, but it seems to be more friendlier and cozy.  

Try it, you'll like it !

I'm an Uber driver. And I guess it's company policy for the bell hops at the front entrance to treat drivers like they are peons. 

I had a couple of riders that had a ton of luggage. It was enough luggage for them to need a luggage dolly. When I pulled up and got out to help unload, I noticed the bell hop wasn't noticing that they needed a cart so I spotted one and went over to bring it. Maybe it wasn't my job. Okay. But that's not the issue. The issue is this. When the bell hop saw me at the cart he came over and asked, "Are you the driver?" and I said, "yes." Then, here's the part where it all went south, he says to me in a super condescending, snarky way, "I got this." and gave me one of those pats on the shoulder.

I was just trying to help my riders, and help the bell hops as a matter of fact since they failed to notice the need for a luggage cart. So I said, "You don't have to be a dick, dude. I'm just trying to help." and he dismissed me by just saying, "Thank you." So I called him out for being an even bigger dick. And he kept on just dismissing me. 

All of this in front of their registered guests.

If i were his boss and I was what just happened, I'd fire that prick on the spot. I wouldn't want an arrogant bastard like that representing my organization. It speaks volumes about what kind of place the Golden Nugget is. I'll never suggest to any of my riders to visit that place.

I also tried to contact their customer service by phone, web chat and email. Nobody is taking complaints there. Crickets.

The Golden Nugget is a joke. The only reason it's not demolished is because they think they're nostalgic enough to be protected. But you're not. I hope they take a wrecking ball to that whole place.
Horrible service, was playing slots and the machine went down it took them well over and hour to get someone to the location, if you are going to be installing new machines so far away why do it.

The best hotel in downtown! Stayed here 3 years in a row every summer with my family and kids. I've stayed at gold tower and rush tower. Preferred rush tower, more quiet and their rush tower valet parking less crowded. As soon as you enter rush tower entrance the elevator is right there. I stayed at the junior suite , very roomy plus got a pool view (no extra charge).
Main reason staying here is the shark tank pool and water slide which the kids love!

This has to be one of the nicest hotels in the downtown area. I love the downtown area and all the excitement and the ability to get from one hotel to another without having to walk miles. You have all the great neighboring hotels and of course the Fremont Street Experience is just that, an experience. Want to take a picture with a couple of cute Show Girls or a 300 lbs man in a thong, you can do both. Lots of music on the street: some from established bands on the stages and some from individuals putting a had out for a couple of coins [bills but you get the jest].

If you don't want to go out the Golden Nugget stands on its own. They have great bars all across the property but my favorite is the Rush Bar. Great music and lots of people watching and intermingling. Drinks are very reasonable [around $10 or less]. Since we were very interested in MLB playoffs we went to the Cadillac Tequila Bar which has lots of TV's all on sporting events and got to see the playoffs.

The pool area is amazing with a slide that goes through an aquarium. There are black jack tables and more out in the pool area for your viewing, I mean, playing experience. We stayed in the Gold Tower so gaming area is right there with plenty of tables and slots.

Our room, which was on the 16th floor was phenomenal and coffee and fruit was put out every morning near the elevators. Our room was huge and we were happy to see that there is an extra level of security. If you want to get up to that floor, you have to swipe your room key in the elevator. 

Can't wait to come back.

We made reservations and received a great price for the Carson Tower.  Stephanie checked us in and was very friendly and helpful.  She upgraded us to the 9th floor of the Rush Tower which made us very happy.  Our family members were in one of the older rooms in the Carson Tower and said the room was just ok.  They were envious of our room.  It was a very nice room with a great soaking tub and a super comfortable bed!  We really enjoyed our dinner at the Grotto.

We only have two "cons:"  The casino is more smoky than most of the casinos on the strip.  Our room faced The Fremont Experience and there is no escaping the beat of the music in your room.  On Saturday night; the music didn't stop until 2pm.  The earplugs the hotel provides does help.  We would ask for a room on the other side next time.
The Golden Nugget is the ONLY place I would stay if I were staying downtown again.  The staff was very freindly, the commute to and from the strip was easy and the place looks great!

The 2nd most recognized and famous hotel in Old Vegas behind Binions. I've stayed here really in 3 stages in my life. As a kid my parents took my family here, as a freshly minted adult I came here and as a more mellow adult. 4 days 3 nights is a long time in Vegas. The hotel is nicely upgraded from how I remember it just 8 and 18 years ago. The newer rush tower has the nicer amenities, but the casino as a whole is nicely upgraded. The pool is open till 2 with tables, lounge, private cabana's and a slide that goes through their world famous aquarium. They now have a poker room that is pretty large and a club that plays top 40 for old couples and divey swamp donkeys. 

Pro's were price, nice upgrades like a Sushi restaurant, poker room, aquarium.

Con's were billing, room AC, housekeeping, TV.

Overall a good experience, a place that's a nice change of pace to the superficial, glitz and glam of the ultra modern super hotels of the strip.

The Golden Nugget is great!!!! We got to stay in the Rush Tower room and loved it. It was clean and convenient to the pool. 

The room was large in size, very nice bathroom. Our view wasn't that great but you can't win every time. The room was clean and decorated nicely. 

The Pool was AWESOME!!!!! There are sharks how much more could you want. I do wish that they would check on the Sharks a little more though some of them looked super sad. But there are plenty of chairs and the water is warm. I love the slide. 

We only ate at the little diner place which closes kinda early for vegas times and the only 24 hour restaurant that they have is the clam jumper which was weird. But at the little dinner place I got a quesadilla and my guy got a hot dog so it was cheap and tasty. 

The Gamblin was good. We love playing blackjack on the cheap and they have a couple of $5 tables but those close kinda late considering it is Vegas again. On the weekdays I think they close at midnight and on weekends at 2:30. 

The drinks at the bar were kinda pricey so, my guy would have me run over to the Fremont and get drinks which were almost half the price of Golden Nuggets cause the drink girls hardly ever came around when you were playing so. Hint Hint Golden Nugget drinks should be less and drink ladies there should be more. 

SO Overall pretty good I think we will stay there again in the near future.
Horrible!  Room is great but music from bands with massive bass rattles the windows until midnight on weekends. After driving 6+ hours no sleep tonight. Will NEVER stay here again!!

Third time we've stayed here and I do believe it has improved each time we stayed.  The people that staff the hotel and the Carson Street Cafe are very nice and while friendly, they are still very efficient.

Get a rental, stay downtown and visit the strip at your leisure, using the Valet service to save yourself from from all the walking.  Be sure to tip the Valets and any other Service personnel.  They exist  to make your visit more fun.

I love the golden nugget. I'm glad I had a good deal on the carson tower deluxe. I absolutely love the shark tank slide. the only thing was bummer is the shark tank slide i should have checked in a bit early to go on it, but next time i will come earlier.

The only reason I don't give this 5 stars is because of $10 per computer, per night wifi, the not so great spa, and the blah buffet.  The lack of resort fee makes up for the cost of wifi, but they really do need to upgrade their spa and buffet.  The room itself was wonderful and extremely reasonably priced.   I love the new trend of no bed spread, so everything on the bed is freshly washed.  The sheets were soft, and the bed very comfy.  The room was clean and spacious.  Love the pool.  The slide is super fun.   However, the jacuzzi is not hot enough and the jets were weak.  The massages at the spa were good, but the facilities need to be revamped.  Otherwise, what fun Freemont Street is these days!

Played a bit of slots and came out about even.  I'm pleased with that.

We stayed here in January and I thought I had written a review then but apparently not. I purchased a Groupon to stay at this hotel and the first night the air conditioning clanked super loud all night. My husband recorded it and showed it to the front desk. They didn't care. They told us they weren't sure if they would be able to move our room. We told them they had to since we didn't sleep all night and we had our kids with us. The TV had problems as well and maintenance had to come out. Every interaction we had with staff was rude. The manager in the buffet was walking through the food area typing on her phone and never looked up. She almost bumped into a couple of people. The staff doesn't move out of guests way at all.The buffet was HORRIBLE for breakfast.When I spoke the manager he didn't care.  I wrote an e-mail and have never received response. However when I informed Groupon about our experience they refunded me. I was shocked and not expecting that at all. Groupon rocks but Golden Nugget stinks! I will definitely be staying somewhere else next time.
Golden Nugget have a beautiful salon and spa.  If you are in Vegas and need an awesome stylist, ask for Sally!  I wait to get my haircut and style if I know I am heading to Las Vegas.

For the location and price the Nugget is a good deal. My family and I have been coming here since the Tank pool opened. But this year we encountered some really bad service. I can't even put in words how disappointing our trip was this year. Three people using very poor common sense can ruin a trip real fast. Luckily it was then end of our trip anyway so we only lost one night. I'm not gonna lie we loved the Nugget up until this year. It is a nice casino and has a nice pool but for me that's just not enough. I need to be treated with a little respect. And this time we most definitely weren't. All the free rooms in the world can't make up for poor customer service. Customer service is the life line of any good business. I do want to mention that the majority of the Nugget staff are friendly and do a great job. But a few apples is too many and can spoil the whole bunch. I'd consider staying there again but it would have to be super cheap room.

EDIT2: They charged my card AGAIN. I have now been charged four times for a one night stay. I've put a charge block on my card. Here's the saga on Vegas Chatter: http:\/\/www.vegaschatter.com\/story\/2012\/9\/4\/162713\/3521\/vegas-travel\/If+You+Stay+At+Golden+Nugget%2C+Keep+An+Eye+On+Your+Credit+Card+Statements

EDIT: So, I'm fresh back from my stay this weekend and here's the rest of the story.

A representative from The Golden Nugget called me on Friday and explained their billing software was not jiving well with AMEX and that's why the double charge again. He then told me I would receive $300 off the bill when I checked in.

Flash forward to Saturday (my check-in day) - my husband and I check-in with surly employees at the VIP lounge, go upstairs, have a lovely stay in our suite. 

Then we checked out this morning and THAT's where the issues come up.

The employee who checked me out informed me we were booked to stay until 9\/3. I replied to her that we had only booked one night. She then said, "Well, whoever booked this online booked two nights. If you want to check out today there will be a $50 early check-out fee."

I simply replied, "No." She did some typing and then, lo and behold, we didn't have to pay the fee anymore.

I am utterly AGHAST at the amount and degree of billing errors I have experienced in booking one night with The Golden Nugget. From reading other reviews here, I believe this to be a systemic and reoccurring issue in this casino and hotel. 

I'll be calling the number of the gentleman who promised me everything would be fine during my stay to alert him to this. Even though I received a reduced rate, I cannot in good conscience recommend anyone give these people their billing information.
________________________________________ 

I wish I could give this hotel NO stars. 

The Golden Nugget has now charged me $530 TWICE for a stay I haven't even HAD yet! Watch your credit card if you decide to give them any of your information. 

The first time was when I originally booked my stay in July. I noticed a duplicate charge on my AMEX and called them about it. I was informed they had double charged almost everyone that day and were working on getting people refunds.

They did refund me but then...

On August 27 (two days ago), I received ANOTHER CHARGE for $530 on my AMEX from The Golden Nugget, THIS time it was filed under "Specialty Retail," which a customer rep told me meant someone had charged my card in one of their shops. I haven't even stayed there yet, so this means someone has either taken down my info and used my card to charge something or they have a dangerous glitch in their accounting system.

I informed them of this and after more than 20 minutes on hold, I received NO apology, no compensation, nothing. They told me I have to talk to their accounting department. The hotel manager (Roxanne Yun) said they could do nothing for me and that she "had no knowledge" of the SECOND duplicate charge on my card.

Basically, they told me since it didn't show up on their screens (which, why would it? It's not attached to my reservation. It's a charge on my card from an unauthorized purchase in the gift shop.) it does not exist to them and they can do nothing for me.

I offered to send them statements, written instructions, etc. and she repeated to me that I would just have to talk to accounting. 

Again, I would not recommend you give these people your credit card information. I'm reporting them to the FTC tomorrow morning.

Stopped in for a drink at the Bar next to the Cashier Cage and to play some video poker.   It isn't much fun being ignored by the bartender who doesn't give a hoot about his job or the guests who sit at "his" bar.  (He must truly believe it is his bar the way he behaves while on duty!)    Three of us must have waited 10 minutes before he would even acknowledge us because he was busy chatting at the end of the bar not two steps from us with someone who already had drinks.  He walked by us three times at a turtle slow pace and still wouldn't glance at us purposely ignoring us.  Heard him mumbling and grumbling about his patrons in a disgraceful manner.  

I could go on but don't wish to bore you any longer.  The fact of the matter is...
I don't care to gamble at the Golden Nugget on Fremont ever again because of this terrible employee of theirs.

The Golden Nugget is my favorite hotel in Las Vegas.  It's the best bang for your buck.  I booked the room on Travelocity this time and even got the third night free.  Score!

The water slide through the shark pool is awesome.  I can't count how many times I flew down it.

The only thing keeping me from giving the Golden Nugget a solid 5 stars is the customer service is really lacking.  I don't even know why the concierge gets to have a "Concierge" sign in front of her because she's useless.  Can someone cough up a few hundred dollars and at least give her a computer so she can Google answers for us?

We LOVE staying at the Golden Nugget!  Spend the extra $ and do the VIP check in and stay in the Gold Tower...it is TOTALLY worth it.  Unless you enjoy standing in long lines to check in to the hotel, or lines to the buffet, etc., and less than amazing rooms.  Every morning there is hot coffee at the elevators, bottled water and snacks in the evening.  Right outside the hotel is the Fremont Street experience and a great venue to people watch, and all of the casinos are in close proximity to one another, which makes a difference when it's 100 plus degrees (try walking from casino to casino on the strip during the summer....you'll appreciate close proximity).  While it's not 'the strip' this is Iconic Las Vegas, and must be experienced just once or perhaps several times.

If you like having a stranger come into your room and steal your stuff then this is the place for you. Exhausted from our long road trip we drug our stuff into the hotel lobby from the valet parking area. As my husband gave the front desk our name for our reservations the lady asked for a CC number. We told her no this has all been pre-paid through his work. This is when our horrible weekend began. It took over 20 min to resolve the whole issue. Then we drug our bags through the crowded hotel to the Carson tower side of the hotel. We were suppose to have a suite but when we got in the room we realized it was just a cheap dirty standard room. We went out for an hour to go get food and when we got back we found that  my husband's tool with bag was gone. We reported it to the hotel staff. Just waiting for a resolution so I guess I'll write more later. I honestly dont expect much to happen since the only staff member that was nice to us was the security lady but I don't think she has much say as to how they will proceed with the investigation.

I didn't stay at the hotel, only went to the buffet.

All I can say is, It's bad when the best part of the buffet is the beverage.

Wake up service on phone didn't work - we almost missed our flight.
Had to wait 30mins just to get coffee at the breakfast buffet
Called desk to see when pool closed - they said 9pm - we went down at 7:30pm and they said 'no pool closes at 7pm'
Went to the blackjack table and some female asian dealer started shouting at my wife because our 14 yrd old was standing behind her at the table - turns out the dealer had been on a losing streak and decided to take it out on the players.
First hotel I've stayed in that you have to pay for coffee in the room.  Feels like cost cutting with total disregard for the customer. Disappointing.

I must say that I was very disappointed with the service in the casino area last night. I have visiting relatives in town and I was so excited to give them the "Fremont Experience", we encountered such rudeness at this casino. The waitresses completely ignored us and NO I did not imagine this! At some point I sat off to the side and just watched them either not come to my family members or walk by quickly and ever so softly say "drinks cocktails" so they couldn't hear. After actually flagging down a waitress she rudely told us to wait for the next waitress! WTF?! The way my nephew was spoken to by the dealer named Hue.....Let's just say I wouldn't talk to a dog that way! What? I know I should have gotten a manager right? Well tried that and was told "he's not answering his phone which is so unusual because we have to call if we need to take break" Wow! Needless to say we won't be patronizing this business anytime in the future unless I get a response from them after reaching out on their
 site. Stay tuned......

Check in was terrible right now. There was only one person working at the Rush Tower and were staying at the carson. The concierge was taking forever with this guy that had no reservations. And there was more than twenty of us standing in line. I hope the rest of our stay this weekend gets better. :(
Great location and loved the seafood buffet. I didn't understand the bottled water situation though.

Nice clean rooms, wonderful staff, beautiful aquariums in Chart House and at the pool. This place is a lot of fun and close to everything. Our room looked down onto Fremont Street Experience. Just an overall great experience here. We are locals and wanted a staycation and this was perfect! Happy hour at Chart House is a great deal plus dinner at Vic and Anthony's was amazing! The breakfast buffet was fantastic! Great price too for our room!

Love this place! People employed there couldn't be nicer; it's a fun place for the entire family.  Best hotel and casino in the entire USA.  Encourage anyone who is looking for a fabulous getaway vacation to consider and book the Golden Nugget.  You will not be disappointed!

Nice hotel outside. Pool is really nice. Casino is nice but the layout is so confusing. Checkin was so confusing. The tower you book your room is where you checkin. When we finally found our tower, the checkin was closed so we had to walk back to the front and checkin.

Room was horrible. I thought someone was staying in my room. The iron board was still out, an empty of water was on the desk, 2 of the Lamps didn't work. My room was next to the elevator and you can hear the elevators in the elevator shaft. The elevator closest to my room, you can hear the door open and people getting in and out. Not my idea of a nice hotel.
Truly disappointed with my recent stay. Do not spend your money at the horrible restaurants at the hotel. Best part of my trip was checking out. Wish I could give them 0 stars.

I was SO DISAPPOINTED on my recent visit.

I've been coming to this hotel for YEARS.  Always had great service.  This was my first stay back in 2 years and I couldn't believe how poor it was.

First of all, the wait to check it was so long.  There was hardly anyone in line but there was only 2 check-in counters.  Not to mention- what's the point in having a check-in desk near the Carson Tower if it's ALWAYS CLOSED.

Second of all, the check-in girl was SO RUDE.  We asked if there were any upgrades available and she flat out said no- didn't even bother looking in the computer and I know for a fact that this wasn't a busy weekend because I booked the room a few days before.

The worst thing about this recent visit was parking.  There was NO PARKING even for hotel guests.  I don't know what was going on but the parking structure didn't even bother to put up the sign "for hotel guests only" until it was too late.  Even worse was the attitude we got from everyone.  The parking attendant was incredibly rude and said in a matter-of-fact-tone, "well if you check the website, you'll see that parking isn't guaranteed."  REALLY!?!  My bf spent the next 45 minutes driving around to the 'recommended' alternative parking structures at Four Queens and Binions.  They got mad at him because GN told him to try to park over there.  In the end, we had to pay for parking over at the ghetto Plaza lot.  Please explain to me why I, a hotel guest, should have to drive around the block several times then pay for parking at another hotel.  What is up with that?!?!

In addition, the lady at the 24 Karat club gave me an attitude when I requested a replacement card.  Again, I haven't been here in 2 years!  Now I am seriously wondering why I bothered to stay at GN... I am so disappointed in the staff and service.  The casino is also smoky and cramped- the sports bar lacks decent seating.

The only plus [and reason why GN gets ONE star from me] is that the rooms are pretty clean and nice for what you pay for.  HOWEVER!!! our room had mold and rust in the bathroom.  Pretty gross.

Golden Nugget- what happened to you?!  I was going to have my next Vegas trip here and bring all my friends for the pool.  Now you're making me think I should go back to the strip.

You know Downtown has changed a lot and with it the old Golden Nugget has been able to keep up pace with the newer "branded" hotels. You can get class here even when in the trash of downtown and for cheap too!

Came here to see a Christmas concert and stayed in the Carson tower.  Even though the hotel was packed with people who were in town for the rodeo, service everywhere was pretty fast (check-in, breakfast buffet.)   Room was surprisingly quiet at night.  A nice touch was a tray of cookies left out for us with a card welcoming us back to the hotel.  The holiday décor around the hotel was fun and the atmosphere festive.  This is without a doubt my preferred hotel when staying downtown.

I don't want to sound like a pissed off customer as I am not. I would like this review to be honest relating to my recent stay.
I have stayed a few times over the years here and usually in the Gold Tower on the  "Gold Club Level"  as the extra privacy is always nice.
I rented 2 rooms as my daughter wanted to celebrate her birthday with friends.
Let me say, I see why they lost their 5 Star rating.
Worn and not even close to what it use to be.
The tub had built up calcium on the glass.the mirrors had the last renters tooth paste spattering on it. The bathroom mirror had a built in TV that had no reception. The  room TV speaker was distorted sounded like the speakers were blown. There seem to be red blood on one of the pillows too, maybe the maid cut their self and didn't realize it.
I see there rating was 4.1, not even close in my opinion. 
The next morning I asked to move to the new Rush Tower, Club Level. They did without hesitation. They did want to charge me $10 extra per room for the move. The $10 was not not the issue but I commented really? I asked if that made sense to them. They made a call to someone and did not charge me.
The rooms were fabulous. This was closer to what I expected. 
2 items to note, the maid had left her disposable gloves, they were on the sink in bathroom.
Also the caulk on the door of shower leaked when showering. Allot of water on the floor. More than a single towel could cleanup.
One last note, the pool. Most know their pool because of the unique slide through the shark tank. When I made the reservations I asked if the pool was open. They didn't mention the slide was broken. Closed....
One of the staff mentioned it discovered cracks in the slide tube in February. They thought it odd it still was not fixed. Well guess what that day construction started. Jack hammers and a flood of noise started 9am. We could only take it for an hour and left.
Avoid the pool until its done.

Cant beat $39 a night?  This is one of our fav "staycation" spots when we want to hit the town and not drive during our evening.  In the morning, relax at the pool and hit the waterslide a few times.  On busy weekends be sure to grab a spot early.

Worst vacation ever. I could write a book on how disappointing this experience was. From check in to the pool on to customer service. Not to mention the price of food and drinks. Even the dealers at the tables were rude! 45$ to rent a chaise lounge chair at the adult pool. I was ready to leave the day we got there, stayed hoping it would improve only got worse for the next 5 days. I will never go back!!! The most pleasant experience we had was with the valet.

Went to the Nugget over the passed weekend for a friends wedding and stayed to party...  

I never stayed here before, but was really surprised on how clean my room was for $39 a night.  When I was helping my friend check in they were cleaning her carpets, when I went to check in they just finished changing my filter on my a\/c...  Not to shabby of a room... I mean I had a huge flat screen TV, granite and tile bathroom..  I felt I should be paying more...   Plus all guest get access to an awesome pool area.  They have a live shark\/fish aquarium that has a water slide that goes right through it..  They offer lounge chairs, a hot tub, pool side bar, seriously what else can you ask for.  Yes the casino part is all old and ranky, but that's ol' Vegas baby.  
I did get to see the wedding chapel and for what my friend paid for her services it was a steal.  Very elegant and formal feel.  Also an after party was in a suite and can I tell you, I felt like I was walking in the Tony Montana's house in Scarface, really HOT!  The suite had a jacuzzi tube, double story loft vibe, dramatic curvy staircase,a steam shower, baday(I totally know I spelled that wrong, but whatever) , full party bar stocked with glasses, nice loud stereo totally staying there next time I go..  For reals though... don't pay the high prices on the strip, get a bargin and stay here.. I was really impressed.

I booked my room on orbitz. When I arrived, I upgraded to a better room for $15 per night. At that time they required my credit card, BIG MISTAKE! Reviewed my credit statement later and was billed for $130.99. I was confused because 15+15= $30. I called the accounts receivable department. Your only option is to leave a voicemail, so I did. Never heard back! Called again, nothing! Called the front desk, got connected with accounts receivable. At that point I learned about the $20. Per night resort fee, was not aware of this by booking on orbitz! Next, my card was used at claim jumper restaurant for $53. That's nice, cause I've never eaten there in my life! The guy says he'll look into it and call me back. 2 days go by, nothing! I call back again and talk to a manager, he won't help me with anything! The best he can do is connect me with claim jumper restaurant, I get voicemail, left a message, never heard back! This place is a FU####NG monopoly ran  organization that isn't interested in the slightest in helping its customers! I called my credit card company and reported Freud! Thanks golden nugget! And FU## YOU

Love, love, love this hotel!!! Great check in customer service, free upgrade for military personnel or if you ask at the right time :)
New rooms, modern hotel, clean, and smoke free rooms, along with free parking :)
The only 4+ star hotel on the Fremont st experience, with a great price!
Pretty nice room for fifty bucks.  Didn't get to use the pool... it was too cold.  Would rather stay here than the Fitz ("D")

I have never stayed at this hotel. We always stay at the 4 Queens for free. My husband and I like to gamble and it doesn't seem like your points add up to much at the Nugget. The 4 Queens always comps our rooms and food, even free dinner at Hugo's! The Nugget is pretty inside, and their casino floor is clean. But I think something should be said about the employees. They ALL hate being there! I asked one older bartender who is always so grumpy if he liked working there and his response was a loud "I used too!" I don't know what happened after the remodel, but all the old timers still working at the Nugget after like, 20 years, are miserable. I feel bad for them. it says a lot about a place when they treat their employees badly. The 4 Queens have awesome bartenders that greet you with a handshake, a smile, and they always remember your drink even if you haven't been there in months!

Never Again!  Been going to this hotel for the past few years and just got home after celebrating St Patrick's day and the NCAA tournaments.  First off, upon arrival the hotel including the manager at checkin did not honor the package deal we bought on two rooms from Southwest Vacations.com. So disappointing and I will be contacting SWA on Monday morning.  He was so rude and offered rollaway beds after we paid full price.  Just like the other person who reviewed on here the wifi did not work, their were hidden charges upon check out, and it used to be the gem of downtown but no longer.  The Carson tower was dingy, old, noisey, and they are rude including the manager at room reservations, also the server at the Grotto restaurant.  I will never stay here again, I'm spreading the word you can be treated much better at other downtown hotels and casinos.  Do not stay here there are other places who will respectfully treat you as a customer should be treated.

BED BUGS!!!
I have been coming here for 20 years and used to love this place. I have been getting comped for ever and that has been great.  But what just happened gave me the creeps!

I just stayed in the Carson tower here over the last week and on the second day my friend woke up ravaged by bed bugs. He has bites on his arms, legs and fingers.  Gross!!

We called downstairs and they sent security up like we had done something wrong. We had to fill out a report and take pictures. If we wanted to move rooms they wanted to inspect the room and move us to another room. They wouldn't tell us how long it would take or even if we would end up getting a new room. They said they would give us new bedding if we wanted, but not give us maid service since it was later at night.  Weary from the incident,Vegas, and feeling intimidated we just settled for the clean sheets. 

The girl shows up with just sheets, nothing else!!! I tip her and tell her what happened and then she comes back with new bed skirts, comforters, pillow cases and towels. Would have been nice if that happened without me tipping. 

We called back down and they said since we didn't move rooms we would get a $50 credit towards the room. After trying several times to use the credit, and it not working, we realized that it wasn't going to happen and they were just hoping we would be quite since we were leaving the next day. 

Needless to stay, we took our new bedding and slept on the floor. Sleepless night for all of us.

After sharing our experience with employees and fellow guest we found out this is a common occurrence and practice here. 

Never I have been made to feel so dirty, unappreciated and of no value by an establishment such as I did by The Golden Nugget. I will not be coming back ever and please know that this place is infested with bed bugs and instead of solving the problem they just try to make you feel like you did something wrong.

The good: room was clean and for some reason HUGE (we got a corner room, so probably atypical). Staff was friendly. Shark tank at the pool is pretty awesome. $60 including resort fee without even going through a 3rd party website. Check in time is flexible. 

The bad: we had a terrible time finding our room. Water in your room costs $4 and coffee $10? That just seems stupid to me. In 2015, are there really hotels that don't give you free bottled water and coffee? No fridge in the room. Towels are TINY. I almost think they gave us incorrect towels because they were so small. 

I'm not incorporating this into my rating because it's just a random preference, but they use the "mini keys" that are about 25% less width than a regular card. It's not really a problem, personally I just don't prefer them.

This was my first time staying on Fremont and I have so say I was impressed.  We got an older room but it was very big and roomy.  We tried for an upgrade but the week we where there was busy and there where no rooms left.  Check in was fast & easy.  The staff was friendly, helpful upon check in.  
The only real complaint I have is the maid service, it was everything we could do to get them to keep us stocked on towels extra pillows etc.  We were there a week and we would leave notes (with tip) and they would only leave extra on that day after mentioning we were there a week.
The enviroment was nice and the pool was amazing.  

I would recommend if your not wanting to stay on the strip. My goal is to try alot of different places when I go, but I would stay here again forsure.

Once again we had an amazing time in Vegas and enjoyed every minute of our Golden Nugget stay.   We had another room in the Carson tower and this one had more modern decor than last year.   The pool is amazing and we spent every day swimming and going down the water slide like little kids.  I love everything about this hotel from the friendly employees to the restaurants to being right in the middle of Fremont Street.  This hotel is extremely classy without being gaudy and over-the-top like some other places.   See you next year, GN!

Very comfortable beds for a hotel.  It would have been nice if the room safe work.  My friend swears the maid stole his mini alcohol bottles but I think it's more likely he drank or lost them.  The pool area was nice but far too many kids in the pool.  Not sure why the parents brought them.  Vegas is no place for kids.  The slide is a nice novelty but you really go down too fast to enjoy a view of the sharks.  Would definitely stay here again.  I enjoyed the Fremont experience but again this place is no place for kids and I probably wouldn't bring my wife here either.  Great place for the guys to party though.  On a final note I do not appreciate the fact that they charge you to use the internet.  Would have been nice to print my Southwest Airline tickets for free.

This hotel dashed my previous prejudice of DT Las Vegas.  Our room was clean and comfortable.  The location ideal.  The staff were friendly and professional.  The variety of eateries inside was great. We've stayed on The Strip and it was nice to be able to step out of our hotel without it taking half an hour just to exit!  I was just a bit disappointed that the pool was under maintenance, but...something else to look forward to on our next trip...and DEFINITELY we'll stay at the Golden Nugget

This is one of the nicer properties on Freemont Street. The coffee shop is one of the downtown power lunch places in Las Vegas (My review coming shortly). The pool is very cool, only in Las Vegas will you find a shark tank next to tourists getting tan in the glorious Las Vegas sun. Stop by and check it out. Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

The assistant food and beverage manager, Chris is a condescending jerk. I could not believe how rude he was and how much he lacked basic customer service considering he chose to work in costumer service. The front office manager was very helpful and so were the cocktail waitresses hence the 3 stars. Besides the catastrophe that was trying to get assistance from the cabana food and beverage assistant manager,  the experience was great,  just wish the entire staff participated in the culture they seemed to cultivate.

I've stayed at the golden nugget for years, and I will NEVER be back after this weekend. We booked a few rooms with some friends for a birthday weekend. We all booked king beds and when we checked in they put us in a room with kids size  double beds. So we all got to sleep separately from our husbands which was really disappointing  since we booked these rooms months ago and most of us this was the first weekend in a long time without our kids. I also understand that things happen, but they couldn't have been more rude about it. Then we get up and there's no coffee in the rooms and we have to go to the lobby to Starbucks wait in line for 33 minutes to buy an $11 cup of coffee. We get back to the room to shower and the handle is broken off of the shower. When we call the front desk, after being on hold for what felt like forever, the lady couldn't have been more rude about it. She tells us she'll send someone and we just get to sit in the room on our separate beds like we're in timeout until they decide to come fix it. All this wasted time, we could have been gambling. Instead we're waiting in lines for coffee and showers. Everything that happened would have been understandable too, I am aware they can't help the shower breaking, or whoever in management decided not to put coffee in the rooms. It was the attitude of every person we talked to at the front desk from the lady who checked us in to the lady who answered the phone finally after being on hold for quite a while. The customer service is the worst I have ever experienced at a hotel. I can't even remember the last time I had to call the front desk at a hotel and this weekend I feel like I've spent more time on the phone with rude women than I have in the casino! Obviously it's Vegas and they're gonna sell the rooms if they have good service or terrible service, just thought I'd warn people... if you expect the room you reserved, friendly staff and a shower that works, this probably isn't the hotel for you.

This might be a great hotel but we were there just to gamble and drink.  After ordering a Bud Light and a water,  we were charged $9.50 and the waitress only gave us back  $10. We thought she went to get more change and finally asked her where the rest of our money was. She said it was  $9.50  and walked away.  So $9.50 for water and a bud light and she tipped herself?  We finally asked the bartender why it cost so much and he said it's $4 for a tiny bottle of water? ; Really? That's total BS...

Nikki (sp?) front desk manager has no business being a manager of anything. She's crude, unapologetic, and tells people "feel free to go somewhere else" when confronted with a problem.  She's the epitome of why businesses go under. No sense of anything except repeating herself "for security purposes we can't do this..." or "its corporate policy". Both answers weren't applicable to the question at hand. She's clueless and it represents how poor the management is here.  She cost the hotel 50 rooms we had planned for a small convention.  Not to mention the money that comes with that.  So much for a Fremont, back to the Strip for us.  Would give Zero stars if we could.

Amazing for the price.  

Great location in Downtown.  Nice clean interior, great valet service, 3 star rooms that have been recently renovated, comfortable beds, and cheap eating and gambling.  

If you are OK not staying on the strip, the Golden Nugget is as good as it gets.

THE WORST!!  The room was so dated and run-down and this was an upgrade.  Deluxe Tower?  I don't think so.  The bathroom was a tiny.  We were on the 9th floor.  The view was all rooftop and metal from the Fremont Street structure.  The music from the Fremont Experience was deafening in our room until 2am.  When we walked out of our room the next morning(to check out early)  the housekeeper was walking the halls spraying some kind of horrible air freshener, disinfectant or bug spray and the cloud of it was visible.  The best was the front desk staff.  As they collected the $55 early check out fee, not one of them asked why we were leaving early.  I moved to the strip(TI) nicer and cheaper.

Don not stay in the rush tower unless you don't plan on sleeping until after 200 am
The club is that area and is very loud

Not worth the little savings from staying in strip

Smokey

The Golden Nugget is the best Hotel downtown.  It is also one of the best hotels in Las Vegas.  To knock the GN down because it is downtown makes no sense.  You can't pick the hotel up and move it.  Downtown is an acquired taste.  The down side of downtown is the poor people and homeless who wonder the streets and sleep on the streets.  If you would stay in the GN and never go out you would not know you were downtown.  It is insulated that well.  I stayed the the "old" South Tower.  Room is a good size bed and bathroom very well appointed.  The service as far as I asked for was prompt.  Problem with the toilet 15 mins later someone was there to fix it.  Wanted extra pillows and blanket no problem came fast.  They were so fast they missed the tip I had left for them.  The reason you stay at the GN is price to value.  You are not going to stay ANYWHERE for the price and get the quality the Nugget has to offer.  They have many places to eat, Vic and Anthony's, Chart House, Lilly's, Sushi Bar, and the Buffet.  The Buffet is the weakest of all the places.  Cannot understand how a Landry property has a bad buffet.  They are in the food business for goodness sake.  

The room had a flat panel TV a clock with a docking station for your IPhone and the furniture was changed since last year.  

Downtown has it advantages.
1 proximity to other casinos.  Don't like the place your are  go across the street.
2. It is old Las Vegas the Video Poker payouts are liberal as are the rules for blackjack
3. High end eateries.  Binion's Steak house and Hugo Cellar two top tier eateries anywhere in Las Vegas
4. Fremont Street Experience.  Beside the overhead show there are two live bands playing plus a DJ spinning records and a Sax player all going on at the same time.  That is a lot of action packed into a small package.

Got the room thru Priceline which was 1st mistake.  Priceline fees have surged.  The first room the GN gave us had a rusty tub and feces on the wallpaper of the bathroom.  It also had chewing gum stuck on the carpet though the room had a comfy king bed.  But, then a maid tried to enter our room about midnight.  At that point we had not requested anything.  I think the maid thought the room was empty and wanted to watch some TV and sneak a break.  The next morning we did complain and the GN gave us a nicer room in a remodeled tower.  This room was great but it took 3 attempts and 3 hours to finally get a maid to clean the room the day after we got the better room.  So, if u want to get a room thru Priceline bid very low or you will get soaked by fees.  Also, do not even stay at the GN unless you are sure you won't get stuck in an old tower.

I've lived in Vegas for 6 years and never been here. Not sure why. Its cute and the pool looks super fun! 

The entrance is inviting and leads into the ice bar and very trendy, sparkly type of bar. 

Lots of restaurants, retail stores and of course gaming!  I have concluded I will be having a staycation here soon, summer most likely so I can use the pool

I first stayed at the Golden Nugget with my husband three weeks ago and have been raving to my friends and family about the service and accommodations since our stay. 
My husband booked our room through a third party site, but we were still treated with the utmost respect. The valet was great, the desk attendants were great, the cocktail servers, the waiters and waitresses -- everyone!
When my husband checked us in, the desk attendant ensured that our room was accessible. I am temporarily handicapped due to an injury. When she saw me and my husband asked if she anticipated that I would have trouble, she obtained approval for a room upgrade at no additional cost. I didn't expect much except an accessible bathroom, but she checked us into to a Gold Club suite on the 16th floor! Our room was amazing! I had access to an accessible restroom and shower stall. Our bed was comfortable and not too tall. It seemed like a bit much -- until I made use of the extras. One evening, I used the sofa and television in the living area while my husband was downstairs gambling. I was tired from a long day of sightseeing and shopping in the city. The chaise in the room was also very comfortable. I dozed off on it when we first got to the room because I was afraid I would have trouble getting in and out of the bed, but it wasn't a problem at all once I got over the initial apprehension.
I could go on forever about the pool and the restaurants -- even the buffet was pretty good. Overall it was an exceptional experience and when I'm completely recovered we will definitely plan another visit. When a company goes out of their way to make every guests' needs a priority they will always have my loyalty. Hopefully we'll see them sometime before the end of this year. If not, we'll be back in the spring. Golden Nugget: you won me over and that is difficult!
Really so so with that price range. However, we enjoy the view that we can see people enjoy sun tanning and swimming. However, the bread pudding was pretty good there. Worth to try

Remodeled and nice!!!! The smell of cigarettes wasn't as strong as the hotels on the strip and it seemed roomier. If I had to book in downtown, I would definitely book at Golden Nugget. Heads up, since it's remodeled, it's more expensive now!

It was my first time staying at the Gold Nugget. It was nice considering what I have herd a about downtown. The casino itself was much more well ventilated compared to some of the other ones downtown. I did not play any table games but the few machines I did play where just okay. It has a smaller selection of penny slots compared to other downtown casinos. 

The room is nice (not that I spent a lot of time in the room). One of the more interesting things I noticed about the room was how modern it was. The alarm clock and tv looked brand new. The room lived up to what the pictures where shown to be. One of the more interesting things I noticed about the room was that the bathroom door had no lock on. This likely isn't a big deal if you are going with someone you trust but it could make for some interesting surprises.II didn't watch the tv with the exception of the end of the NCAA title game and the TV picture quality was quite poor but only on that station oddly enough. 

The only other thing that I didn't care much for was that where my room was located you could hear all the action at night\/early in the morning. I just turned on the AC unit to drown out the noise as it was rather mild at night. 

Overall would stay again. I had no other issues. I didn't do any real eating or gambling at the nugget. Much better casinos downtown for that..

This is a fabulous stop when checking out Downtown LV. $5 blackjack, brilliant lights and a perfect place to people watch. I'm so happy it's been preserved, it's a wonderful piece of Las Vegas history that we should absolutely treasure.

Golden Nugget is the best hotel & casino in downtown of Las Vegas. It is so clean. The service was awesome. Our room was nice and is always clean in a timely matter. The casino was great too. Be sure to sign up for the new card membership and have some free money to play on any slots of your choice. (I am a winner *wink.*) 

Definitely one of my favorite hotel in Vegas.

We had a great time at this hotel. The pool, complete with shark tank(!), is the centerpiece of the whole place, and for good reason; it's awesome! The waterslide through the tank is amazing, but you're going so fast you hardly see the sharks. I thought it was even cooler to just swim in the pool right next to the tank...you're almost literally swimming with the sharks!

The room was spacious and comfortable, the location on Fremont St (close enough to enjoy the fun but not so close that it's too noisy) is nice, and the buffet is pretty good (HUGEST piece of corned beef I've ever seen at the carving station).

The spa and salon bring the Golden Nugget above and beyond. It feels like a Roman bath, and the staff and amenities provide everything you could possibly need. We felt so incredibly pampered!

I've seen this described as the most elegant of the downtown hotels and I'd definitely agree with that. Would stay here again!

I'm impressed that the rooms don't smell like old people and cigarettes since most of the rest of the hotel does, but I am happy to say that despite the need to walk though throngs of dirty wide eyed gamblers flicking ash everywhere as they desperately search for the next waitress to drown there already dying livers.  We actually slept well, and had a great time in Las Vegas.

Very disappointed in this place, we called three times today and all 3 times I was advised by the operator that the pool was open to the public for $25 each. We were willing to pay $100 for our family to swim here, so we rearranged our schedule and drove out the way to "try and enjoy the sun" however when we arrived we were advised by the rudest front desk clerk that the pool was not open to the public..I was beyond upset and Requested to speak with the manager and even the manager played dumb and said no one would tell me that. I ended up calling the phone number again and asked the young lady if the pool was open and she replied with yes!!! He could careless about the information being provided by his employees and still advised that the pool was full and we could not enter. Not to mention the pool was not full!!! This place is extremely beautiful but has the worse management and customer service...this is just one of the many complaints they will be receiving from me!

Review #10

No one at Carson Tower front desk at 12am.  This is Vegas. Should be 24 hrs. Hotels in small towns have 24hr service.  You have to go to Rush or Gold Towers to check in to Carson Tower then haul your luggage back over again to Carson.

Room shower doesn't work & no rooms left. Waiting on maintenance since 1:25am & its now 1:57am.  

So far not looking good.  Not worth 1 star so far.

Room view is nice of moon & strip.  

But no shower water!  I'm tired & on DC time in Vegas. So my body clock is at 5am even though its 2am Vegas! 

I have a friend's wedding to attend in 12 hrs & need sleep & a shower before the wedding.

Update:  shower working but water still dripping badly when you turn it off, no matter which way you angle water knob.  I told front desk this but no maintenance ever came to fix it.  

I will give some good points though & up the stars to 2.5 for the rest of the hotel, not the room & extra charges for tea & coffee, Internet use ($12.99 for 24 hrs- quite outrageous when other hotels include free Internet), & $4 for a small bottle of water.  Go to Walgreen's 2 blocks from hotel to buy water, noise for construction, since I'm a nice person, & hate to give bad reviews.   

The location is great for Old Vegas & you can walk out of the hotel to Fremont Street which is crazy, but a must see.  The restaurants & bars inside the hotel are wonderful & the famous, largest "Golden Nugget" is showcased here.

 I'll write more later, but I must go run errands.

This hotel is really all about the pool and casino everything else needs needs work. The service is terrible. We have a room service cart outside our door for a full 24 hours. We complained twice. Our key had to be replace twice because it just stopped working with the door. 
The worst of it all is that first night I was there I took a fall in the shower. I believe the cleaner used was not rinsed out all the way. The next day I decided to call the front desk. I would feel terrible if someone else hurt themselves. They asked me to come to the front desk where I waited for someone to write a report. They did nothing! My husband went down to check on the report the next morning and it was never filed. This hotel has complete disregard for the safety of the people staying there I guess. I came home with a black eye and bruised leg. So much for a nice getaway

If you want to do any sun\/pool time when in Las Vegas, DO NOT STAY HERE!!! The pool area is way too small. The pool opened at 9am, I was there at 9:03 and all of the loungers were taken. And there's no where else to sit! I has no problem at THE MIRAGE or THE MGM hotels. Their pool areas are more spacious and luxurious. Just say  NO TO THE NUGGET!!!!!

Really surprisingly nice room. I say that because of her stigma downtown gets. I really enjoyed the stay.  The pool was not so great. It was small and crazy busy.  I believe the hotel is missing a lappool and or a spa pool. One should be able to swim laps or enjoy a more relaxing swim than one big non stop party. Maybe a designated later hour for that once sun goes down and drinkers at passed out or done

Gambling in this casino was nice, we definitely won for a little while but ended up losing some money. It's much older and you can smell all of the smoke, which is a bummer, but the pool area is really nice! Its supposedly one of the top 10 pools, it's got a water slide that goes through a shark tank, pretty sweet! I've visited in the summer, and the pool is usually full to the brim, so careful with that, maybe go on a weekday.

Nice hotel downtown. I've stayed here at least 3 times. The pool area 'the Shark Tank' is pretty cool and one of the nicer and more interesting pools of the hotels I've seen in Vegas. 

If you're looking for a full Las Vegas Strip experience, you may want to stay at a strip hotel rather than the Golden Nugget, because taxi will be a bit pricey and not the easiest to catch on the strip during busy times. Bus takes a looooong time to get from the strip to downtown, and at peak hours you may have to wait a while to even catch one. Those are planning considerations, but as for the Golden Nugget itself, it's a nice hotel. Buffet's not bad.

We were there for Thanksgiving weekend. We booked through last minute through Expedia. Just grateful to get a room I was surprised when we checked in that we were assigned a suite in the Rush Tower at no extra charge. The four stars are for the room which was beautiful. The bathroom was huge with a walk in closet. The minus one star is for the very loud air conditioner, so loud you couldn't hear the TV. The other negative was the parking. On Friday night we arrived at the valet at 9:00 pm and told there were no openings and to go to the other valet. That valet also had no openings and were directed to the parking garage where there was a long line of cars all seeking an open parking space that didn't exist. After spending 30 minutes in the lot we were directed to the Plaza lot and told we would be reimbursed the $5.00 fee. After hearing our plight the nice attendant at the Plaza didn't charge us the fee. After spending another 30 min in this lot with no luck I finally found a group leaving and slowly followed them to their car. When I checked out the next morning the desk clerk asked if I needed help with my luggage. I told her sure if she had someone available to trek to the back of the building then across the street and through a construction zone to get to my car. She declined.

Golden Nugget actually lost a star as soon as we arrived. It was our first time staying there and we had reserved a basic Carson Tower room. We walked up to a random employee at a counter near the Rush Tower elevators to ask where we could check in and he said he could do that for us. Awesome! He checks us in, we make the trek across the hotel to the Carson Tower, are happy that our room is near the elevators, open the door...and walked into a room that was still occupied. There were clothes and suitcases everywhere so we walked right back out. I left my husband there with our luggage while I went to complain & get a new room, now feeling a little uneasy that someone could that easily have access to all my stuff when i'm not in the room. They immediately upgraded us to a Rush Tower room and sent someone to help my husband with our stuff. Unfortunately that whole situation cost us about 45 minutes of precious pool time.
The room was very nice, view of the strip on the distance, spacious, his & hers sinks, big TV, and a couch. We made sure to use the safe when we left the room, just in case. We didn't use the coffee maker because the Keurig pods were in a 4 pack that cost $10 if you used even one. The GN Starbucks is 24 hours, though, so that makes it easy to get your coffee fix. 
I like that thee pool entrance was centrally located. By the time we got there, the pool was already packed and it was near impossible to find a chair to put our stuff down. The adult pool on the 3rd level was small and you have up pay $10 for a chair so we didn't even hang out there. The 2nd floor was just a bunch of chairs and cabanas, which was awkward since you can't even see the pool. The shark tank was definitely worth going to the pool to see. The slide goes so quick that you can't really see anything, but its still a cool concept. The drinks were a little pricey, but strong.
The rest of the stay was fun and we enjoyed the upgraded room. Just beware of what you leave out when you leave your hotel room!

Stayed 4\/2 to 4\/5 in a Rush Tower suite -

Pros- Awesome pool! Nice poker room.Suite was nice and modern.

Cons- Service at the bars with video poker really sucked! My wife and I played a lot and always had to flag someone down and we tip every drink! 
I'd only return if it's comped!

The Valet here is very rude a man working asked me to pull up my car I explained to him I was in a Rush and if you could just take the car and he said sorry ma'am I can't Park it anymore.  I guess he had got offended or something and i got out of my car and asked  hey different Valley to please park my car and I took him $20 I asked him to keep it in the front. he said OK and then said next time please don't give the other valet A hard time and I replied well I wasn't trying to I'm not sure what happened there... then when I picked up my car the door was left unlocked and it was up in the front I did not like that!!

Rude front desk. Had a reservation through a group rate and should have been around $500-$600. When we check in it ends up around $1500! We tell them no way we had a group rate. They said oh sorry there's a note in here that says certain things and you don't have it now??? The reason I'm writing this is because we weren't the only family checking in that this happened to. We tried to negotiate the price and the employee and manager both said they are sold out and that's the price (and due to tournaments and conventions everyone around is sold out). Sounds like a ploy to up the rate last minute. After a few hours we finally secured a room else where! DISHONESTY!! CHEATING! TAKING ADVANTAGE of people who are coming as families, driving far, them trying to charge them $1500 for stay at the Golden Nugget---

For all those people who don't get away from the Strip in Vegas...you are missing out.  We stayed here for two nights in the Rush Tower suite for less than $200.  We had a king sized bed, two flatscreen TVs, a view of the pool, a couch, a coupon book...(which we never used but it did have some great deals in it) The room was modern and everyone who worked at the hotel was helpful and attentive to our needs.  Plus, we won money at the casino!  We basically won enough to cover our expenses for the two nights plus a little more.  The pool has been redone and houses a tropical fish and shark tank, and it has a water slide.  A GREAT place to stay and I will be back.

cons are its not on strip.

if you are in the new"" tower you will be impressed. the rooms are beautiful, easily on par with the new hot hotels such as the aria etc... the casino isnt as nice but its not bad. 

this is an overall good place.

I had some friends in from out of town a week ago Wednesday and I wanted to take them downtown so they could eat, drink and gamble and have a good time.  We chose the Golden Nugget as it has a lot to do.  Upon entering their parking garage I asked the attendant if they validate the slip inside the casino for free parking and was told yes.  I got my parking slip stamped in the casino by their players club employee.  That is also a stupid policy as you used to be able to just stamp it yourself now I had to wait in line quite a while.  In addition, I was told you have to gamble to get it stamped which was fine with me but some people only want to have dinner and drink and they don't want to gamble.  When we left at 3 am to head home the parking garage attendant charged me $8 for parking.  I have NEVER had to pay to park in Las Vegas in the 20 years I have lived here.  Of course I do always tip the employees \/ valet attendants.

So let me get this straight.  Because I brought three gamblers to their casino to have dinner, drink and mostly gamble and we decided to keep giving them our money till 3am I was charged for doing so.  I will never take my out of town friends to the Gold Nugget Hotel again.

The next night valet parked and gambled at the Golden Gate Casino where valet parking was free and I was happy to give the worker a nice tip.  A much better place to hang out and gamble and drink than the Golden Nugget.

Stayed at the Nugget for 3 nights on business. Generally, I was very pleased with the product and service they offer:

Pros
- Rooms look like they have been renovated recently, mine was in the Carson Tower and was very well maintained, clean, comfortable
- Thank you for having Starbucks open 24 hours, little expensive but very good coffee
