- I was helped twice by "back of the house staff" (I think banquet housemen - my bad for not getting their names) who went out of their way to direct me to the meeting room I needed. One walked me half the distance. Very impressed, they understand hospitality.

Cons
- The in-room coffee was $10 for 4 cups. No thanks.
- Paid for the internet, had to have it for work. While I am ok with paying for it, the wireless signal should have been a little stronger.
- The concierge in the Carson Tower should smile. They don't look like they like their jobs.
- Kind of difficult to do work in the room, no real desk to operate from (my laptop is on my lap right now)

My wife and I stayed here. This was our third time in the hotel, and most likely last. The hotel rooms were average.

The service was slow, and non-attentive. My wife stepped in some fecal matter in the hallway. How do you not clean something up like that? It ended up ruing the night for us.

What a joke!!! We checked in with the most un-personable person ever. Not even a smile did we get. Then after walking all the way to our tower the keys don't work!  We get a hold of housekeeping and after verifying it is us she won't let us in to our room. Instead we are at the mercy of someone bringing up keys. After waiting 15 mins they still haven't come up with keys, so I walk down to registration for my tower and it's CLOSED!!! Are you serious?! How do you close a front desk? I'm still in front of my room waiting for security. When security comes he is leisurely strolling up our hallway and yet another miserable person who works here!! All I want is to get into my room!

September 08:  Drawn by the pool, I spent the night in the South Tower.  I actually prefer the tower rooms at El Cortez, but the quiet hallways here make it more than a fair trade.  Better amenities and bathroom at the GN, too.  Strangely enough, the Nugget's website seems to offer better rates than Priceline - and the not-fully-operative video checkout said I owed less than both, so we'll see.  Did have to endure repeated sales overtures on the way to and from the lifts.

And the pool?  Freaking awesome.

Not exactly thrilled with the Golden Nugget hotel. My husband and I stayed for a night, and upon checking into our room, the entire floor area by the air conditioning was wet. We called maintenance and they came in about 30 minutes. The guy was really nice and after about 15 minutes tinkering with it, told us the vacuum he had to soak up the water wasn't large enough or working. He said he would be back and not to worry if we left because they have keys to our room. Comforting? Haha we returned about 5-7 hours later after dinner and gambling to find a couple towels laid out on the floor around the air conditioning and now the water had spread farther out on the carpet. It was 1 AM at this time, I called the front desk to express my concerns. The front desk girl was very sweet, but nothing was ultimately done. It was too late in my opinion to have another maintenance person come fix it. So we slept, woke up and checked out. Just a little disappointing, especially for the price we paid. Which I felt was way over priced. Will not be staying here again. The staff was nice, but the hotel and rooms were not.

Let's do an update.

My last review of Golden Nugget did not include the hotel rooms, but since I stayed at Golden Nugget a few weekends ago for my bachelorette party downtown I can now do an update involving the rooms, the casino, and room service.

If I were reviewing solely on the room this review would be a 2.5-star, which I know is impossible, so I have to bump it up to a 3. The room we stayed in looked as though it had undergone a serious revamp, but it was very eclectic and not in a good eclectic way. There were random half-curtains everywhere. The one on the bathtub was especially odd. Why only part of the curtain? The fabrics chosen clashed throughout the hotel room. I wish they'd gone with more of a neutral palette rather than many patterns. 

The room was clean though and they do supply plenty of towels and toiletries. Room service was ordered for myself because I was super late in getting to my own bachelorette party because of work. They have pretty standard fare and I ordered the chicken strips. They did come with a BBQ dipping sauce, but no ranch and came with some decent french fries. 

Even though we we stayed a GN we didn't get a chance to utilize their awesome pool. Around 10 AM is was already packed and I actually saw people setting up their towels on the hard concrete because there were no chairs left. Icky. No thanks. 

The casino review stands. It's still nice inside and everything has been redone. Therefore 2.5 room, but considering it's Downtown and the casino is nice must go up to 4 stars.

Booked a non-smoking room.  Upon arrival I was told that there were no more non-smoking rooms available.  Apparently all the non-smoking rooms were given away the day before.  They said the smoking rooms would be deodorized and we would be able to move to another room the next day.  They went on to say that we should have booked using the guarantee upgrade.  For $30 more they would guarantee we would have a non-smoking room.  What kind of the BS is this? I have to pay extra to insure I don't get a room that smells like an astray?  

Go to the room and it did indeed smell like an astray (20 solid years of smoking I'd say).  Housekeeping eventually came up and deodorized the room, but in honesty it did very little to mask the smell of cigarettes.  In a couple hours the room smelled just as bad as when we first walked in.  We ended up going to a Walgreens and buying air fresheners and deodorizers.  I really cant overstate how bad it reeked of cigarettes.  I've stayed in plenty of smoking rooms over the years and this was definitely the worst.  

Called downstairs the following morning, couldn't get through to anyone at the front desk.  Called a few more times and eventually left a message with the front desk regarding a room change.  Never heard back from the front desk about the room change.  Stayed another night in the astray and left early never looking back.  

Needless to say we will not be coming back to stay at Golden Nugget.  I'll stick to the better hotels on the strip where customer service is golden.
One of the better downtown Las Vegas Casino \/ Hotels.  Of course it depends what tower they put you in. But even the worst room is okay. Nice pool with the shark tank in the middle.

Great ambiance. This is old school casino with a touch of modern. The hotel has spacious rooms, and the hotel staff is friendly. I found the casino to be interchangeable with most of the others there on Freemont Street. Rooms are priced better than the strip in an effort to get people in. Buffet was OK- neither great nor terrible. Id stay there again in future.

It's not a bad hotel at all. We always stay on the new strip and decided to have an extra night in Vegas so we booked a room here for a night. It was better then expected. I do have to say some of the staff seemed a bit  unhappy. I wish this hotel were on the new strip though. The pool was awesome. We liked the shark tank. It was pretty neat. It'd be nice to have a pool somewhere for adults only like this one. On checkout day it sounded like the people upstairs were going to fall through the ceiling which was kind of annoying, but not the hotels fault. Overall our stay was great and we would come back again.

To start the check in process is what created the whole mind set for the rest of the evening....I turned in the backside fronting the rush tower and was approached by a woman that asked the following..are you a guest? Yes can I see your room key? I don't have it I will be checking in now. Ok right now you can park elsewhere until I see a room key I can let you in....maybe tomorrow there might be room? Wtheck?  Ok so instead I valet parked at the Cal and walked over to check in. I swear the line snaked way passed the ropes passed the poles and it seemed endless.

No complaints whatsoever. Valet people were very very nice. Check in was quick and painless. Room was easy to find and very nice. Everything in the hotel as well as Fremont St was easily accessible from where we were staying. The pool was really nice and fun. Staff seemed friendly. I like that there are 2 Starbucks so that I had coffee accessible to me at all times lol. The walk from the parking structure was also very easy to navigate and close. I'd stay here again for sure. It's a nice break to not stay directly on the strip. Golden Nugget is a quick drive to the strip though so it was easy to get there and get back. I'll be back!
Usually enjoy this casino however tonight service was non existent sat at a bar playing electronic blackjack and wasn't served or even asked if we needed a drink for nearly 45 min

Truly old town Vegas, right off of the Fremont Street Experience.  I can't say anything for the Hotel, but the casino has some first rate slot machines, all first run, all bright, shiny and some are even blinding (I suggest avoiding the crystal game near Godzilla).

Lots of progressive slots. Some live entertainment - at least there was when i was wandering through, and she was damned funny. I noticed that it appeared to have gone a renovation recently and that's probably a good thing. Some lovely Chiluly glass in their eatery and above their high stakes tables brought out the "MONEY" vibe to the floor. 

If I get a chance, I'll come back and check this place out again. I Know for certain that the guys must love the dealer's. They're lovely eye candy in their red and black ensembles.

I LOVED this place! My friend and I got a room for 50$ and the room was clean and had the most comfortable beds ever.

The staff is extremely nice, From the girl at the front desk, to our bellhop and the valet. Not one had a negative attitude!

The only thing is, I wish the room came with more amenities, like a hair blow dryer or a fridge. If I didn't think to pack my hair blow dryer last minute, I would've been screwed.

The pool was crowded, even on a Tuesday, but clean. I loved the water slide. Although, I wish you could actually see the sharks when you slide down.

I will come back here.

Stayed here for my anniversary and loved it!  We checked in around 10pm and we were given a complimentary upgrade to a corner suite on the 24th floor!  The room was awesome, I wish we had booked more nights!  We will definitely be back!

HORRIBLE PLACE TO STAY.  I flew out there and my dad  had a conference  when he worked for the YMCA  Corporate North America  as an artitech.  He took me along  cause it was free of  course.  But  I rather stay at that italian hotel next time i make a trip out there.  I love old people  but i felt like i was living in a nursing home hehehhe when i resided their for the weekend
Did not stay here but visited and was unexpectedly surprised! This would make old town the New Town, 5 thumbs!

Booked a trip to Vegas with my pre-teen daughters  staying at the Golden Nugget.  After searching up the best family friendly pools in Vegas and giving the options to my girls choose from, they both agreed their first choice was the Golden Nugget.  I was hesitant to be off the strip, which meant I would have more driving each day, but I agreed that it looked too cool to pass up.  They were so excited about the water slide through the shark tank!!!  The whole drive from CA they were going on and on about how cool it was going to be.  Then we walked in the doors only to find it was closed and under construction!  No mention of it on the website or anything to forewarn you if that was your primary reason for staying at the hotel.  The room was nice, but there was also no fridge in the room.  Another thing not mentioned on the website.  Extremely disappointed!

Nice hotel.  Clean, updated and modern, and a killer pool area!  Great value for what you get.

My only complaint is other downtown clientele - it's not the nicest area to party in, so we took cabs a lot to the strip.

Very pleasantly impressed!!!!!!!!!!!! 

We arrived early, (2 family's and 2 rooms) bellman immediately checked our bags in and valet our cars. 

Check in line took about 15 minutes, our rooms weren't ready but the clerk said they'd call me on my cell when they were so we can pick up the keys, so we decided to hit the pool, but had to go ask for our bags to get our swimsuits and towels NO problem the guy took me back there, and I was able to grab what I needed in less than 5 minutes... about 30 min later one room is ready, so up we go, call for our bags and they were there in less then 10 minutes. Another 15 minutes later they call and say the other room is ready, I asked jokingly if they can bring the keys to me, and they said sure no problem?????????????

The pool was pretty packed, but was amazingly entertaining for our kids, we didn't get any lounge chairs, but were offered a shaded section of couches if we spend a minimum of $200, well with 7 of us that were hungry and thirsty, it was no problem, and well worth every penny!!!! 

After a full day in the sun we went back to our rooms to get ready for a night full of entertainment of people watching on Fremont, and a great dinner at the Hash House a Go Go...once we got back to our rooms we slept like babies, on our amazing beds they were like sleeping on a bed of clouds....  (we stood in the Rush Tower)

We will definitely stay here at the Golden Nugget again!!!!  Next time it's going to be a Girls Only weekend!!!

Extremely small room with a view of the side of another building up close.  What more can I ask for?  How about a TV with a missing remote? Yes! Strange stains in the bathroom sink! Yes! All for over the price of hotels on the Strip itself!  Oh yes!

The Gold Rush tower is so cool, it has a massive fish tank right when you walk in. It's in old town Vegas, good for parents+kids..Big ol' water slide at their pool. I just like that they made it kid friendly and low key from all the crackheads and hookers on the new strip.

I so wanted to love the Golden Nugget as it really reminds me of classic Vegas. Unfortunately, there were a few things that wouldn't allow me to do that exactly.  

The good:

Location. It's a good location if you're staying on Fremont street as it's not too far from anything down there. ABC Store, La Bayou, food, and good slots. 

Casino: Really good air conditioning!  I have to say, I felt very comfortable there in the 114 degree heat. 

Pool: Great pool area with outdoor gaming, and a really cool fish tank with sharks!  There is even a water slide that goes through the tank.

Room (Part 1).  The Room was clean, updated and felt higher end (wait there's more). Lots of towels, and a decent wall unit A\/C that kept us comfortable. 

The Bad:

Parking structure: One elevator worked, and one was broken. I was told by the front desk that maintenance knew about it, but it was never fixed. No A\/C either in the elevators. 

The Front Desk. We booked our room through a third party and we were told that did not include 2 beds, so there was an up charge of $33.00. We were also told that it wasn't something they could do anything about and they would never promise two beds without charging. I definitely did not feel taken care of. No offer made to make up for this issue, or even ask a manager or supervisor to speak with us. I get it, after a 5 hour drive, we didn't look amazing, but it would have been nice to have been treated like they wanted our business.  Good news, we didn't gamble much there anyway. Their loss. 

Elevators: No A\/C. Really? These were the ones inside the hotel as well. Apparently a theme at this location. 

Ice Machine: Ran out of ice, but hours later it did work again. 

Room (Part 2). The sink and bathtub had a sewer smell, that didn't really get better. It wasn't something  I felt was becoming a nice place. There was rust in the bathtub around the drain. Nice!

I had a good time in spite of the issues, but that's what family does.  

I usually stay on the strip, so this was an experience, but not sure I will be trying it out again at this location.
Best hotel on Frenont by far. Nice room, great hotel services, excellent restaurants. The pool has a slide that goes thru a shark tank!

Have stayed at the GN twice in the last two years.  It has failed to disappoint each time.  It is incredibly impressive how so much is crammed into such a small footprint (compared to the strip).  The restaurants our fantastic, including Vic and Anthony's a premium steakhouse.  The gambling is part old Vegas and part strip.  The dealers are professional and helpful and the attitude of the entire staff is nice and welcoming. 

My adult son and i enjoy the downtown location because other casinos are a mere short walk away.  Downtown is getting its own bar and restaurant scene making it a tough choice to venture to the strip.  '

During the summer, the pool can be crowded - but it is a stop all its own because of the shark tank.  A water slide through the shark tank! 

Highly recommend the GN for a true Las Vegas experience without the hassle or up charge of the strip.

I've experienced better, The Golden Nugget lost its class in my opinion and tried to create an atmosphere that doesn't work from the minute you step in - and lug your suitcase down the stairs (no ramp to be found anywhere).   It once was a beautiful spot to stay, and our favorite hotel downtown, when the walls were creamy white with gold accents throughout the hotel.  Back when the ceiling was high so that it wasn't like walking through a dark dense smoke cloud as it is now.  My clothing reeked daily because it was so stinky smoky, and although the rooms are labeled non-smoking, the ventilation system cannot screen out the smoke smell.  

We asked for a quiet room and was assigned a "mountain" facing room (in other words, facing Fremont St.) #18206 by the most unfriendly desk clerk ever.  She didn't say a word, it was obvious she was having a bad day.  We entered the Rush Tower room, and it was so dark and dank we could hardly see, even after turning on every light.  Dark brown black and brown interior with a tub\/shower combo that is difficult to step in & out of because the tracking is so high.  Light comes out at you from the mirror above the sinks which make it impossible to see anything-horrible lighting.  Door to room sticks and is difficult to shut, you have to really slam the doors or risk it staying open.  You can hear every sound from the people above you, beside you and the clanging of the staff - not sure what was making all the noise coming from the walls.  TV channels were very limited, maybe 5 or so?  Picture did not come in very well.  The room was dark, dark, dark, did I say the room & hotel was dark?  The fun began when we came in our room from the casino after a ten hour drive that morning ready to sleep at 9pm - impossible -  the music from Fremont street was blasting & vibrating through our room, it was hard to even hear the TV.  What a BAD design plan.  I called down to the front desk and was informed it would quit at 11pm.  Ugh.  It ended finally around 11:30pm but the noise lingered until 1am.  Next morning we asked to switch rooms.  Our next room, not ready until late afternoon was much, much better noise-wise.  Everything else was exactly the same except for maybe a sliver more light coming through the window & a much better view of the strip.  Charges for the coffee & water in room-tacky.  Nice shampoo, soaps, etc.  Bed was pretty comfortable.

Food-wise they took out our once favorite cafe that served great quality food and added Claim Jumper, a chain restaurant (who wants a chain restaurant, is that the best they could do?) and The Grotto which has horrible pizza.  The whole smoky vibe is bad, even when you venture toward the only light in the casino, near the pool, to see the poor sea creatures contained in a too small aquarium at the pool-with chairs packed so close that it is impossible to squeeze a leg between to lay down on one.  Awful.  Vic and Anthony's was delicious, that is about the best I can say from a food perspective.  

The downtown vibe is great if you like porn in your face every time you venture from the hotel, Fremont street is gross.  We won't be back to this hotel.

This review is for the casino only. 

The Gold Nugget casino area was fairly large and had a wide variety of slot machines.  Some of the machines they had were newer versions (at least I thought so) because the other casinos I went to in the area had different versions.  For example, they had Gold Fish 3 while some other casinos had Gold Fish 1 or Gold Fish 3.  The tables for black jack and craps were grouped together and were usually busy.  I thought the casino was okay at the Gold Nugget.

Each year my friend's plan a large event and book a block of rooms in the Golden Nugget.  This was my first time staying in this hotel (I usually stay on the strip) and I was pleasantly surprised by their overall ambiance.  They have some great dining options (read: bottomless mimosa buffet), spacious and clean rooms, and a bad-ass pool area.

Let's be serious, a slide that goes through a shark tank?  Yes please!  I'm pretty sure I went down the slide more times than any of the kids in the hotel...  And we never got kicked out of the pool area even thought we constantly took over the hot tub and adult areas.  Major props to their staff for putting up with a few hundred rowdy idiots.

Notes: Make sure to put the "do not disturb" sign on your door or you'll be woken up around 9am.  Yes, I know that isn't early for some, but this is Vegas after all.  And more importantly, there are multiple towers, it is easy to get confused when coming in late at night...

I'm sure we'll be back next year.  Already looking forward to the slide!

This was our 3rd visit to Fremont but first to stay in downtown Las Vegas. Heard a lot good things about Golden Nuggets so decided to book 2nights stay. It wasn't hard to find since it was literally in the middle of Fremont experience. They have valet, parking garage and more. If you stay at the hotel obviously it's free otherwise they do charge you.

Our rooms were in the rush tower. Probably a good 400sq feet, room facing the strip view which I enjoyed and you get 2 bathrobes with slippers which I thought was delightful. The hotel was immaculate, there were fish tank at the bar, swimming pool with exotic fishy and sharks. I was very impressed how modern and sleek the place looked. We ate at the buffet, nothing to rave about, pretty simple dish and okay. 

We were down here to celebrate our anniversary and the front desk manager was kind enough to send a fruit basket with nuts and chocolate on the house. I definitely will be back.

One of the older remaining Casinos reminding me of the old PI show Vegas. Complete with neon lights, etc. 

The Showroom has comfortable seating and there are no bad seats. Won't be able to take any photos during the show, so the empty stage is all you'll get.

A downtown must see. This oldie is a goodie! So glad we stopped in here. The staff was friendly, the promotions for new members are better than the majority of casinos I visited (10 match play for table games and $5 for slots) I enjoyed the ambiance of the Golden Nugget as well.

Recently spent 3 days at the Golden Nugget.  I'll be honest.  It's not any of the newer hotels that are on the strip.  

For example, I miss having a dedicated elevator to the upper floors.  They only had 4 in the Rush Tower and one was inoperable.  Another example, they don't have a ton of valet hosts ready to greet you when you pull your car up.  I found the location of the TV in the room rather off because you couldn't see it from the sofa in the room, but only from the bed. There's no fridge, but they do have a Keurig machine which you have to pay for if you use their coffee.

All that being said, the people were the most friendliest people in Vegas.   Every single person I interacted with made me feel important and took the time to answer my questions or assist with my needs.  From the Players Club to the Valet - pretty much perfect.  An example, I dropped my Key FOB at the Valet, which appeared to have broke into pieces.  Not good.  Well, they young man helped me put it back together including finding all the small parts that flew everywhere and got it working again.  The people in the VIP area were extremely helpful, especially when I asked if there was place to print my boarding pass and they offered to print it for me.   There were a few other surprises along the way (a nice hand pay at a slot for example where again - the slot hostesses were extremely nice and seemed to celebrate my win as much as I did.  

Another thing I've read about is the noise from the street.  We were on the 15th floor, facing the strip, and even though ear plugs were provided, I couldn't hear a thing from Fremont Street.  

That aside, it was the people who made this visit worth while and special so Thank You to the staff at the Golden Nugget.
Downtown nice change of pace.  Live music on Fremont defiantly lots people watching.  Pool is nice plenty enough seating.

Stay there a few days this week. Not impressed with the hotel at all. Didn't understand all the hype about the golden nugget. First off, I have a Ford F-350, the valet said they might not have parking for my truck. They only have 4 over sized parking spots. Really only four?!? The rooms were very dated... AC didn't work all that great. Went out for the night, came back to the room for the night. We woke in the morning to find our door slightly open... Chain was on. Don't know if maid service opened or it never fully closed when we got back. Went down to the pool and it was PACKED!! While walking into the pool area a family was in front of us, showed they're ID and walked in. I guess Las Vegas residents get to swim for free. Didn't know Golden Nugget was a "public" pool now. But we had to pay a resort fee.... Yeah not happy about that. While at the pool my wife and I order a slushy drink from the cocktail waitress. $14 a drink. She brought our drinks. Gave her $40. We waited almost 45 minutes for our change. While waiting for the change we can see her taking drink orders and serving cocktails. Started to get a little mad. Finally she came by asking if we wanted more drinks. I said no but I'd like my $12 change back. She handed me $11. She said "this is all I have." I told her keep the dollar. Shitty service gets shitty tips. All and all I would not recommend this hotel. Yeah stayed there.... Won't make that mistake again!!

I just wanted to update my review here at the Golden Nugget. A big MAHALO to the Golden Nugget for the comp. room! I must say, the Golden Nugget is by far the best hotel within the downtown Las Vegas area.

The accommodations were wonderful, as the room we had at the Rush Tower was very spacious, clean, and well kept. The room was all so quite too, so you don't hear any of the noises from the outside light show from the Fremont Experience.

I didn't realize it, but there are a lot of restaurants and bars within this hotel property....they are -

1. Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse
2. The Chart House
3. Grotto Ristorante
4. Lillie's Asian Cuisine
5. Red Sushi
6. The Buffet
7. Cadillac Mexican Cantina and Tequila Bar
8. Claim Jumper Restaurant
9. Starbucks
10. Gold Diggers
11. Rush Lounge
12. Claude's Bar
13. Ice Bar
14. Bar 46
15. Stage Bar
16. H2O Bar
17. The Hideout at H2O

So you can see there is no shortage of places to visit within the hotel property. Looking for a downtown hotel? May I suggest the Golden Nugget!

Valet and bell staff were great, housekeeping was nice, although bathroom wasn't cleaned very well.  Room itself was nice, but beds were Full Size not Queen, and pool view was overrated, sure I can see the pool if I lean out over the A\/C and hang onto the window sill.  Bathroom had mold on ceiling and caulk molding and falling out.  Front desk staff was not very helpful, when I stopped by to ask them if I could get a privacy sign I was told that I should  have called housekeeping from my room.   Ok, so I should have awakened the person sleeping to get a sign that would save them from being awakened?!?   Charges for many things extra $12.99 a day for internet, $20 a day for gym, $10 if you use their in room coffee... Etc.   the thing is I thought I had picked a mid-high grade room\/reservation but was being treated like I'd used a Groupon.  The pool was nice but crowded. Teenagers blatantly pouring alcohol in a drink bottle right in front of the lifeguard while inside the pool.  I won't stay again.

I am very disappointed with my stay thus far. I've stayed here before,  but it appears their standards have dropped.  We rented 2 rooms for our stay, since it was our anniversary and Chritmas, we traveled as a family of 5. Our rooms had nothing but issues. Room 12108 had gum stains on the floor (which they came and cleaned after a call to housecleaning), and hair in the bed (they came and changed the sheets after 2 calls to housecleaning). In Room 12110 the shower was filthy, there were blood stains on one of the towels, and when we woke up in the morning we realized that there were dried blood stains on the comforter. This is not acceptable for a Hotel that claims to be a 4 Star property.  This is very disappointing, considering that we are paying customers.  I understand we booked the lowest rate, which must place us in the oldest tower, however this is not acceptable. I will be speaking to Hotel Management today.

In the past we favored the Nugget because it was good value, pleasant rooms and located right in midst of downtown. We haven't been there for a year or more and this past visit totally turned us off. I agree completely with other reviews about charging for everything e.g., coffee in the room ( not room service ) is 2.50 a cup, Internet is 13.00  per 24 hours and bottle of water is 2.00. I would expect these prices at a 5 star establishment , but in my opinion, it is not even close to 5 star, maybe 3 star. No complaints on room, clean and well done. Prices have greatly increased. We don't  plan to return !

We called ahead to let the hotel know we would be checking in very late. Good thing we did, because the hotel had sold out. We were assigned a room on the 8th floor overlooking the Metropolitan car park garage. While we weren't concerned with the view, we were mightily concerned with the stench that assailed our nostrils as soon as we walked in. And when I say "stench," I'm not talking about "Oops, I left the milk in the fridge 2 days past its expiration date" - I'm talking, "Oh my God who died?" stench. Which the cleaning staff had further compounded by spraying a nasty floral air freshener, which made the place smell like a moldy dead bouquet, with just a touch of sewage. The carpet was unpleasantly damp as well, and the capper was - the bathroom floor was sticky and my flip flops stuck to the floor. I refused to walk barefoot on the carpet, and washed my feet after I had done so. It was 1:30am, but I called the front desk to complain. I am not one to make a fuss (hell, our daughter worked in the hospitality industry and I know how hard these poor people work) but this room was not healthy. The front desk attendant told me that the hotel was sold out and he could not switch us out at the time, but would help us first thing in the morning. He offered to give us $50 in food and drink credit, leading me to believe this had happened before. Once we had the AC going, the smell in the room diminished (what a time for me to forget candles! I usually take them whenever I travel) and we were so tired we were able to just go to sleep. First thing the next morning, we were switched to a different room (higher, with a view-and closer to the elevator as well-the other room was almost a quarter of a mile from the elevator, no exaggeration.) The new room smelled like what you expect a hotel room to smell like-that is to say, it didn't. We paid almost $100 for the first room, but they made it ok-sort of. I will conduct a separate review of the restaurant-think we will hit the buffet. The hotel is in a nice location and the public areas are very nice-but when we talked to the housekeeping supervisor and tried to get her to "smell" the room, she was very reluctant, and when she did, she acknowledged that it needed attention. Think that says it all.

Stayed in the Rush towers which are newer. Definitely worth the extra money because the rooms are modern looking and have a very nice bathroom. I love Fremont street. It feels so Vegas. 

The pool is not as nice as it looks in pictures. There were a lot of kids when I went so it felt like a water park.

Hello my old friend. Haven't seen you in too long. Please show me your generosity once more 
On the real, I feel like I'm in Hawaii when I'm here. Not ghetto but not too high class where one would feel intimidated to play. And the lighted canopy just outside the doors is always awesome!

Gave them a second chance... I understand this may be our fault as well but we left our new hyrdroflask in our room on sunday1\/17\/16 but for some reason house keeping and "lost and found" have no record of it. Its really frustrating that someone would even take a water bottle....

After writing my initial review, they instantly followed up with me.  After several conversations both good and bad, they offered me two free nights for our trouble and losses.  It's a drop in the bucket to them, but shows they are "sincerely" sorry about our bad experience.  Hopefully when we make our return, it's a much better experience.

The hotel was OK.  Nothing special, but fine.

I was taking the elevator down with my son and a large group of other hotel guests, when we reached the lobby floor everyone began to excit.  My son and I were the last to attempt to excit the elevator when the doors began to close.  I waved my hand to reopen the doors but the elevator door closed smashing and trapping my arm.  I pulled and pulled as the elevator started to go back up.   I started yelling as my son did the same.  The other people that left the elevator saw what was happening.  Finally I was able to free myself.  The elevator went up and then came back down.  Some of the other people had already began to report to the hotel what had happened.  I did the same.  I was treated by the risk manager Richard Smith like I was trying to scam the hotel.  I was not.  I was not bothered medical help or even a free stay.  Very poor service!!!!

What a gem!  Last bit of class in downtown.  Great staff, clean rooms, great casino!!!  Plus if you are feeling like being a bit dodgy - all the finest in decadence (albeit trashy decadence) is only a stones throw away.  I'd definitely recommend this place, especially if you are on a budget!

Initially booked a room at Golden Gate but they were overbooked and walked us over to Golden Nugget next door. Funny thing is before they walked us they said that they would waive all of the resort fees. When we walked over and asked Golden Nugget front desk to confirm they'd waive the fees, they said they never had resort fees to begin with! Haha. 

As far as the hotel, it's a good place to stay if you have kids! There's a swimming pool in the middle of the casino that the kids can hang out in while the adults gamble or drink on Fremont street. The standard rooms are nice. This particular night we stayed in the Carson Tower and it was somewhat of a long walk to our room since there are so many rooms in the casino. I personally have seen the suites in golden nugget and it's a great place to stay if you're looking to book a night with a bunch of friends.

You never get a second chance to make a good first impression. My wife and I walked into the lobby and the VIP desk (which we paid for so we wouldn't have to wait in the long line trying to check in) was closed. We then waited 20 minutes in line to check in. Then when we finally got to the counter, got our room keys we took our bags upstairs as their was no porter to carry the bags, then when we got to our room, there was someone else in it! LOL! So we had to take our bags back downstairs and stand in line again to get another room! On the second trip up the elevators we were assigned room 1625 in The Gold Tower which was right near the elevators. Which we heard every night, all night, for all 4 days of our stay. Out of the 4 days we stayed, our room was only cleaned twice, one of the sinks in the bathroom was clogged and they finally got maintenance to come unclog it the second day. One of the lamps in the room didn't work, and the way the bathroom was designed, you had to close the bathroom door to open the closet. Why they had the closet in the bathroom I still couldn't figure out. Then when you opened the closet doors they wouldn't stay open. Then when we checked out which was early in the morning on a Monday the VIP desk was also closed so we spent money upgrading to VIP for nothing. This lack of service also cost them thousands of dollars in gambling revenue which they lost because after dealing with some of the staff at the hotel and the casino, I refused to do any gambling at The Nugget and caught a cab to the strip. This hotel is rated as a 4 star hotel and has a very nice pool area and casino. The Fremont Street light show is also nice. However this hotel is not a four star hotel based on the customer service which was seriously lacking and the overall design of the rooms. The rooms are very cheap compared to staying on the strip, however you are going to sacrifice service. If you are someone like me who doesn't worry about price, then spend the extra money and stay on the strip. In all my trips to Vegas I have always stayed on the strip, so this time I wanted to try staying downtown since people had told me about the great renovations at The Golden Nugget. Although they spent a lot of money on the pool area and the casino, they would have gotten more bang for the buck firing the staff and hiring all new people!

This Golden Nugget has built a new tower (Rush) and upgraded the rooms in an attempt to make people believe that this is a 4 or 5 star hotel.  And in fact, the rooms are gorgeous both in the Rush Tower suites and the Gold Tower rooms.  However, the Front Desk people are lacking the most basic interpersonal skills when dealing with customers.

Rush Tower Notes: Noise from the Fremont Street is noticeable if you are on the North Side with most shows going until midnight.  On the South Side noise from the pool is noticeable on the lower floors and goes until midnight or 2 am depending on the day.

Gold Tower rooms are decorated similar to the Rush rooms, but the renovations that they did were not that well planned out, especially in the bathroom.
They have done some great updates to the casino. Looks much newer, the pool area is great with the new aquarium slide. The sushi restaurant is decent. Downtown Vegas is always fun.

There are so many things I love about this hotel. First of all, you can go from the front desk to your room without going through the casino. You can easily go from your room to the pool without going through the casino as you pass it on your way. The pool is outstanding! My kids loved the water slide going through the shark tank. Let me say that your child needs to either swim or have floaties as when they land in the water at the end of the slide, it is a bit deep. The drinks are reasonably priced ($7) and the reserved area has a low minimum to sit there ($25). There is a shallow area of the pool with these really cool chairs that are partially in the water. I loved the classic rock music playing poolside and the jacuzzi is nice and hot. Unlike hotels on the strip there is a coffee maker in the room (keurig) so bring your own coffee or you can pay $10 for the 4 provided in your room. Adjacent to Fremont street with its crazy laser light shows and street performers. I would stay here again. Clean rooms oh and did I mention there is a Starbucks right at the elevator to the room?

Good for adults that need to pass out from a night of drinking, but not good for kids.  

The hotel lobby and casino area are very clean and well kept, but once you get to your room be prepared for nasty black stains all over the carpet, hair in your tub, and candy wrappers all over the floor.  We called the hotel manager to get a refund, but all they said they could do is give us a free buffet at their piss poor excuse for a buffet and have someone come clean our room.... again.  We languished slept and ate at the terrible buffet, which had about zero choices of entree to choose from and all tasted like crap.

I also choose this casino because they had a workout facility, I went to the gym area, which looked like a Bath and Body Works and said, "Is this the Gym?"  A woman said, "Yes, for $20 you can have access to the workout area."  Nice, I have to pay for the gym just like the water in my room, coffee, Internet, etc?  This place is trying to get more money out of me after I already paid a fortune to stay in their coat closet?

The most important reason we went to this hotel with our kids was for the giant fish tank pool experience, which was actually not experienced by us at all because the hotel caters to drunks that are passed out until checkout time.  The "Butt Nugget," our new nickname for the facility, does not open the pool until 1 hour before checkout, which would give us no time to swim, back to the room, shower, and checkout.

Oh well, lesson learned.  Going to the M nextime!
My girlfriend won $15K in Pei Gow poker there, so we love the place and hope the luck continues.

We stayed at the Golden Nugget the last night of our honeymoon.  We had stayed on the strip, and thought it would be cool to stay on Fremont Street the last night.  They have done some upgrades to the property, but coming from the modern hotels on the strip I felt like I was taking a downgrade.  The one redeeming feature they have is the shark tank by the pool.  It was really cool to swim near the tank and use the water slide that goes through the tank.

The hotel was nice. Smokey in the casino (and all of the downstairs) but that is apparently to be expected. The room was nice and clean (and no smoke smell on the floor). Watch your bill. We got double charged for some stuff -we paid the resort fee but were also charged for internet (which is included in the resort fee). It took a few calls, but we got it straightened out. Everyone I spoke to (in person or on the phone) was helpful and friendly. Be aware you will wait in a long line to check in (think airport check-in). Our room was pretty quiet - we asked for strip\/mountain view. The Freemont Street Experience was pretty cool. The Gordie Brown show was not. Make sure you bring bottled water! Parking can be a challenge, but we managed.

Old Vegas. Some people love it, and other people....act like it doesn't even exist.

I happen to be one of those people who love it.

So cheap. So tacky. And such a blast.

Sure, modern Vegas is great & fun, but you can do so much more for so much less on Fremont Street!


The Golden Nugget is where you should stay if you're into hanging out on Fremont Street, hands down.

Myself and 3 other people stayed in one of the Rush Tower deluxe rooms. And the room was fantastic. 2 Televisions, a fantastic bathroom, 2 couches......

...but only one bed.

When I reserved the room, the website said it was for up to four people and had the option of getting two full beds.

When we arrived they told us that was an option, but not a guarantee.

Normally this sort of customer service would merit a god awful review.

But....they have a slide that goes through a shark tank!

And as I said, the room was very nice for the price, especially for 4 people. There was plenty of room to sleep on the couches...but when you're two couples, it's a little less than ideal.

But if you're going with a few friends or if that doesn't bother you, then go for it. No regrets staying at the Golden Nugget, and I definitely would do it again. My only complaint is that I wish they'd be a little more honest with their online reservations.

Ugh. Downtown hotels. I don't know any other sentiment is good for this place. I'm sure if you come here to gamble or have cheap eats, you would enjoy this place a lot with their $4.99 late night steak specials and $1 minimum black jack tables, but as far as the quality of your stay goes, it goes without saying that this is not your Vegas.

Although I agree with some reviewers that this place is one of the classier places in Las Vegas, if you're seeking out a cheap room during CES, you should be prepared to pay $$$ for a * location, * bed, * shower and swimming in smoke in your short trip from the elevator to the exit. 

The rooms have this nice moldy stench, and kind of leaves you feeling icky like you stayed at a really random Motel 6 middle of nowhere and you're not too sure if the black stain in the floor was a stale piece of gum left there for years. Bleh.

The Nugget just keeps getting better and better! They're building a new tower with a restaurant that will have a huge aquarium. The Tank makes me a little sad because the sharks and fish seem frustrated, doesn't seem very friendly environment for them.
If you get a cabana you'll have a blast, cozy chairs, private lounge area, fridge and flat screen make for a good respite from the crowds.
We stayed in both the South and North towers, the North has updated bedding (hello down!) but is pretty much the same as the South and only a wee bit more expensive.
The Grotto, Cafe and buffet all offer excellent and reasonable dining options.
the wife got here boot beer here which was cool and we had breakfast here as well pretty nice for a older place in vegas i prob would stay here even.

Decided to stay an extra day after Christmas and booked a room here on Hotwire for $39. Showed up, waited at check-in for about 15 minutes, after which I was told the hotel overbooked. One star for this.

Asst. manager on duty said she would refund my payment and got us a comp room at the Hilton, so extra star for this.

The room was clean, but nothing fancy. Why I give it a one star is because of the customer service. Absolutely, the worst I've encountered in a hotel. Something is going on with management as none of the employees seem happy and accordingly  take it out on the guests.   All could benefit from lessons in civility.

It began when I checked in. I was to receive a coupon book, but was told it only applied for future visits. I later found out this not to be the case.

My biggest irritant was returning to the hotel to find the valet was not accepting any more vehicles. After circling the self park for twenty minutes I left the parking garage. The attendant was extremely rude and told me I would have to park some where else. Rather than try to help me, she was more concerned with letting me know the hotel would not be reimbursed me for the parking fee. At 12:30 PM, I really wasn't concerned with the fee as I was finding a place to park. What they had done was sold the lot. If the guests are inconvenienced, that is OK, as they are making a fee.

When I checked out the next day I expressed my displeasure in not being able to park at the hotel. It fell on deaf ears and no offer was made to send a bellman to help me take my luggage to the other hotel's parking garage. They really didn't care, they were not being inconvenienced.

I was left with the impression that all the Golden Nugget is concerned about is extracting every dollar they can from you with the least effort possible. If you are expecting any thing resembling customer service, this is NOT the hotel to go to (they even seemed put out when asked for directions).  If you don't mind being lied to, putting up with rude staff,  and inconvenienced, then stay here as it will happen.

Hotel is nice but just a suggestion for the casino, maybe invest in a door guy to check ids, or offer a desk where people can get a wristband stating they are 21 or something, my cousin got carded 5x in 15 mins, no exaggeration it got to the point it wasn't even fun to gamble bc she was constantly being bothered so we went somewhere else.
Overall didn't enjoy my stay here at all. Room was soooooooo dang far away from the elevator and everywhere smelled like smoke. Paid way too much for this room

We stayed in the Rush tower and paid for an upgrade room.  The room was beautiful and large.  But at night the noise was so loud from Fremont street it was vibrating my bed.  It sounded like the band was in my room.  Didn't get any sleep at all.  For this reason. I give it a 3 star.  If u like peace and quiet when u sleep do not stay in this tower.

I stayed at the Carson tower.
It was for business since I work seasonally at the Furniture Market and this place is the best you can get in that area.

I didn't know what to expect from a hotel in Fremont street, but everything turned out great.

The beds were very comfortable, the staff was nice enough and the noise level was not at all what I feared. The decor was kind of dated, but I don't really care, the room was very big and it had a nice TV and a desk.

The rush tower is the nicest, it's the newer tower and everything there is more modern, but even if you don't have that upgrade, you will be ok as long as you are not expecting fanciness.

Be prepared, they charge you for EVERYTHING! a bottle of water was $7!! and there is no refrigerator, the coffee pack in the room is $10. So, go to the store ahead of time and get some bottled water and coffee if you need it in the morning. There is a Starbucks downstairs but the line is never ending.

I ate at all their restaurants and there are all very good and decently priced.

The only thing that I didn't like is that the whole place stinks like smoke, but I guess that is a "Vegas thing" not really just that hotel. Also too many children in the casino! If you are one of those parents that has a yard of beer in one hand and a toddler in the other hand while you play slots at 11:00 at night, I have one question for you: "WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU?????"

The pool is nice, if you don't mind public pools, they have a slide that goes through a shark tank, I personally think public pools are kind of yucky but if you are into that sort of thing theirs looks ok.

The Golden Nugget seems to be the "Wynn" of downtown.  It seems to be a little more elegant, a little cleaner, a little nicer, and a little more upscale than most of the others on Fremont.  It's also very crowded, the traffic aisles through the casino are very narrow, and you can get claustrophobic in a hurry.  

The last time I was there, the reason for stopping in was to see a show, "Defending the Caveman".  The theater was large and had comfortable seating, and I enjoyed the show.

I've been wanting to try a couple of the restaurants here, but had already eaten dinner at Triple 7 Brew Pub at Main Street prior to the show.  Will put dinner at Golden Nugget on my list for next trip.

It's a nice place, and I had a good time at the show.

Tops for Downtown, for sure... this is an absolute gem (not a nugget)!!! Clean room, very nice hallways, good ice locations, view was of the backside roof on the 6th floor, but hey...it was ~$70 avg. inc. Fri. for 5 days, love it! I got bored being in just Downtown for 5 days (only so much to see and blaces to gamble), BUT there is super easy transport to the Strip from GN. I actually walked from DT to the Stratosphere in 20 mins. 
Buffet is probably the best in quality DT, but you pay a bit much for it. Pool was closed cause it's Winter. But I have been here in Summer and it was crowded. Cool shark tank. Great layout on the Casino floor, plenty of good slot choices, but the table games have a fair mix of $5 - $25 min's.
The swankiest of DT Locals casinos. Loved it. Will go back.

This was my first time staying Downtown and the Golden Nugget was a solid choice.  The casino is large and easy enough to navigate.  My issues here were minimal;  I understand that you can charge more for the nicer towers (Rush and Gold) but at least maintain Carson just as well, even if you don't update.  Our room was nice enough, but showing signs of neglect and wear.  Not gross by any means... just a little shoddy.  After our first night, we didn't even get housekeeping service.  An oversight, I'm sure, and nothing to throw a fit about.  We were just a bit puzzled and thought maybe it was a hotel policy... no daily service if you are staying multiple days?  I don't know, but then the room was cleaned up each day after that.  Anyway, they have the best pool downtown and several restaurant options onsite.  I would stay here again.  BTW, the Wi-Fi is built into the daily resort fee ($22.60 per day w\/ tax), but it's only for 2 devices.  You are also supposed to get 2 bottles of water in your room that resort fee covers, but I drank one of mine and never got more, so.... maybe not?
Terrible service. Took me like an hour to check in. They only have one person doing the registrations.  They also sell water for 4$....

Stayed here a few years ago and heard it is even better now. It was great before and so I can't imagine it now. There is nothing that I didn't like about this place. The only reason it isn't a 5 star is that I can't really remember gambling here.

I stayed here Sept. 21-23, 2014. My previous stay was a couple years prior. This is definitely one of the best properties in Downtown LV, BUT it was obvious that management had not a lot of money into keeping the hotel up. Hotels.com and other sites have it rated as 4-star, but I would put it as 3-star, particularly, when compared to other hotels rated 4-star. Casino has a good vibe, and decent sports book, though could use more seating. They have a poker room too with daily tournaments. The rooms are comfortable, beds are not too soft, and they have flat screen TVs. Best thing about the resort is the pool\/shark tank. Cons: old town LV tends to be dirty.  Hallway carpets looked pretty dirty. Valet was slow.

It has been over a year since writing the last review, and I wrote that post immediately after I returned.  A lot happened after.  A week had gone by, and had no response from the Las Vegas Police.  I ended up calling and leaving emails till they responded (took 5 days).They put a detective on the case, and left me a voice mail saying that the Cameras in the hallways are not turned on.  They are actually fake cameras.  Only the casino cameras are working, no surprise.  

I also wrote a review on Trip Advisor about the robbery.  5 people who saw my review contacted me that they were robbed the same way: While they were sleeping in their room. Robbed on the first night of their stay, because you would be carrying the most amount of cash.  Around a holiday or an event happening in Vegas.  4 of them were on the same floor and tower in a span of 6 years.  All of them did not have a chain lock or deadbolt on their door, until they were relocated to another room.  After reviewing some of my photos of the first day, we did not have a chain lock on our door either.   The Golden Nugget didn't do anything about it, and shrugged it off.  The corporate office also gave the runaround.  

I had some time to reflect on the incident.  The robbers were professional about it.  They lined our bags by the bathroom door, so they can use the light to go through the bags without it being bright in the room. The room was also pitch black because of the curtains.  The money and casino stubs were in multiple areas.  I found my wallet was on the nightstand, but I do remember leaving them in my pant pocket on the floor.  Which means they were that close to us.  They did not steal our cell phones or credit cards, because they can easily be traced. 

Looking back, after we went to the front desk to report the crime, the clerk relocated us to another room.  We went back to our room to gather our stuff, and became locked out, because they room key became invalid.  We called the front desk, and they sent a security guard to open the door.  She said that she could see the history of the card keys used with her electronic device that unlocks the doors.  She just paused and said "oh..." and opened the door.  I never got an answer, because that's when my girlfriend realized her Macbook Pro was missing.

I'm not going to make any accusations, but this is a little too coincidental.

doesn't include free internet with stay.
room is big but a bit out dated
no coupon booklet or anything special when check in.
No! I won't be back again (to stay in hotel) I would rather stay at downtown grand.

We really like this hotel. Loved that everything is close together. Room service awesome. Pool amazing. Kind of noisy. The only negative is that theirs no overhead lighting in the rooms. Not enough outlets in rooms. We would definitely stay here again! Fremont street is a whole new experience!

stayed in the carson tower...room was excellent, clean and in great shape except for an odor that come from the sink..a sulfur smell???  comfortable bed, great pillows and a good nights sleep...staff at hotel was friendly, easy check in...the carson tower is a bit of a walk from the main casino floor but worked out well since we ate lots of food while we were there...freemont street at night is not to be missed...Americana at its best!!!  overall a great stay and we will surely be back...buffet was just average at best...

Had to make some changes to previous review 

Second visit in a row that I've been placed in a nonsmoking room that absolutely reked of cig's , oh of course housekeeping came by and sprayed some  of the stuff they spray to no avail , spent 5 nights and even then you can still smell that horrible smell - not sure what the answer is for the management team but you have to figure out a way to kerp smokers OUT of nonsmoking rooms - way to expensive to have to deal with that annoyance on a daily basis - I don't know what the answer is but as a long time guest that has visited the property many times I THINK you should be able to solve this ongoing issue - if not , I wont be back . FIX THIS ISSUE PLEASE

The cocktail waitress took my boyfriends order at the slots. When I said what I wanted, she said "im only getting you a (free) drink if your gambling!". I throw money in the machine and she takes my order. Go through it quickly and go back to watching my bf. 

We having been moving from machines. I Typically go slow and only spend $40 through the night; boyfriend just feeds the machine, lol. 

The cocktail waitress bring back one drink..... Says "I looked at the cameras, you aren't gambling!"
an obvious lie. 

We cash out and leave immediately with the beer. Super rude. Regret tipping her still.

How tacky. Even if I didn't gamble all night, my boyfriend is. In San Diego, the casinos are much classier and have never had any such problem while watching for a bit.

Never stayed here - but we love using the pool here - its hands down one of the best in town, with a slide that goes through a shark tank!
Its also open super late and has plenty of seats, bars ,towels and everything else you need.

I really enjoyed the hide out at H2O pool. It was a bit crowded but what can you expect its las vegas and over 100 degrees out. The pool was neat i thought, i loved the waterfalls, just the ability to relax on a chair in the water, drink a pina colada, and watch the sharks in the tank. The slide looked cool to try but i did not try. It got windy by 5pm so we decided to go in the hot tub that was nice but because there were more kids in the hot tub then the pool that part sucked. I almost had a kid jump on me because he thought it was funny to run, try and jump in the water. I was getting a bit angry but finally after the 5th jump the kid's parents yelled at him. There was trash on the ground everywhere but once again its las vegas and it is party season so i just ignored that but i just thought to myself that people are pretty lazy that they can't even throw their trash in a trash can. I did take notice that the cleaning staff was trying to keep up on it. I had a fun day in the sun with my friend. I would go again, can not really complain since a friend got us in for free. If you have time while staying here in vegas or live here all year round, i would take a day and go swimming here. 

There were some things that i took noticed as i was leaving that give me another reason to come back. I took notice to stairs going up to a top level with a pool maybe a better place to relax and get away from the crowd and kids. I also want to try the slide, pretty neat that it goes right through the shark tank. there are firepits so a nice evening by the pool maybe more relaxing once the crowds head out for a night on the strip.  parking was free, i know the sign said $2 hour but the lady let me go for free so that was nice of her. there was one thing that scared me a bit but i almost got hit by a car as I left the hotel. one of the streets as you leave the golden nugget hotel grounds there is a street and it is a bit hard to see because of cars parked and people trying to cross but just be careful because you have to pull out a bit far to be able to see if anything is coming and there is no four way stop which i think there should be. i believe the road is called Gold Nugget Drive but once you get there you'll know what I am talking about. its the main street before you pull into a drive way that has the parking garage, valet and pool entrance for the golden nugget.

I would absolutely stay here again! 

Having never been to Fremont, I decided that this year for EDC I'd book a place downtown and explore another part of Vegas than the strip (at off-strip prices!). My flight got in at 6:30am, so I went to the front desk exhausted and hoping by some miracle that the room I'd reserved or one enough like it was available already. 

It wasn't, but the gentleman at checkin did offer me an upgrade to a suite for what ended up being $35 per night (really, $60 but that included the resort fee which we would have paid anyway) and I leapt at the opportunity. I was given a room on the 16th floor and informed of all the additional amenities I could enjoy as a club level guest. The process did take a bit longer than I'm used to, especially for how early it was in the day, but I didn't mind that as I was just looking forward to trying to sleep.

The room was, honestly, far larger than I needed. It was just myself and rave bae, so we didn't really need a living room or 6-seat dining room. But the minifridge, daily bottles of water (something like 8 bottles) and an extra bathroom really came in handy! 

The bed was comfortable, the Gilchrist and Soames toiletries were a nice plus, and the towels were the best I've ever used - so absorbent I am buying some for my home. The floor was quiet for the most part (which is unusual for EDC week but I guess the folks staying up there with us, being as they're spending more money probably want a calmer experience) and although the hallway smelled stale (kind of like cat pee) the room did not, at all. 

I did use the spa while I was there which was such a nice addition to the trip - honestly in itself worth it for the price of the upgrade. 

Well done golden nugget! I'll be back for EDCs in the future!
This place is always great to stay at never had a complaint about it. Staff is helpful and kind

Somebody else wrote up the first review of this hotel while I was staying here (I feel robbed!) but I still have plenty to say about the Golden Nugget. The pool is........ well, I don't know because it is being remodeled! The spa is......... I don't know because it is being remodeled. The lounge is............. Again, I have no idea because EVERYTHING COOL ABOUT THIS HOTEL IS BEING REMODELED!!! The story is, if you want to know about the Golden Nugget you must come back in June.  And whatever you do-- don't cross the street and venture into The Plaza. Contrary to the rumors, it's not like the "Plaza" in New York (at all!) and is a soul sucking experience.

But there is a saving grace here, and that would be the wonderful real estate conference being held here by my friend's family. I highly recommend it although I will not name who they are for the sake of their privacy (they are like the kennedys). The other good thing about "the nugg" was the 13.99 champagne buffet brunch. The food itself was god awful, but it was gratis, and the mimosas were just lovely! And who doesn't love a vegas buffet? 

Also the in-room movie selection was fantastic - I think we saw 3 separate movies starring Donald Faison, some of which never even made it to the movie theater! Ha ha. I'm sorry this review makes no sense, but as you can see, neither did my vacation...

TRY THE WORLD FAMOUS BREAD PUDDING!

Update:
*****************
I just looked at their website and it turns out the pool they are adding is like the coolest pool known to man. I'm talking about trained dolphins, waterfalls, moats and and tiki hut cabanas spun from gold!!! I am laughing and crying right now just looking at this sketch of the pool that did not exist when I visited....

You get what you pay for.

I just needed to a place to crash for the night, and the $60 room in the Carlton Suites sounded fine.

Of course, it was older, and not exactly what you'd call luxurious - but the bed was comfy.

However; the window heater was basically broken and make LOUD clicking sounds whenever it started up. The toilet also ran loudly every six minutes or so (yes, I timed it).  Fortunately, I had earplugs with me. 

The two real downsides?
The registration for the Carlton Towers was closed, making me walk with all of my luggage over to the other tower to register - and then back to the Carlton towers - a bit of a hike when you have luggage, and there was no offer of help with that. Serious drag. I suppose that if I had valet parked my car, this wouldn't have been an issue - but I don't trust valets.

Also - and more important; the bathroom was not clean.
Black mold in the showers. Scuff marks on the floor and on the side(!) of the sink. There were rings from drink glasses on the nightstand and vanity. Not like white water marks on the wood, but actual rings from soda or something. Hello? Housekeeping??

I have been told that the newer towers are much nicer, and I'd be willing to try them out.

The whole place is right in the heart of Fremont Street - so if that's your scene, this is the place to stay. 

If you're a college kid who just doesn't really care about things being super clean, or are on a seriously tight budget, then I'd consider the Carlton Tower; otherwise, I'd look at other options.

We stayed in the Carson Towers, which is the older section of the hotel. The air conditioner in our room was extremely loud, no central air. The room was ok just slightly outdated but clean. The pool and shark tank  were great but you have to get your spot early before all the chairs are gone (seems by 11:30 they're all taken\/reserved). Friendly staff, decent breakfast buffet. Good cocktails poolside.

Great Hotel, Great staff, great location....

This hotel is everything I was looking for in Vegas. The fact that you don't have to walk 4 miles to go from your hotel to the restaurants and then to the pool was the best part. Valet is FREE, the wi-fi not being free is not an issue as my phone has free Wi-fi anyway.  The price of drinks and food will more spendy than back home, WAY cheaper than any other Vegas hotel. 

  The pool OMG was to die for, the kids had a blast, and yes.. there was a lot of kids but guess what adults.. You have two upper decks with your own pool areas.. So why are you complaining about too many kids in the pool?  I was able to get up by 7am to throw a towel down on some chairs to reserve them for later, but I felt bad for the people that walked around forever looking for an empty chair. The pool was over-crowded people were sitting on the ground....I saw like 4 fights about people reserving chairs with old towels.. I say, quit whining, get up early and do the same thing :) 

 My kids and I had a BLAST, great hotel, great clean comfy, quiet room, all in all we visit Vegas like 5 times a year.... We will be back!!

Finally, Fremont Street is amazing and WAY more fun than the strip! Free concerts, street performers, etc.... We will never stay on the strip again!!
Great Stay. Only place downtown I would stay at. Pay extra for the suite. Enjoyed the experience. Very convenient!

Im sorry, but to all of you who say its TOO SMOKEY. get the F out of Vegas people, you are in a casino, and people do SMOKE!!!!!!


moving on...

I love the Golden Nugget. Since growing up I have been to Vegas many many times with my parents, usually always staying on the strip. Once I turned 21 and was able to go myself, I decided to visit the Golden Nugget. I've been here about 3 times now & I really do love it. I love their pool, their rooms are very nice!! Clean, updated, flat screens, comfortable beds. etc. Their black jack tables also starts at 5 $ minimum, which is better then 20$ minimum like other hotels on the strip. Its about a 10 - 15 min drive from the strip which is not far at all. Plus you have your own little downtown strip, which yes ITS OLD, but its cool, you dont have to walk 3 miles to get to the next hotel, people are dressed up, cheap food etc.

If you hate paying the resort fees, would like a clean nice updated room, a cute hotel. Nice Shark tank swimming pool, 5 $ tables.. etc. etc. Stay here! Then go to the strip at night.

Have fun in Vegas people!

Great Hotel, Beautiful pool and shark tank.  Great staff and tons to do onsite. A must do again.

No complaints other than the rooms are a little out dated.

I had no issues with Golden Nugget. It was pretty much how I expected. We stayed in the Carson Tower suites as we chose the lowest budget rooms. We got double beds. It wasn't really what we wanted, but we opted not to upgrade so that is on us. Resort fee was expected as I read reviews before going and I know it is not exclusive to this hotel.The beds are comfy. Overall good night of sleep. Room was pretty basic. Hotel staff were very friendly. We received water any time we asked.
We did not get to enjoy the pool as the one day we set aside to do so ended up being windy and cold. It is a beautiful pool area.
We enjoyed playing in the casino here. Make sure you join the player's club.
Location is fantastic. Freemont St is amazing for people watching and great vibe.
If you enjoy value, nostalgia, casual vibe, and people watching this place may be for you. I will absolutely stay here again.
The only thing I did not like, and this is an issue in more than just the GN, is the time share people from Diamond Resorts. They are set up in the desk in the "lobby" near the Carson Tower elevators and one of the casino entrances. We were approached with an offer for $150 casino credit, $150 dinner and free stays. Sounds too good to be true? It is. It was only when the lady pulled out a map with "Diamond Resorts" on it that I realized what this was. Research this company and avoid at all costs.

https:\/\/www.tripadvisor.com\/ShowUserReviews-g45963-d91828-r364923569-Golden_Nugget_Hotel-Las_Vegas_Nevada.html#

Lost 6K in 2014, went back November 16, 2016. Golden Nugget offered  me 3 free  room stay with 150. Free play. Went to the players club card to redeem free play credits on the November 16., players club card was closed. I declined to stay at the GN because I can never sleep on there rooms, you can't  breath the outside air, the windows cannot open. Golden nugget  is pumping a lot of oxygen in the  rooms, so you can never yawn or sleep. Lost 1k at golden nugget on November 17 slots  are very tight. They modified the slots payout, to pay less and got rid of all the loose machines and you had to put more money to play the machines the 20 dollar top dollar machine went to 50. The 10. Top dollar increased to 15. To play. You will always loose at the Golden nugget, the payout on the machine sucks!! Don't  gamble here you will always lose!!

Staff is not courteous and unprofessional.

The rooms are nice. The Gold tower suite has dim lighting if you're looking for a romantic stay for that special someone. :)

The new rush tower is also very nice with a large bathroom and tasteful furniture.

This has got to be my favorite hotel in downtown. This recent trip was my second time staying at this hotel. I've only stayed in the Carson tower, so not too sure how the Rush tower looks, but I'm sure it is way better since it's new. Maybe I'll stay there on my next Vegas trip.

The Golden Nugget is in the middle of Fremont and it is also the nicest looking hotel in downtown. The pool is also gorgeous, although I didn't get to go to the pool until the last day of my vacation in 105 degree weather. What's better than hanging out in the pool with a couple beers in the sun?? Not to mention, the weather makes you drunk much faster. 

If you're staying in downtown Vegas, I'd suggest you stay at the Golden Nugget. It may not be as cheap as the California or the other Boyd hotels, but it's much nicer and you get your best bang for the buck!

Rooms are nice , location good, Buffet, not great, Check in can be time consuming Ice 
 machine worked. Low speed internet horrible at night but there. No refridge or micowave. Wish I could post a photo of this . Give you a coffee machine. K cups are 15 bucks.

Ok the Nugget is the Nugget and it is what it is.  We like it.  What we like about it:  It's cheap, it's not too big, low cost tables, low cost food, Freemont street people watching, it's not the strip, friendly dealers,  great pool.  What could be better: showing some age, it's not the strip (I know this was a positive too)

It all depends on what you are looking for in a casino.  If you want glam and glitz and the strip this isn't it.  If you want low mins and no hassle gambling with regular people then this is it.  Good clean room for dirt cheap.

Didn't give 5 stars because the location of my room this time had lots of pool music noise and elevator noise.

All the hotels\/motels I have stayed in over the years, never have I ever been charged for the coffee and the coffee maker in the room. At almost $150 a night, I would expect complimentary coffee in the room, Golden Nugget charges $10 for a 4-pack of K-cups. It used to be that hotels in Las Vegas were thankful for your business, and would comp rooms, offer free drinks, they made sure you enjoyed your stay. I will never stay at Golden Nugget again until the put free coffee in the room.

By far my favorite hotel.  I live in vegas, but with family so needed a place to stay when my fiancé came to visit.

My guy and I stayed two separate occasions within the same trip, because we had to change to new years and a lot was already booked up-he decided to stay another day so we ended up in the carson tower.

First off, we stayed in the Gold Club VIP room- I LOVED IT the bed was SO comfortable, no bedbugs very clean, the Shower was awkward to get into, and as long as you plan to take your clothes out of the closet in there before a bathroom hog gets in you're fine.  My guy LOVED that there was a TV in the mirror, I think he turned it on and never turned it off lol.  I kinda dug how people were envious of us when we had to insert our gold key to get to our floor, and we even explored the presidential\/executive suites floor one night BEAUTIFUL... I might try that when we get married because why the hell not.  It was cool to have free ameneties, wifi, water snacks...

The staff was incredible here and pushed my decision to go for the lowest room type for the one off day I needed another room.

Carson tower; when we first walked into the room, I was surprised to find some things in the room I liked BETTER than the VIP.  The bathroom for one, was a little more normal in size and the showerhead envelopes you when youre in there I wish I had that one at home! the bed, again SUPER soft and no bedbugs.  . . still treated awesomely even though we booked the bareminimum... only flaw about that room was the AC was a little terrible and my guy gets hot.  

Golden Nugget is my favorite place on fremont for sure, the parking is so easy I didn't feel like it was going to be a hassle except, it was packed and a couple nights, we had trouble getting a spot but eventually we got lucky.  

Every intention on booking this again should I need to.

Cant give NO stars. Stayed off the strip and paid for it, through the nose! Service is horrible, and food is inedible. Tried to stay off the strip and paid in more ways than one. Will NEVER make that mistake again!

My wife and I just stayed 5 nights in a rush tower suite, and it was wonderful. Great room with complimentary in room coffee, bottled water, and wi-fi.  The freebies are based on staying in a suite, so pay attention to what type of room you book.  VIP check-in was quick and helpful.  Every service person\/staff we dealt with was great (other than one rather snotty clerk at the ticket\/concierge desk).  Perhaps chalk it up to a bad day...rest of the staff exceptional.  We took advantage of the H2O hideout, paying for lounge chairs one day ($20 each), and a cabana another day($275 weekday w\/ $75 food\/bev credit).  The limited pool chairs fill up quickly, but it you're an early riser you can grab a couple before it fills up.  Our room faced Fremont street, and there was some noise, but I felt it was white noise and it didn't affect my ability to sleep (we were on the 24th floor however).  My wife and I have stayed on the strip and we enjoyed the stay downtown.  Plenty to do and see and if you still want to head over to the strip cab rides are around $26-$28 one-way not including tip.

I love this place!  Its ever changing and upgrading, probably the only hotel downtown that does.  Just went last weekend and had our usual clean room in the Rush Tower.  They have once again renovated and are set to open up a new "Tequila Cantina" and Claim Jumper restaurant.  Unfortunately, we were a little too early to enjoy these new places.  Staff is always super nice and helpful.  Will continue to be a patron for many years to come.  Keep up the good work!!

I had a blast here at the Rush Tower. I was meeting some friends on the Strip and came in a day early, and since I hadn't even been downtown in about 8 years, I decided to spend a night here. Booked a corner junior suite for the unreal rate of $89 and it was one of the hotel bargains of my life. Large open space with a comfy sectional leather sofa and flat-screen, table with two chairs, and actual entryway with decor. Bed is fine and there's another flat-screen facing it. Only room layout problem is that the closet is all the way across the room from the drawers. The bathroom is long if a touch shallow, but there's still plenty of space and it's very attractive in that modern Asian style. The wallpaper that's patterned to look like tile was maybe a touch tacky, but no matter. I was very pleased. (The tub and shower aren't separate, which isn't my preference, but the tub is still wide and deep enough for a good soak.) The vibe of the rooms is sort of like THEhotel at Mandalay Bay, only done with the choicest stuff from Pier One instead of custom-designed originals. 

Some have complained about check-in waits and front-desk service. I arrived about 11:15 and was the eighth party in line.
