I'm not an expert gambler and like to extend my losings over the longest amount of time possible and therefore Golden Nugget served it's purpose.  However, I don't see myself staying here or coming here for anything other than cheap gambling.
The rooms are beautiful, staff is pleasant and pool is bustling. I would come back again and again. Love that they are pet friendly too.

Gotta luv the G-Nug! The Golden Nugget is hands-down the nicest hotel in the downtown area. I prefer downtown when I'm in the mood for a gambling\/drinking trip to Vegas vs. an upscale shopping\/clubbing trip - for that - you go to the strip. 

The check-in process was slow but after that service was not an issue. I did not stay in the upgraded tower but my friends did, the only difference between regular rooms and upgraded rooms is the decor, the rooms are the same size. Personally, I wouldn't spend the money for the upgraded room. In our case (Superbowl weekend) there was a $100 per night difference. 

We pre-booked our rooms using a travel website and when we checked in they informed us that the price per night had dropped and we were issued a refund, pretty cool, right? Score. 

The casino is pricey but they do have a really fun and really cheap virtual poker\/ black jack game - try it! The Rush Lounge is also fun for a cocktail and the Grotto makes a dynamite lasagna!

Like I said ... Gotta Luv The G-Nug!

Italian restaurant  The  Grotto is fine. Great happy hour.

The usual slots, lots of over intoxicated patrons who enjoy being especially loud and boisterous. 

No benefit to the players club, other than the initial sign up freebie.  

Cool pool with sharks and other sea life trapped behind glass.

Could use massive updating.
Had a wonderful time in the casino as always..... Will definitely stay here on our next trip. The pool area is one of a kind and the customer service here is always on point.

Everything was clean and in good condition.  I was disappointed that this is the second time that we have been there and the pool was unavailable.  Also, it would be wonderful if you had a refrigerator in the rooms.  But for the value, this was a GREAT place to stay!

Upgraded to the Gold tower for three nights.{$60 extra June 27-30th}.Saturday night started well. Won $700 at the tables and slots, Saturday night till Sunday Morning there was a loud party next door till 5am.Had to call Security at 4:45..then the hallway doors stopped slamming..yelling and swearing too. Sometimes I think alcohol should be illegal for some yahoos. Thought the Nugget had better clientele, but this was a night from Hell,they took off our $20 upgrade charge for that night..only ruined our whole Sunday as we were exhausted all day. Pool was great Sunday until 4pm..then the alcohol fired up rowdies partied hard. I remember when Vegas was classy,but Frank Dean and Sammy are long gone ,rest in peace,we won't stay here again..to bad..used vto love it here. 5th stay here. Hotels are focused on the revenue from hard drinking,loud,club kids now. JZ

I would give this place four stars for the great rooms, fun pool area, and courteous staff, BUT their front desk staffing is WILDLY INADEQUATE! Yes, I meant to use all caps there--this issue needs to be addressed.

Arriving after midnight, with a wiped-out child in tow, it was simply unacceptable to wait 40 minutes in line in order to get the keys to the room we had prepaid for weeks earlier. What could possibly take them so long? Do they even have computers? They spent ten minutes with each guest checking in; what were they doing, chiseling the contract on stone tablets?

Then, once in our room (which was beautifully furnished and very clean), we discovered that they had provided us with only one bed, despite a reservation for two. A call to the front desk got it resolved with a rollaway, which would have been fine except for the 30 minutes spent on hold! Seriously, 30 minutes just to talk to someone (who, again, was very nice). The actual rollaway delivery happened within five minutes, so no knock on housekeeping. The problem was strictly with the staffing level at the front desk--they were overwhelmed.

Seriously, the rooms are great, the pool is great, the restaurants are fine, but the front desk staffing renders it nearly unusable for a short trip. We were only stopping for one night\/morning, so we spent nearly 10% of our time there waiting for front desk staff to be available. If this is some kind of weird business strategy, I'd love to have it explained. More likely someone's idiot son-in-law has been put in charge of staffing the desk and has decided to cut costs by reducing staffing levels; if so, they have not only cut costs, but also cut this visitor from ever returning. It's a beautiful property, but it's just not worth enduring the wait.

Went to Las Vegas with a group, to visit a convention in town. So I made our reservations, to hold the room. And was told that it would cover the first night! all is good right, wrong. We checked in and told them we are splitting the room charge and the stay, they took both credits cards,and said it will be done !  We Checked out on Sat. 4\/5\/14 they split the bill, took our credit cards ,and split them. Never saying they are only splitting the second  night ! So ,just so you know, if you are using your  credit card to hold the first night , you will end up paying for that night ! And if you hold more ,rooms your stuck. Only way , I found out was 2 charges for one stay ! And the lady at the Nugget , said what do you want me to do about it! Then she tells me I'm not the first one that said something. Really !!!!

This is the first time we stayed @ the Nugget previous night we were at the The Plaza big difference, this place was more alive.. glad I didn't have to pay the resort fee, wasnt able to get a coupon book because I used my AAA 10% discount.. wish I had a choice to see which would of been more beneficial to us.. we had a great time in this place alot to do but only had one day, so until next time...

Service is horrible at the bars. The bartenders pick and choose who they want to serve then ignore everyone else. Especially at the sports bar. I'm in the industry in Vegas and it was the worst service I've seen anywhere! The pool is nice, crowded but fun. The rooms are a little beat up and super noisy from Fremont street. Don't plan on getting any sleep. The best place was the Golddigger club. Excellent DJ, service, view and atmosphere. It's small but it doesn't have that stuffy feel of all the other Vegas clubs. And the bartenders were awesome as well!
this company is a joke. they do not even bother responding to bbb complaints or even attempt to make anything right. if ypu want quality customer service, do not stay here.

Very nice hotel with potential to be a four star hotel.  However they're regressing, therefore my rating for them is two stars.

Housekeeping rarely vacuums the carpet in the rooms.  Yes they'll make the beds, empty the trash and change the linens.  There's this one pretzel that's been just underneath the bed for two days that any vacuum cleaner would have obliterated.

Speaking of housekeeping, today as I was in the bathroom and as my wife slept, they came barging in without warning.

Some of these things are not the hotel's fault, for instance the idiot who called my room around midnight stating that he occupied the room previously and left items in the safe.  (Eastern European accent)

The bartender in the casino who wouldn't comp me a beer even though I was playing video poker, making the maximum bets.  He said I needed to put more money in the machine.  Hell, I started off with a hundred!  I can't help that it's gotten down to $3.75 while you are flirting with a waitress..

Gold Digger's night club turned me away for wearing a bandana.  I am there once a year for a birthday party at the end of April.  Had on a bandana each time.

It's Sunday, Gold Digger's  is empty (except for my friends), I'm 53 years old and I get carded then turned away.

The bathtubs always have slow drains.  All of them.

Neither one of the card keys worked well on the doors.  Five swipes minimum to gain entry to the room.  Went to the front desk and had them replaced.  Same problem.

Did I mention that this is a very nice hotel?

I got in early Wednesday but as expected, there were no rooms clean.  I was offered and upgrade to the Gold tower for $20.00 extra per night.

My friends got in late Thursday and the Carson rooms were sold out, they all were upgraded to the Gold tower for no extra charge.

Then there's this new resort fee.  

Today is Sunday, April 26, 2015.  I'm still here and I can't wait to checkout tomorrow!

Back to the strip for me.

Nothing notable about this casino. I did not stay in the hotel. Nice locale downtown Vegas. 
We sat at the bar to play video poker & the bartender rudely advised us we HAD to play a minimum of $20 at $1 lowest bet or pay $6 each for the beer we ordered. He then proceeded to wait for me as i was choosing my game and asked "are you playing or paying $6?!" If we were that hard up for free beer we couldve played slots & waited for the waitress, then left. He must be under pressure by management to really be on that free beer. Disappointing attitude, especially when youre already losing a lot of money
Great show: Gordie Brown. !!!! 6 plus times we have seen his show.  Buffet is excellent. ..a few dollars more includes show tickets.
Good place to stay.. Away from strip but u wil have 24 hours buses to strip.. Shark aquarium is highlight for this hotel... Rooms r good.. U wil njoy stay

We stayed for two nights, we spent most of Saturday at the pool, it was wonderful.   We had not planned on staying the entire day pool side but hour after after hour we found more things to enjoy.    The room was okay, we were staying in the older tower but we spent very little time in the room.   The hotel had everything we needed and it was very very easy to walk out to Fremont Street to pick up anything else we needed.   We went on the zip line, we had a plan to meet up with a young group who had been staying on the strip, it was easy to meet up in the ice bar and walk down to the zip line area.     On the way the youngsters noticed all the bargain prices on drinks and so they ended up spending the afternoon drinking and gambling on Fremont Street, three of the gals won jackpots so it made it nice to see that they were so happy, being that they were new to gambling.    The reason for 4 stars was the grill was always slow when I went to order items for pool side and the room was old style.    We had a blast, next time we will ask for the newly remodeled tower.

Overall this hotel is as expensive as anything on the strip. (Once you factor in all the extra costs - see below)

Good: rooms are newish...definitely not horrible. Staff is nice for the most part. 

Bad: be prepared - you have to pay extra for almost everything. Wifi $20 a day. Gym $25 a day. MiniFridge installed in room $25 a day. Coffee machine in room $10 for 4 servings. List goes on. Plus it's on the far side of town so a cab ride from airport is $50. 

Overall just kind of ho-hum. And, sitting by the pool costs money too (for the lounge chairs). 

I am really disappointed in all the extra fees. Feels like a slap in the face especially since i'm here for 5 days.

The casino itself is a bit dated and smoke filled but it is "Old Vegas". -1 star. I'm not much of a gambler so I decided to sit at the bar in the lobby in front of one of the nicest fish tanks I've seen in Vegas. I ordered a mint drink but received a blood orange drink instead. After I got over my initial disappointment I really liked the drink I was given. The group I was with all ordered different drinks and all was good until my wife asked the bartender for an outlet for her charger. The bartender replied "We don't have any because they are all being used by appliances". What the bartender didn't know was that the mirrors behind the bar showed four unused outlets! She lied! We would have preferred a "No" or "it's against policy" but she lied. -1 star for that. 

I also liked the slide from the second story of the building that sends the slider through a SHARK TANK (with reals sharks) and into a pool on the ground level. That was the coolest part.

Not so humbly submitted,
Michael C.

Though a frequent visitior to LV, hadn't visited let alone stayed "Downtown" in at leat 10-15 years.  Wow, have things changed. Love the way they made a covered pedestrian mall out of the main street.  Not only feels and is far safer to walk around, it makes it fun and interesting, especially at night when the covered 'ceiling' turns into a giant projector screen and lots of good music.  As for our stay at the Golden Nugget, we were equally impressed.  While no doubt it cannot be compared with the top hotels on the Strip, it is nevertheless reasonably classy and quite comfortable.  Best of all it is a very good value, and they treat you far better than the Strip (i.e. far fairer and more generous in 'rating' you for comps).  Definately a good alternative when you want a change of scenery from the Strip.

The Golden Nugget is terrible!! They charge $12.99 for internet access, $7.99 for 12 oz  water bottle ,and $10.99 for coffee. They charge your credit card twice, once when you make reservation and another time when you check in the kiosk because they have no employees at the front desk.I was afraid to use or touch anything inside the room I rented because of fear of being charge an obscene amount of money.

Very nice hotel! And very close to the freemont strip. This little strip was amazing. There were many little stores, shops, and mini casinos within this strip. There was also live music and artists. 
The hotel was very fancy and clean. I really enjoyed my time here!

Pros - Location was great for down town, clean room\/bathroom, nice fluffy pillows.  The Chart House and Vic and Anthony's were both amazing!  The Chart House we had sea bass and spinach salad and at Vic's we shared one dinner filet mignon with lobster tail portobello mushrooms for an appetizer and house salad, no drinks the bill was $150 but worth every dollar!  Staff was friendly.  

Cons - Carson tower does not come with a fridge or coffee maker and forget about asking for late check out!  Oh and don't think you'll be using the water slide the one that goes through the "shark tank" (I never saw a shark) because it's been broken since Feb!  And remember the picture on the website of the pool, beautiful bright blue "shark" tank with ONE row of lounge chairs around it?  Well there are really about 100 lounge chairs cramped together so tight you can't walk in between the chairs you just have to crawl onto one.  So plan on getting very close with your neighbors.  Casino was packed!   We paid $94 a night plus resort fee.

Poker room is lousy 2 girls running the list are more interested in talking to some tranny then watching the board so seat people that are wating . Was here tonight and they are not friendly and over heard them making plans with a patron to go out and drink . Pretty ghetto . Golden Nugget has lost its luster never again for me and my friends and family$$$$$$$
shark tank

best pool you are going to find is vegas is definetly here! surrounded by a huge shark tank! included with water slide that goes through it. Also an adult pool (which you have to pay for entrance) is also a great escape from the tons of children. The hotel room was okay had some issues with the shower drain, besides that they reponded to issue very quickly. We choose this hotel specifically for the pool and were both very happy with our choice!

Really enjoyed my visit to the Nugget.  Have always stayed on the strip in the past, and was blown away at how nice the Golden Nugget was.  It isn't as big as places on the strip, but that is a bonus imo.  Not to mention, you are literally steps away from other casinos on Fremont Street.  Stayed on the 20th floor in the Carson tower.  Room was quite spacious and very clean with a nice view of the strip.  Staff was nice on all levels.

Best $100 dollars  spent in Vegas hands down.

We had a handsome spacious room with beautiful modern decor in the rush tower section of the hotel. If I can make one suggestion to yelpers,  upgrade to a tad bigger & better room for the extra $20. Never get the cheapest room they are advertising.

The entire hotel is really beautiful and the special touches are everywhere.

The way to work Vegas is to stay downtown (here) drive up to strip to the other high dollar hotels and their attractions and you get to come downtown to retire but you are staying in big style without the huge price-tags along with seeing all the cool glamor of yesteryear. The signs downtown are cool, vintage eye candy.

NOTE\/ I gave this hotel this star rating based on hotel sites & our  room; the service was fine

HORRIBLE. HORRIBLE. UBER  picked us up and the TERRIBLE valet guys cussed at me and my husband! Such bad treatment of paying patrons! Nicest Uber driver ever.  So disappointed
GoldenNugget!

I make it a point not to write reviews on just any little thing, but this needed to be put out there. Last night, while staying at the Golden Nugget, we were robbed. It happened after we went to sleep, while we were in the room. Deadbolt you doors. Lesson learned! So scary!!!! The hotel staff were rude, not helpful and downright disgraceful. I assumed the security staff would call the police or know how to handle the incident. We wrote out a report and then later I found out they had not called the police. We were given no procedures or helpful advice. None! Funny thing was when I spoke with the desk manager in the morning, about the rudeness, he was more concerned that the charges for out room got posted to our cancelled credit card. Oh, he tried to say the right things all while making sure the payment was good., barely making eye contact. So disappointed,  I would NEVER have so little empathy for anyone. I did not ask for anything from them financially so it is not like they were trying to get out of something and all I got was nothing but condescending, begrudged assistance. 

I wanted to add an update, just after this review, I received a call from the Golden Nugget. The lady was very nice and apologized. After a long conversation where I explained that they should have a policy and some printed material for their guests should this happen to anyone else (i.e. What to do if they steal your I.D. and you have to get on a plane, etc.) she offered a refund and a free stay, which she was going to email (I guess she forgot to send it, apparently not important). 

I wonder, do they know what a toll this has taken on my husband and I? We no longer have a sense of safety. Sleeping is a nightmare! We have anger that because their security did not call the police, the robbers got away with our cash and wallets. Turns out that while security was in our room they were using my credit card to get a cab. If security had been doing their job, we might have had our possessions back. Also, we were on a private floor, there had to have been surveillance, something!  I feel that their lack of security caused this, and I have my suspicions it may have been an inside job, as my purse with no money or regular credit cards was taken, (makes me wonder who went through my stuff previously to know that) the failure of security to do anything, the access key to the private floor and our room, the rudeness management to try to make me feel somehow responsible (I was told at one point by management that they would probably find out we were robbed by our traveling companions, friends of ours for 20 plus years and 10 plus years) and then their pretense to listen, make changes to their policy but obviously an email was even too much! The reason for this update is that with each sleepless night it is impossible not to replay all of the insults in our heads. It takes our mind off of the fear that their lack of security has put there.

I enjoy gambling off the strip.  Golden Nugget is probably the nicer hotels off downtown Fremont.  I like the service, the rooms are bigger and for the price, good on your wallet.  I also like the location where you can walk to the other dingy hotels where you can play $2 blackjacks.

At night, you can just walk over to the Fremont experience and enjoy the laser shows, walk around, patronize the vendors.  It's fun and away from the hustle and bustle of the strip.

I always love this place. When I'm in Vegas, this is like my home away from home. The standard rooms in the Carson Tower (formerly the South Tower) are just fine. But it's worth the extra money to upgrade to the Gold Tower (formerly the North Tower). The furnishings are better, you'll get an extra TV in the bathroom, and the location is right off the casino floor. This may not sound important, but all the walking back and forth really adds up. It's nice to step right off the elevator and be in the middle of the action. If you want to upgrade even more, stay in the newly constructed Rush Towers (bordering Carson St, on the Clark County Detention Center side of the bldg.). It's a bit of a walk from Fremont Street and the main part of the casino, but the rooms are absolutely stunning with great views of the Strip and surrounding areas. 

I often travel solo for business and find the Golden Nugget is one of the best places for solo travelers. All of the employees are friendly and there are numerous places to eat. I tend to flock towards the H2O Lounge next to the Chart House restaurant. There you can sit at the bar with other solo travelers and enjoy some fresh cooked meals brought right to you from a Chart House server. I've tried several dishes and above all would recommend the Macadamia crusted Mahi. Also love the East Meets West Tuna and Coconut Crunchy Shrimp. I had the Lobster Grilled Cheese and it was good, but a little on the soggy side. 

I'm not a pool person, but this pool is so nice I usually pay it a visit. Sometimes I'll just lounge out there in jeans (when it's not too hot) and enjoy the music and sounds of happy tourists. They also have outdoor blackjack right by the pool if you're in the mood. 

Other amenities include not one but two Starbucks. An excellent sushi restaurant called Red Sushi (they stole the chef away from the Rio's sushi bar). Grotto, for some excellent Italian at a decent price. And the Carson Street Café for an eclectic mix of quick food (ideal for breakfast). And you absolutely must try Vic & Anthony's Steak House (see my separate review on this outstanding establishment).

You usually receive a coupon book at check-in with match plays and decent discounts off the restaurants. There are usually some other surprises in there as well. 

All in all, the perfect place to call your Vegas home away from home. So why not five stars?? Only one reason: the check-in line can be extraordinarily long - like an hour or more. I know a lot of people have complained about the long waits. I wish they would fix this problem, but that is the only drawback. If you can get VIP check-in, this place is a five star joint in my book.
Anytime I go to Vegas I stop at the Nugget they have great customer service I always have a great time in the casino and there is plenty to do. It's a nice and always clean.
The Rush Tower was gorgeous but downtown is low rent.  Stay on the strip.

First time staying on Fremont street and have to say I was pleasantly surprised with my experience at Golden Nugget. The room was very good and staff was pleasant. 

I have to say that I was very glad to read other reviews first because it saved me money. First off bring your own Keurig Kcups because they will charge you $10 just for opening the box to see what flavor they have. So I brought my own thanks for those tips.  Next if you buy drinking water at the pool then buy the large smart water at the entrance to the pool from the booth selling sun Screen. It was $4 for a large water vs $4 for nasty small water bottles at the pool bars. 

The hotel was busy but it wasn't nuts like you'd find on the newer strip. We ate at Grotto and wasn't impressed but went across the street to Hugo's cellar and had a Great dinner. 

For the price and experience Golden nugget was worth it.

Looks like they have done a lot of remodeling in this place. Looks very nice and appealing. I loved the pool itself as well, along with the adult pool on the roof top. The one thing they don't have hear is great service. We were at the pool and I walked over to the restaurant with my two kids for some pizza and chicken tenders. Once I ordered, the pizza came out way before the chicken tenders. I easily waited an hour. I complained to the manager and she did give me an extra pizza, but by the time I got back to the pool it was CLOSED! Are you serious 8p.m. pool shuts down? That just added to my frustration.

The next day we rented a cabana at the pool which had a drink minimum of $200. We had no problem with that. We did have a problem with the waitress taking so long to bring us our drinks. I DO NOT BLAME THE WAITRESS at all since I saw her hustling. So whats the wait? She was literally the only waitress on that whole side of the pool! With both incidents happening to me on our weekend there I concluded that either Golden Nugget is way under staffed or they have serious managerial issues.

Well our first room had a bum toilet but they switched us with no problems.  Decor was nice, rooms were clean.  I loved the pool THE TANK and got to hangout a little at THE HIDEOUT.  Didn't have too much luck at the casino but I'm kinda unlucky anyhow.  I like that they have tons of place to eat here and their little cafe was great.   For the price and location on Freemont street I was pleased

There is no better place to stay in Downtown. Period.

And it's not like it's a "little bit" better than the other choices. It's night and day. 

Golden Nugget is like "The Strip Lite" in Downtown.

Clean and classy. All rooms are nice, and the Rush Tower is even better. (I like the contemporary decor, but the more traditional feel of the other rooms is just fine!)

As others have said, the pool is awesome. And the adults-only sun area is great for avoiding tan lines. You'll be peeped at, of course, but hey, that's what happens when your bo*bs are out.

I'm not a big gambler, but the casino is very nice. Good selection of slots, well-run table games.

This is the only hotel I've stayed at downtown. I wanted to stay in the super new part but it's non smoking, and since my husband is a smoker, we had to stay in an older part. The room was clean and pretty nice. Make that, very nice for the price we paid. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were OK. I bring my own pillows though since I like a really flat pillow. 
I think most people either really love downtown or they hate it. I am a strange one where I am ambivalent about it. I certainly dont love it, but I dont hate it either. I like going to Insert Coins, that's fun about downtown, but the light show just doesnt do it for me at all. The crowd is much different too. 
I'd love to check out the pool and the newly remodeled part. Maybe if my husband quits smoking, *cough cough*, we can do that.

Check in lines are long. Luckily we opted to book a room with VIP check in which sped the process up exponentially. That said, check in time is 3 and our room wasn't ready until after 3:30pm. I booked 2 queens and was given 1 king and told rooms were sold out so nothing they could do, even though it's not what I booked when I booked 3 months in advance.

Staff isn't overly friendly and unaccommodating when mistakes are made, albeit it's not a 5 star hotel so I guess we shouldn't be surprised there.

We stayed in a gold club room for 3x the price of the standard room...The room is on the club level in the Carson tower which we've since learned 'club' only means you're paying additional for all day snacks that sit on a table outside the elevator on the club level floor...snacks like peanuts, jelly beans and m-n-ms and water. Nothing special. Room is decorated modern decor. No fridge , no mini bar, is small, tub not large as described and plumbing fixtures wobbly with the bath\/shower option knob, broken.

One thing not mentioned at check in is the VERY LOUD construction noise happening in the main tower that begins at 5am! Yes, I said 5am. If you're a light sleeper like me, avoid this hotel completely until renovations are complete. Although you may have a hard time getting an honest answer as to when that will be. The front desk was not apologetic or honest about what the noise was until I said , "are you stating you're not aware there is major construction happening on your grounds"??? They hemmed and hawed saying oh, yes but "usually"'they don't start making noise until 9:30am. Clearly not true b\/c management is aware of when the workers check in. There are cameras everywhere and a check in policy for personnel. Why check a crew in at 5am if they won't start work until 9:30? Simply not true. 

I'm rating 2 stars b\/c the pool is gorgeous. The shark tank with the slide going thru it is unique and very cool. The pool is on the small side but still worth experiencing.

I have walked through the Golden Nugget a hundred times but have never stayed the night.  Recently I stayed the night with a buddy so we could safely explore the mysteries of the revitalized section of Fremont St.

The one constant in all my visits have been the cleanliness of the the establishment.  The rooms were no different.

Everyone from check-in staff to casino personnel were polite.  Happy employees always make for a more pleasant experience.

The Golden Nugget made for a comfortable home base from start to finish!

This place is overhyped. The decor in the Rush tower is nice, I'll give them that. But at over $100\/night, its way out of line with other recently renovated downtown hotels. Try the Plaza or D.  The casino itself was a total rip off.  I've never come across tighter slots in my life. Most casinos will toy with you for a while before they take your money, but the GN just saps the fun out of the air immediately. There was no excitement in the atmosphere, and everyone just seemed pissed off. Not a good sign for the overall odds. I would never recommend this casino or hotel to anyone.

This was my first time staying at the Golden Nugget. The main reason I wanted to go was to see the Shark Tank, the 61lb gold nugget, and to go Zip-lining on Fremont Street.(which i highly recommend! Was really fun!!) The Shark Tank was AMAZING!!!!! I'm a big scaredy cat yet i loved it!! I even went on it twice! It was very busy and crowded but the lines go by very fast. The rooms were very comfy and had a nice view of Vegas. The staff were very helpful too.

 I would of given this place 5 stars, but the registration people were very impatient, unfriendly, and rude.
Internet sucks despite springing for the faster wifi and talking to tech support for half an hour.  Arg- not cool for business travelers.

Just arrived today and I had high hopes for the GN Rush Tower but the relationship between us turned sour as soon as we tried to check in. Room not ready? Sure we'll wait - and thanks for the offer to call us when it's ready. I love great customer service. Three hours later? No call. Boo. Ok, I let that pass. Checked in our room and it's cool - much more modern than the old tower for sure. Nice. Unfortunately safe was broken when we tried to use it, but it's ok, per front desk, housekeeping and security - maintenance will fix it. Thirty to forty five minutes later? Nada. Okaaaay. Patience. Finally just left the room and cancelled that request. Decided to sit outside at one of the hotel bars to relax and people watch, and I think you can write the rest of this review. Hello, Haydee - we'll complete your first day with us by introducing you to our prize Super rude waitress. And this is coming from an ex bartender and hospitality worker. I know customers can be arse-wholes - I get it! But come on Golden Nugget. Get your shit together. I'm here two more days! 

Will update review after I check out.

And now...I'm breathing. :)

Had a wonderful experience here, despite 115 degree heat.  Would definitely come again. Cheap table games, decent decor, nice rooms (north tower), fantastic pool, and pretty good food.  A great value in general, especially compared to most spots on the strip.  If there were better access to the strip (the Deuce is miserable), this would be 5 stars, easily.

Hotel rooms are nice and big! Claim
Jumper restaurant located downstairs has delicious burgers, the pool is beautiful with a slide going through an aquarium. Would definitely stay there again :) 

The only down side is that we stayed in Rush Tower and since we arrived on a weekday and at night, the Rush Tower Front Desk was closed. We had to check in at the main front desk. Other than that, we were satisfied with the service :)

NEVER staying here again. I've been a loyal golden nugget guest for years but this was the last straw. Room was disgusting. There were cigarette burns all over the carpet, and the WORST sewage smell coming from the bathroom it was vile. Had to leave the door closed or it would stink up the whole room and could hardly use it the smell was so bad. There were also many problems with our keys and room situations where I had to ask for a manager because they kept charging me for things that I wasn't supposed to be charged for and then they only gave me 50 dollar food credit for my "troubles". And my brother who was staying in a different room had BLOOD on his bed. BLOOD. Then we went to the buffet this morning for brunch and that was disgusting too. There was hair in my salad and everything was cold. So very disappointed. Save the trouble and stay somewhere else.

If i have my way I'm never going to stay on the strip again.

We got a suite in rush tower. The room was beautiful and the price was so reasonable. The bed was amazingly comfortable too. It took me a minute to find the blowdryer so i was panicking thinking about walking around with wet hair but i found it in the closet, so my only tip would be to make it easier to find. ;) The pool was fantastic, the shark tank is amazing and the water slide is so fun. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants but we got dessert from the chocolate box and the cupcakes were really good. All the staff we met were really nice and we didn't lose in the casino! 

I'll be back!

Great place to gamble and their swimming pool was on the list of top 20 pools in the world!

The swimming pool is outside with a shark tank in the middle. They also have a slide that goes through the shark tank which I think is pretty awesome.

Gambling here was fun except when your drinking the Red Bull isn't free. So I got a Remy Martin and Reb Bull for $5 plus tip. Not too bad. 

The tables by the pool suck! I totally lost all my profit and the girl at our table was whack! No customer service or a smile out of her. But the person that watched her was a total sweetheart. She even gave us an extra drink ticket!

Hotel room was nice and big.  Just got back from Vegas.

Golden Nugget...really, people.  Come on!!!  I was hoping to get into the private pool upstairs but had to do an about face back the F*&^% out.  The shark tank pool was murky and gross.  You couldn't even see the bottom of the floor at 4' high.

The private pool was grossss.  It too was murky with stuff floating on top.  Eweeeee!!!  Having that kind of money, you should spend some on maintaining the pools for your guests!!!  Oy!!!

I am writing this review because of BRAD at the bar just outside the golden nugget on Fremont street.  He's just REALLY GEEAT!  I sat outside yesterday and he made me feel very welcome. I was so happy with his service and dry\/comedic personality that I had to introduce
My husband!! He is down to business but kind and just seriously funny!  You're the old school kind of bartender that Fremont Street should have forever!!
I Love staying at the Golden Nugget ! The rush tower is the best GORGEOUS large room. Semi dark ambiance making it amazingly relaxing !

All things considered, this is a good hotel if you need something really inexpensive for Vegas, and it's downtown; however, of you're looking for the true Vegas experience, it is truly about an up-to-date hotel on the strip, which the Golden Nugget is not...the rooms are like a Marriott. I would pay the extra $20-$50 a night to stay where every room is like a mini sweet on the strip.

When it comes to staying in Old Vegas, Golden Nugget is a classic.

The Hotel & Casino has almost everything you need. The hope is that you don't spend much time in your room while visiting Sin City anyway but the beds are comfy, the black out shades are hung by the window with care, and they leave you two bottles of water! Score. What else does a girl need to survive a night on the strip?! Well, maybe a mini fridge...

A big bummer this trip was the Shark Tank Waterslide was closed!! It didn't hold anyone back from enjoying the pool, but that was a major reason I had booked the Nugget this trip.

If you're looking to wet your whistle immediately after check in, stop by the bar to the right after you get your keys. It's conveniently located and there's an awesome bartender there (Jenny, I think?) who will take great care of you if you swing by on a night she's there.

So apparently the "free Maserati" offer only applies if you win. I did not know this at first so while I was breaking into and hotwireing the on-display Maserati the cops came. The arrested me for "attempted grand theft auto and assault and battery (that was because an old woman attacked me) whatever that means. Anyway the service is nice so two stars for that.

Okay... I'm going to be honest.  I have heard of young ones staying at the Golden Nugget b\/c rooms were inexpensive and when you're young and in Vegas, you probably don't plan on sleeping or being in the room much if at all.  With that being said, I seriously thought the hotel was similar to a cheap motel just from the stories I've heard in the past.  But boy oh boy, this place has great potential!  

When I stumbled upon the hotel and casino, I was amazed at how pretty it was inside!  I was totally expecting it to be all old and rundown, like a ghost town, etc. The casino is nice and the fixtures\/furnishings\/design seems to have been updated (though I've never seen what it might have looked like in the past).  

Pool - Didn't get a chance to walk around and explore it, but by being a spectator from the outside looking in, it looked a lot of fun and I really wanted to go for a swim but there was just no time.  :[  There is a freaking waterslide that goes THROUGH the shark tank!  YES, there are SHARKS!!!  (and some fish).  The pool wraps around the tank and has sunny and shady areas.  There are daybeds and chaises that are in the water as well as normal ones on the deck.  I also noticed that there were multiple levels (upper level it seemed like there were actual cabanas there).  

Restaurants - Don't knock 'em till you try 'em.  It took a while for us to figure out where we wanted to eat because the menus don't really sound all that appetizing, but when we ate at this Italian restaurant, the food was actually really good.  I didn't order a dish for myself because I wasn't feeling well, so the waitress gave me this drink that would help me feel better (and it did).  The bread w\/ the olive oil dipping sauce was pretty yummy and I got a chance to try some of my  Mom's dish (some type of pasta) it wasn't bad.  My friend ordered I think the Eggplant Parmesan?  

Bathrooms - I noticed that the two casino level restrooms were different - one seemed a little nicer and more lit than the other, but nonetheless, they were both clean.  

Location - Not sure if its in the best area necessarily... it is right next to the Clark County Metropolitan Police Department\/Facility... steps away from the Court House, etc.  During the day I would say its fine, but it looks so sketch at night.  

Airport Shuttle - If you schedule an appt. with the Showtime Shuttle Service, they can take you directly to the airport.  

Greyhound - Not too far from the hotel & casino if you choose to take the bus back home.

Starbucks - Yes, there is one located downstairs.

Rooms - My Mom had said that she booked a room in the older part of the hotel... I was dreading what it was going to look like, but when I walked in, it literally wasn't as bad as I had pictured it in my head.  The room seemed to be updated?  I wasn't afraid to sit down anywhere nor sleep in the bed.  The room had a good amount of walking space.  The bathroom wasn't scary at all either... the only thing I could probably complain about were the bath fixtures... maybe they can update those soon?  :D  Dirty bathrooms freak me out but I was okay with this one, lol.  

The Guests\/People - I initially thought that I would be seeing a lot of elderly guests wandering around, but to my surprise there were people of all ages roaming around and hanging out!  From families w\/ kids to teens, people in their mid-20s-30's to 40's-60's to Grandpa & Grandma status.  

The Elevators - They're pretty quick and they don't look rundown or outdated at all.  The waiting area near the elevators was also nice... pretty painting and lighting above.
Nice and clean. It tends to carry a older crowd 30's +up so I like that ... And surprisingly the casino doesn't smell like a smoke house.

Rooms are a little old school but since we haven't been staying on the strip lately, this is our go to hotel. We enjoy staying here. DTLV is a pretty crazy place but I guess so is the strip. We really like this hotel because they allow pets. We have a service animal and no questions asked they allow her to be a guest. $100 deposit a night tho for pets and $40 a night pet fee if they aren't service animals. 

Plenty of places to eat at inside and plenty of slots and tables to play at. We will always stay here if we don't stay on the strip. Great last minute deals too. Although we booked for a king bed we were given two twin beds. Only thing I didn't like.

My girlfriend and I had been planning a trip to Las Vegas for quite some time. I have been coming to Las Vegas since I was 21 and 99.99% of the time I have stayed at the Golden Nugget. To me Downtown in Vegas and the strip is an amusement park. 

My girlfriend and I booked our room via Expedia and locked in at $79.00 a night for just above a basic room. We figured the less money we spend on a room the more money we will have to live the life fantastic. 

We arrived at check-in and I mentioned to Ryan how long I have been coming to the Golden Nugget, I also mentioned to Ryan how I try and send as much business there way via my Yelp reviews. After I dropped all of that information I then asked Ryan if there were any room upgrades available. I was honestly expecting to have to fork out a few dollars more but that was not the case. Ryan simply said we have upgraded your room to one of our suites, not sure what type of suite it was I asked, what is the charge, Ryan told us 'No Charge.' 

We headed to the elevators which were literally located right next to High Roller Slot section of the casino. We headed to room with no idea of what to expect when we opened the doors. When we did in fact open the doors we were shocked (in a very good way) at what type of suite we were given. We were upgraded from a Gold Tower basic room ($79.00 a night during a weekday, $179.00 a night during the weekend) to a Parlor Suite ($179.00 a night during a weekday, $279.00 a night during the weekend). 

We walked in to find a HUGE bathroom with a Jacuzzi bathtub. The bathroom had a separated vanity area. Out bedroom has a large King sized bed, mirrored walls, large closet, a digital safe, desk & 42" flat screen Television. As we continued walking around the room my girlfriend said 'Oh my goodness' the door separating our room from the room next door (you know those doors) is open. We knocked on the door we connected both of our rooms to alert the person who might be staying there that our shared door was open, little did we know this was still our room. This area contained a separate dining room, living room, wet bar, refrigerator, wine glasses, an additional closet, another 42" flat screen television and a view of the Fremont Street Experience. 

This made our trip so much better, we were treated like Royalty from the moment we valeted our vehicle to the moment we left the Casino to head home. As for the Casino it has more of a down to earth feel to it. The games are bunched closer together to give you the vibe of a party going on which is exactly what is going on. This will not be my last trip to Las Vegas and without question when I come back I will be staying at The Golden Nugget. I say if you are coming to Las Vegas connect with 'Old School' Las Vegas and be treated like a 'King' or 'Queen' at the Golden Nugget.

If I were to stay downtown, the Golden Nugget would be the destination.

This was my first experience of Old Vegas - arriving in a taxi and sweeping into the place through the front doors, you are half-expecting to see James Bond and Plenty O'Toole at the craps table, or Tiffany Case with her hair piled on top of her head wearing a beautiful "nothing."  In fact, in DIAMONDS ARE FOREVER, the Golden Nugget, along with the rest of Fremont Street, is prominently displayed, in all its neon glory, during the infamous car chase scene.  

The casino decor is beautiful and understated in a way that the casinos on the Strip are luxurious and overwhelming - seriously, you get a bruised instep and blisters walking through the newer hotels.  People come here to gamble and for the cheap eats, which is what Vegas is supposed to be, not for mom to be pushing strollers through the airport terminal-like casino while daddy is blowing great wads of cash in the private rooms, plus here the cocktail waitresses don't have to cross a football field to bring you a singapore sling or john daly.

Give the Golden Nugget a shot, just to say you've been here, even if it's just for a drink and a quick fix at the tables.  You might actually enjoy losing your money here.

For sure the best Fremont Street has to offer.   The building and rooms have all been remodeled and updated.   The casino is pretty clean and doesn't smell of smoke as badly as the other.   Drink service is prompt and friendly.   Of course, it's still on Fremont Street.   Unless it's neighbors start to take up the slack a little, the Golden Nugget will sink with the rest of them.

As much as it pains me to say this... I had forgotten how crappy the Carson Tower is. I mean, it's no Binion's, but it's not great. Stick to the Gold Tower or the Rush Tower... the Carson Tower just ain't worth it.

I have always stayed on the strip. However this trip I went with a friend who had booked the Golden Nugget. I wasn't expecting such a nice experience from an older hotel so I was very pleasantly surprised. Starting with the valet service which was fabulous. We were called by name and all were so pleasant and retrieved our car quickly each time. Our room in Carson Tower was larger than normal. The Claim Jumper was a great restaurant. I will definitely stay at the GN again.

The hotel itself is great - clean and, well, seems like any other decent hotel. The thing that really made me enjoy my stay was the SHARK TANK SLIDE!!!!!! Yup, get on your suits because down at the pool you can ride the water slide that goes through a tank of sharks!

Now before you asphyxiate, when you go though the tank you are enclosed in a plexi-glass tube so you will not get bit - barring some unforeseen incident. Sometimes the sharks will freak out swim all over the place when someone rides the slide. However this wont really happen when mobs of people aren't going down the slide all day, you need to lull them into a false sense of security then... BAM! scare the fish crap out of them.

Another cool little thing to check out if you're in the neighborhood is the world's largest nugget of gold on display which is in the lobby. As a side note, does anyone else find it ridiculous that it was found only a foot underground?!

They also have some really great pizza at the Grotto!
one of the best casino in las vegas!

I stayed at this place several times, I like this hotel, it's off the strip which is okay to me. I enjoy "The Freemont Experience" maybe even better than the actual strip. The hotel is nice and has a lot of amenities. I like the pool and the tank it offers, real pretty. The choice of tables and slots are nice. The restaurants are also decent.

For me, it's a little strange to hear how great the Golden Nugget is. I went to the buffet and it gave me indigestion. I played their slot games and they were not paying me. I looked at their tables and they were way too high to be downtown. I thought the decor really simple and classic. The pool is without a doubt *epic*. But Golden Nugget to me is not worth the expense. Yes, I would stay at any ol' clean hotel in Dingy Old Downtown before Golden Nugget.

I have to say I am a bit disappointed in this hotel. First, my main reason for staying here was because of their pool\/aquarium\/water slide. We go to check in, just to find out that the slide is having work done and closed, along with the aquarium. We were very disappointed because NOWHERE on the website does it mention that it's down for 3 months. If we knew that, we would not have stayed there. Also, there is very limited seating on chairs at the pool. We went down to the pool 3 different times and never were able to find a lounge chair that was not used. Or we could rent one for $30 each at the 21 and over pool. They also charge a ridiculous resort fee per day that you can not find anywhere on the website before booking. What they say the resort fee includes, is not worth it AT ALL. Especially when their one advertised feature(water slide) is down and not working. A lot of the staff was rude, especially at their Starbucks downstairs. They also let kids in to the hot tub, when it clearly says 16 and over. It was annoying to share a hot tub with kids jumping in and splashing. Not nearly enough to do on Fremont street as they make it seem. I will not be staying here again, even though I really would like to try the water slide. I would rather pay more for a nicer hotel then cheap out and get stuck here again.

I've been coming to Vegas for more than 35 years and it stayed all over the city. The Golden Nugget rush tower is one of the best deals in the city.  

They have some great restaurants including sushi and Italian... And their morning buffet is a wonderful deal. Ask for the coupon book when you check-in it will get you two-for-one. 

If you want to great location but you want to save a lot of money there are other rooms are acceptable. 


 It's also nice being able to walk out on Fremont Street just to see the people the lights and shop.  

By the way their pool is outstanding even when it's cold outside.

It was an awful experience. 
There was an empty black jack table. The 3 of us never played before so we didn't want to bother more experienced players. So we sat and told the old hag we never played before. She was not happy with that and acted like a complete jerk. I guess it's a hassle to let new players play. It was such an uncomfortable experience. I wish that employee nothing but misery in her life. I will discourage others from coming here.

As a single parent, I like this hotel, but will also never stay here again.
Wifi is $13, per 24 hours, the pool closes early in the summer (8 PM!), there are no kids channels on the tv (which forced me to pay $13 for a movie they'd already seen!), and you have to PAY for your in-room coffee! 
I will easily pay slightly higher, for a smaller room, "uptown", with the included amenties, and closer to the majority of the Strip action.

Carson tower rooms are in horrible shape. Paint peeling, fixtures rusting, sinks not draining. Stains everywhere. Gross. This place is not worthy of the Landry's brand. 

We booked a luxury pool cabana for their infamous shark tank pool. As we check in for our wrist bands, employee tells us "no outside food or drink" which we take to mean we have to purchase everything through the pool menu. We were dying for coffee and a piece of toast or bagel (10 a.m.) We get all the way up to the Cabana, and they tell us "we don't have coffee, go get it at Starbucks". Well, we were told no outside food or drink "oh, that means not outside the casino"--gee, that explanation would've been helpful. 

Also, we've stayed at hotels all over the world, and always get pool cabanas and this is the first time we've experienced one that doesn't serve coffee. "Luxury Cabana" this is not--it's also the only cabana experience we've had that doesn't offer an option to dial a number for service. You're at the mercy of when the server comes by. Thankfully, our attendant was good.

So I schlepped all the way down again, got coffee and came all the way back up. Food and drinks were good. Shark slide was fun. Just remember, you'll have to walk barefoot up to the elevator (which is super gross) to get back to your cabana. Yuck.

Elevators throughout the hotel were a mess--slow, shakey, and two just broke down. This was true for the garage, the hotel itself and the pool (the lifeguard said he was embarrassed by the pool elevator squeaking and shaking).

Also, be aware that Starbucks in Vegas hotels is much more expensive than regular Starbucks--$7 for a breakfast sandwich, This hotel has 2 Starbucks--one that is always out of bagels and croissants, and another which has it all, but no microwave or toaster. WTF???

I'm also sick and tired of Landry's promises of room upgrades with the Landry's card. Not once has this been honored. There is always an excuse i.e., there's a game, there's a convention--when is that not the case in Vegas? We're signing up for other loyalty brand cards, this one isn't worth it.

The worst customer service ever. My daughter and I stayed 6\/3- 6\/7 2016. The hotel hallway was dirty on the 6th floor. The same cart from room service sat in the hallway for 3 days. We also were woken up by pounding and nailing on Monday morning at 7 a.m. I was told to come down to the front desk to get a different room because there was construction going on above us. It took hours before we were set up in a new room. The manager Wayne yelled at my daughter and called her a liar. Wayne told my daughter he couldn't reimburse her for the room because it was third-party billing to call them. She did he wouldn't authorize it and told my daughter he didn't tell her that and preceded to yell at her. Tried to make the best of the rest of the day and go eat at the buffet in the hotel to only find hair in my daughter's food. To top everything off I had my car in valet parking for five days and got it back with the right side of the bumper coming off. I have contacted Landry's Inc, and Golden Nugget still no follow up call back. I was only contacted through Facebook messenger that Martha or one of her team members would call back. Still waiting! Very disgusted.

I was impressed with the casino and hotel for the cost we paid for this last minute trip. The standard was up to par and the pool was impressive. But what I didn't expect, and we were never informed when booking or checking in is that they can't guarantee a parking place for hotel guests! Ridiculous! My fiancé is driving around trying to find a nearby parking lot for us at this moment. Seems like this place gips you in the smallest things - parking n\/a, coffee in the room $10, microwave $20\/nt. etc. Let's not mention the Guido wanna be Bartender at the adult pool who took over 20mins to serve us drinks 2 days in a row. Apparently conversation with the other couple at the end of the bar was more important the waitress even had to interior so he'd start making drinks for their customers.
This place is cheesy and the staff is nasty and unhelpful .. Never again ..Tillman Fertita is a asshole!!!
Love it! Clean,cheap, friendly associates. Rooms are big. Awesome room service.  Will definitely stay there again.

I have a soft spot for the Golden Nugget. Maybe it's the shark tank that you can ride a water slide through or just the old fashioned marquee lights, but it feels outlandish in a way that I can appreciate when coming downtown. Plus, they have clean bathrooms and ATM's that don't charge astronomical fee's.

Giving this hotel even 1 star is a strech.  First off-do not stay here if you are bringing your own car!! They do not have enough parking in the valet or self parking. We arrived at 8:30 pm and were told the valet was full. We ended up getting to the room at 11:pm and spent two hours finding a parking space and hiking to the hotel. There was also very loud construction that may have been the reason the emergency alarm was set off and kept announcing to evacuate the hotel. The room was dirty and old and food carts sat in the hall all day and night.  Basically the management does not care. His excuse about the parking was that "this isnt a strp hotel" .  Most slots were 1 cent. This is not a winning our classy hotel at all!

I was real impressed when I stayed here. The room was at a good price and the beds were so comfortable I didn't want to go back to my own house. The staff was friendly and on top of things which made things much easier to check in when the kids were not willing to be patient. I will be returning here again no question about it.

Pretty nice hotel, rooms was updated recently. We stayed in the Carson tower since and the room was well worth the $55.00 plus tax that we paid. The pool and water slide was also awesome! The only downsides was the room air conditioner that did not seem to work very well, and the bathtub also had some draining issues. Other than that we'd stay again.

I was pretty disappointed on my visit upon check in when I was hit with a "resort fee"  This negative wasteful charge really set the tone of my stay.  Be up front and charge me the real price when I book a room.

What happens when you take twelve young professionals (swanky title I know) on a hot summer day to a chill-out lounge with cheap drinks and a shark tank?

Well, it's hard to say, but best experienced!

Downtown Las Vegas does have its share of hidden gems, and the H20 Bar in Golden Nugget is certainly one of them! While initially going in just to see this indoor water slide, my group of friends decided to stay here and chill by the poolside. The pool area offers up beach chairs, towels, and plenty of space to relax with your friends. There were areas where we could put our feet into a hot steamy tub, which was strangely fitting even on a hot day.

To top it off, the drinks here were great! Smoothie drinks with shots of 180 octane for only $8... you can choose from flavors including Strawberry Lemonade. We each got a drink and took over a whole area with couch pillows and waterside views... and with more alcohol comes more rowdiness than a whole day club could handle.

Had a real good time at Golden Nugget. The nugget itself was much more interesting after knocking back two or three smoothies. If you're looking for an affordable place to relax and kick it with your friends, that's not crowded with other drunk tourists, then Golden Nugget H20 bar can be a great alternative for you.

I stayed here for two nights on our Spring Break in March, I turned 21 on St. Patrick's Day. I stayed in a tower suite, which was huge and had a pool view. The tower had just been redone, so we loved it. I had read some reviews about rooms not being clean, so I made sure we stayed in the newer tower. It was very clean and I was very happy! It was a high up room and seeing the pool was great. The room wasn't more than $150 a night and could've slept 4 because there was a king bed and a couch. 

The pool was nice, having a bar outside is fun. The casino is great!!! Since I was new to gambling, I woke up early and took some free lessons they had in the casino. I took lessons in black jack and craps, and I was so happy we took advantage of the free lessons. 

The buffet was nice too, the waiter was so kind and quick to pick up dirty plates. It was also very affordable. We had a nice dinner at the Chart House and sat right by the fish tank. Our meal was pricey but delicious, the only thing I wasn't a fan of was my Moscow Mule. 

The location is great too, it is different than the jam packed strip which I have stayed on before. I went to the Mob Museum and spent a lot of time on Fremont Street. 

Overall it was a great experience, and I didn't end up spending as much as I would've in worse hotels closer to the strip. I will be back!

Very expensive for what you get room wise. We paid over $200 for what would be a $60 room anywhere else. No fridge. Deluxe room?! Huge line at the check in, small busy pool. Small parking structure. Horrible. I will never come here again. I would leave no stars if I could.
Charge for internet, drinks while gambling, $15 min on blackjack table,  rude dealers,  stay at your own risk!

I'm really glad I decided to stay here while in town for Punk Rock Bowling.

The room rates were reasonable, our room was clean and comfortable, and the pool seriously rules. 

Can't imagine staying anywhere else downtown.
I have stayed here a few times in my opinion the best casino on Freemont street. Nice rooms and the heart of the freemont experience

This Hotel is awful! Where do I start? The room was ridiculously expensive for being outdated and stinking of old cigarettes. The entire room felt dirty, the air conditioner doesn't work well at all in 115 degree heat, and the windows are so thin that I could hear people taking 4 floors down on the sidewalk all night. Room service and front desk help is basically non existent. I waited on hold for an hour and was transferred three times just to find out they had no roll away beds. If your planning on staying here for the pool, don't. The kids enjoyed the water slide but I didn't enjoy sitting on the wet concrete because there literally is no where to sit. It's overcrowded to the point of being extremely uncomfortable. I live two hours away and visit Vegas frequently but I will never at at the Golden Nugget again.  08\/10\/16

Second time I stayed here trying to cut costs.  The rooms were incredibly dirty with a few dead bugs on the floor. The bathtub looked like it hadn't been cleaned. The resort fee doesn't include the gym fee so you end up paying 20.00 a day to use the gym.   The coffee in the room costs 10.00 for 4 packets.  IE: 4 cups.  When I checked out they didn't ask me how may stay was nor do I think they cared.  Do yourself a favor and go to new Vegas it costs about the same but at least the rooms are nice

My friends a I came for the 7th annual Wine Fest. We got a room on the 14th floor of the Gold Tower. While everything at the hotel was great. Good food, service on the main floor, our room was disgusting! We had to go to Walgreens and buy antibacterial wipes! The counter with the safe was covered in grossness! The floor was not swept or mopped and we found blood on the bathroom floor!  We had actually call housekeeping and tell them what to clean and they still didn't! The didn't even empty out trash!  We plan on coming back next year for the festival and I hope that the quality of housekeeping improves between now and then. We saw the housekeepers talking on the phone in other rooms when we left!

Beautiful hotel!  I would give give stars but only down side is that we reserved a king bed and wad given a room with 2 double beds.  Not cool when you a used to a king.  Also they got us in s king the next day but no apology, no small gesture for our trouble. Check in was fast and when we visited other hotels check in was crazy.  First room was nicer than 2nd room but no biggie. Also people on elevator went through same thing with their room so it seems to be a bigger issue.  All that aside this hotel is beautiful and fremont street is a blast!  And hotel is very economical.

I adore this hotel now! After this weekend all I could think about was how I was going to go home and right a nice review. 

Well for starters, my boyfriend and I got a really nice room. The sheets were downhome comforters, the bed was really comfortable and the place was clean not to mention the room service was ridiculously good! 

I ordered a philly cheesesteak, he got the club sandwich and a banapie as a desert. The drinks are pretty expensive (3.25 for a can of coke) so I highly recommend you bring your own waters for the after morning thirst quenching hang over lol 

Anyhow, I bounced from hotel to hotel attempting to learn the game of craps. Not realizing that I would have learned it here at the golden nugget because it seemed upscale and their was a lot of money on the table I was a bit intimidated however I picked up pretty quickly and found myself at the table all night long!!! The dealers are willing to teach you how to play and the people playing are much more put together than most of the surrounding hotels ;) 

The cafe is really delicious as well I had fried rice and it was so tasty I came home talking about it. Not to mention the pool is absolutely gorgeous! My sister told me that it was on yahoo as one of the most beautiful pools in the world!!!  

The Golden Nugget is my target: It's affordable, nice, and I feel like I really do get what I pay for. Not to mention if you have a players card (they are free) They keep track of how much you spend there and they will comp your rooms or give you free upgrades!!! First time I went I was in the pimpest suite ever! (BF plays a lot) 

I so heart this place... YAAAAY! Can't wait to return for my birthday? halloween? something and sometime soon!!! My hands are itching!!!

We prefer to stay in Downtown Las Vegas for the ease of walking to different casinos and the table prices, even at peak gambling times. The Golden Nugget is pretty much the only place we will stay if it's a personal trip. 

We have stayed in the oldest to the newest towers and the amenities are pretty much the same: comfy beds, decent sized rooms, and cleanliness. The Nugget provides noise cancelling earbuds in case you're sensitive to sound, but the rooms are isolated enough that you can only hear the random door close. The Grotto restaurant is the best for happy hour 1\/2 priced pizzas and the pool is absolutely fantastic.
The buffet is mid level cafeteria food. That's all I have to say about that.

I love staying at the Golden Nugget! 
The Rush tour corner suite is great but the parlor suite is even better. 
The rooms are modern and comfortable. 
I have to give a shout out to Daniel who is often on the front desk he is so professional and helpful! 
The Golden Nugget is really so far above the other choices if you want to stay downtown!

Being used to California Hotel and Mainstreet Station (which I still love by the way), I came here with low expectations.  That made this experience so much better!  I was only willing to pay the premium because it was my honeymoon, but I would never do it again because I am nearly broke from my gambling addiction. (If you are reading this please seek help for me)

They have the best restaurants in downtown and I love fish tanks. Need I say more?? I stayed in the Rush Tower and it's clearly the best in downtown.  Stay here if you have the money (not me after my last Vegas trip), it's definitely worth it!
Good location in downtown. Pool is the best feature. Lots of room, and very good service.

This is by far my most favorite hotel I've ever stayed at in Vegas!!! We got there and I asked if there was a free upgrade and she gave us an awesome room we absolutely loved. I bed was very comfortable, the room made me feel like I was rich and the atmosphere of the hotel was great. The pool was the best pool I've been in. The shark tank is very cool and the water slide made me feel like a kid again. I had the best time ever here. Also, we tried The Grille and as a woman who's not huge on sandwiches...it was pretty good!

Ok this is two separate reviews, Hotel then Casino. 
Carson Tower, average.  Bed very good and comfortable, bathroom had some chipped rust in the tub around the drain, clock radio broken, TV very good, no fridge but available for rent, Did have a flood in the bathroom, Housekeeping and Engineering very good response, room very clean.
Casino if you are playing slots it's very difficult to get a cocktail, excellent assortment of slots, very large casino floor, cleanest bathrooms of any casino I have ever been in. Would have bumped the rating up if cocktail service had been adequate.
Pool area is excellent, nice cocktail service, get there early for a good seat in the sun.
Did not eat at any of the restaurants so can't rate any of them.
Bottom line, will return.

I'm a big fan of downtown Las Vegas, and the Golden Nugget is as good as it gets on Fremont Street! 

The rooms are very affordable, and pretty nice! The hotel staff is really nice too. The new Rush Tower has a separate check-in desk, so if you're staying there keep that in mind (it can take a while to get checked in at the regular desk). The Rush Tower rooms are a little more expensive and and little more fancy - they have massive bathrooms which are pretty cool. It all depends on what you're looking for - but in Vegas, I spend very little time in the hotel room, so the nicer rooms don't really matter to me.

As far as food, there is pretty good food available in the Golden Nugget. At the pool, you can order sandwiches from the bar, and they're really good (you can also charge the food to your room so you don't have to bring cash with you to the pool). There's a Italian restaurant called Grotto inside, close to the check-in desk and pool. Grotto is really good too, but pricey ($10-$30 plates). If you get the meatballs, be warned - they are about the size of baseballs, so go when you're really hungry! The buffet is OK for breakfast, I've never tried it for dinner though.

They have the coolest pool I've ever seen - there's a shark tank in the middle of it, and a water slide that goes through the middle! Cabanas are available too, but you'll want to reserve one in advance.

Personally, I think the slot machines in downtown Vegas pay better than the ones on the strip. I always seem to do much better on Fremont Street. Last time I was at the Nugget, I won $900 on one machine and $600 on another, in the same day!
Over all great experience love this place, very clean and welcoming, especially the valet Austin made me feel like a vip

The Golden Nugget is an excellent value, especially when you join their players club online and receive a $39 room special.  We stayed in the Carson Tower, which I believe is the oldest of the three followed by the Gold Tower and the Rush Tower, which is the new and very up to date tower.

Check in was easy and we always used the valet for parking.  Tip: Call down from your room to request your car, then it will be waiting for you when you get downstairs instead of you waiting for it.

THE ROOM:  The Carson Tower room was perfect for what we were after, basically a clean, quiet place to crash after a hard day or night on the town.  Bathrooms were average sized with granite counters and a nice selection of toiletries.  The room itself wasn't exactly dated, but it is definitely not as sleek and modern as the newer rooms on the Strip or the Rush Tower rooms.  But let's face it, you're staying downtown for a reason, and that reason is that you can spend 4 nights downtown for less than 1 night on the Strip!

THE POOL: Very nice!  Has a fast water slide that runs through a huge shark tank, and has a nice shallow area with special lounge chairs for sitting in the water.  There is cocktail service and a walk-up bar at the pool, as well as 4-5 blackjack tables that are staffed throughout the day.  Take the stairs or elevator up to the Hideout Pool and spend $10-$20 for the day to have a more private, quiet experience.

The Nugget has a lot more bars and restaurants located throughout since my last stay there in 1997.  We had lunch at the Grotto near the pool one day during their happy hour and the pizza was pretty good; for $6 you got a 12" thin crust pie.

Overall, the Golden Nugget is a Strip hotel located Downtown.  It is by far the best of the Downtown hotels, and would probably get into the top 15% of Strip hotels for amenities and service, but the best part is that it's about 75% cheaper than any of those Strip hotels.

So if you're looking for a very nice, clean, friendly place to stay in Vegas, and don't mind the extra 5 minute drive to Downtown, stay at the Nugg and use your savings to gamble or splurge!  

I highly recommend the Golden Nugget.

Stayed here last weekend for Punk Rock Bowling. I miss the smaller, more intimate days of yore, but if we're stuck with the music festival then I'm glad it's all based around the Nugget. Everything was clean and the staff was very nice whenever I dealt with them. When we stayed at Sunset Station a few years ago for PRB we were getting the stink-eye all weekend from security and staff. This place is a serious labyrinth, though! I was still getting lost on my 5th day there. Our rooms were huge but the double beds seemed smaller than we were used to. Water pressure in the shower was a bit of an issue, but I like that the hotel has an emphasis on being eco-friendly as much as possible (it IS Vegas, after all). I would definitely recommend the GN to anyone wanting to stay downtown.

Despite being a pricier stay than my usual spot downtown, we decided to stay here for the pool. NEVER again! For one, we never made it to the pool. It was always soooo crowded. Secondly, the bartenders at the main bar- not friendly. One morning we sat for video poker and the bartender did not greet us, made a drink right in front of us, and walked away right as I said "excuse me" to order a drink. Bartender there the second day, sat playing for about 15 mins without a drink. Finally asked for one and I swear he seemed like I was troubling him. Third, we ordered room service the first afternoon we got there. They quoted 35-45 mins for delivery. 1 1\/2 hours go by and my bf finally  called to check on the order and they tell us it was delivered to another room and they will make another one right now. Another 35-45 mins. Like, why not call and tell us that when it happened? Lastly, for being a nicer hotel in downtown, the room wasn't any better than where I usually stay for a fraction of the price. 
The reason for two stars...housekeeping. Always came back to fresh towels, water, & a freshly made bed. Second star is for The Grotto (I have a separate review)
Needless to say, there are too many hotels in Vegas to chance the crappy service again.

We checked in today and were surprised how the room was different from the pictures seen before booking. I asked the front desk and was told to pay $99 per nite more to upgrade which is not reasonable. The shark tank is closed until May and the swimming pool is not so impressive. Valet staff are amazing. Very nice and professional. If you are about to book the hotel, make sure it is in rush tower and don't have a high expectations for pools. (I should have known a way early.) I wouldn't rate as a four star hotel here.

Old hotel but a great hotel. I like going here in the winter because of the location, the pool is nice but a little compact feeling to me. The rooms are old school but up to date. We had a two story room that was very nice. This is an oldie but goodie.

Note: no fridge in room,  11 am check out ...

We have stayed here several times.  The Rush Tower and the Gold Tower were the best. This time were in the Carson Tower and it is nice also. Decent room and a good size.  We have always been happy with the room service.  Good size Sportsbook but it would be nice if it were larger. Casino floor is hard to walk through when somewhat crowded.

I was on a road trip and decide to spend the night in Vegas, I usually stay on the strip but I sometimes like to check-out the circus on Fremont street. I called about 1:00 pm to reserve the room no problem.  When I show up at the parking garage the  attendant told me I was not on the guest list they had given  him that morning and he would not let me in. They should upgrade their system to keep this from happening. Now am a little  pissed at this point. Not a good way to treat guest.  I parked at the four queens next door for  4 dollars, and walked back to the nugget to check in. This turned  out to be a good thing, I won 180.00 on a slot machine in the four queens as I was walking back to my truck.  I did my gambling at the four queens that night   Now the good. The golden nugget has the best rooms on Fremont street, even the Carson rooms are good size and clean with flat screen TV's. When I'm with my wife we stay in the Rush tower, these are very nice rooms.  We found  that they are not generous about  room comps so we play slots all up and down Fremont street. I would give them 4 stars if  the garage thing would have gone better. I will be back.

After close to thirty years of staying in this Hotel and the last few visits a very bad experience we are bidding a farewell to this Hotel and probably any other Landry owned property, past owners had been nothing less than spectacular but I have grown tired of the hidden charges and the total horrible service extended here.
This place was at one point the Gem of the down town Hotels she still has that on the outside but its the management and people skills that need some fine tuning so it is her insides that need help the grande dame of Fremont has lost her heart and seems to be in the game for the dollars it generates.
Shame on me for coming back the last few months after threatening never to darken their  doorway again but adios grand lady your death was imminent under the Landry group and i'm sorry to see us go.
If I had the ability to place zero stars it is what I would have done..
Newfound place to go!! Cheap drinks good atmosphere. If you gamble too it's not gonna cost you a fortune for one bet. The cafe nachos are horrible though.

We stayed here for two days on a weekend. The complex itself is pretty amazing like many Vegas hotels. From what I saw of the hotels around Fremont Street however, it is probably the best. We stayed in the Carson tower which is the older part apparently. It was okay but certainly not approaching upscale. I put it on par with a typical three-star hotel. Everything about the room was...just okay. The weekend price was pretty ridiculous but considering the time and place, I begrudgingly admit it was fairly priced. The coupons they gave us with the promotion we used, were basically useless: Two for one buffet...on a weekday, did not help us at all. Ten percent off retail purchase of one hundred dollars or more-useless, ten dollars off spa service of sixty dollars or more-useless, buy one get one free cocktail-useless, especially in a casino. If you are considering staying here, do NOT count the inclusion of their coupons. Oh, if you like coffee, bring K cups, they charge ten bucks for four here. Also, buy some bottled water before you arrive. They charge an arm and a leg for water here and the tap water sucks.
