The pool is amazing. You can view it and the shark tank as they are basically one, from the lobby area. It really looks like a fun place to party. They have poolside blackjack with some fine looking women as dealers which is cool although the rules are not conducive to winning.

The food here is pretty good. We ate at Lillie's Asian, Claim jumper, and Caddilac Mexican Kitchen, all were very good.

The main selling point of this hotel is the area. It's an awesome location if you are looking for the Fremont street experience-just walk out of the casino and you're there! If you come to party, this the place. If you are looking for peace, go elsewhere.

Pros: Great customer service, clean big room, top notch pool with shark aquarium, relative low cost rooms without strip fees, walk out to Fremont Street

Cons: No free Wifi, smokey casino

I expected the casino's to be smoke filled. The hotel was great. The hotel looks refreshed and modern. Will visit again. I really want to say the customer service was great. Genuine and not forced smiles. I appreciate the dealers took time to give advice on craps, didn't make me feel like an ass when I made mistakes. I felt like I was on vacation and my wife love it too.

OUR WEDDING EXPERIENCE:  For the past 2 years, my fiancé and I travelled to Las Vegas at least twice a year to visit family.  Each time we stay at the Golden Nugget.  So when the time came to plan our wedding, we immediately knew our location.  

We contacted Silke in Sales and she provided us all the information we needed to choose the perfect wedding package.  They truly do have a package for all budgets!  Silke was with us all the way helping to handle many of the details including the ceremony, food, drink, favors, rooms for our out-of-town guests, amenities and many other items.   

The wedding chapel is small but elegant and overlooks the gorgeous pool!  The banquet rooms are all fully equipped and tastefully designed.  The reception buffet was excellent!  All of our guests raved about it and though we were very busy, we did get to taste it and agreed wholeheartedly.  Since our group was relatively small (less than 40), we had a small wait staff.  Still they were impeccable in providing service throughout the entire reception and it was a relief for me to be able to enjoy the time with my new husband, family and friends rather than having to direct things every minute. 

 If I had to cite one negative aspect it would be that outside photographer and videographers are not allowed to shoot the actual ceremony.  The Golden Nugget does provide these services and they are adequate but we really wanted our own photographer to shoot the entire experience. 

 All in all, our wedding was as magical and beautiful as we'd imagined and the Golden Nugget gets a lot of credit for that!

OUR SPA EXPERIENCE:  During our wedding\/honeymoon  Initially, I visited the spa to have my hair and makeup done for the wedding.  Both the hair stylist and makeup artists were masters of their craft!  Please view the attached pictures to see their wonderful work!  

I brought in pictures of three possible up-dos (created during a trial run with my hometown hairdresser) and The Spa stylist ended up creating a combination between the three!  She used all my own hair to create a full and elegant up-do!  

As for makeup, I had no idea what I wanted and put myself in her capable hands.  I shared with her that my usual makeup is minimal: Bare Minerals and mascara.  Since this was a special occasion, she suggested a more dramatic eye and minimal cheek and lips.  Everyone agreed that the result was simply stunning!

Our second encounter was during an in-room couples' massage (included in the wedding package we purchased).   The therapists were very professional and attentive to our preferences.  They were very skilled and we were both thoroughly relaxed by the end of the hour!  I highly recommend The Spa at the Golden Nugget!

I went here as a staycation on New Years of this year. I could have had a free room at the Plaza but I chose here since the room included tickets for the Fremont Street celebration and I've always wanted to stay at what everyone says is the nicest place downtown. I was disappointed. The room was run down. The bed was an adjustsble mattress but it wouldn't flatten all the way, they offered zero discounts to any of their facilities, there was no view and the walls were thin so you could here every word of your neighbors. We had coffee in the room but they did not refill it on the second day. There was a mini fridge which was nice.

I'll stick with the less expensive more recently renovated properties.

My GF and I came out from Philly for a week for our 1 year anniversary.
It was and AWESOME stay. The pool is great, the staff is friendly, the restaurants were great, and Fremont street is insane!
The rooms are large and clean.
I would highly recommend staying here.

Probably our worst weekend in Vegas :(    Paid for VIP check-in, that was great.   Room ok but the odor in the room was like someone had a very bad stomach ache and left the stench in the room ...then the next night there was outdoor music that was shaking the room.  I guess we should've expected something when there were earplugs on the table :(   and that was just rehearsal.    We had 630am call times so that meant 5am wakeup both days.     Take late shower before bed and the tub fills up past my ankles....too late to have someone come so when we get back from games call maintenance and my husband stays back to wait for them and housekeeping.    Housekeeping came and maintenance never did and again was too late to have them come as we had the kids get to sleep for the early call time.   They finally come and no apology or anything.    they did bring up extra blankets right away when we requested them and room service was quick and tasty.    not a hotel to stay at for a youth sporting event.    Annies was yummy and fun dining.    Claim Jumper was eh.   Parking was easy.    Not sure if the outdoor concert is every weekend but would be a nice heads up for people staying in the Carson Tower.

This place has gone downhill. I used to work here nearly a decade ago, and great care was taken in the rooms. Apparently, they don't care at all about the Carson Tower. The carpets are filthy, the rooms are dirty, and the elevator made such an abrupt stop that I thought it had dropped unexpectedly. We came here for the pool....never again.

UPDATE: I paid for an upgrade to a newer room in the Rush Tower. A big improvement!!!

Third time in Vegas and by far my worst experience! We landed on Wednesday morning and caught the shuttle to the Nugget. There were four of us and we booked two rooms months ago. I knew check in was not until 3pm but was informed we may be able to get an early check in if we asked or at least have the hold our bags until we could get in room. Staff was rude! Bell hops were RUDE! No one knew what was going on, we had no idea who to talk to , told us to just "stand over there" and then walked right up to the folks behind us and graciously took them to where they needed to be. We waited approx 20 minutes to meet Mr. Wonderful behind the counter who told us each 2 different stories about check in but did offer to text my phone once room was ready (which didn't happen) Once we were finally checked in we were told to wait (no idea where again) just wait until they decided to see what we wanted. Fifteen minutes later, I was getting upset. I literally just opened the bellhop door we eventually found and had to ask them to please help us! He rudely told me "JUST WAIT" so about 10 minutes after that they finally thought it was time to do their job. We were told to expect the text so we decided to hang out on Fremont until we heard back from them....never happened. We just decided to go to the strip and see what we could do. Came back to the hotel at 4:30pm and the manager was there in the lobby. We told him about our horrible check in experience and he really didnt give a crap. The guy behind the counter did offer 2 free buffet passes for both rooms, which made us happy and we were grateful. The room was okay, we knew we werent staying the remodeled part of the hotel so we didnt expect much. We did however expect working toilets! Our toilets would back up everytime we flushed, by the third time we just decided to use the ones in the lobby. It was a great time riding down from the 8th floor to have to pee every morning! We still didnt complain to the front, we just dealt with it. Decided to use our free buffet Friday night. Get to the buffet counter...they have no idea we were given vouchers - had to call down and prove it (eye roll) food was okay after all of this, we were just beyond annoyed with this place.

Check Out: 
5 am....someone who actually helped us right away 
Not only did they not get the free buffet right for both rooms but also added an extra person's buffet dinner on our bill at check out & tried to charge us $94! ( IN ADDITION TO RESORT FEE)
They had my credit card on file for the $50 security deposit (that'll fall off in a few days -- still hasnt happened) and they asked if i wanted to put the resort fee on the same card, I told her no and gave her another card. Well they decided to run it on the other one anyways! Now I've paid TWO resort fees (that extra one will fall off according to the front desk chick I FINALLY got ahold of yesterday) 



Two days later and I am still waiting for a manager to call me. 
This place is beyond ridiculous. We go to Vegas every year, twice this year - and with the amount of money I fork over to stay, eat and especially PLAY  at their casino...jeez louise. Common courtesy & respect is expected. Be helpful. Train your people better! SOMETHING. everyone just gives you the run around and passes the problem off to someone else

The only one who knew what he was doing and was respectful was the maint guy who had to unclog our toilet!! I felt bad having to bother him (why we just found it easier to go downstairs) 

I really hope this place can either train the rude folks they have to do a better job or HIRE NEW FOLKS.

Dont stay here.

This is the only place I would stay downtown.   We stayed in the Rush Tower.  The hallway was a little too American Horror Story for me, but the rooms are clean and quiet and I slept like a stone.  The room air conditioner was loud.  Good restaurants.  Downtown is known to get a little unruly.  While sitting next to me, my adult daughter was accosted by two drunken 30 somethings, one wearing red contact lenses screaming at her to look into his eyes.   This was my first and last time to stay in the downtown area.  I much prefer the elegance and good food on the Strip.

Service - 2 stars
Food - 1 1\/2 stars (see review)
Value - 2 stars

The wife and I went to Vegas this past weekend and for something different, we decided to stay in Fremont Street at the Golden Nugget.  We usually stay at the strip, but sometimes come out to Old Vegas to gamble when we want to be cheap, so we figured why not.

We really wanted to love our experience here.  Sadly, we really didn't.  

When we arrived, we dragged our luggage from the parking lot (Parking was free because we were hotel guests) to the check in area, and waited for about 15 minutes in line.  While I didn't mind that much about the wait, the line was consistently long every time we walked by the area (to go gambling, walking by, etc).  Line was always full of guests waiting to be checked in.

While checking in, I informed the clerk that we were celebrating an anniversary.  He mentioned that they would note that in the registration... but nothing ever came of it.  We did get a coupon book though (oh wait, everyone got a coupon book).

I guess we could have used more of the coupon book... but a bunch of them were for discounted drinks (or two-for-one offers) at the clubs.  Since we got drinks for the cost of tips while gambling, we skipped out on those.  Other coupons were for two-for-one breakfasts or lunches at the Cafe, which was one of the high points of the stay.

The room itself was quaint.  We stayed at the South Tower since the North Tower was "completely sold out."  The TV was tiny one that equated to our spare one at home that we don't even use.  The bathroom was unspectacular, and the bed was fairly comfortable (another high point of the stay).

We got thirsty\/hungry at one point in the trip on the first day, and went down the hallway to get a drink and some munchies from the vending machine.  Bad idea.  The 20 oz Diet Coke ($2.50 for a 20oz Diet Coke) that was dispensed was 5 months expired (expired 8\/20\/08) -- mind you, we went this past weekend (1\/2009) -- and the Twix bars tasted like they were melted and cooled repeatedly.

So I contact the Front Desk and let them know, and the person I speak to is (understandably) horrified.  They ask me to bring the product downstairs to the Front Desk in order to get it taken care of.  I trek down from the room (ass end of nowhere) to the Front Desk, where there's still a line of people waiting to check in, and after about 10 minutes of procedure, signatures, me showing proof that I was in fact a guest, they hand me back my $2.50.  

No apologies, no comp'ing me for my troubles, just the $2.50 back and a "Oh I'm sure the drinks in the Gift Shop aren't expired."  Don't want to get ripped off?  Bring your own sodas\/snacks (from Walgreens down the Fremont Street or somewhere else) and use their ice makers in the hallways.  At least (hopefully) that ice hasn't expired.  

Later on we used a two-for-one breakfast\/lunch coupon at the Buffet, which read "Usable on Monday-Friday" but since the Buffet was closed, it was usable at the Carson Street Cafe... on Saturday.  It was pretty busy there, so the food was only decent.  We actually had a better food experience off-site, across the street for $1 Nathan's hot dogs at Mermaids.  The Starbucks inside Golden Nugget is also about $2 higher than your normal Starbucks for no reason except it's occupying hotel space.

The experience was really disappointing and mad me a sad panda.  :(

Best hotel ever.

The location is perfect, the price is usually just right, the pool is the best in the entire world, the rooms are nice, the people are nice...

It's a winner!

The hotel is the best on Fremont Street, we stay here twice a year when we come but this may be the last.  The Band at the Fremont Street experience is WAY TOO loud.  You can hear the bass of the band beating really loud in your room and we are in a junior suite on the opposite side.  What is the city thinking letting the decibels be so loud?  It's so loud you can't comfortably stand down there and listen, and needless to say, sleep at a reasonable hour.  Most cities have a 10PM noise ordinance for residential areas, so much for those of us who pay to stay here and spend money to boot????  The city or the hotels down here need to do something about this!

I had a great time here losing my money at the roulette table.  Also, I noticed there were $5 blackjack tables here, which I have come to found relatively uncommon at the big Hotels in Vegas.

We also had a good time watching an older gentleman throw random chips all over the roulette table while his much younger girlfriend cheered him on.  

Good times for sure.  If you are looking for an old fashion style casino in the middle of old Las Vegas, this is definitely the casino to go to.

Thank the Lord...er...uh...I guess since it's Vegas it'd be more like Satan?

I was about to give up on Vegas and viola! Here is the Golden Nugget! Every time I've been to this town I've stayed on the Strip and I see the error in my ways now. Fremont might be a bit older but it's definitely the kind of kitschy that I crave. Strangely enough though, the Golden Nugget does not give away it's age at any point. You can tell that they've put good money into renovations.

Now, I will admit my stay was not all shiny and perfect. Our neighbors wonderful, sweet children started screaming at 6:45am. Yes, I said it. 6 fucking 45 am in the morning.  It bothered me so much that in my dreams I was fantasizing about opening the door between our rooms and screaming at them. This ended at around 8 am when I couldn't take it anymore. So I called the front desk..

"Good morning Mrs. Hilmers! Is there something we can do for you?"
"...yes....the room next to us....their kids have been screaming since 6:45am....is there anything you can do?"
"We could send security up to check on them."
"..oh...I don't think it's a security issue, I think they are just horrible children."

The hotel went to great lengths to make sure the rest of our stay here was pleasant and comp'd us a meal. The room we were moved to had a great view of the strip which I was more than happy to be nowhere near. 

So yes, I think I've found my hotel!

Also, the shark tank is pretty awesome. The slide..well..don't think you'll see fish when you go down the slide. It's more like blurs of silver, but the slide is still great. I think the pool is half kid urine, but somehow the tank kept me distracted from that. :D

How do Main Street Station and Golden Gate have more stars than the Golden Nugget? They aren't even half as nice! People expect the Strip when staying Downtown, but -alas- you aren't on the Strip anymore, Dorothy!

Accept the Golden Nugget for what it is - The Strip's mother's best hotel. The aquarium pool slide -- Might I point out that no hotel on the Strip has a pool anywhere near that awesome? --  and the cabana pool drinks should make up for all the little complaints.

It was girls weekend in Vegas, Baby!  The pool in this place is very unique as it has sharks and sea life swimming  in a tank along side you. Pool service is almost non-existant, so be prepared to fetch for yourself.  We were there on the Saturday and Sunday..so the pool was VERY crowded, but a lot of fun.  Our room was comfy. Beds were made up with nice thread count sheets. There is a variety for anyone in the casino and the sports book was quaint and fun.  The valet was BUSY but my car arrived unscratched.  Its really all I ask for!  The downtown vibe is very fun.  I usually stay on the strip. This hotel did not disappoint.  Dining at the Chart House there is very good and expensive. This seemed to be the nicest hotel in Downtown Vegas.

Again I'm back and the Golden Nugget supports these fake fire fighters when the real heroes risk their life protecting us daily,  if we need them  at your  home if it  catches fire or you are involved in an accident on road they are their to help you I full uniform. It's sad the the Nugget supports these FAKE  fire fighters you want support them
Go ahead. I would just walk by and ignore them! It's sad that the Golden Nugget management supports the fake fire fighters. Some day I know  the  greedy management will need a real fire department personal in a emergency.  I just hope they then know the different between the fake fire fighters they seem to support and the people that actual are here to help citizen in a time of need.

Ok after reading some really bad reviews i was a bit afraid to stay here but i was determined to give this beautiful hotel a chance and boy was i glad i did. Im going to start off with the only downside, when they say 3pm check in they mean it, we arrived Sunday a lil after 1pm and couldnt check in we went and killed time by having some lunch. They called my cell at about 2:55 (LOL) and said our room was ready. It was f** amazing. It was me and my 3 adult daughters, every employee that we came into contact with was nothing but professional and accomadating. We stayed in the Rush Tower Jan. 19th for my bday. They gave us the VIP treatment from beginning to end. I really like that u had to insert your room key to get up to your room, no key, elevator wont move.The rooms were unbelievable, large, clean, modern and,2 sitting areas with large comfy chairs. Bell service, ppl that actually open the doors for u every time u come and go. Our room included a safe, FREE wifi which worked better than at home, fridge, access to the gym etc. Complimentary robes,slippers,kcups,Fiji water,snack bar with apples,trail mix, nuts,candy. The bed was so plush, the pillows were like sleeping on clouds. Nightly chocolates on our pillow. We will definately b back

The shades of classic Vegas are best exemplified by Golden Nugget.  Of all of the older casinos along Fremont, the Golden Nugget has renewed itself with a significant makeover earlier this year, making it one of the top casinos (if not THE top casino) in the downtown area.

The casino seems slightly more expanded, with more slot machines in various areas than before.  They've also increased some of the table games load and there seems to be a good mix of games \/ limits for high and low rollers alike.  Comps here are far easier to achieve than any strip casino, though most players should know this.  Overall the casino staff has been accommodating, though I think the cocktail waitresses are looking a little old to be skimping around for tips.

The rooms in the North and South tower are unbelievably nice, especially after the recent renovation.  Anyone who has stayed here in the last two decades will recognize the key changes made in all rooms from suites to standard deluxes.  One end has incorporated a modern, contemporary theme and the other still retains the old luxurious theme, reminiscent of a mini-Bellagio but with a much cheaper price tag.

Though the general demographic here is most certainly going to be older, Gold Diggers is the only nightlife venue to attract a younger crowd.  At least the dining choices feature a good amount of variety, with the Buffet and Vic & Anthony's earning my biggest nods.

If I had to stay anywhere downtown, the Golden Nugget would be my first choice.  It's recent changes and new additions are good enough reasons to make this casino one of the better choices downtown.
Just made phone reservation for bike fest. Kate helped us out. And she was very professional and helpful. Thank you so much for making it easier! We are looking forward to staying in Vegas!

This has to be one of the nicest casino hotels in downtown. The pool itself should be enough to make any person a fan of this place. You can take a water slide through a shark tank. Really. The rooms are clean enough. Better than some of the places I've stayed on the strip. Caught a comedy show that was free with our check in that was good. Ate an 11:00 o'clock breakfast at the cafe downstairs because 11 in Vegas is early. I wouldn't suggest it but it wasn't bad. My only complaint is the elevators. There were four to take us to our floor, but only 2 worked the whole weekend. It took so long to get on one because of the amount of people who stood in line to get on one. Nothing more uncomfortable than cramming. We can't help but make conversation. Especially when you have to jam your bag against somebody's knee just to get in. Fix your broken elevators! I would definitely stay there again than any of the other places we visited that weekend. The casino said enough about them to make us leery to try something new.

Booked the Tower Spa suite a month in advance and when I get there they give me a smaller room in the Rush Tower because all of the Tower Spa are taken. I returned to talk to them about my new room and they then tell me that the room isn't available because of a so called Roach infestation. Any advice I would give on this hotel is that you should not stay here! The manager AJ ( Ajay) was not helpful at all and we didn't even get credit back for the room we initially paid for after we received a significantly smaller suite.

We've stayed at the Golden Nugget a few times now and it has become our favorite place to set up shop for a Downtown LV-focused stay. You can't beat the easy access to Freemont Street and all the craziness that affords. We always try to stay in the Rush Tower, which as I understand it is one of the most recently renovated. Friendly staff, good food and drink options on site, proximity to cheap gambling - it's a great place to stay in Vegas!

I was contacted by the management regarding my review and experience and I have to say they said all the right things. They recognized the need for a more satisfactory response to my concerns and that it was likely a training issue that could be addressed. I agreed to try them again and they agreed to upgrade my next stay to make amends for the previous experience. I will update the review again in August.

The rooms here are alright.  We stayed in the Carson Tower and were satisfied.  They were clean.  No frills.  The casino here was ok.  This may be one of the nicest hotels downtown.  The pool was still open -- even in the middle of November.  The Freemont Experience is right outside.  Front desk and housekeeping were responsive to our needs (water, late room cleaning, 12 p.m. checkout).  The WiFi sucks.  I would stay on the strip the next time.

Old Vegas, gaudy, tacky, trashy place on the North Strip. It's yuck and gross and for cowboys and crack smokers. I feel like everyone there is a 70 year old chain smoking jewish grandmother with a trach-ringed 95 year old cowboy husband, all coughing and gagging and playing penny slots with too much make-up. Rooms are ok. No elevator security. Good valet.
There is a really nice aquarium in the hotel which is very nice to look at.

Great hotel, we stayed in the Rush Tower Suites and they were beautiful. Great choice of food options and very friendly staff. Pool is top notch and shark tank is pretty neat!

Only ding is noise, it was very noisy on the 12th floor even being opposite of fremont street.

Probably would stay again if I was to stay on that end of the strip, however we prefer the big strip.

My experience with the Golden Nugget was very disappointing. I was stuck in a hotel elevator for approximately an hour one night. Not only was the responsiveness to this incident slow, but also the employees assisting were unprofessional and disrespectful to my peers and me. I am considered about the safety regulations and lack of service, and would not recommend staying here to anyone.

My wife and I took our first trip to Vegas last October (2011). I was surprised at how clean the Golden Nugget was, and how nice it was! Honestly, I was expecting a lot less. It wasn't until we visited some of the supposedly "nicer" places on the strip that we realized that the Nugget is much better than it's given credit for. 

Our room was very clean. The carpet had just been cleaned before we arrived. I guess it's possible that a lake of vomit had to be cleaned up, or the soggy remnants of a porn video production, or whatever, but the only thing we saw or smelled was a clean room. I appreciated that. Then we noticed that somebody was always, and I mean ALWAYS, doing a shampoo job on the carpet somewhere in that place. Whatever the reason, I liked it. It told me that they wanted it to be clean all the time. 

We never attempted room service. In fact, we didn't take advantage of much at all that the hotel had to offer. If it had have been only the room I was talking about, I would have given it 5 stars, especially after seeing the room my friends had in a much more expensive hotel on the strip! However, getting a drink in the casino required huge patience and even an occasional scavenger hunt for a waitress. And also, the check in time was too long. I would think that management could figure out peak times for customers checking in and out and staff up the desk for this. Oh well. 

Overall, we enjoyed the Nugget and will certainly stay again.
Went to gamble for about hour and a half and not once did we get a waitress to ask us for our drinks. We went up to one and she said she'd get our waitress. Disappointed.

I was looking for a cheaper place to stay on this trip because I had just gone to Vegas last month. This trip was to pick up my in-laws as they were visiting friends in town. Looking around, I found a great package deal from Orbitz that included 3 nights stay for two rooms and an SUV from Hertz. All for $500. 

Valet parking was quick and efficient. The front doors aren't automated, so you have to manually hold the door open if you have a lot of stuff to lug around. Checked in to the hotel, and the front desk girl was fine. Really no chit chat, just all business. Not super friendly like most of the strip hotels, but not rude either. Almost impersonal. We were given two adjoining rooms with double beds in the Carson Tower. This is where it got crazy. I know Vegas hotels are huge, but didn't expect it in downtown. Our rooms were literally the furthest you can get from the casino floors. But I guess for the price I paid, I expected a not so great room. But that was a trek to the room! Seriously, why aren't there two separate banks of elevators. I counted...after the elevator ride, i turned a corner 5 times!

Rooms were clean, but too much open space. I feel like there should be more furniture or something. Clean beds, clean bath, flat TV, really nothing more you can ask for except maybe a mini fridge.

Casino floors were very busy, and very smoky. Typical of downtown hotels due to their low ceilings. Lost money here. Construction around and outside hotel, so beware of that. Also, they charge for non-guests to park on property, which is a bit odd. Also there are 2 starbucks on site, but hit up the Dunkin Donuts at Fremont for better coffee. You can get Starbux anywhere.

Probably won't stay here again. Downtown scene is not for me.

Best place to stay downtown! It has easy access to the Fremont Street Experience and an AWESOME shark tank pool. We paid extra to get into the pool upstairs for adults which was a great place to chill. Our room was tidy as usual and the staff was courteous.

They gave us the wrong room. Room service was bad and overpriced. There were dirty towels in our bathroom. House cleaning woke us up early in the morning. They charge Ten Dollars to make coffee in your room. The clientele was trashy. This place sucked.
I liked seeing the largest gold nugget in the world, though!

Totally awesome. The pool is seriously amazing and almost kid free. The shark tank is beautiful, the waterfalls, the waterslide, the poolside blackjack, lots of lounge chairs, I mean, seriously, it was an amazing pool area. The drinks were a little pricey but really tasty. Ate at the cafe, which was fine, nothing amazing, decent price. They give you a good amount of coupons for free drinks and $ off on dining. The rooms were great, very clean, AC worked awesome. Its right on Fremont St and there is plenty to do...we didn't even go down to the strip at all. My only criticism would be the H2O barstaff and blackjack dealers were pretty unfriendly, but really, who cares. I would stay here again ANY time. It was a fantastic experience!

All downtown casinos are smelly filthy boring small crowded smokey dives not worthy of visiting.  This one is different.  Downtown Las Vegas draws the Walmart types.  This one is nicer, less smelly, more spread out, so you are not fighting with crowds.  If I'm forced to stay downtown, I would stay here.  But here's the problem, you still have to deal with Walmart type people as they are everywhere in downtown Vegas.

This is one of the nicer hotels on Fermont Street.  The casino floor and lobby is fairly huge and definitely clean.  They have an awesome pool and crazy slide I didn't get to try.

I didn't get a chance to stay here, but I'd love to try his place out if I decide to stay on Fremont Street.
Very impressed with the room look. Very spacious and accessible. Great prices and friendly staff.

I decided that at least one time in my life, I had to stay in Dingy Old Downtown, and so last summer I took the plunge at stayed at the Golden Nugget. I got a room in the newer Rush Tower.

The hotel itself was nice. The Rush Tower room was decent for the price. It's right on Fremont St, so you can enjoy the overhead show at night. The pool is nice, but it was super crowded in the summer as it's quite smaller than many of the Strip hotels.

However, outside the walls of the Golden Nugget is a different story. I would not eat at any of the downtown restaurants outside of the Golden Nugget (except for the legendary Binion's Steakhouse). But by contrast, I would gamble anywhere downtown except at the Golden Nugget, where their $10+ minimum tables made me shake my head. If I wanted to play tables of this price, I'd go to the Strip. Very disappointing. However, there were plenty of nearby places like Binion's, Fitz, etc., that were the cheap gaming experience I expected.  

If you want to stay downtown, Golden Nugget is the best and (in my opinion) the only option. However, there is no reason to stay Downtown. Get a room on the Strip or stay at one of the quality off Strip hotels if you want a cheaper option. If you want to see Downtown, travel here for a couple hours, which is all you will need before you will want to leave.

A word of caution... if you do stay here, be careful venturing off Fremont Street. Once you leave the part of Fremont covered by the overhead screen, it can get really shady quickly. If I was a young female, I would not feel comfortable leaving the Fremont Street Experience area.
One interesting place. Stayed here for work, but it wasn't a bad experience. It just didn't have any real flair to it, but the shark tank and slide were just what I needed after a day of work.

Terrible service. We are here celebrating my boyfriend's birthday, so obviously we've had this trip planned a month in advance. We reserved a room, and when we got to check in at the time scheduled, we were informed there were no king rooms left. The receptionist then told us we can upgrade, but had to pay the difference. The other option was for us to downgrade to a double bed room while still paying for the king room, and then they move us tomorrow morning when they had what we reserved available. Neither of those options were appealing. How is that fair to your guests to pay for YOUR mistake? We paid for this weeks ago to have a specific room, and then they make us pay for it. Rip off. You can hide behind the shining lights and glitz and glam, but this hotel and its staff care for nothing but money and screwing people over.

My friends ask me what I table game I like to play. It's Craps!

The Golden Nugget overall has great minimal bets, far better than The Strip. If by chance you can play in the morning, the croupiers are kind and can help you place your bets. 

The best bets are the restaurants. Delicious food at a solid gamble. Vic and Anthony's if you're a winner or not. Claim Jumper is a sure bet. 

You won't find a more lovely staff there. I hope you break the bank.

Love the Rush Tower.  Great looking room and a great price.  Comfy bed and chaise\/sofa.  Bathroom, just beautiful.  Check out my pics.  Only thing missing is a mini fridge and free wifi.  That would've made it five stars.  But still a beautiful room, good bang for the buck.

Checked in last week and had no wifi, so the front desk gave us an upgrade to the Golden Tower. Beautiful room and good wifi. The pool is amazing! We enjoyed the buffet several nights in a row. Valet was easy and fast. Luggage Bell service was top notch. By accident we forgot a Kindle and Beats headphones. I figured they would be gone, but they have honest maids and they were turned in to lost and found! I couldn't believe it. Great place to stay, perfect downtown location. Staff was very hospitable.

Ok, so let me just preface this by saying my review is NOT based on ANY experience at the hotel OTHER than a mere lunch and brief walk-around.  

That said. THEY HAVE A CLEAR TUBE-WATERSLIDE THAT GOES THROUGH AN AQUARIUM WITH SHARKS?!?!?!?!?! OMG! I'm SO staying here at LEAST once JUST for this reason.

I have to admit, it's definitely not as upscale of a crowd as anything I've seen on the strip...but then again...neither is Old Town Vegas...

The hotel didn't seem like anything special...UNTIL.. I saw the pool with a tube slide shoving people through a shark-inhabited aquarium and poolside blackjack tables. Are you KIDDING ME? 

How come I never knew about this place.

PS $20 to ride the waterride if you're not a guest of the hotel...

- Nicest casino in downtown.  Cool shark-tank that their pool's slide goes thru.
- I'd give 'em 5 stars but it's always a hassle to park in their lot (which is not free unless you jump thru some hoops), even when I'm going there to visit my friend who's staying\/playing at the Golden Nugget.

Best choice for downtown and a great place to stay. only there for a night and our first night off the strip. felt family friendly. we didn't gamble but felt welcome and easy access to downtown vegas stuff. good time had by our party range of 8 to 42 year olds..

Just stayed at the Golden Nugget for 3 days. My husband and I stayed in the Rush Tower. We had a group of people and between us we all stayed in each tower. Our Rush room was beautiful, and check in was a breeze. Our room was ready before it said it would be. I got a chance to check out the other rooms in each tower and they seemed nice as well. The gem of this hotel though is the pool! The sharks are so cool, and the water slide is no joke lol, it's fast! There seemed to have alot of good restaurants, we only ate at Claim Jumpers and the Grille though, both were good. The location is THE best! Right on Freemont. I have never stayed Downtown before and we had the best time:) I will be looking forward to our next stay here.

This place was amazing!  We booked 1 month out and got a really great rate!  The room was very clean and cool which was great because outside was 120 degrees.  We ordered steak from room service and it was delicious!  The prices were pretty standard compared to other hotels.  Wasn't the cheapest food out there but it is convenient and they are quick.  The pool area alone made it worth the stay.  There is a 3 story slide that whips through an aquarium filled with sharks and other fish.  The pool wraps around it and features a waterfall, hot tub, reserved seating, cabanas, margarita bar, outdoor gaming, and an adult lounge.  There are multiple restaurants inside and a buffet area.  If you walk through the casino, it will lead to a side door that goes into the old Las Vegas strip.  It is a covered strip with casinos, souvenir shops, restaurants, and night clubs!  There were 2 stages with bands performing cover songs outside!  We literally stayed at our hotel the entire visit because everything was right there.  There is even an arcade next to the elevators!  The strip featuring MGM, Caesars Palace, and all the other giant casinos are a 5 minute drive.  This spot I highly recommend.  We will come back!
The room was nice and large and pretty quiet.  We were disappointed that it would cost us $25.00 per day to have a refrigerator in our room.  We had to use ice to keep our medicine cold.

TALK ABOUT SERVICE!*KALEI*

Great service they greet you & make you feel as if they are your friend at the front desk when we checked in. 

RUSH TOWER seems to be their newest renovated tower & literally smelt nothing like cigarettes CRAZY! Anyways the moment you walk in you see they HUGE FISH TANK behind the front desk where you check in. The chandeliers above our heads were gorgeous and sparkly.

We went to the VIP line check in & our girl helped us quickly & efficiently... KALEI was also one of the staff members that helped us pick out our room when I tried to compare prices with third party sites he made me notice that is it much more beneficial to actually go to the mother site. THANK YOU KALEI for having that pointed out to me. Really looking out for their guests is a number one plus in my view 

We got to our room door & the keys did not work... so went back down she double checked them & they still didn't work. So we used the hall way phone as she instructed so that we don't have to come all the way back down... security came up the help us... he taught us that we need to push it all the way back & make sure the arrows on the card are staight. 

Ahahhaha I guess you get what you pay for... but we walked in you see double door opening bathroom area with beautiful marble & huge sink w\/ waterfall shower top. A vanity across from the bathroom right when you turn left into the room.

There was a couch area with a TV & then the lovely king bed right behind the couch with also a TV to watch as well. It was a corner suite so we had two window views which was one of the strip & the other not so sightly of the plaza hotel & pool hahaha

There was a table to do business on and everything in this room was just homey...only thing I did wish was to have a better comforter blanket... it was very flat & not so fluffy as you would expect from a hotel.. but the pillows were fluffy as heaven!

Negative 0 stars !!!( I had to rate the place but they dont deserve a single star!!) two words BED BUGS!!! I stayed at the rush towers and came home with bites all over my arms and bacck and one of the stupid critters made it to my toilettries bag. I am so disgusted with this place. My arms and back are an itchy mess. Room is under investigation, howevver I was not guaranteed even a refund for this horrific inconvenience.

GN is my favorite downtown hotels. I like that it has 2 Starbucks, that it's right in the middle of downtown and that it is the nicest hotel in downtown. I like the rush tower if it's just the hubby and I but with the kids, I prefer the gold tower. I normally don't win here so I don't gamble here. Claim jumper should be opening soon so I will have to try it when I go back.

RUSH TOWER - We stayed for a week with an upgraded room to a suite (next time we'll book directly with the hotel for the military discount which we did not get through Orbitz).  Nice double view as we were in a corner room.  Fantastic view of the mountain range.  Great view of the pool area from directly above it.  

PROS: The room was very nice upon arrival.  Clean and everything in place.  The front desk personnel were courteous and helpful with lots of smiles.
- HOUSEKEEPING: Even housekeeping personnel all through the hotel would answer any question we had with a smile and "good luck!"  If you call the housekeeping desk, they do make sure your request is taken care of quickly.
- The Gordie Brown show.  Don't miss this one.  Seriously.  Try to get the dinner and a show coupons - ask the ticket counter or front desk and YES, THEY OFFER A MILITARY DISCOUNT.  
- The SPA: Well worth the $$ for a therapeutic massage by Jeff (get that trip for you and your dad back to the Old County going. Post pics of the Pirminator).   And so totally worth the $$ for the mani\/pedi from Karol.  Just an excellent service provided by both.  The staff was not only friendly but super super helpful, even an hour before they closed.  
- THE POOL: Yep, beautiful.  Towels are free as is entrance if you're a guest.  The lifeguards could smile more but still helpful :)
- SHARK TANK - everything you see on YouTube is the way it is.  Super cool to look at and slide through.  Beautiful photo ops. 
- VALET - free and very nice people.  Be sure to tip them.  They deserve it.
- INTERIOR - so nice and elegantly decorated.  The chandeliers are well worth a few pictures.
- BARTENDERS - super nice and make a great gin\/tonic (especially the ones at the Gordie Brown show area).  
- THE ROOM - if anything is not working, report it immediately to the front desk (always good to do a function check at the beginning of your stay).  They are really good about taking care of room issues right away.

CONS: No real explanation of their rewards\/VIP program.  SUGGESTION: Offer your guests a mini-seminar (say, 20 minutes or so) in a conference room to answer questions and go over all the services you provide in your rewards program.  The lobby is super busy and super noisy so this would not be a good venue but it would give a special touch of class to your hotel.  Guests should sign up as soon as they get there or a month or two prior to your trip to get your card.   
- AMENITIES: Why do you charge $10 for a 4-pack of K-cups?  SUGGESTION FOR GUESTS: Leave GN k-cups right where they are.  Go to Walgreen's on Freemont and get a 12-pack for about the same price.  Get snacks and drinks while you're there for those late-nite munchie attacks.  Well worth the effort.  NO MINI FRIDGE - unsure if you can ask for one but if you're going to stay a week, they should at least offer to bring one up for you.
- The SPA:  No military discount.  
- HOUSEKEEPING: You will be making a lot of calls to housekeeping. No daily 2 bottles of water as promised on their brochure. Once or twice the cleaning didn't provide shampoo, another roll of TP, no extra tissues, they took one of the robes (make sure you tell the front desk so they don't charge you $60 for a missing robe) or the small things that make staying here special.   
- THE POOL - upper decks are not free.  
- SHUTTLE SERVICE - not free - why do I mention this?  Because each call to the front desk advises their airport shuttle is free.  We never saw a shuttle that specifically said Golden Nugget on it so if it is free, you need to tell us where to look for the GN shuttle.  Otherwise, 1-way to\/from the airport is $9 per person.
- THE SOUND SYSTEM: Dear God in Heaven, please upgrade your sound system so that even at the higher levels, it sounds smooth.  The sound is extremely blaring and obnoxious not only in the pool area but especially in the lounge\/bar and GoldDiggers club.  
- INTERIOR - please change your carpet to something lighter so your casino\/lobby\/common areas don't look dark\/depressing.  For an elegantly decorated hotel, the carpet is the absolute worst.

Terrible experience so far.  We booked 2 months in advance and requested a non smoking room.  When we showed up to check in we are informed that we had to stay in a dingy stinky smoking room.  Will not be staying here again.  Absolutely terrible service

Stopped by specifically to see the Hand of Faith nugget. Unlike other aspects of the hotel, directions to the nugget are not clearly marked. After getting some help, we found it around the corner from registration. It was cool to see and bigger than I expected.

Booked one night at the Golden Nugget during our recent trip to Vegas.  We couldn't get in anywhere on the strip for our first night, so we thought to give downtown a try for the first time ever.  Boy am I glad we did!  We LOVED the Golden Nugget!  

First off, the valet service was nice, especially since it was free.  Check in was easy and we were able to get a room on a high floor not near elevators\/ice machines, which was a plus.  The only negative was that we weren't in the newer (Rush) tower and came to find out it wasn't much more to stay over there... I wish someone had offered it to us.  Nonetheless, our room was really nice and clean, the bed was comfortable, and it was a good size.

We LOVED the pool area.  Though it was a bit chilly to swim, it was nice to sit outside, listen to music, have a drink, and be near the fire pit.  I do wish they had more more pits though, because it was usually packed and didn't allow for more people to partake in it's glory.  

Even though we only stayed one night, we really enjoyed the atmosphere of the Golden Nugget.  There are two starbucks (a huge plus for me) and lots of restaurants to choose from at this hotel and at nearby hotels.  It also is nice that this is the place for cheap gambling (fremont st.).  We'll be back for sure!

this whole stay was shitty for lack of a better word. got 2 rooms, girlfriend and her friend put their cards down for 50$ and later both noticed that there were 300$ charges on their cards....went to resolve this and their reason was "to make sure the card is valid"....all the while they're saying something about the cash we put down? I honestly don't know. then the towel thing, ordered 4 body towels and got 8 hand towels? what. don't even get me started on the restaurant here, from the stupid Eliza hostess girl calling us kids, to the waiter running into one of the people in our group with a tray and then looking at her like it was her fault. I've heard awesome stuff about this place and received all but awesome anything. definitely staying on the strip next time, and don't recommend that anyone else ever stays here. we should have taken the lady screaming about her ruined vacation at check out upon our check in. ugh.

One of the better hotels in Downtown Las Vegas.  The rooms were super clean and super nice.  Enough eating places to satisfy your needs.  Easy parking and super quick check in.  Fantastic place to stay downtown.

This review is not for the stay at the hotel but for the restaurant inside - Charthouse!
My family went for dinner on Christmas Night was we love it.

We saw this hotel once over 25 years ago and it's now completely different.  I only looked at the lobby and some areas on the casino floor and it is really beautiful.  They have the amazing shark tank.  We're enjoying our dinner at the same time as looking at the huge tank with all kind of colorful fishes.

The Charthouse has good food and great service.

I truly enjoyed my stay here. The accommodations were excellent. We had a nice view, free internet with free parking. Located at what I would call the heart of Vegas.We were able to walk right onto Fremont Street for the 'EXPERIENCE". A must see! The buffet had everything anyone one would want. The shark tank awesome. I will be back.

I will give two stars because it is really pretty! They did a great job on the remodel. That's about it though! I don't know if it's all in Vegas now but you have to seriously have to buy everything now! I am a huge coffee person and there is no longer coffee in the rooms. You have to pay for it. Which to me is re CRAZY! I spend 23.00 for a resort fee and you can't give me cheap coffee lol. Then at 7 in the morning they are cleaning carpets!! Are you kidding me!?! I go to Vegas all the time. I don't think I will stay here again.

Would have stayed at Binions because it's legendary but the bf  got kicked out last time for supposedly counting cards. 
What the Mother of Pearl? My how GN has changed, for the betta.  Nice rooms, service, gaming floor, dealers, 'tenders, FOOD and kick ass pool.  Winnings from the casino paid for the trip, plus some change, so the prospect of winning seems more likely here. 
Another stay is a definite possibility.

We arrive on Thursday at 400p valet unloaded our bags , checking in was a breeze , and inside of 20min we were escorted to our 16th floor room with a beautiful view ... Only gripe is no coffee in my room , oh well Starbucks in lobby . 
Room was clean , smelled good , but furniture showed its age, room needs more outlets & a proper business desk , popcorn ceiling dates the place . I hope they remember first impressions last !!
I love the energy of Fremont street, and the Nugget is the best resort and is in the middle of the action. My preferred Hotel in Vegas

Had a family vacation so figured I'd stay here. It was my first time staying here and all the workers were nice. Had a pretty bad hiccup them when arriving. They booked my room to another guest so while settling in my room for about 10min the door opens up and a strange man looks as confused and scared to see me as I am to see him. Just like a what happens in Vegas but without the crazy parting and getting married to each other by morning lol
Plus- The hotel did end up upgrading us both (2 separate rooms) and then we went on our way in better rooms. 
Had myself a winning streak on the slot machines on my stay so definitely loved the casino.
The pool was perfect and the slide is so cool major brownie points for making adults feel like kids again.
Restaurants all great. Hit up the happy hours at Cadillac and grotto pizza place. Food great in both places and drinks as well.
  Room (new upgraded room) rush tower- was very spacious like a perfect clean studio apartment except for my day before last there because when I came into my room after a great day at the pool, my room reeked  of marijuana and when my family came up to my room they thought I was smoking pot. Nothing I could do about that. They know I don't so it wasn't like a big deal but still sucked. 
 I would most likely stay here again. The rooms were fairly priced and as long as I stay in the new tower again I'd probably always stay here when in Fremont.
Room was clean and beds were very comfortable. Check in & ticket staff was very nice. 24 hr Starbucks in case you need a fix. The pool gets very crowded even early morning. A good place to stay.

Spent last weekend in Vegas at the Golden Nugget.  Everything was great, room, restaurants and the casino.  I usually stay on the strip, but stayed here because of a convention. Would stay here again in a heart beat.

Definitely a four star for the Downtown area.  Only a three if comparing to other locations on the strip.   I prefer the "feel" of the Fremont Street area over the strip....makes me feel like Vegas use to be.  Even better with a 35 year blackjack dealer veteran dealing at my table!

We stayed in the Gold Tower and the room was nice.  Starting to get a bit dated, but overall well worth the room rate.  I am spoiled when it comes to beds and rarely do I find a bed that meets my expectations in a hotel room.  This place did.  Pillow top mattresses with down comforters, the beds rocked. 

This trip was business, however I spent some time checking out the pool area and it would be very family friendly if I brought my family to Vegas.  (Not Likely)  The shark tank and water slide puts this one over the top.

Overall a stay that was worth the $$.  Even better that their black jack tables paid the bill!!!
This review is for the cafe:  The food was great and the staff was very polite. This casino looks much nicer than I expected for a downtown hotel.

Nicest place downtown
The Tank is friggin awesome
Fun for all ages

The Golden Nuggs!! This hotel as recommended to me by some very trusted sources before a recent trip to Vegas. Now I'm no Vegas expert--I've actually only been one other time, and it was just for one night with my mother. I'm not sayin' my mom's not a party animal, but I think it's safe to assume that we made it to sleep earlier than most Vegas-goers do. I was pretty excited for this take-two Vegas adventure and I think the Golden Nugget was a perfect home base on this trip. 

The hotel is located at the end of the "Fremont Street Experience," which is certainly an experience. So many performers, chippendales, little booths to buy chachkies, bars, etc. It was sort of stimulation overload for me, but a very fun little jaunt. The hotel itself is pretty modern for being such a classic. Again, I don't have much to compare it to in terms of casino quality, but it looked pretty good to me. I sort of hate that you can smoke cigarettes in these places, but I get why it's part of the experience for a lot of people. 

The check in line is sort of a hot mess. I think this might be the case in most Vegas hotels around 3 pm, but it still doesn't make it fun. The line moves excruciatingly slowly, everyone has luggage, and it seems like people might start their Vegas activities as soon as they land in Nevada (or maybe before), because there were definitely some happy\/tipsy people in line. When we finally made it through the line to check in, the front desk clerk was super nice but also told us a slightly bizarre story about how he was born on the day his girlfriend's aunt died. I'll chalk it up to small talk and did definitely note that the hospitality industry is on top of their game in LV.

Our room was located in the Rush Tower and we were on the 21st floor, so we were able to see past the parking garage and onto the city. The rooms are spacious and clean, the beds are comfy, and those black out curtains are somethin' else. I honestly could've slept in all morning if it weren't for my excitement to check out the shark tank slide! The wifi was sort of a bust for me--it's supposed to be included in your $30 resort fee, but when we tried to log on it gave us a $15 and $25 option. We called down and they reset it, but once I was logged on I hardly got any internet at all. Not a huge deal, but I did have a little work to do and was glad I had my own hot spot.

Let's talk about the star of the show here: the shark tank! This was actually super cool and I can see why people love it. My friend and I made our way down to the pool around 10 am and it was already blazing hot. The pool temp is chilly, but perfect for those 115+ days. We made a few laps in the pool to check out the sharks and fish and made sure to take a few runs down the water slide. We were having so much fun that we asked for late check out, which the front desk happily approved. This hotel was definitely the fun, slightly cheesy old school Vegas vibe I was looking for. I'll be back, Golden Nuggs!
AMAZING HOTEL, AMAZING SERVICE, AMAZING FOOD!!! However the pool staff can be a little less lazy and pick up te trash. Its's such a beautiful pool, but I was saddened for how poorly it's cleaned.

This review is strictly for the casino...

The Golden Nugget is probably the nicest casino in downtown Las Vegas. I'd rank it above Imperial Palace, Harrahs, etc but not quite T.I. or the Mirage.

Came in here after driving from Huntington Beach straight to Vegas 6 hours of HELL and on an empty stomach. We headed to the cafe here because honestly, the casino here is cleaner than all the other ones around it downtown. Also the food seemed normal compared to the 99 cent foot long hot dogs and deep fried Snickers at the nearby casinos.

We all demolished our breakfast food and hit the tables for some action. The casino staff was very friendly and the limits are on the upper end of of downtown limits. (10 dollar BJ, $5 craps, etc).

They got an awesome pool that unfortunately was closed at the time (2AM - reasonable enough time to have it closed) and overall it just had a nice clean feel to it. Not something you get at nearby Binion's which is a different story...
Got sick eating at Claim Jumper in the Casino.  Then woke up to beetles in bed with me.  The only cool thing was the pool.

I would have given this hotel four stars but there were a couple of significant problems. The first problem is that the bathroom\/toilet in our room was not working. We had to call maintenance to come fix it. That should have been fixed before we checked in. The second problem was that we wanted to valet our car as we were staying at the hotel and were clearly told, in a very demeaning tone, by the 'valet guy', that valet is full even for hotel guests and there is nothing that they can do. 
The good: the beds were comfortable and the shark tank is pretty cool. The restaurant pictures where they claim that you could eat right by The shark tank are not all that accurate. You are close but far from right by it.
Since we went to stay there on the weekend where a festival was going on downtown, it was pricey. I was able to get it at a better price through the festival website, which I believe is the price the hotel usually charges. That was a good thing.
The restaurants are just OK. We went to RED sushi and were sorely disappointed. The buffet is apparently OK but we were not willing to wait in line for one hour and they have a claim Jumper as well as Asian cuisine. The food is just average.
This hotel has potential, but being downtown, despite renovation, it's still maintains the infrastructure from many years ago. Due to this, it cannot offer the same level of class and service that is offered by top hotels on the strip. Overall, decent for a strip hotel but still only an average three-star value.

This is my favorite place to stay in Las Vegas. It has an amazing positive energy, and a perfect location on Fremont Street. The $30m pool is by itself a reason to visit Vegas. My only complaint? $15 wifi.

After staying at Golden Nugget in Vegas this past weekend I can say I'm definitely a fan! This is probably the cleanest and nicest casino\/hotel in all of the Fremont street experience. 

We stayed on the 16th floor of the hotel which is a VIP level that you can only access with a. Special cars and have to be a gold member to book. The room was newly remodeled and was gorgeous! The standard room on the 16th featured a king size bed, a sectional couch, large flat screen TV, DVD player, and best of all a to built into the mirror in the bathroom that is visible from the spa style tub. 

They had every game that the other casinos had. Although I would have liked to see some $5 blackjack tables here during the weekdays (especially since all of the surrounding casinos had that). But overall you can't really find something they don't have. 

There were plenty of dining options as well and of course bars throughout. I have to give a shout out to the best bartender ever, Ku. She was unlike any bartender I have ever met in Vegas, GENUINE! She's a total gem and makes guests feel VIP no matter the circumstances. 

Overal I enjoyed my time here. I was a little bummed that the tables were so expensive and the people bugging for money outside the doors made us uncomfortable but the hotel itself was gorgeous and the casino is the best on Fremont, hands down!

NIGHTMARE ON FREMONT ST

My driver dropped me off at the hotel in the back and when I say driver I received a ride alone in a short bus from the airport. I was staying in the Carson tower and when I walked in I was informed to go to the Carson tower registration. 

So I started walking through the craziness of a Vegas Casino. Maneuvering around tired people who are drinking a lot and losing too much money. They are like rats trapped in a box for 4 days and 3 nights and are in no hurry to go anywhere. But I pushed on and made my way past the mayhem while dragging my suitcase to get to the Carson tower for check in.

When I arrived at the Carson registration desk there was a sign that said Desk closed. Check in at the Rush Tower. What? So now I had to go back through the mayhem again. I pushed through and when I got to the Rush Tower there was a sign that informed me to check in at the Gold Tower registration because the desk was closed. What?

At this point I felt like there were hidden cameras laughing at my every move. I took a deep breath and decided to look for the Gold Tower registration. I asked the lady running the high roller Keno room and she pointed me to the VIP check in door. I knew this wasn't correct but I was frustrated and I was going to make it work. 

So I walked in with my frustrated face and informed the staff of my wild goose chase I had just been on. I also dropped the Keno ladies name because it's always good to drop a name. I believe they took a little pity on me but the staff was very unapologetic to my dilemma. They were also very unfriendly and it was probably because I wasn't a high roller VIP. I did ask them if it's normal to send guests on a scavenger hunt to check in and they looked at me like it wasn't a big deal. I then asked if they were going to fix the incorrect signs and they told me no. After 10 hours of no sleep and traveling I had no more fight in me but I do know this was wrong. 

Upon walking to my room I finally walked past the open registration desk for the Gold Tower. I will say this was a frustrating way to arrive at a hotel. 

So I get into my room and start unpacking my bag. I then go to the bathroom to wash my face and realized someone had used the bathroom. Yes someone sat on the toilet seat, used the toilet paper, unwrapped the soap and used a clean towel. I'm too exhausted for this. I called down and spoke with the front desk. I also asked if I could be moved to a new room. Of course my request was denied and a maid was sent up to clean my room. A housekeeping manager walked in and told the maid to clean my whole room including the sheets. She was actually nice and hard working. So I left my room for an hour to let the maid do her job. 

Day 2...I wake up early and leave to get my work day started. When I arrived back 4 hours later my room wasn't clean. I spoke with the maid in the hall and she said they would clean my room by 1pm. She even wrote me on her list. I came back to the room at 2pm and it wasn't clean. I called Housekeeping and they said they would send someone up. I got back to my room at 5pm and it was still dirty. I called and spoke with a manager who promised to take care of it and my room was finally cleaned at 6pm. Honestly is it that hard?

Day 3...It was my only day to sleep in and the maid bangs 5 times with the vacuum cleaner even though I had a "Do Not Disturb" sign on my door! Was it necessary to ram my door that many times? It was just rude. She knew what she was doing. 

Day 4...The room was prepaid by my client but for some reason the hotel decided to charge my credit card. I called down to the front desk and they were no help. The girl on the phone was rude and unhelpful. Then when I went downstairs that same girl was there. She was mean to me because of our phone call. I asked her to only see a copy of my bill. She printed me a bill with my credit card charged. She then slid open a drawer where she had her personal cell phone and started texting. This was incredibly rude & why would you do this in front of an upset customer. I did snap a photo of her displaying this unacceptable behavior. I really believe the staff needs to go through a hospitality travel course because they don't get it. 

The hotel staff doesn't have any good customer service. The employees seem unhappy and it translates into the bad customer service I received. In all of my travels, I've never seen a more incompetent  staff, then here. 

On another note: the room was nice. I was expecting dirty old gross Vegas but that is not what I received. The casino was very modern. The pool had a shark tank in the middle which was really cool. You could even water slide through the middle of the sharks. This place wasn't what I expected. It's just sad that the customer service isn't there. I score hard on being treated nice and the Golden Nugget failed on every level.

Recently stayed at this classic old school destination.  Every staff member I encountered treated me like royalty.  The room though, while clean and spacious, had a partially clogged sink and faulty shower faucet. I'd rate it 3.5 stars. Would definitely stay again.

Danielle checked me in. I paid $25 for VIP check-in and was unaware that there was a separate area for VIPs to check in. I had to ask her what "VIP" entailed in order to be directed to the VIP Lounge area. Isn't that listed in my reservation Danielle...why did I have to tell YOU about it? (If I hadn't have asked I would not have been issued a VIP card nor informed about the free drinks and snacks that I am entitled to during my stay...thanks Danielle!) I later went downstairs to ask the Front Desk about the public transportation bus to get to the strip and another female working on Thursday around 12 noon in the VIP Lounge said she has no idea of what bus to take there....ARE YOU KIDDING ME!??!!? This must be a question that people ask on a regular basis so the fact that she knew NOTHING about the "Deuce Bus" was absolutely ridiculous! I went outside to ask the Bellman and he was able to tell me the name, Deuce, and where the closest bus stop was. It's really unfortunate to have FRONT DESK women who look good in their uniforms but have the intelligence of a 1 year old. I'm not impressed at all. These women look as though they were hired for their looks rather than their knowledge of the area...I mean, I wasn't asking for much and they weren't able to deliver anything. I'm here for 3 more days so I will write a follow up. I'm hoping things get better.

Just stayed here for three nights and I have to say this hotel was actually GREAT! All the staff was very friendly even house keeping I think I got into conversation with them every morning. Ordered room service one night and it came up with in 30 minutes. All and all my stay here was good. I'd highly recommend this place if your family oriented.

Hands down my favorite spot in Vegas for staying the night, dining, and lounging poolside!

First, I just love downtown. It has a great 'feel' to it. It's friendly and easy to have fun affordably or luxuriously.

Second, The Golden Nugget is like Peter A. says: "The Crown Jewel of Downtown" and is also much nice than many mega hotels on the Strip. 

Third, the Rush Tower is absolutely the best room I've had, ranking above Caesar's. It's clean, smoke free since it was built, has excellent design and bedding, a private check in desk, and is only $20 to upgrade from their Carson Tower room. HIGHLY Recoomend the Rush Tower.

Fourth, their pool is the bomb! Huge Shark tank with a water slide that goes through it. Lounge chairs in the shallow water, outside gambling tables (yes there are some $5 minimum tables too), a fire pit, and nice size hot tub for the evening, it's perfect, albiet maybe not big enough for the amount of people dying to use it. 

Fifth, surprisingly delcious dining options, especially love the Grotto restaurant for amazing Italian fare at reasonable prices. (See my review on that) AND their Cafe is pretty darn good. The service is a tad slow there though. 

So, for many reasons, the Golden Nugget is my favorite hotel in Vegas!

This used to be our favorite hotel. We are not normally rattled with poor situations as we are very laid back travelers. But our latest visit to the Golden Nugget will be our last.  

The cleaning and bellhop staff were phenomenal as always. That being said, every other experience there was a big disappointment. The front desk staff was always rude. The staff manning the "event" table would roll their eyes when you turned down their advances. Checkout was a nightmare and nearly made us miss our flight. 

The final straw was when we were required to pay $10 to "rent" the plates used for our wedding cake. 

This hotel used to make their customers their #1 priority. I am not sure what happened, but that is not the case now.

The good:  Rush tower rooms are very nice. They are modern and clean. The casino is on par with any on the strip. Pool area is cool too. 
What could've been better: room up-charges are a downer: $10 for in room coffee from the Kurig coffee maker, $15 a day for Internet, $20 to use the gym for the day. $7 for a bottle of Figi water. Room needs mini fridge. 
Summary: I found the rush tower rooms and casino to be very nice, and for those reasons I could see myself coming back.

Stayed at the Gold tower for 3 nights and had a blast! The room was wonderful, very clean, designed nicely. They cleaned the room everyday before we got back from the pool.  Its a great location on fremont. We ate at Lillies asain cuisine - Meh - it was over priced for the food but it was still  good. The sushi bar has an excellent bar tender, Jennifer, and a great happy hour! also, the cantina has a great happy hour.
Do NOT go to gold diggers, gross, rip off - dont go.
We went to the Hideout pool and got a DayBed both days for the pool. It was a great price, and there are no kids! Totally worth it. They have a dj on saturdays too. The bartender Mike was great and so was our host Carolynn. The regular pool was full of kids so if you have kids, thats a great place for them just make sure you arrive early to get a seat. The left side gets more sun then the right.

overall the hotel was great! friendly and helpful staff.
Very clean and interesting layout. The pool area was pretty impressive with the large fish tank in plain site. Moderately priced for the weekend ; would stay here again unless the d hotel is less.

If it wasn't for work I doubt I would ever stay here. The room was OK, it is far from the strip. The hotel room was just OK, OK that is it. You can'y throw a flat screen TV in the room (NON-HD) and then think it upgrades the room. Like every other vegas HOTEL the nickel and dime you for everything. $20 for their GYM (HAHAHAHA), $13.99 for Internet (walk to starbucks) and so on. I have to go to vegas fairly often and it is bcoing more aparent that it is more reasonable to stay at a Laquinta than a $45 casino that charges you another $33.99 for BASIC stuff.... Not to mention it takes longer to get in and out of the hotel while there for business.

I've stayed at the GN numerous times in the past,  so I was looking forward to this stay but was disappointed.  First, the prices are waay out of line for a DT hotel.  Yes, its the nicest,  but $15 for 2 eggs and couple slices of bacon is a bit much for their Denny's quality meal. Wifi in your room will cost you an additional  $14\/day.   Add to that, $10 well drinks from the bar and you begin to realize whose paying for the new tower and fish. The night club has a sterile divish ambiance to it, so much so,  that to try to charge a cover would be laughable.  Simply put: The place is now well overpriced. For the price tag, I'd recommend the strip.

Upon arriving the valet was awesome, the lobby looked beautiful and we were offered waters while waiting in line. However, the women who checked us in was not nice at all and very rude! We asked if an upgrade was available and her words were,  "no way". During that same time our friends were checking in,  yet their receptionist was friendly and offered an upgrade!!! Upon entering our room the carpet was WET, but otherwise everything else about the room was fine. We hung out at the pool for two days which was fun for kids and adults! We enjoyed the buffet which had great selections. When we left, it took awhile to get our car from valet and even longer for the bell desk to retrieve our items. Otherwise, we were able to tell the difference between quality of service on Fremont compared to Flamingo or Cosmopolitan on the strip. Despite some hiccups we'll return at later date.

I love the golden nugget. It's a great place to stay and have fun. I'm giving the place 3 stars because of there sportsbook. I have been here for the last 3 days and have placed bets over $11,000 and only once have they offered me a free drink coupon. The people in there who work behind the counter are not friendly and act like your bothering them when you want to place a bet. The tickets I've come back with that are winners they act like they don't want to pay me. Like I'm taking their money? What's up with that? It's sad that I now had to go and sit inside the casino hosts office that is located inside the Keno area and complain. I talked to the manager of the sports book who's name is tony and he said he was surprised as to my complaint. But I informed him I was denied to place a $3600 wager on baseball by the black girl at the counter so I said ok and walked across to Binions horseshoe and placed my bet there. Tony was upset to hear that I took my business elsewhere. But oh well. Bottom line is yelpers we need to hold these business accountable after all we are spending our money there. I'm done with this sportsbook.

First and last time staying here.
We were booked in the Carson tower for a work event, so we didn't pick the hotel by choice. 
The hotel seemed ok, pretty outdated with that old Vegas feel. 
Our room was fairly small, as was the bathroom. The in-wall AC unit was pretty loud (no central AC) and the TV was very old and didn't work well. We couldn't even use the TV for our check out.

Our biggest problem was finding 2 cockroaches in the bathroom on the morning we were leaving. Not cool and will definitely not be returning.

I'd rather pay more to stay in a nicer hotel on the strip on my next Vegas trip. (This was not my first trip to Vegas, and I've stayed in plenty of other nicer hotels here).

If I could give it negative stars I would. There is a DJ playing disturbing techno music under my window at 12:30 am. There were a line of people at the desk trying to change rooms because of it. The manager would not come out from the back & it is absolutely miserable here. Never again.

The Golden Nugget is definitely the fanciest casino downtown and when you walk in, you might almost confuse it for a strip casino.

The GN has several restaurants including one with a giant fishtank and one that's a trendy sushi bar.  There is a decent buffet in the back.  The casino is well decorated and has lots of glittery lights and style.  The slot machines seemed newer than at the other casinos downtown.

I guess the pool has a giant fishtank in the middle with a waterslide that goes through it.  I saw pictures and it looked pretty cool.

This hotel has always been a great place to stay. Check in was a breeze only because i checked in at the Rush Tower check in desk...a good thing as the regular check in line is usually a nightmare at times

My room was fantastic, although we did find used shampoo packets in the shower...we notified the front desk and the agent Chris seemed as unsympathetic as can be. When you book a Gold Rush Club room you get extra perks like entry to the Spa and refreshments in elevator lobby- except there was no refreshments in the elevator lobby of the 24th floor the entire time we were there so we didnt get to enjoy that perk.

Pool was crowded but fantastic. 

Its a great place to stay if you are willing to spend the extra money to stay here

Fremont street is always going to be a little different than the strip, but thats why I like it much better than the strip. The Golden Nugget as of right now is the gem of Fremont street. Totally remodeled , brand new tower and all the rooms in the entire hotel rival those of the brand new rooms on the strip for about a 25% discount from the strip. Best place to stay on Fremont.
Michael Godfrey.    Horrible manager.  Rude.   Unable to deal with issues in the poker room.  Childish.  Embarrassing.

Service NOT great. Front desk people grouchy and disgruntled. Rooms are dated in the Carson Tower. Extremely noisy, music across the street rattled the Windows  NEVER stay here Fri or Sat night. Ridiculous resort fee..... NOT a 4 star hotel.  NOT recommended, we were disappointed.. Wi if was poor.
Very cool place! I love Fremont street.  This place is definitely old Vegas with so much character! I would definitely recommend visiting this casino before leaving Vegas! This place is CLASSY!
got trapped in an elevator for 45 minutes. Staff claimed it wasn't their problem since contractors managed that. Please make your hotel feel safe for those visiting
For 40 bucks a night on valentines weekend you can't beat it. The pool is awesome with a waterslide that goes right through a huge shark tank. Pretty cool.

HOTEL: Loved it.  Stayed here just one night before staying 3 nights on the Strip at Ballys (12\/20 to 12\/24).  The hubs and I have been going to Vegas probably about 3 times a year for the past 5 years, but this was my first time staying at the Nugget.  The room was nice, but it's really the bed that gets the 4 stars --- I had no idea how seriously posh it was until we moved to Ballys, and the hubs jumped on the bed, belly-flop style, fully expecting the nice cushion like at Golden Nugget.  Ballys, not so much cushion, more like painful pool-belly-flop.  We got a pretty good deal for our stay, so for sure I'd repeat, especially if it were the summer and we could take advantage of the pool.
