SPA: Awesome. I've hit 4 other spas in Vegas (at Caesars, Venetian, New Orleans, and Treasure Island), and I loved this one.  The hubs surprised me with an early morning treatment, a prenatal scrub, which had me a little worried as to whether I'd really find it relaxing.  The facilities are pretty nice - you walk into a small-ish lobby to check in, straight off one set of elevators, then you enter one door into a larger area with upholstered chairs, coffee, and fancy water dispensers.  Then you enter through another door into a hallway, which branches off into a few curtained off areas -- part of leads to the steam + dry saunas (can't tell you about these since I couldn't use them) and also an upper level hot tub that looked fantastic -- dual staircase leading to this well-lit but soft lighting, with murals that look like curtains.  Sure, it could look more posh if they had actual draperies, but it's practical to have the paint rather than drapes in the steamy area.  The showers + vanity area is pretty large, the lockers a bit smaller but enough room for 2 chaises and 2 upholstered chairs, and a separate changing room (literally, a room outfitted so you can change in privacy).

More importantly, my smoothie body treatment was fan.tastic.  Started at the legs + feet -- my skin is a little sensitive, so the scrub was a little more scrub-tastic than I'd have liked.  But holy cow, Linda was my therapist, and her work on my shoulders and back (by working on me as I lay on my back, and later on my side) was pure magic.  Again, I'm super sensitive, and sometimes shoulder and back massages can get painful, esp because of how much tension I'm always carrying -- but she did a great job, easily the best I've ever received, and I didn't even mention my sensitivity to her.  Although I'm sure if I had, she would have been immediately responsive, she was great.  Not too much chatter, just every now and then, which was great -- I'm not a huge talker, but I get that complete silence is sometimes weird.  I wish Linda could move to Austin.

I have no idea how this hotel has anything above a 3 star review. If you have ever stayed on the Strip, The Golden Nugget pales in comparison on every level! It's definitely a different level of standards here, and I was not expecting them to be so far below what we're used to from hotels like MGM Grand, Planet Hollywood, etc...
 
- Service was terrible: Check-in took 10x longer than usual and staff was not knowledgeable or courteous about anything in the hotel or in the area. I've experienced better service at a holiday inn!

- Hotel Pool: sure the shark slide is cool. Very cool, it's the hotels only saving grace.  So you would thing it would makes sense for them to invest in more than a small area of lounge chairs. By noon, every single pool chair was filled, even the ones in the shade (which accounted for over 1\/2 the deck). This is a very family friendly pool, so having one area for the huge families and other people wanting to lay out and relax was a turn off. 

- Rooms: I am usually not a room snob, and I'm usually really happy with every room I've stayed at in Vegas. The rooms at the G.N were not even close to those standards.  No fridge, no complimentary coffee, no wi-fi.... not good.  It really felt like a depressing holiday inn. We were staying in the Gold Tower. Rush tower seemed nicer. Won't be back to find out.

-Hotel Offerings: Husband and I both felt sick after eating at the buffet. Instantly ill, the both of us. It knocked us out for the rest of the night. We had trouble finding a quick place to grab a bite as their offerings were either steak house or starbucks. 

- Gambling: with low ceilings and no ventilation, I felt like i was in a smoke box the entire time i was on the floor. 

All in all, we had heard Golden Nugget was the nicest hotel in downtown Vegas. Wanting to experience a diff part of Vegas, we thought we would be in for a different yet still quality experience. Boy were we wrong. This hotel is not worth going to Vegas for, and I would never ever return. You are better off staying at the worst hotel on the strip than here.

I love this casino! It's my favorite place in Downtown Las Vegas. The pool has a triple story deck with a water slide that goes through the large shark\/fish tank! The drinks are good, the service is good, and food? The Japanese restaurant is nice or you can go for the buffet. I'm busy winning at my favorite slot machine. They do have a few bars and the best is "The Bar" by the pool and a showroom featuring the comedy stylings of Rich Little. This is a classy joint, especially after they did their remodel. Trivia: The hotel was owned by Steve Wynn but sold in 2004 to  Poster Financial Group. They paid for a remodel that has that old Vegas flare. Good thing b\/c before that it was getting old and stinky.

I have nothing but FOND memories of my stay at this hotel in their Penthouse suite. My baby and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The room came with slippers, a robe and refreshments for the Penthouse floor guests.

They have a huge pool (which was full of people), a sweet shop, boutiques and restaurants.

The buffet was really great with a wide variety of foods available for brunch and dinner.

Parking and Wi-Fi were free, as well.

First let me say that this is not the first time we've stayed at the Golden Nugget. Everything has gone incrementally downhill since the first time we stayed here, but we decided to give it one last go.

This trip was to celebrate my Mother in laws birthday. I called the hotel directly almost two months in advance. We needed to make sure we got a handicap accessible room preferably with a roll in shower, as my Mom can't stand to get get out of her chair, and has to transfer over to do anything outside of her chair. 

We were informed that they only had FOUR handicap accessible rooms with a roll in shower but they all had king beds. (Do they not take into consideration that some disabled people would like to not have to share a bed with their traveling companions?) They said we could have a roll away cot brought in for the third person. As it was my Mom, my husband and myself we needed 2 beds. Making someone sleep on a ROLL AWAY COT for FOUR days of a VACATION was unacceptable to me for the amount of money we were paying for the room. So we compromised and booked a room they said was also handicap accessible, that had two double beds but a regular bathtub that we could use a shower chair in.  I thought that would be ok as long as it was truly accessible, so we booked the room.

Upon arrival, we waited in line for about 20 minutes while we waited for one of only 2 clerks working the check in. There were about 18 people behind us and about 5 people in front of us when we got there. After getting to the check in desk, we were informed that there were NO handicap rooms with double beds available at all (even though we booked this room two months prior.) The desk clerk finally got her supervisor and he found a room that was handicap accessible with two double beds. So up to our room we went.

Although our room did have two double beds thats about all I can say about it. First, the beds were too high. I mean they were even high for able bodied people. When you can't use your legs, the only ways to get into bed are to transfer evenly from your chair to the bed. This can only be accomplished if the bed is even or just slightly (1 or 2 inches) above or below the seat on the chair. They other was is kind of degrading. You either have to have someone pick you up and put you in the bed (which wouldn't have happened in this instance), or have someone push you by your behind while your are yanking on the sheets hoping that the housekeeper tucked them in nice and tight, while you pull yourself over the bed. We ended up taking the bed and box spring off the frame and putting the bed and box spring on the floor.

The toilet was low....I mean knees-up-around-my-ears-when-I-sat-down-on-it low. So we called to ask if they had a riser for the loo. What they brought didn't really work. It had plastic bolts on the side so that it would tighten down. Well it didn't. The first time she tried to transfer over, the riser slid nearly off the toliet. So for the whole trip, any time she had to go ( that we were in our room) , I had to hold onto the damn handles attached to the seat. Not to mention the not-helpful-at-all-to-someone-who-can't-use-their-legs grab bar that is bolted to the floor. There was also no room for her to turn around in her wheelchair for the bathroom. She doesn't even have a big chair. Its a little racing chair.

How they thought this room is handicap accessible shows a shocking lack of knowledge in the ADA laws and requirements not to mention a serious lack of training for the front line staff. With more and more customers requiring special needs accommodations it would benefit the Golden Nugget greatly to do a little research and fix the problems with the rooms so that their less spry customers can enjoy their stay as much as their able bodied friends.  

The only reason this review got two stars instead on only on is the service in the poker room. They were very friendly and accommodating when my Mom wanted to play in a no limit poker tourney. 

Unfortunately, the nice guys in the poker room were not enough. We will no longer be staying at the Golden Nugget and will NOT recommend them to anyone.

If you want to stay at a classy downtown casino with the old school Vegas vibe then this is your spot.  We had a great time here.  From the beautiful pool to the buffet, the steakhouse and then the gambling.  Everything was on pin t and we had a great time.  Our room was amazing too.  I was afraid of how busy and loud downtown was that our room wouldn't be sleep-able but we didn't have a single problem.  We stayed at another casino the night before and didn't have near the experience as we've had here.  Great room, pool and customer service along with the dealers here too.  We lost some money but sometimes it doesn't matter as long as you have fun gambling.  They offer a party pit, regular put and the high limit room.  We tried it all and had a blast.  We will be back in the near future.

Checked in today on my bday! So far I like what I see, we drove in & guided instantly by a valet staff. Parked our vehicle left the key with the valet. Loving the customer service. Checkin went well, the front desk clerk was able to accommodate my requests for two beds & strip view! Thanking you will update after I check out! X

Stayed at the GN last year while in Vegas for a friends wedding. Nice room at ~$99 a night. 

Although, I was repulsed by the shark tank at the swimming pool. Sharks belong in the ocean and it's pathetic to bottle them up in such a tiny space. Shame on you!

i get to travel quite a bit thanks to my job... i've gambled quite a bit throughout california, reno, vegas, atlantic city and even some odd places like kansas city, missouri... the golden nugget has BY FAR been my worst experience at a casino yet. i decided to take a week long vacation to myself and spend it in vegas, and after a lot of googling around i wound up choosing to take a chance with the golden nugget and made my reservations.

so off to vegas i go for 7 nights and about $3,000 cash to try and have fun with. so i land in vegas, grab my rental and head to the hotel. turns out there is NO parking left at the hotel, or anywhere nearby for that matter. it wasn't a holiday, just a friday. anyhow, i'm forced to pay $12 a day to park about a block and a half from the hotel (which golden nugget would only cover if i had a receipt). anyhow, after walking through half of fremont street, i finally get to check in. i get my room key and head towards the elevators... should i mention that the check-in and elevators is probably a good 3 minute walk from each other? once out of the elevator i'm making the trek towards my room, another longgggg walk from the elevator. so i get in my room, begin to unpack my things and about 10 minutes later my phone rings. time for a new paragraph.... -=D

it's the front desk! i'm being informed that the room i'm in is actually reserved for another guest. apparently, the couple in the room next to mine wanted to reserve the room i was in for their friends to stay in. and the hotel obliged, even though i had begun to unpack. the front desk apologized and said they would take care of it. so i'm greeted at my door by the lady from the front desk with two $10 comps to their buffet (wow :sarcasm:) and another room key. another 10 minutes of walking later i finally get to my room. thankfully, they let me stay in there this time. i didn't get an upgraded room or anything, same deal.

i told them i wasn't satisfied with the comps and they would have to do more than those buffet discounts to make me happy. i basically got the run around the entire week about who i should be voicing my concerns to.... finally when i did talk to the manager of guest relations, she assured me that those stupid buffet discounts was all they could possibly do.

on to the rest of my experience. like i said i took $3,000 with me to have some fun. so i make another mistake by joining up for their club and during the week blowing the entire thing in their casino.  a big mistake. because after spending an entire week there and blowing $3K, i would up with $30 cash back and no other kinds of comps AT ALL.... i don't know how in the world that is possilble. maybe the card readers at some machines were broke? maybe the points system is really that bad? i didn't even bother asking at that point. it didn't matter. this casino really sucks.

i've never been to ANY PLACE in this world so unforgiving and careless of it's customers. i have been all over the US and parts of canada and yeah, this was absolutely my worst experience ever. i even sort of campaigned for myself for a while after through e-mails with customer service reps at the golden nugget telling them about all of this and not a single person there cared.

bottom line. this place sucks. vegas is definitely one of the least forgiving places to go, but this spot takes the cake. i would in no way ever recommend that anyone give this place a single cent.

why did no one tell me the noodle house was open at 11pm??? WHY? 

we ended up eating at the nasty cafe where 5 pieces (maybe it was 4, don't matter cuz it sucked) of cocktail shrimp was $10. it tasted very much like plastic. the Caesar salad was crap too. lettuce was NOT fresh.

other than that, it's a wonderful hotel at a great price. swimming pool with sharks is cool and location by fremont strip is nice too. feels like day time at night cuz of the bright lights!

Best hotel rooms downtown (by quite a bit)
Best restaurants downtown
Best pool downtown (by a million miles)
Worst gambling downtown

If you want strip fancy check into the Rush tower which are usually $100 or less a night.  The old south tower can be less than $50 a night.

Good buffet, nice Italian restaurant, two great steakhouses.  I've stayed here at least 10 times, but gamble other places.

Golden Nugget used to be the best Downtown casino, but the last 2 times I stayed there the service got progressively worse. It is very apparent that most of the employees are unhappy with their jobs and with the way management is doing things (or not getting things done correctly). I've asked multiple employees why this is and the majority said that those working in management have changed and\/or been replaced and the way things are run is now more inefficient, unfair, counterproductive, and management doesn't care about the front line employees like they generally used to (until around 2014-2015).

I just got an offer via email that said I had both entry into a $799 slot tournament and 3 nights free stay. The way it reads is extremely deceptive and to be sure it wasn't just me, I let 5 friends of various ages read the email, as well as 3 of their friends. I didn't tell them anything about it, I just asked them to tell me what the offer included, and ALL 8 of them thought it included free entry into a slot tournament and 3 nights free stay. When I called to book this promo I was told I had to PAY $799 entry fee for the tournament to get the "free" room rate! Keep in mind that rooms at Golden Nugget are around $60-$100 per night depending on the season so I'd have to be an idiot to pay $799 for 3 nights in a regular room there lol! If it was a huge suite it might be worth it if they looked like the junior suites at Caesars Palace. The lady in Golden Nugget Promo department 800# basically inferred that I was stupid and couldn't read (which is why I polled a bunch of people to prove my point and confirm my claim that the email offer was EXTREMELY DECEPTIVE the way it was written) and she sounded very annoyed the whole time as if she couldn't wait for her crappy job and day to end so she could just go home. I was never angry, rude, mean, or anything other than perfectly civil the whole time so for her to act like that and treat me like that was very rude and uncalled for. Because of the deceptiveness of the email as well as her poor attitude, I then requested to be taken off the email list for future offers and she said she couldn't do that (still in the "annoyed" tone of course). I will always give a business a 2nd chance because there are always a few bad employees that can ruin your day, but when it's apparent the vast majority of them are bad that's where I draw the line.

This has been my favorite casino to stay at in Downtown Vegas for many years even though I get more and better room offers and promos from Caesars and Venetian, but I'm going to start staying on the strip from now on because the slightly lower cost of food and easier parking Downtown is just not worth the poor service, attitudes of unhappy employees, and deceptive marketing. Instead of paying $9 for a good Golden Nugget cheeseburger, I'll be spending $12 to get a good Venetian burger but that $3 difference to TOTALLY worth the excellent friendly and helpful service that I've always gotten at Venetian, and I'd actually be happy to pay twice that much just to avoid the bad attitudes and poor service of any casino such as the Golden Nugget from now on. Obviously this is MY opinion based on things I've experienced and I hope your experience is better with Golden Nugget, but when all the 1529 Yelp reviews of Golden Nugget only average 3 out of 5 stars you can safely assume that the experiences I've stated above are a pretty accurate depiction of how your experience will be too.

Bits of greatness in this dank hole: 
The Tank...
Yup, that's it, and the best part about the experience is being able to say, "I took a water slide through a shark tank." and having the photos to prove it since from inside the slide you can see little other than shades of green and gray in the blue as you speed through the clear portion of the slide. 

The rest: 
1.) No bathrobes in our room
2.) Internet costs $12.99 per device for 24 hours of unlimited use, 4 Keurig cups of coffee costs $10
3.) Told at check in we would get a AAA discount, and upon checkout were told that was completely incorrect
4.) We were supposed to get free admission to Gold Diggers because we were staying at the Golden Nugget as part of an event instead we had to use these coupons given out (they're for no cover or buy one drink get one free) so we didn't get the buy one get one deal and two well rum and cokes cost $20. There are way nicer places on Fremont Street that charge less.
5.) Maybe we're neurotic, but we always leave our "Privacy Please" sign on the door whether or not we're in the room or not. So on night 3 of our 3 night stay when we returned to our room and saw the sign missing we were a bit perturbed. When we entered and found the sign hanging on the inside of the door in addition to the lights being on, towels on our bed, and a mini-fridge on a kart we were more than a little furious. We called down to the front desk and received a, "That shouldn't have happened" - duh. Then we waited on hold for 20 minutes only to be hung up on. When we called back we received more of an explanation, "I called housekeeping, I'm waiting to hear back." And what does this do for us? Beyond annoyed we wheeled the fridge into the hall and quickly switched into warmer clothing to go out for the night. When we left 10 minutes later the fridge was gone. So they can take a fridge in ten minutes, but can't offer an apology ever. At check out we asked what happened and what the hotel intended to do about it, and we received the response, "An internal investigation." NO APOLOGY was ever given, and certainly no discount or other means of maintaining a good relationship with the customer. Overall every single staff person we encountered was rude, or misleading: some were both. we will NEVER stay here again. This was our first and last time. 

With tons of hotels to choose from why stay at one that blatantly disrespects your privacy, and has TERRIBLE customer service?

freaking coolest spot in vegas. f the strip. this place was the vegas from oldtimes ...when it was a classy place to go. well, maybe not. haha...but the kind of vegas that makes you want to dress up and go out and live life lavishly. definitely plan on staying here in the summer an taking advantage of the badass pool i covetously looked at while there.  big on glitz and shinyness

Website is annoying. When I was booking a room they showed all the unavailable ones too so I had to scroll through those to see available ones. Why? 

That being said, the rooms aren't too shabby ;p

First of all, our room at the Golden Nugget was roomy, clean and nicely decorated, but best of all it was cheap.  Unfortunately, you get zero amenities.  No refrigerator, no complimentary coffee (K-cup machine is there, but the cups are $10).  A bottle of Fiji Water in the room was $7.  There was no working ice machine on the floor.  Our TV was never able to connect to the pay per view service.  Internet was expensive.  There was a lot of nickel and dime-ing going on.  

In general, the staff was rude and unhelpful.  My mother is diabetic and needs to refrigerate her medicine.  She called the front desk to ask about getting a refrigerator.  They transferred her 3 times.  One person told her that the fridge would be $20.  But the manager said that it would be no charge because it was for her medicine.  Good thing we checked our bill on the way out, because there was an $80 charge for the fridge - $20 PER DAY (we weren't even there for four days - we checked in at 7 PM for a three night stay).   The girl at the desk was nasty about removing the charge, which she did eventually do. 

The one saving grace this hotel has (aside from the price) is the pool.  The shark tank mesmerized my son and he swam and played for hours while I read and sat in the sun.  The waitresses in the pool area were the most friendly people on staff and the Bloody Mary I had poolside was great.  So in spite of lousy service, the pool and the price of a room still make this an attractive place to stay.  Just don't go expecting much and double check your bill on the way out!

Stayed here for 3 nights last summer for $100. What a great deal for a wonderful property! The rooms are nice (ours had a small vanity with a light up mirror) and the staff is pleasant, but what I really love is the pool area. My bf and I like to hang out Downtown, and when it's warm out we go get some food and sit in the pool chairs to eat and watch the fish swim, or to practice our Blackjack. Those pool chairs are more comfortable than the beds at Binion's (look up my review)! Also, they offer coupon books depending on your reservation, which have good deals. I like the Carson Street Cafe, which is featured in the coupon book.

My bf's parents recently stayed in the new Rush Tower so we got to see what the new rooms look like. All I can say is, wow. Modern, classy, and warm, all in one. The room and bathroom are luxurious while still being comfortable. It has a very warm feeling inside, offsetting the feeling of staying in a hotel in Vegas. What I REALLY loved about the new rooms are that instead of having a random chair or 2 to lounge in, there was a corner leather couch located directly next to the window. You can sit in comfort and enjoy the great view. They had a view of the Strip, facing south, that looks really cool at night. The only negative I'd say are the gambling odds. GN is the only place Downtown with Strip odds, so gamble elsewhere.

I love the Golden Nugget casino floor and the slot machine selection.  I always try and stay at the hotel but there always booked so I just enjoy playing in the casino on the tables or on my favorite slot machine the pinball slots...awesome.  The casino floor to me is always crowded but I like the crowds, I mean to me the more people playing and having fun makes the vibes in the hotel so much more exciting.  I always play the same machines and the same table games but to see others winning and having a great time makes all the difference.  I love the bar staff there outgoing and friendly and the waitresses are sweethearts always making sure you are having fun...great service.  Overall the casino has winning vibes and the environment is safe, fun, clean and I so want to go back soon to play the pinball.

I have to say what a wonderful place. It was very clean and just so beautiful in side as you walked up. We were greeted kindly by every employee I was amazed . We have stayed at a lot of hotels on the strip and I was not looking forward on staying down town. But I will say my husband was right in this matter only!!!!! LOl I---I LOVED the Golden Nugget the slots were awesome. I did not feel like I was taken so fast like so many casinos. The table game employees knew when to be nice and when to stay to them self. That is very important to us when you play as much as we do. I loved the surroundings I felt very safe more so then the strip when we go 3 times a year and stay only 5 s . I have to say Golden Nugget had the 5 employees   5 service 5 check in 5 slots what more could I ask for . The rooms were very nice and clean . I am playing most of the time so I loved that the room was dark. I sleep when most are up that we loved also . But if you wanted it bright you can open the curtains  wow you have light. Just so wonderful and you should book it on bookit.com

This review is for their buffet and casino.  We decided to escape the strip and try downtown ended up at the Nugget as it seemed to be the shining ship in the middle of an armpit area.  

The buffet was reasonable for a large hotel mid-week: $17.99, and while it wasn't over the top, the food was top notch and delicious.  Sushi was just out of the water fresh and the roast beef tasty and perfect.    

The casino had all the familiar offerings, minus one or two state of the art computerized money-takers.  Table minimums were very affordable ($10 min blackjack, $5 min roulette), and they didn't take all our money in the first 5 minutes.  Now I don't ever expect to get rich gambling, but there are some casinos that you basically just hand them your money and within minutes are either walking away or digging in your wallet again.  Myself, I just like to be entertained for a while, some winning combined with some losing, and at best break even when I'm ready to go back to my room or a bar.  The tables at the Nugget did just that - some YEAH!s and some OH NO!s, and in the end not losing much at all.

My stay was pleasant. There were many things to do, I mean it's Vegas right. But from the moment I walked into my room I just knew it was going to be bad. I found blood stains in the bathroom and on the carpet (it seemed to have been cleaned out with hydrogen peroxide) and here was a dirty hand towel hanging inside my bath. The bath curtain was dirty and reeked. It was just really nasty. I didn't even dare to put on their complimentary bath robe. Only reason I didn't give it a one star is because the fish tank by the pool is really cool.

This is a great place to stay if you're trying to avoid the "strip" experience in las vegas.  Located in the scenic downtown area, this is one hotel that should be at least tolerable to those with tastes that more accustomed to five star then um... the hotels in downtown las vegas.  The Nugget (pronounced "New- shay") was recently renovated, and is within walking distance to the beauty bar las vegas, a short cab ride from the art bar and right on top of the "fremont street experience" (the fremont street experience involves looking at a light show on the covering of the street... it's hard to explain.)

Anyway- I recommend this place for those looking for the "alternative" vegas.

The Nugget has a lot of problems. A lot of the staff seem jaded and rude(which is not unusual in Vegas). There is a 50\/50 split on dealers. Some of the pit are very charismatic and friendly, but some hate their jobs and the customers. 

Pros=

Poker Room-The dealers at the poker room are the finest dealers in the casino. Very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. 

The Valet- It's free. They treat you like you are at the Ritz. They call you sir, they work hard, and speak in that sophisticated tone that you would expect from a full service hotel.  They are also very knowledgeable of the whole valley area. If you need directions to Red Rock Canyon or the Boulder Strip, they will know the shortest route. I always leave them a giant tip. 

Cons= Casino Host. Casino Marketing. Floor Supervisors. Management in General. These cheapo managers don't comp players unless they are staying at the hotel. That means if you are just a local who wants to come here and play, you get Nothing! You can bet $25 a hand for 16 hours and you get NOTHING! You can bet $100 a hand for 16 hours and you still get NOTHING! You get nothing unless you are a guest in the hotel! 

Remember at the end of the movie "Casino", Sam Rothstein talks about how the corporations hired a bunch of idiots who ruined Las Vegas? Well, the casino marketing department here is obviously who he was talking about.

1 STAR FOR CUSTOMER SERVICE..ONLY BECAUSE I CANT GIVE ZERO. 

Booked the spa suite for 1 night ($864) to celebrate me and my boyfriends birthdays. Was excited about the complimentary VIP check in. When I arrived to check in, I walked in to a VIP lounge thinking I would be greeted with friendly faces and VIP service. First woman who helped me didn't even have a smile on her face. Told me check in is 3 but they would call if the room was ready early. No problem. It was about 11 AM. We waited til about 2:45 and I walked back to the lounge to see if the room was close to being ready. I was helped by a different woman who told me no, with no smile on her face. Said that it could be anywhere between 3:00 and 6:00. I told her that I wasn't aware of that. She didn't mind me walking out feeling confused and feeling like I was a burden. She didn't want to be bothered. I checked my email to see if there was any mention of 3-6 PM check in. It clearly said 3:00. So I walked back in at 3:00 and spoke to another woman and showed her my email. Meanwhile, the other woman who I had spoken to 15 mins before was behind her and didn't even acknowledge me or try to fix the situation. This last woman was just as rude as the other 2. Unbelievable. She just looked at me and said it is 3-6. I told her that nowhere in my email does it say that, so how do we fix this?  She rudely told me they have a room ready for me. I've never seen so many unhappy employees in 1 place. Maybe its time to find another job. The suite was really nice, but wouldnt stay here again. 


We moved to The Downtown Grand for the next 2 nights. 1 night free! Customer service is amazing here!!! Like night and day! All I have is a standard room and from the beginning was greeted and treated like a VIP guest.

We got there at 11, check in was easy. We get to our room, there is no in room safe, even though everything says there should be one. I called downstairs, they sounded shocked and almost disbelieving. They said they would send someone up to show me where the safe was. 20 minutes later nobody shows up. So I called and they said there was a mixup and nobody was going to come up after all, but they could give us a different room. Sweet. Buuuuuut we have to walk all the way back down there to get the keys. Ok gotcha. Finally we get our new room, it's perfect, the beds are the most comfortable beds in the world. The casino is awesome, the food at The Grille and the Buffet was great. My only complaint is the pool. The sign says they open for swimming at 9, but you can start viewing the shark tank at 7:30. The problem is that people go in at 7:30 and "reserve seats" with towels then leave. So if you show up at 9 when the pool opens, all the seats are already taken.  That doesn't seem fair to me. If you aren't using the pool you shouldn't be allowed to save seats. The shark tank was cool though and the water slide was super fun. :-)

Completely pissed at the Nugget , $20 resort fee ( extort fee) , wi fi didn't  work , card reader was broke for the door and had to renew my key daily , ice matchine was broke on our floor and had to go to another floor for ice.  
Bottle water was to be replaced daily and wasn't . Talked to the front desk who in turn spoke to the manger who said there was nothing they could do about the billing differences!  I have always stayed at the Golden Nugget , but no more . Waaayyy too many hotels in Vegas to pick from to receive this crappy of service !!!

The Only place I like in Fremont and the only place I takes friends when in town too not be too creeped out by the bums and dancing old people. I have not stayed in any rooms there yet and I really want to rent a Cabana there next summer.

Dad, Brother and I Annual Vegas Trip - 12-15 May 2013 - People of the world "LISTEN" there isn't too many places left on earth like this anymore...where else can you carry open containers of beer or get tasty frozen drinks in souvenir cups while walking from one casino to another, while listening to fantastic "cover bands" and getting your picture taken with celebrity impersonators?  Where else can you play $5 Blackjack or $5 Craps? Where else can you get a ice cold beer and a juicy burger for $5?  I said all of this and I haven't even mentioned one of the best casino's in Nevada...the gem of Freemont St "The Nug".  If you also want to sleep where the real action is then spend a few nights here, you won't regret it and your wallet will thank you as well.  If you want to continue paying $300 a night on "The Strip" go right ahead, but for 1\/5 of that price you can get a clean room, comfortable bed, great pool, great table games, and one of the most comfortable Sports Books in town, in other words save that extra money your blowing on a bed you barely sleep in and use that hard earned money toward more gambling, food, and entertainment...come to The Nug and while you're at it enjoy Freemont St...if you don't I will.  Enjoy!  

PS this place isn't for kids...this is Adult World...I witnessed far to many parents pushing around babies and walking with little kids at 2am...please leave the kids with Grandma or save your money for Disney...your time for Vegas will come soon enough...2 cents.

Stayed here for a night as a little birthday staycation. Definitely one of the nicest hotels downtown as far as looking more modern. I stayed in the Rush tower which was very nice, I wasn't expecting it to be so clean and chic. 
The bathroom was spacious, big bath tub and double shower heads were a nice touch. Very comfy beds and a big window with a view. 
I got drinks at that bar with the big fish tank, which was enjoyable to just sit by and sip cocktails with my fiancé. I was given free champagne in the watch store to sip while browsing. 
I went to the pool but it was really packed so I just ended up grabbing a beer and hanging out in the shade with my friends. It wasn't loud considering how many people were there. 
It's right on Fremont so if you want to get the classic tourist experience you can. All the bars are close by, I definitely prefer downtown to the strip.

Stayed there last night, have to say, ive been to many places, and the pool is awesome. The beds were comfortable, the rooms just redone, however a little pricy at 150$ after taxes for a room with two small beds. First off, the pool closes at 10pm, and thats just wrong for a city that never sleeps. The women there were mediocre. The food was also mediocre at a high price. The drinks? Well, let me tell you my story. So i left my room about 11pm, with 40$, went down to the bar near the exit by fremont street, at the lowest level of the casino. This is where i had the worst service in my life. I sat down, and waited 15 minutes waving and yelling trying to flag down one of the bartenders, who kept making eye contact, but passing by, finally, he asked what I wanted, I told him makers mark on the rocks and asked him how much, to which he replied he could not comp the drink, and then walked away without taking my order for another 15 minutes. with a super annoying attitude like he was racist against me or my father inlaw who is hispanic. I didnt ask for it to be comped, i was going to pay straight up with a 20$ bill and leave him a tip, however i decided to hell with him, and put the money in the machine so I could "Get comped". So i asked the gentlemen sitting next to me if service is always this bad, and he was from london, and said he had just arrived, i complained that the bartender with the mustache was being rude, so he then flagged down the man and told him to get me a drink, i wa astonished that he payed attention, but the british man was gray haired and in his 60s, he me got service immediately. Then the bar tender pointed to the plaq on the machine which read, to get comped drinks you must put a $20 in, and be playing $1.00 per round, which i was doing, and i told the bartender i put 20 in and are currently playing a dollar hand, he then rolled his eyes and made my drink, which i downed immediately because he pissed me off, huge mistake, worst customer service, he didnt come take an order for another 20 minutes, i was getting really angry, he pushed a large black trash can right infront of me, and was throwing beer bottles from across the room breaking glas right infrontofme and my father inlaw. Finally he came by and gave me another drink, i still had 5$ in the machine after i had finished the drink, i kept flagging him down but he kept walking by, so if he wouldntserve me i refused to play until he took my order, when he walked up and said and pointed at the plaq again, and told me i have to put 20 in and be betting a dollar, repeating what he said eairler, and he wentback to breaking glass infront of our face from acrosstheroom. I was very irritated so i kept playing and flagging him down, i had $1.25 left, and i got him to talkto me. Finally after beingthere for an hour he said he wouldnt serve me because i only had $1.00 currently in play and .25 cents left. The plaq didnt say that, thats not the rules, so i finished my bet and left, i almost waited aroundfor him to get off work. It was a complete waste of time and money. Exceptthe pool. Which was still a waste of time causeitcloses. At 10pm. I hope management reads this and does something because no one should be throwing bottleslike that. He was about 55-65 years old, white balding head, white moustache, old white man about 5feet 7 inches tall. The bar at the rear entrance near the tables. For thisyou. Get 1 star

Awesome place to stay when you're on a budget :)

It's the Wynn of Downtown Vegas. The room and pool at this hotel are fabulous. 

I'm a big people watcher. I love going out to Fremont to observe the public (good looking people, ugly people, crackheads, and etc).

First time here... I am also a Landrys Select member...

I wish they would have told me the following upon check in...

Upgraded room consists of loud music from the pool... I'm here with my kids now and none of us can sleep because of the loud music and bass from the pool...

Didn't realize an upgrade consisted of not being able to sleep, annoying bass and music, and nothing to block out their establishments noise!!! Even the air conditioner isn't blocking out the club music.

Not a happy customer right now...

And again, another Landrys fail... I can't wait to check out in the morning asap... Its 1:30am and my room is still filled with music and bass... So much noise. I pretty much paid to have club music played in my room all night. What a waste off money

The only good thing here is the pool, and even that was a huge hassle. 

:(

Booked trough hotels.com for my partner's birthday. I think I paid somewhere close to $260 for 2 nights, Thursday-Saturday. Parking is complementary with stay. The room was clean, big enough to spread out. We got a king sized bed overlooking the pool (not requested, just happened to be treated to a great view). the room had a sectional couch and modern look. Some of our favorite features: one of their cafes is surrounding an aquarium-do it for the gram, heated pool year round, lazy river, and convenient location! One thing that was disheartening was the price we paid for a haircut at the in-hotel salon. I know, I know, why on earth would we even go to the salon in the hotel, right? Well, we expected to pay more than what we're used to but we were quoted $70 for a wash, cut and blow dry and ended up getting charged $155 at the register. They said it was because of the length of my partner's hair but they literally cut off about 3-4 inches MAX. We wouldn't have opted for it if they had been honest with us over the phone when we called to inquire about prices. That was the only disappointing part of the stay and the only thing I would recommend you avoid if visiting.

This hotel was much better than I expected. We got a really low rate so I was very sketical but it all turned out good. The room was very nice and the hotel, restaurants and casino were all better than I expected.

It's right on Fremont Street so it's in a very good location.

Don't hesitate to stay here.

The room was nice but NO FREE WiFi and you are charged for everything under the sun. 
Next time for sure staying on the strip, Free WiFi and your given gifts for staying, not charged for everything.

The Golden Nugget has the rudest servers I've ever encountered in Las Vegas. We were there last week and the servers that we interacted with (all two of them) rudely demanded to know if we were playing games and stated that they would not serve us if we weren't. Number 1 - it took forever to even see a server to place an order(we only ordered 2 sodas, not even booze) and Number 2 - when we are standing at the rail of the craps table, it should be pretty obvious we are playing. If she had come around more often, she would have seen us playing for the past half hour. She rudely told us that "cameras are watching" so they would know if we weren't playing. What the heck? This was my sister's first visit to Vegas and she was highly offended (we all were). We will NOT be back.

This was a last minute weekday summer trip for me and my husband. After doing some quick comparison shopping for rates, we decided to take a risk and stay downtown rather than in one of the main hotels on the strip.
I had heard that GN was renovated, and it did not disappoint in the least. From the huge aquarium bar to the waterfall pouring into the pool, all the sights were luxurious. We stayed in the Rush tower, and the room decor was ultra contemporary (big plus for me). Hubby enjoyed the variety of gambling methods, and it was cool to just step outside the hotel and be in the middle of the Fremont street experience. FYI they have awesome free concerts in the summer there. 
Overall, great ambiance, friendly staff, superb value. Only minor downside was having to walk across the street to hotel from parking garage..am used to those sky bridge thingies that connect the 2. Otherwise, A+ would stay again

Not the best experience. Had nothing but problems unfortunately.  First room they put us in had no sunlight from the very small window that opened to a wall, and the room smelled like cigarettes. The new room was much better but of course the remote for the tv didn't work. Had to call 3 times to get it fixed and still didn't work when we left.  Maid service didn't come in the first day and I finally had to call at 3 pm the second day for service.  Also our stay was supposed to include 2 bottles of water and a newspaper. Didn't get any of those.  In room coffee is $10 for 4 cups.  On a lighter note the pool at this hotel was wonderful.  Disappointed on the over all stay...and I have pretty low standards.  Lol. Sad but true...

Shark tank was great, even though it was too cold to go out and actually use the pool during our visit. Staff was friendly and attentive. I was worried that housekeeping was going to hate us, we had been on a cruise for a week then driven up to Vegas and had 6 bags and I was trying to find things in each of them. I did try to pick up after myself, but at the same time was exhausted and just wanted to go have fun. They picked up and kept the place cleaned. We stayed in the Carson Tower and had asked for two queen beds or one king. I like the extra bed to put things on but the hotel was nearly full when we booked so they booked us a two queen room. We checked in she let us know they only had a two bed room and could change us the next day if we wanted (6 bags.....) Got upstairs and was hugely disappointed to find it was two DOUBLE beds not queen, we are not big people we are both under 6ft and pretty average sized but come on 2 people in a double bed? Went to ask about the King room the next to get told they are sold out .. REALLY???? so I booked my room through you not a booking agent 4 weeks ago and I am stuck with 2 double beds? 

The tub was a little weird it kind of curves at the middle of the tub (like a u shape) so you get off balance if you step to the side ( I was sober and our friends said the same of their room) 

The toilet- now remember we have been on a cruise for a week so used to VERY loud toilets, dear lord the thing in the hotel scared me half to death- we were there fro drag racing I am used to loud that thing is powerful enough to suck down a small child!
and the lighting in the room is well DARK. 
Over I love the place, just not the bathroom and the lighting, and will not be leaving the front desk next time until they put us in a QUEEN or KING sized bed. 

and I don't base my review on Starbucks-but seriously the slowest Starbucks staff I have come across! and I had to repeat my order 4 times, when I did I made sure I said LATTE at the end each time and each time I got an eye roll and a "ok what kind of drink is it" ummm lets see double tall vanilla LATTE oh I know a milkshake?

Warning about casino slots at Golden Nugget...I stayed on Fremont a few weeks ago and visited the GN.  I picked a slot machine and played the SAME machine for three hours.  Not once did it go into a bonus.  Granted I did not spend a ton of money on it, but there is something definitely wrong with a machine when it doesn't go into a bonus after three hours.  I contacted a slot attendant to call a floor manager.  No one ever came to speak with me; however, a manager lurked behind me watching me play (I let the attendant know that the machine had not went into a bonus in three hours).  After I spent the money I put in, I called for another manager.  The lurking one approached only after the second visited with me, and confirmed that the machine had not gone into a bonus the whole time he was watching me.  They could not provide me a reason to why it was happening nor did they seem to care.

I have been gaming for over 10 years.  I understand that gaming is gambling.  However, GN is using a machine that is obviously not functioning correctly.  They did not offer any suggestions, so I asked for the gaming commission's number to report the issue.  I requested the machine be shut down until the commission could review.  They did, but then later turned the machine back on.  The commission took my complaint and told me that they would be assigning the case.

Sorry, will not be visiting GN in the foreseeable future.  I wish that the manager could have offered some explanation.  I wasn't asking for a handout and was polite.  Nothing. 

I will be staying close to home and play at the local tribal casinos.  Payouts and bonuses are much better than what I experienced at GN.

Worst place ever, I work as a Babysitter and work at all the hotels and casinos in Las Vegas. And I've never had to pay $20 for parking, not even in the casinos in the strip (las vegas blvd). I had to pay $20 for 4 hrs and 30 min that I was there. It's crazy I feel so upset. I didn't use valley parking it was self parking, That was the worst.

A lot of people seem to either like or hate the old Vegas. Me personally, I enjoyed it. It's cheaper for everything from rooms, to food, to drink. Not to mention this hotel is at the very heart of Fremont Street, which is why most people visit the old Vegas.

Stayed in an upgraded room Gold Tower. First perk I noticed was the 24\/7 candy\/nut and water bar in elevator lobby on our way to our room. In the room itself there were  CDs, a DVD player, and an HD TV.

The room itself was very ambient, almost posh. To give an example, the mirror in the bathroom has a TV in it. I don't see that kind of flair very often.

The downside to this room was the tub\/shower itself. It was difficult to take one due to the spacing issues and just seem to be broken down and\/or not working the way that is expected of such.

Other than the tub\/shower issue, it was a pretty nice stay for $140\/night during our visit. Will definitely come here again. And if you end up giving this place a try, dish out the extra money for Gold Tower rooms, they're worth it for the price.

I wasn't very excited to stay in this hotel because of the bad reviews but I was pleasantly surprised how nice it was! The lobby is Really nice and the line was long to check in but we drank a beer and we were up front in no time.The manager offered us water while we waited in line which was very nice. Then when we checked in we got upgraded rooms which was even better! 

The pool was super nice, the shark tank was awesome. The slide through the tank goes by so fast you don't see anything but I was laughing the entire time! 

If we go back to Vegas and decide to stay on Fremont street this is the place we will stay!

The whole strip vs. fremont street argument isn't really one worth having after you think about it for a while: yes, the Strip has the forum & the wynn & thomas keller & mario batali & all the expensive clubs, but have you BEEN to Bill's Gambling Saloon? Imperial Palace? Excalibur?  Have you had a yard long margarita while browsing Nanette Lepore's boutique? Let's not forget where we are, people. 

That being said.. the Nugget is probably the only place I would ever stay downtown. And I'm not just saying that because my friend allows me to crash here with her for free (okay, maybe).  Rooms are totally clean and decent (not as dingy looking as excalibur), they have wi-fi in the rooms,  wonderful frozen drinks by the pool (try the pina colada!), plenty of nickel slots and you can get decent fried rice and steamed vegetables delivered to your room.  I also enjoy the Belgian Waffle Utopia,  mostly because it's fun to say.   

(Yes, I have been to Vegas all of two times and have spent considerable time in 4 different hotels. What of it!?)

I'm not sure who has stayed here before, but this is old school vegas.  The bell and valet staff were very nice however, front desk staff could care less if your are staying there or not.

The rooms are just a step above a motel 6 and its a toss up between the bed and the floor.  

Now I'm not a snob, I like old folks as much as anyone, hell I'm 37 but there seems to be an abundance of them at the GN.  If you into hanging out with some young hip faces... you need to go down the block.  

Finally, if your using a credit card from your bank, be prepared to prove its not a debit card... and if it is... then look out you can get anything here.  My CC is from my bank and looks just like a check card.  Even says Credit Card on it... but I had to whip out the AMEX just to get my room paid for and put things on the room bill.  I've stayed at 5 star joints and never had so much trouble. 

Oh and FYI the wireless aint very good either...  get the cheetanet!

First the positives. A+ customer service. Friendly staff and they let you early check-in, no charge, if there is availability. The negatives, the Facility and room itself is a solid D to D-.  No easily accessible power outlets in our room. There was a tight space to reach the outlet beneath the mattress headboard and an outlet in the corner of the room next to the AC behind the lamp and chair. We had to unplug the lamp in order to keep a phone charger near the bed. The plumbing is really bad. 4 mins in the standing shower and the water is backed up ankle high. Also it appears that they've had a broken elevator (out of only 2) with no secondary entry into the garage parking structure for a while. So the wait to get on and off the only option to get to our rental car could get lengthy. The stairwell remains locked as well, albeit to prevent theft and wonderers thru the parking lot, but still with only one elevator access that's kind of ridiculous. This all leads to a 3 stars, although I think I may be a little generous with that.

This is far and away the finest hotel on Fremont. It has old school charm and a "classic Vegas" feel (less like the new Disneyland hotels). If you stay downtown this is THE place to be. It's also close to dozens of other fun destinations.

Amazing pool with a waterfall, shark tank, and hundreds of lounge chairs, really nice rooms, great bars, a nightclub, excellent food, clean casino, and a great value.

Post renovation I would put the Nugget in a class with most strip hotels.

In a hurry to find a place to crash, we hit up Golden Nugget. I'm not a big fan of the Fremont strip (the food is awful and some of the characters are sketchy) but this hotel was very nice. Evidently, they've done some renovations and the rooms are very very nice especially for the price. Great value.

Update: My comment about the food along Fremont is now expired as I've since discovered the restaurants in the bottom floor of the California Hotel & Casino (or "The Cal"). In particularly, The Market Street Cafe is ridiculously good and ridiculously cheap. Try the ox tail soup. I still have cravings.

Small dark hotel room (and one of the lamps didn't work), maid service didn't come (had to use same towels three times), check in process slow and confusing, bath tub clogged during shower, no view (unless parking lots are your things).  

Pool left a little to be desired (see separate review).  Not sure I would be in a rush to stay here again.

Thankfully we didn't pay an arm and a leg considering we were there on a couple week nights.

We had to valet as the self-parking garages were full.  The valet service though was pretty good.  More efficient on the drop off than pick up however.  Maybe it's because we were picking up at 7 in the morning and they weren't quite awake yet?

This is a great hotel in the downtown Las Vegas area. It is located close to the 95\/93 freeway so you can avoid the strip traffic en route to places outside of Vegas.   Our room in the Carson tower was large and clean. The bed was comfortable. The pool is great. The buffet is passable.  The jacuzzi could have been hotter and it would have been mice to have an adults only jacuzzi. There's a Starbucks in the lobby and a kickass steak house too. 

The best part is that you don't have to walk through the casino just to get from your car to your room. The crowds of 20-somethings celebrating their birthdays or bachelorette parties are down on the strip so you don't get the loud drunken partygoers yelling and being obnoxious. 

This is a great Vegas casino and hotel for the family.

Very disappointed.  Pool area overcrowded to the point that no lounge chairs available.  We were exhausted from driving and hoping for a nap but they put us near a room undergoing noisy heavy construction.  Called to complain and they said had to come down to bell desk but we're 90% full. Bell desk said untrue they are 100% full... who's lying? Paid a fortune for mid week rates.

Ok, so it is hard for me to give five stars, but the Golden Nugget got them!  Went the other day.  I haven't played craps at a casino before, so the 10 am teaching table with a $5 minimum was right up my alley!  We got $200 in chips and walked out an hour and a half later with about $500.  It was great!  The dealers were awesome and did a really good job explaining how the betting was done.  I had a great time!

The draw of this hotel\/casino is the pool, and it really is amazing!  The water slide is fun, and fast.  The shark tank is really interesting to look at, and the water was clear and clean.  The room we had, in the Carson Tower, was adequate.  The bed was comfortable, and the air conditioning worked well.  I resent the idea of having to BUY K cups (3\/$10) if you want a cup of coffee in your room.  How tacky!  But, that seems to be what the Golden Nugget is all about, getting every last cent they can from you for the basics.
We ate at the buffet and it was pretty bad.  If you like Costco desserts and pressed prime rib slabs, I suppose it would have been okay.  The waitress was nice, and she was empathetic to the raw blintzes, oil soaked tater tots, and undercooked sausage.  The coffee was good.  
My biggest gripe was the fact that I complained several times to the managers about the activity on our floor and nothing was done about it.  There was a pot smoking bicycle club staying at the hotel for a convention, and many of them were on our floor.  Our floor, was supposed to be NON SMOKING.  I guess marijuana doesn't count, as the air was thick with it.  I heard the housekeepers complaining about it, as well.  Also, the bikes were moved from the lobby to the rooms over and over, so you couldn't get in the elevator to get to your room.  I went to the lobby and mentioned this TWICE.  Nothing was done.  I suppose the cherry on the top of the cake was when I returned to my room early Sunday morning, to find a long line of vomit running down the hall.  I called the front desk to report it, but nothing was done because the next morning,It was still there, just sunk into the carpet somewhat.  I wanted to love this place.  I love the feel of the old glamour.  However, it's just kind of dumpy.

I spent a weekend at the Nugget in downtown Vegas and had a blast.  They were in the process of remodeling the lobby so we were in kind of a make shift one that was rather small but the staff was there ready to help.  The rooms are clean and don't smell smokey at all which is such a welcome retreat from the casino.  I really loved downtown\/freemont st. just as much as the strip.  It's a little lower key but the gambling is fabulous.  If you need a good place downtown I'd say it's got to be the Nugget all the way!!!

Worst service and treatment by staff and crew ever.  Although the actual location is decent, the service is piss poor.  Ended up checking out earlier than planned it was so bad.  NEVER staying there again.

It is one of the older hotels on the strip but they are redoing the rooms one by one I am staying in a new room and it smells great carpet is nice Decor is very nice. They are redoing things slowly but surely to keep up with the new hotels. Come and see it for yourself

To celebrate our anniversary we booked the Gold Club Level Room for the extra amenities and the lure of "VIP" treatment.  The room was nice and spacious, with a very luxurious king bed, but as another reviewer noted the room is very dark and the lighting is extremely dim affording zero help if you want to read in bed.  

Our room had operational issues daily (i.e.: faulty showerhead that needed replacing, daily blown fuse in bathroom, non-working switches, etc.).  Worse, when we tried to get these things attended to by directly addressing the VIP Lounge staff these issues went unresolved.  One example (of THREE): we went to the VIP Lounge to alert the staff to have our bathroom lights fixed while we were out for dinner and asked that in concert with our turn-down service (one of the listed amenities for the Club Level) we needed replacement towels since we had to clean up the bathroom ourselves after the showerhead was replaced earlier that day.  When we returned 3 hours later we were disappointed to find nothing had been taken care of and though we figured out and fixed our lighting issue ourselves, the turn-down service never happened. (The DND was not on the door so not the excuse.)

The Club Level amenities are overstated at best and undelivered at worst -- absolutely not worth the higher rate.  The ice machine was out of service and though we told the VIP staff about this it went unrepaired.  The table with nuts and M&Ms at the elevators was usually a sloppy mess and unappealing.  The coffee is touted as Starbucks and that simply cannot be true for as bad of brew as it was.  The coffee accoutrements were paltry (no Sweet n' Low) and one  1\/2 &  1\/2 carton was put out un-chilled (which was fine because it ran out by 9am).  How hard is it to have a decent coffee station presentation with a thermos for the cream and the gamut of sugars\/sweeteners - especially if you're selling a VIP experience?

In the staff's defense, every time I called the general number at the front desk, I was helped quickly.  The Valet\/Bell personnel were fast, friendly and helpful.  We did not try any of the restaurants nor did we gamble at this property so cannot speak to these offerings.  Lastly, we did ask for a late check-out and were told that "suites are not eligible for late check-out" - yet another reason not to pay more money for less service and unfulfilled expectations.  If the price were right, I might book this hotel again, but I'd never book the Club Level and in any event would check-in with low expectations.  I will be writing the management a letter of complaint regarding this stay.   The Golden Nugget should not have the audacity to call any of their Club Services "VIP" - total bait and switch there.

One of the last great OG Vegas hotels! The Golden Nugget is definately a diamond in the rough. Though I have yet to stay here this place has true old school charm. I love their casino!!! They have an awesome poker room, pure class! The slots are always tons of fun too! They have a Monopoly game there that is freakin' addicting....aside from the fact that it pays out too!!! They only have four of those machines in the casino (and as far as I know, the only ones in Vegas!) and they aren't the annoying electronic newer ones it's the "reel" deal with the actual reels spinning in your face!!!!  Old timers usually frequent this place but who cares!!! I come to Vegas for one reason, to gamble!!! So I could give a rat's ass how old Betty Sue is playing the machine next to mine. Definitely a must when you go to Downtown.
UPDATE: I finally stayed at this hotel! It was actually nice & clean. I liked the beds....pillowtop....aaaahhhh! The action was live too! It gets packed on the weekends from about 9am til the wee hours! FYI- I was in the casino losing my booty off until I sat down to play a Wild Cherry old sit down table top slot (no I didn't win!) and a few seats down from me was two ladies that hit the other Wild Cherry jackpot.....they were yelling and hi-fiving each other, then I asked "that's awesome! how much did you win?" she said a few thousand (lucky!!!) and then put out her hand for me to shake. I told her to throw some of that luck my way and shook her hand. She told me that she appreciated me shaking her hand & that I was good people  and then gave me $30. Wow free money just for shaking her hand?! I refused but she insisted!!!! Only in Vegas!!!! I love LV!!!!!

The GN is okay if you are staying down in old Vegas. Our room was super dated, no USB ports and the lightening was terrible. Robes were nice to have. Also the nugget was wonderful about making sure the room had no feathers for me. 

Howeve, random charges showed up on our bill. We are still looking into this. Make sure you keep any receipts for anything you charge to the room. 

Tierra thy checked us in was Ah-mazing. Loved her. She called to make sure the room was without feathers.

My friends and I decided to spend our Saturday afternoon at the golden gate pool with some cocktails and do a little bit of gambling. Once we got to golden nugget valet, valet was full. So we had to park elsewhere (which was another huge ordeal) and walk to the pool. 

When we arrived, it was super busy. (We expected that since it was Saturday.) My friends and I all agreed to get a table so we can get bottle service. One of the waitresses got us a table within 20 minutes of our arrival. Once we asked for a drink\/bottle menu, it took her 20 minutes to deliver us one. We eventually got tired during our wait and went to the bar ourselves and grabbed our own drinks. 

The shark tank is cool but quite small. Sort of makes you feel bad how many sharks are in this tank with such limited space. 

Children everywhere...EVERYWHERE! And since the adult section was beyond full, we had to hang around with them. I don't hate children, but I just didn't feel right having cocktails and smoking cigs next to one. 

The worst part was people swimming in their clothes. Men jumping in with their basketball shorts and old tshirts. Women in their basketball jerseys while wearing old sneakers to swim in. Babies swimming in soiled diapers. I found that quite trashy because all other hotel pools forbid any other attire other than swim suits and sandals inside the pool. 

Once we got to top section of the hotel pool, (the adults section finally has some vacancy) it was a bit more relaxing but the music was different from downstairs. I swear it was putting me to sleep. 

You'd be better off going to the pool during the weekday where it's less busy with people and children. It was obvious the waitresses couldn't handle the rush which took forever to recieve proper service. Last year, 2013 I had a blast but that's cause I went on a Monday afternoon. Stay away in the weekends.

I would give 5 stars bout customer service and the casino attendants but rooms are just not organize. No wall socket next to the bed which is really important. But everything was great about the hotel. The swimming pool was really great!

The Golden Nugget will officially be my preferred hotel when I return to Vegas. The room was very nice and clean. The Grille was really good. The pool was amazing. Everything I experienced was fantastic. I don't care about drinking or gambling so this place was perfect. Mere minutes from Fremont st was also great since I had a concert at the LVCS. I love the Golden Nugget and will be a Fan for life.

The hotel was ok. They did move our room when the first "non-smoking" room reeked of smoke. They wanted to just spray a deodorizer; but, moved us when pressed. There is a resort fee that makes little sense and gives the guest very little benefit. Bring your own kcups and request a kuerig for your room. The coffee machine will be brought to your room free of charge; but, the pods cost $10 for 4. Starbucks is also onsite. The breakfast buffet was a good price at $22; the food was good. We had a nice enough stay.

I stayed here because of a conference but I wish I have stayed on the strip. I found a bug on my bed, hair and blood on my pillow (and that's that I upgraded to a suite-17th floor, I don't want to imagine how the rooms at the Carson tower would be like). This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Customer service is terrible too.

After a complete renovation, this place actually is pretty decent (for downtown LV) and although is still on the gaudy side, is relatively new and clean. They even have a high end steak restaurant serving up entrees around the high $20 range.

We had eaten here years ago at the coffee shop, but since the facelift, hubby wanted me to see it to prove to me that it wasn't as disgusting as I'd remembered it to be.

Well, it wasn't. Plus, they have a brand new pool with a 'shark tank' in the middle of it. So basically you're swimming amongst sharks (or so it seems).

Lil guy was impressed. He wanted to go swim in the pool but it was slightly chilly and plus we weren't staying there. They even have card tables set up by the pool with chairs so you can get a couple of games in while you have your swim.

Not shabby if I might say so myself. However, the decor still probably appeals to an older crowd with its bright lights and very very complex designed carpets, which combined, gives me a headache after a while.

We usually stay here. Something has happened. New management perhaps. Worst stay ever. First room smelled of sewage and was so loud we could not sleep. They moved us to new room and next am no electricity in the bathroom. Very unhelpful management and rude front desk staff. Won't staycagain.

Simply love this place .. The rooms are always clean and well kept up and room service is fast and friendly . I really liked the new function of texting water and having 2 new bottles brought to your room. Drinks are a little high for downtown and you need to play a dollar at a certain pace to be free but over all a great trip.

Hotel is clean, and great. BEWARE OF THE RESORT FEE. Its $30 a night, and all you get is 2 free water bottles a day. Not sure if it's required, as we were kind of tired when we checked in. Just make sure you read all the fine print before checking in. We were hit by surprise when we checked out this morning. 

Otherwise, the hotel was amazing. Bed was comfortable. Shower was roomy. The room did have a weird odor, but not unbearable. The hotel and casino is MASSIVE. So good luck trying to order take out food to be delivered. It takes forever to find the proper room. We stayed for 3 nights and got lost every single time. We stayed in the carson tower, which is the oldest building. I think it was the quietest out of all the hotels I've stayed in. I would recommend it, just plan to spend like $100 a night instead of the $60 a night that they advertise.

This is the best hotel in downtown Las Vegas. Hands down. Frankly, it's in the top 25% of the nicest hotels in the city.

But they know they are the prettiest girl in class so they charge more. A LOT more for everything. (Water and beer is at least 1\/2 the price at the ABC store next door!)

But I guarantee you that the crappiest room in the Carson tower is better than the best room at the Plaza.

Trust me. I post reviews on the Internet.
Told us we'd have a quiet room. Twice. Room overlooked Fremont and shook once the evening events started.

I didn't stay here--just dropped by to gamble a bit.  This was my first venture away from The Strip.  Gotta say I was impressed enough to consider staying here on a future trip.  

The casino is authentic Vegas--a bit cramped, smokey, and chock full o' slots.  You can get $10 in free slot play by signing up for the 24 Karat Club.  The table minimums appeared reasonable--$5 on most tables I saw (this was a holiday Monday at midday).  

The pool looks like a good time, with a slide that takes you through a shark tank.  And, of course, the 67-lb. gold nugget is on display for you gawking pleasure.

Drop by the Nugget and give it a try!

HOTEL FRAUD! TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! STAY AWAY!
I had my hotel booked for me by another person; when it was booked my name was misspelled. (Spelled Darin with a B). I called the hotel to confirm that I had a reservation, while driving to Vegas, and I was told that they couldn't find it. I quickly booked another room so I had a place to stay. When I arrived we figured out the missed spelling and my original reservation was found... When I tried to cancel the duplicate night and very unfriendly lady informed me that it couldn't be done because I should have known about the original reservation... I explained the mistake with my misspelled name and I was told it was my fault because I should have known about the reservation.... They double billed me for one night... My mind was blown! I have never experienced something like this in my life..STAY AWAY!!!!!

I was so excited to stay in a suite here... Let's just say I wish I would have just stayed in a normal room literally anywhere else. I called ahead to see when we could check in and I'm told 3pm. We get there at 530pm and they tell me my room isn't ready and it's going to be another hour. Don't offer anything for this inconvenience. Over an hour passes and no one ever calls me to tell me the rooms ready so I go to customer service. The room still isn't ready but they'll call me whenever they have it ready. I tell them that's unacceptable and I have a show so they agree after getting a manager to let us get in to the half of the suite that is ready to get ready in.  Get back at 11:15 pm and surprise surprise our keys don't work on the other part of the suite and the door between the two rooms is still locked. They never got the conjoining door unlocked but at 1215 in the morning we finally got key that gets us in to both sides of the room from the hallway. Never staying here again.

We recently stayed in the Rush Tower, it was great. Downtown was a fun change from the strip. 

Here's my lowdown:
***** room size and bed
**** decor was nice although I was not a fan of the wallpaper in the bathroom
**** service was fine, quick check in nice staff
**** FAST elevators, really a plus for a tall building

* HORRIBLE toilet paper, come on pony up for some decent soft TP & Kleenex!

This place was pretty nice from what I saw. I didn't really have much contact with the staff but they seemed friendly enough. I didn't really know what to expect from this hotel because I had never even been to Downtown before but it was actually pretty nice. It was really cheap and the rooms were REALLY nice for the price. It was just an average hotel though, nothing fancy or extravagant. 

The pool is what everyone is raving about, and yea it's cool that there's an aquarium in the middle, but it wasn't crazyy cool.

This place is worth an average 3 stars but the extra star is for Irek, the bartender at the pool.
He Was Amazing!! REEALLLLY friendly to me. He remembered me after our first drink and even knew what we wanted! I came back the next day and he remembered me the next day! "Nice to see you again baby!" it was a really nice greeting. He wasn't young and trying to be slick or old and creepy, just really friendly and nice. He was from Poland or something and had a cool accent. He remembered our drinks from the day before and hooked it up!!! He was great, TIP GENEROUSLY! haha

Spent the weekend here back in the Spring, and thoroughly enjoyed the Rush Tower suite, which is modern and elegant with a big bathtub just calling for Lush bath bombs! Check in is easy, as Rush Tower has a dedicated desk and valet. They sent a delicious wine, cheese and fruit platter up as a "Welcome" gift, and later, Room Service made another for us 'off menu' with service fees\/cart\/flowers, etc. at my request, quite amenable. 

Enjoyed a fabulous meal at Vic & Anthony's, walked around Fremont St at night catching  a few bands, spent a leisurely afternoon sipping drinks in our Hideaway Pool cabana before walking over to Hugo's Cellar for my favorite meal in town. Didn't gamble, because that isn't our thing, but the casino was busy. 

In all, we enjoyed our weekend here, the proximity to all Downtown has to offer, without having to retire to a seedy hotel. Would absolutely stay again, in Rush Tower suites. 

* Room Service was timely, on point & willing to customize orders for us* 

** Friendly service from check-in, valet, pool
cocktail servers, etc. **

*** steps away from Fremont Street chaos, yet locked away in comfort in your suite ***

Very accommodating hosts. The Rush Club rooms are clean and well maintained. We stayed for five nights and enjoyed every aspect of the hotel and casino. Vic and Anthony's was superb, the Grotto was very good and the buffet is decent. The staff are what make the place five stars. Strong and steady drinks combined with a smile make for a great week.

Stayed at the Carson Tower last week.  My elderly friend was mugged by a black woman who entered on the 10th floor.  She was knocked down and her purse was stolen.  Security should have been better!!!  Not even a word of apology from the casino.

We stopped here for a quick night before our next destination, the rooms were alright, beds are a little small but comfortable and the room was clean. I like to gamble here they have a lot of different slot machines and plenty of tables with friendly dealers. I have always came out ahead when gambling here and so far have had my biggest win from this place.I would stay her again maybe use the pool next time.

Heard this was the best place downtown.......ahhh NOT.  Pool of blood in bath tub upon check in with pubic hair  on wash cloth and sink. Wife threw up. Told staff and they said would you like another room like it was no big deal. Well pretty much sick by this point. Never again  screw this place and to he'll with Vegas.

The Nugget is probably my favorite place to stay, why? because it cost as much as the Concha Inn but has the style and class of any hotel on the strip. In terms of comfort and style, I consider the cost inexpensive.

If you want to see the sharks swimming around the water slide bring your goggles. You have to take a bus to the strip but it wasn't so bad for a one night stay. The bus is 8$ for 24 hours. Walking out of the gold nugget into the Fremont street experience was one of the best parts of our very long night.

Booked a king bed suite for an anniversary week getaway. They only had a room with two twin beds,  so uncomfortable we had to get massages. After two nights they gave us a room with a king bed... and mold growing all over the wall paper and light fixture would give zero stars I'd i could

I have stayed here for years. Friendly staff And wonderful guest rooms. I love the Carson tower 1 of the last great downtown hotels in fact it could be the oldest casino downtown . original white marble floors , giant shark tank too swim inn and large guest rooms . 
This place is not next to the Fremont experience it's part of it !
Golden nugget in down town Las Vegas is amazing hotel casino, nice and clean. Live the shark tank.

I came to vegas as a weekend get away with my boyfriend and his family. I've never been to Las Vegas. So I didn't know what I was in for. When we showed up at the hotel, I was like.... "Out of all the cool hotels, why are we here?!?!" Of course I was being a little judgemental. We stayed at the nugget for 2 nights. I ended up loving the hotel. Everyone is so nice, the tank was awesome, most of the visitors were families. Which I don't mind what so ever. Kids are in bed by like 9PM, so if you roam around the hotel you would not see one little squirt in sight. The cafe kinda sucked. The service was slow and the food tastes 'microwaved.'
