All and all I do reccommend this place to anyone who wants to have a nice night away from crazy people and the strip.

I was going to go into this place just to see some of old Vegas, but the surrounding neighborhood convinced me not to get out of my car. There is a tent city about 3 blocks north, homeless pitching tents on the side walk. The general area seemed pretty run down, and the sun was setting. I would advise all tourists to stay on the newer strip, and away from old Vegas.

We stayed 4th of July weekend. We are repeat customer great place and great value. It is a must to go down to the pool at 8:00am and put your stuff on the chairs you want because they go fast. But I love Fremont Street and this place is great!

Love this downtown casino. Easy to get in and out of from the parking garage if your a local. When it comes to gambling they have a 5$ minimum bet on craps! I'm not sure what the odds max is, but I backed my vet with 6x and 8xs on rolls. Only draw back is the fog of cigarette smoke throughout the place when your in the gambling pit. If your heading downtown to see old vegas, make this a spot to stop in  and lay a few bucks on the line!

This review is regarding my cabana experience at the adult pool for my 40th bday party. I love the pool due to the fact I don't have kids cannonballing next to me while I'm sipping a drink but my server, Rachael, was definitely lacking customer service skills. She was constantly trying to " up sale" my group on food and beverage and even became confrontational when we decided against large platters of food. I understand she's trying to put more money in her pocket but that's not the way to accomplish it!! Definitely made the day of rest and relaxation anything but that

Please don't play at the Golden Nugget! Im a local for more then 30 years & I have been known to have some of the highest players cards, 7 star at Caesars, presidents card at the red rock and a few other casinos, which means I'm a player! About 3 weeks ago at 8am I received a phone call, (mind you the call woke me up) from a rude golden nugget hostess with a piste off attitude threatening to cut my free play off because she claimed I had dropped in points in the last month! Who heard of this? I lost $2800 last month! She said but it's not showing! Not my fault! I nicely replied close my account, I will not have a casino hostess call me at 8am with a threatening voice to drop my free play ! This is unheard of! In 30 years I've never had of a casino call me on my cell phone that my play is dropped and they are cancelling my free play after you mailed it out! How rude!They must be pretty desperate for messily free play! I wasn't going to write this review but after asking for my account to be closed and my email removed I'm now getting harassed by emails! I asked for my account to be completely removed! Why am I still receiving emails? 

I hope the owners get to see this message so they know what kind of ruthless employees work for this casino!

I haven't even stayed yet, and I am already disappointed.  While booking my room, I noticed a "best rate guarantee", if you find a better rate on a third party website, they promise to give you the lower rate plus 10%.  After e-mailing them all the information regarding a lower rate on Bookit.com, they e-mailed me back and stated that the rate "at the time of their investigation" was $109, even though I sent them all the screen shots showing an $86 rate.  I then went back to Bookit.com the next day, and sent new screen shots, that showed that the rates were still $86, not $109.  I decided to book through Bookit.com at $86.  I still have not received a response after my second e-mail.  It is disappointing to know that they are "guaranteeing" something, but then they do not stand by their offer.

I've never stayed here, but I always come gamble at the Nugget every visit. I like to play black jack at the tables here. The staff is super friendly. The dealers are funny. It's some seriously great people watching. The shark tank is awesome. Be sure to actually find the golden nugget and snap your photo. It's a definite change of pace. Check it out!

Downtown LV is a totally different more chill type vibe than the main LV strip. Check-in was quick for us and service was friendly. During the day it seemed quiet but at night it was crowded with people! The waitresses came by a lot more often than other places I've been. Hotels are nice and beds were clean. The only thing I noticed was the dirty tub. It had rust around the edges of the tub which was a big no for me. 

The hotel has many great restaurants you can eat at, a really cool pool with a shark tank and lots of great machines. There's a huge slot machine at the front too which can be pretty cool for pics. The "world's largest golden nugget" is out up for display too.

This review is for my visit to the Rush Tower. 

As soon as I pulled up I was blown away with some of the best customer service I've seen. The valet is exceptional!  Even better, the front desk check inn was easy and hassle free. We stayed in a Jr. Corner Suite, and it was incredible!  

The pool is a lot of fun, and I love the little bar in the main casino. There are so many reasons to stay here, and I can't wait to go back!

Stayed here Friday through Monday $118 Friday and Saturday night with a wedding discount and $75 for Sunday.  I thought that was quite high for downtown.  There is no resort fee but you also don't get anything like wifi.  Rooms are not renovated but they claim to have new Serta mattresses.  The casino has been renovated with new tables, chandeliers, and furniture.  I tried to go sit by the infamous pool on Sunday but there wasn't a single lounge chair.  I think they allow non-hotel guests into the pool area.

If I would have wrote this review right after check in it would get 1 Star. But the staff and amenities changed that. 

Check In : We arrived at 9am and went to check in to see if we could possibly get into our rooms early (We had 5). They told us possibly by 11am. Normal check in is 3pm. So we checked our luggage and went to gamble. Came back around Noon and stil no go on the rooms. Okay, no big deal. Came back later and see a long line. So I get in line and see group after group leave with room keys. Get to the front and they tell me our rooms still aren't ready. I asked how is it possible that guests are walking in off the street and getting rooms and rooms we've been waiting for 5 hours still aren't clean. The frond desk clerk gave me attitude and eventually we got our rooms, ON 3 Different Floors. 

Casino : The casino is small in comparison to the ones on the strip, but it's great and every dealer, waitress, etc was great. We all had a blast.

Pool : The pool is amazing, it's beautiful. We also loved playing BJ and Craps out in the beautiful weather. The prices on alcohol are a high but actually pretty reasonable as far as Vegas goes. And of course don't miss the slide through the shark tank. 

All in all it was a great time, we were here for my 40th bday and it was amazing. If not for the check in mishap I would have gave the Nugget 4 stars without hesitation. But if you are going to stay downtown, this is the place to be.

I LOVE THE GOLDEN NUGGET. Located in downtown Fremont St. this place is where you want to stay!! We have been here twice and both times I was very impressed with the quality of service from the staff and the amenities of the hotel and casino. 

We arrived about 7 hours too early (can you say excited much!). But we went up to the desk and asked if we could do an early check in. Not only was there no fee to check in early but they upgraded our room for free too because the room we were supposed to have wasn't ready yet!!! WOOT WOOT! 

The first thing we did was order room service breakfast. Hey at 8am in Vegas you know you want some food in ya before you start all that drinking! The Eggs Benedict was AMAZING!!!! 

While we didn't swim because it was too cold when we went on our trip, we did walk around and look at the super cool shark tank and awesome lounge areas. Going to be giving that a try next time we go. 

Neither one of us play on the card tables so I can't really say anything to that. But the staff at the bars with the video pokers are neat and the machines pay out pretty well. 

We overslept on our second morning there so we missed the maids when they came around. But the second my boyfriend called the front desk to tell them we were on our way out and asked them to come clean. They came right up! 

Extremely impressed by their prices and guest services. You have to stay here!

We didn't stay at this hotel but hung out here while visiting Downtown Fremont Street.

I have to admit that compared to other Downtown hotels, this one actually was nice (I'm guessing it's because it's owned by Steve Wynn). It was bigger than Binion's and the 4 Queens and classier too. It still had the low ceilings and smoky smell but hey, it's Downtown Fremont Street which is home to all the older hotel-casinos.

The coolest thing about this hotel was the shark tank in the middle of the pool. There's also a waterslide and the tube goes right through the shark tank! 

Not sure if I would stay here but I would sneak in and use their pool.

The room was so comfortable & clean, bed was amazing. The pool was super fun with the water slide and shark tank, we had such a great time swimming with our daughter.  Garret in Security was THE ONLY employee with a great attitude & helpfulness. He was very knowledgeable about the grounds and when we ran into him several times after our initial interaction he was still super friendly and hospitable. None of the other employees were even close to this, they all seemed like they didn't like their jobs and didn't want to be there. Elaine who checked us in was curt & seemed to be looking down her nose at our group while assisting us. My husband was VERY bothered by how she treated us. Garret deserves to be recognized for his SUPERIOR QUALITY SERVICE. If more people like him worked here we'd be more than happy to stay again.
Just a "blah" hotel. It lacks in both personal touches and wow factor. Maybe if the pool wasn't closed that would be a different story. As far as room and customer service it  it just ok.

A great place to stumble in to when you are on the Fremont experience. It is a crazy hotel that is a tight fit and often seems packed, even on a slow day. Their drinks are not over priced like other places but their service is below par. It takes a while to get a hold of a bartender to service you, and sometimes they talk with others and delay your order. Its a cool experience to visit this very famous hotel, but it does not seem like a place too stay as the upkeep is average.

This hotel was like your stomach after a great meal. It was good going down, and then it wasn't. 

Some things operated fantastically, and some failed miserably. 

The valet folks operated like as you'd ever want. They had the door open, the car up quick, greeted me by name, and were flawless. 

The staff at the front desk was cordial and efficient. 

The bellman was awesome, willing to do whatever was needed. We can't remember the last time a bellman has asked if we needed ice in our room. This is a great example of an era of customer service that has fallen off the map. 

The room service folks were horrible. It would take the use of capital letters and a long period of writing to adequately explain the frustration. The Reader's Digest version of the story is that my wife was arriving before me and I attempted to arrange for a bottle of champagne to be delivered to the room upon her arrival. I called, we reviewed wines, I made a selection, I allowed the man to up sell me some chocolate covered strawberries, and all that arrived were the berries. When the berries arrived my wife asked about the champagne (I had tipped her off as I got a bad feeling about this transaction when they called me to explain that nobody with my name was checking in) and the lady was going to check into it. My wife waits a half hour and there is no communication. Sorry, this is the Reader's Digest version. 

Also, my wife had, for the first time in a long time, to send a meal back at the 'grotto'. Not good at all. 

So, would we return, yes, but it will be a while, and we won't use room service or eat at the 'grotto'.
Stood in line just to CHECK IN for 30+ minutes and still haven't moved an inch! No one was even behind the counter for a majority of that. I now know where NOT to stay!

I travel to Vegas every month on business and usually stay on the strip.  I decided to give the Golden Nugget another try after having a nice stay three years ago for a wedding.  I stayed in the Carson Tower and here are my lists of complaints:
-TV remote Broke (no big deal)
-Carpets dirty and Crusty (don't go barefoot)
-Elevator shaft right by room (extremely loud)
-Non-Smoking room smelled of an old cigar
- NO mini bar in room
-Crusty towels that smelled like old smoke

Needless to stay I will not be returning.

It was my 13 year anniversary and my wife and I decided to stay here to celebrate. What a nightmare. First when I checked in the front desk clerk "Wade" was unprofessional and did not provide excellent service. I was told by the front desk manager they did something special for my anniversary and they did nothing. What a disappointment. We decided to eat at the buffet......that was terrible. The food quality was below standard and was highly over priced for a thursday.  We paid $43.00 and honestly that was about $15.00 to high. We requested to have 3 extra pillows in the room and they never showed up. More disappointment. Sadly we sweat all night in the room because the air conditioner did not work correctly. The engineer "Wes" stated the A\/C was working fine and there was nothing he could do. The room stayed a constant 90 degrees. Front desk refused to change our room. Everytime I called the front desk the operator would cut me off mid sentence. How unprofessional is that. What a complete disappointment.  The only thing nice at this hotel is the pool. Thanks to the Golden Nugget my 13 year anniversary was spoiled by lack luster service and terrible quality. Take my advice stay somewhere else anywhere would be better.

First off, it is Vegas, so I realize they charge more for stuff, but let's be reasonable. 
The BAD:
- $10 for coffee you brew yourself in your own room
- $13 a day for WiFi (even though there are free ones intercepting theirs)
- They do not assist you with public transport
- The pool closes at 5 pm. Seriously. I'm barely drunk by then. I get off of my work schedule and cannot even enjoy a swim.
- One bath robe. The one place I ever wear a robe and we had to share even though we had multiple people in the room.
- No noise control. 6 rooms down a bachelorette party was up all night screaming with an inflatable penis.
- No shuttle service to the airport.
- Broke my finger trying to push the buttons on the remote. 

The GOOD:
- Location. It was right in the heart of downtown next to the RTC stop which takes you everywhere
- Not a very rowdy place.
- Housekeeping was awesome. They were always a few steps away and were very quick and did not ask questions when the BF and I had an unfortunate flooding incident in the bathroom. What happens in Vegas really does stay there.
- The pool when it is open is pretty awesome. They have live sharks. 
- The buffet was a decent price and the food was good.

Despite the amazing customer service from the ONE person who actually cared about my issue, my boyfriend got attitude from a customer service rep and they were charging us for things that they didnt even know what the money was for... we FINALLY got it resolved and still I am being charged 2 days later... this is ridiculous, this hotel is beyond sketchy and its no wonder they have a shit review on here.. Jacob was outstanding and did everything he could to help us.. he was the only positive comment I could say about this shady hotel...

BEST hotel ever!!! We stayed here for our anniversary and it was just perfect. The staff was attentive and even gave us cookies and milk delivered to our room. The gambling experience was terrific and we met some of the nicest dealers. The location is perfect if your looking for a great time on Fremont street. The shark tank is definitely amazing to try when you are here. The only two things I didn't like was how long we had to wait to get our luggage delivered to our room and how the house keeper only restocked towels and didn't do any other tidying up. Other than that we had a great time and highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

I wasn't expecting much when my girl friend told me she wanted to have her bachelorette at the Golden Nugget.  I'm happy to say that I was surprisingly impressed.  The newly decorated lobby was nice and the room was huge, but the beds were a little small, I think they claimed they were queens but they were more like fulls.  Still they were comfortable.  The pool is small because it has a giant fish tank in the center but for a cool off dip after laying by the pool it was sufficient.  
     The one thing I did not enjoy was the other patrons of this hotel.  They were super loud and obnoxious and not at all considerate.  You would leave your deck chair to go to the pool or get a drink only to come back a few minutes later to find someone sitting in your chair, your stuff carelessly thrown to the side.  Hello people its called pool etiquette, if you are to lazy to get your butt up in time to get a chair don't just steal mine because I was gone for all of 5 minutes.  Our room neighbors were also really loud, I know its Vegas but do you think you could tone it down past 3 am?
      That being said the hotel staff were very polite and accommodating and I know they have no say in who books there so I didn't dock them for their rude guests.

getting dirty in old town vegas...
smoky but old school vegas - lots of fun - the one and only golden nugget!!

I was around here for business, not gambling, so this is mostly a review of the hotel.

Ya know, for the price it's a GREAT hotel.  I found the rooms clean, nicely decorated, friendly staff service, good bathrooms and very comfortable beds.  The room smelled fine.  Free parking.  They build the "resort fee" into the price so there's no bullshit "surprise, it's $17 more per day!".

Con:  
-no free wifi (like $12 a day or something)
-$20 per day to use the gym, but if you do you have access to the hot tub, sauna, really nice bathrooms with free-to-borrow robes, slippers, grooming supplies...a bit pricey for those who really want to work out several times but you do feel very pampered!


Can't tell you about the casino floor but there were several good restaurants, nice sushi place, starbucks, etc.  Not to mention the AMAZING pool!  Where else are you going to have a three story water slide that goes through a shark tank?  No where else, that's where.  

People love to hate on downtown casinos but I found the Golden Nugget thoroughly good for everything I needed.

Our stay was from 2-20 to 2-25. Upon making reservations we were upsild on the "VIP" experience where you skip lines, get free bottles of water and access to the VIP lounge. This cam at an expence of over 100 dollar for the two rooms we booked.
We also asked multiple times about the pool being open, the tube slide as well as the shark exibit. Everything was aligned f9r a great vacation. Once we actually got to the GNLV we quickly realized that it was a mistake.
The vip check in was closed
The pool was mostly roped off due to the slide being closed and the shark was no where to be seen since it was cleening week for the big tank and they had 2 divers in the tank instead.
One the first night we were awoken by the fire alarms going off due to some jack wagon vaping in the hallway. 
Each day we had to remind the front desk of our free water that did not get delivered and according to the hotel websitr the VIP get news papers as well but those never showed up. Not that anyone actually reads a paper but if you advertise it is included, you should follow through.
Since we booked our room through travelocity we were also reminded that any issues we brought up we to be taken up through the "3rd party" for resolve. 
We were harrassed outside of the hotel each night we went to freemont street or the name they should give it...freeloader street and were rem8nded each time that if we can afford to be on vacation we can afford to hand out money to these people parked right oitside with their 5 gallon buckets full of change.
We started to enjoy our stay when we used the room as a pit stop rather than a place to relax. Get up, get ready and go to another hotel\/casino for the day. Come back so tired that the noise from the parking lot would not wake you up. Oh, and garbage is picked up at 6am each day. The constant beebing from the truck is how i know this.
We will not stay at this hotel again, the idea of old vegas is not what it percieves and the reviews of this hotel are not factual. There is one of the 4 towers at this hotel that may be where all the 10's and 5 stars are coming from. It us the rush tower. But if you are in the carson tower, with VIP...this is not worth it at any price. 
They did try to call and make it right but if your  going to treat people different because of booking through 3rd party sites like travelocity...you have earned this 2 star.
Personnally, i think Tillman should spend a few of his billions while he brags on TV and find some hospitality training for his people who work for him.

Very sad experience.

Oh, i forgot. Our credit card was hacked also and the only time it was used was for booking this hotel. That was the cherry on top. Thankfully we caught it in time. I cant trust GNLV with credit cards now.... very shady

When people say the place smells like smoke...they are spot on. You cant walk through this lobby even at a brisk pace and not come out of it smelling like an ash tray. The hotel is old, the ability to move clean air.... i dont think they have the ability like the newer places. AND the tables could use a cleaning as well. Of the 4 i played on they were dusted with ash and stained from messy people.

Clean adequate room, and exceptional service from the staff. My only complaint is the smoke but it is vegas . And housekeeping was a lax on providing the bottle water included in the "resort fee" . We would return tho. The pool and the slide were awesome and my daughter had a blast

Thank you Jacob for all your help. It started as the hell trip, and my husband's birthday to boot. After all was said and done we settled into our spa tower suite. Jacob made this experience amazing for us. Thanks again......

My husband and I stayed at the Golden Nugget over the Valentine's day weekend.  Normally we would stay on the strip, but we were there for a wedding and all of the family was staying downtown.

The public areas of the hotel are lovely...our room was another story.  We stayed in the Gold Tower Gold Club rooms on the 17th floor which is only accessible with your room key.  For the first day, we were both cursing out the elevator AND our room entry system.  The room key was more miss than hit on the first day, by the end of our stay, it was more hit than miss.  Neither of us had the energy to deal with the lines at registration to get new keys...we just dealt with it.

The Gold Club rooms are DARK.  You can barely see a thing without all the lights turned on in the room.  The postage stamp sized window offered almost no natural lighting.  The air conditioning unit is HUGE and hidden in a wooden box that looks like a bench under the window.  It is also very noisy and loud.  You either have it on and suffer the noise at night or you turn it off and the room gets stuffy and warm.  The bathroom is the part of the room with the best lighting.  Unfortunately the bathroom is very narrow and takes a lot of maneuvering to get into the closet (it's behind the bathroom door and the door has to be closed in order to open the closet doors).  The only way to turn on the shower to warm up the water first is to get in, turn the water on, and turn the lever that turns the shower on while at the same time trying to get out of the tub before the cold water hits you on the head and hopefully you won't fall and kill yourself before being doused with cold water.

Free Wi-Fi!  Uh huh, but it only worked some of the time.

All-in-all our stay wasn't awful, but it wasn't great.

Booked a suite for my friend's bachelor party weekend. We were assured by the clerk on two separate phone calls that it could sleep up to 8 people and it was a two-level suite. When we arrived, we were given a small suite with 2 beds. They said "well there is a capacity of 8 in the suite but it only sleeps 4. Plus specific rooms aren't guaranteed". Then why did we put down an $800 deposit?! We were specifically assured the room would sleep up to 8. They refused to comp us an additional room or even send enough rollaways for everyone. Lucky we brought an air mattress. Once in the suite, one of the TVs did not work and a breaker for the bathroom lights kept tripping. Overall it was an extremely poor experience when you're trying to make a nice weekend for your friends. Will not be coming back.

I've heard a lot of friends say good things about the Golden Nugget so after my wife and I being that we go to Vegas about once a year we decided to give it a go. Where do I start! Our toilet wouldn't flush half the time, the shower wouldn't drain so by the time you finished showering you were standing in ankle deep water. The AC wouldn't cool half the time. Elevators P-1 and P-4 in the Carson tower would drop and then stop working for several minutes, talk about scare the wits out of you. Went to the pool and my wife wanted a cup of water with ice well you can forget that. The bar tenders were very rude. They went on to tell me that cups cost to much and people would sneak in their own liquor and use the ice. Golden Nugget charged me $27 resort fee a night well I looked online and El Cortez just down the street charges $10 a night for resort fees. There was a lot of other little things to name a few. I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN! There are a lot better places to stay for a lot less money. This place sucks!

Fremont Experience!!

If there's a casino on Fremont that I prefer over others, it would definitely be the Golden Nugget.  This place has changed in the last couple of years.  I remember when I was only 14 years old walking her from the Excalibur.  Forward 20+ years later and I am still walking here, but from the Main Street Parking Log. 

When I have friends come around from out of town, they always want to go to Fremont Street and this is where I take them. When I think of Golden Nugget, I think of 4 different types of casinos.

1st:  You get the Fremont Experience side where it's mostly your table games and slots.  Your typical "Vegas Baby" crowd of course, but also a large amount of locals donating their paychecks. 

2nd:  You get the lobby area, which has been remodeled.  Nice fish\/shark tank bam!! in your face. 

3rd.  You get close to the family atmosphere near their cafe and pool.  

4th:  You got upstairs where there's more eats and a lot quieter.  

There was a time I came out here almost weekly because they had some of the juiciest poker games.  I'm not even talking high limit. I'm small time for sure, but not uncommon to make some dough on the 2\/4 game here.  Tons of action with tons of calling stations.  I know, I know.  I better be quiet and quit tapping the aquarium. 

As for the atmosphere, I like it.  Never an issue with the staff from their restaurants to their bar to their poker room.  Golden Nugget will not set you back because everything here is fairly cheap, except the gambling obviously

My only issue is with their pool. The fish tank is impressive, but not a fan of their pool being smack in your face when you walk their casino. I'm still  a believer that you should be in the pool area to enjoy the pool area.  

Why the 4 stars then??  I like their poker room.  One of the few places to play where you can make some money, not lose as much, and enjoy the players here.  I've met a lot of good people from different parts of the world here.  They don't take it so serious out here and also don't mind giving you their money.

Ahh, the Golden Nugget, we had our ups and downs during my 5-night stay, but overall you treated me very well. I really dig the more down-to-earth, old school vibe of Downtown Las Vegas compared to The Strip, and the Golden Nugget is the nicest and most complete casino in the area. Many components come together to make a full casino experience, so I'll review each of the components individually.

The Rooms: Unless you are spending a lot of time in you room - and this is Vegas, so you shouldn't be - a basic room is the way to go. And their basic room in the Carson Tower is nice. Ample space, nice TV (that I hardly turned on), a good bathroom, and clean with upscale decor. No free internet is a minus, but even after paying for internet, the rooms averaged out at $65\/night including taxes and resort fees. However, they were doing work on my floor that week - running new phone\/internet cables - and the noise woke me up multiple times. (Yes, I was sleeping until 11AM, but I mean, this IS Vegas) I know casinos never close and this was probably factored into the cost of my room, but I could have stayed at another place Downtown for cheaper with no construction. 3.5 Stars.

The Casino: This is the most complete casino in the Downtown area. Their Poker Room is a bit old school, but still nice. The dealers there are generally nice, fun people to be with, and there is a nice variety of people coming in. Tournaments are run three times a day. If poker isn't your thing, they have a load of slots and table games throughout the casino, including both poolside and in their lounge where live music is frequently playing. Regardless if I am staying here or at another Downtown casino, it's a given that I'll be gambling here. 4.5 Stars

Restaurant Selection: Golden Nugget is owned by Landry's, who owns such posh restaurant chains like M&S and Morton's, so it's to be expected that they do high-end well. The problem is that most people staying Downtown are looking for value. I'm sure Vic & Anthony's and Chart House are good, but those aren't places for an "everyday" meal. The Grotto is pretty good - it's not cheap eats but it is moderately priced and a good value for what you get. I thought the Happy Hour specials at Red Sushi were good. But for late-night eats your only option is The Grille, a small counter-service establishment. It was decent, but you don't get that classic Vegas 3AM dive\/diner experience. 3.5 Stars

That averages to a just under 4-stars, and I'll jump them up to 4-stars for genuinely nice and efficient customer service and an excellent pool area that allows one to get some rest while nursing a hangover after you have checked out and are waiting for your flight. (For example) 

If you are looking to experience the value and classic vibe of "Old Vegas" but with a touch of class you get from The Strip, Golden Nugget is the way to go.

I've been coming to this casino in downtown LV for many years for their buffet and it is usually pretty good given the cost. This review is specifically for their unethical practice of time clock altering in their parking structure to cheat customers out of a few bucks. 

Upon entry, you get a time stamped ticket showing the time of entry. When it is time to exit, you put the same ticket into a reader at the exit gate and it reads the entry and exit time and calculates the cost. All pretty straight forward. However, this is where things go haywire. The entry time clock is always a few minutes early - earlier than the true time. And the exit clock miraculously are always showing the time as later than the real time. On the last trip, Golden Nugget's parking entry clock was early by a few minutes as usual. Upon exit, their clock was showing time that was at least 10 minutes later than real time. This was confirmed by my watch, which was calibrated against the National Institute of Standards and Technology at www.time.gov, not to mention all cell phones now days have clocks that are also calibrated against a standard that  isn't more than 15 seconds off. The parking attendant said even if I were one minute over that I'd have to pay the full price for the next hour. I advised that their clocks were off and the attendant understood that I wasn't going to back down and that I have proof so the extra cost for the additional hour was not charged. 

In years past, the Golden Nugget gave the first 3 hours free so it was never an issue with their fake clock settings - I never stayed more than 3 hours. However, within the last few years, there are no longer any free parking downtown and now the Golden Nugget have changed their parking fees accordingly. There is no longer free parking for the first 3 hours unless you stay at the casino or eat in their restaurants. No problem with that - at least have correct clock settings in the parking structure and not try to game your customers dishonestly. This has been going on for more than 20 years so is not an isolated occurrence. 

Bottom line - you will be cheated out of your money if you don't pay attention even if you don't gamble at this casino.

The Golden Nugget is so nice! 
It's clean, it's not smoke filled and we had a blast in the pool! 
We stayed in a Gold Club room and loved how clean and quiet it was. There were some signs of wear in the bathroom...someone left behind some fingernail polish on the granite counter top...hope they were charged for the damage! But no big deal...it didn't effect our enjoyment of the LCD TV in the mirror of the bathroom. 
The view from our room was of the pool and the new (in construction phase) tower. Not all that impressive but if a view is important to you then stay at Red Rock Canyon! 
The Gold Club room floors are only accessed by key card from the elevators and are supplied with bottled water, coffee and tea and open refreshments of jelly beans, chocolate covered raisins, m-n-m's, trail mix, and fruit such as apples and bananas. It was nice to have these available just outside of the elevator. 
Food at the Golden Nugget restaurants was very good; except the buffet...it was just so-so; edible just not that exciting. However, the pizza at the Grotto was to die for. It had a nice thin crust and it was nice-n-bubbly hot from the oven; a very Neapolitan style pizza, yum! Plus, the coffee from the Grotto rocked! I especially liked their service of "sugar-in-the-raw" for my coffee...couldn't find this stuff anywhere else in Vegas...weird! 
The Valet service was fantastic. They worked extremely hard in some extreme temperatures for some extreme crowds and did a great job! 
OK, on to the "construction issues"...yes, they are undergoing some construction of a new tower and some of the streets are closed, etc...deal with it peeps! If there wasn't some sort of construction or deconstruction going on, would it really be Vegas?! 
The Fremont Street experience is a hoot and I love "Old Downtown". Next time you go, stay at the Nugget. You will be pleasantly surprised! 
This is where I will go and stay time and again!

very unhappy, They misrepresent themselves, 1) they advertise they are on Fremont street when in fact you have to walk blocks to get to Fremont street from your hotel room to parking to Fremont street --- they say it is a short distance when in fact it is a huge distance --- to much for an older person to walk --- which means you are trapped in your room or in the casino --- if you do have the energy and strength to walk to Fremont street
they force you to walk through and by every slot machine & gambling device in the casino twice going each way to tempt you to gamble. The Hotel\/Casino got rid of its good home cooking restaurants with good food and only have commercialized expensive chain restaurant crap food now --- the same chain restaurants that I can get ripped off going to in Los Angeles, no incentive to go to Las Vegas --- just stay home--- we have Indian casinos here with better food ---- also Las Vegas dot com switched our hotel without our permission--- I asked for the four queens and they gave us the golden nugget they gave the excuse later that they are owned by the same people ---- but they are still not the same hotel even if they are owned by different people --- the four queens is a small old style home like casino with its own restaurant and the golden nugget is a huge commercialized piece of shit that is so big that an older person is not able to walk it and is a prisoner of their room or the area around their room where they can walk. 2) The second thing the golden nugget has a balcony over looking Fremont street, 
where you can order drinks and eat and watch the band and activities below--- somehow they purposely turned up the heat on this balcony so it was intolerable to sit on it because it was to hot---- when we complained they lied and said it was just the Las Vegas heat and said we should come inside and sit at the gambling tables where it was cool ----thinking we were stupid hicks from out of town or something and trying to manipulate us into gambling and losing all our money. WE WENT OUTSIDE ACROSS THE STREET TO THE PATIO BAR AT THE HORSESHOE CASINO AND THEY HAD A COOL MIST OF WATER SPRAYING ON EVERYONE IN THE BAR AND THEIR DRINKS AND FOOD WERE CHEAPER---- also the temperature on Fremont street when we walked up to the other band in front of the golden gate casino was just fine ---- no problem --- also they have no place to sit on Fremont so the only place you can sit down is inside at the gambling tables where you will lose all your money. They did not build all those expensive casinos with winners ONLY LOSERS ---- I would like to complain that all I got was manipulated and lied to most everywhere I went with my experience in Las Vegas, even the outlet center is no longer outlet stores but just a regular shopping center with regular prices but they misrepresent themselves as giving a discount when they don't ---- they also charge a rip off resort fee --- added to your bill ---- except at places like the embassy suites or motel six ------ Hilton hotels do not charge resort fees or chain hotels do not ---- only casino\/hotels that work you and try to rip you off for money from the moment you enter the city -------- the food sucks in vegas now -- just commercialized restaurant chains with mass production food ---- nothing special anymore, plus there are no good shows anymore in Vegas, no first rated groups or celebrities----- just second rate crap shows with above average prices ------- THE BANDS OB FREMONT STREET WERE OUTSTANDING AND THE MOB MUSEUM
WERE REALLY GOOD -------- the rooms were expensive and the location of the towers sucked--- the amount of walking to get anywhere was ridiculous----in fact older people could not do it ---- many of them sitting around unable to walk the huge distance required to get from rooms to Fremont street

We were celebrating my sons 30th Birthday. We bought the rooms on Living Social. Great deal. We Stayed in the Rush tower. The rooms are nice and we got lots of free stuff with our rooms. Show Tickets, Spa, ect.

Super cool place, 1 of the originals super neat as the decor and architecture show the age of the times when it was built which is neat to see after being in the newer casinos\/resorts for most of the week.

The service was great, the prices on food, drinks, and gambling much more realistic than on the main strip.  Beer\/Drinks around $5-$6 vs $10-$17 on the strip so huge difference.  The table minimums are much much lower than the strip also.  Neat place to go to get away from the strip for a while. Cab ride over from the strip under $20 so worth it.

Amazing, amazing, amazing! That would best sum up my stay the Golden Nugget! My husband & I stayed here during our visit to Vegas & had the most incredible time on Fremont (old Vegas as they say)  prefered it so much more than being on the strip! The exciting atmosphere, live bands, extreme people watching and best of all its right on your doorstep should you decide to stay at the Nuggs! The room was lovely, very clean, service exceptional, buffet delicious & lastly the pool --  I mean what's vegas without a mega water slide running through the middle of a shark tank right?! Epic! Fantastic stay, highly recommended & well priced too

The front desk area is confusing. It's never clear which queue to line up. The mail\/keys\/assistance queue might seems short but there is usually only one person (or two max). The queue to the registration side is almost always full. Just spent an hour and got nowhere. A couple of the electric outlets didn't work on day one. They fixed one the next day. (One didn't work at all for 5 days.) The in-room safe failed on the second day. Apparently the battery popped out; that wasted 20 minutes of my time. House-keeping is good though.

Since Las Vegas does not have a waterpark anymore , and after seeing the pool on the travel channel I decided to play tourist and stay at a casino with a decent pool. It was either golden nugget or Mandalay bay. Well the rates where insane at Mandalay bay at 229 a night so we decided on the golden nugget. Now all the reviews said take the rush tower but since I wanted to stretch my money out I decided more economically and went with the Carson tower @ $45 a night including tax we were able to stay two nights for under $100 ( after all we were there for the pool) Well the Carson tower is also renovated , came with a flat screen and plush comfortable beds. I was amazed!! The pool was crowded but amazing so relaxing. I recommend golden nugget to anyone weather you live here or are visiting. Can't wait to do it again!

I have stayed at the Nugget several times over the past several years as I like the Fremont experience over the Strip. The service over my stays have always been inconsistent. Over Memorial Day weekend 2013, I payed an enormous amount for a Spa Tower Pool View suite. It wasn't ready for check-in when I arrived, which was fine as they told me they would call when it was ready. They hadn't called by 5:00pm, so when I returned to the VIP check-in, the manager rudely told me that there were no guarantees on check-in times, and they would call me when the room was ready. I finally got to check-in after 6:15pm. I wrote off that experience due to the busy Memorial Day weekend. However, after my last visit on 6\/13\/2014, I think I'll to stay elsewhere. I booked a Gold Tower suite and it was a slower weekend, so check-in was no problem and the room seemed fine. I was only staying one night for a quickie trip, as I often do. But when I got up to get ready for my early flight, I was covered with bed bug bites. I had no time to contact management due to my 9am flight, but based on past reviews, I doubt it would have mattered.

i love me some Golden Nugget action.....the wife and i made it a habit to walk across the street to Golden Nugget every morning(and noon and night) and letting them give us money....a lucky, classy place....very refined yet fun....just avoid the guys in suits at the corner entrance....i hate people trying to lure you with a "free meal or show" just to end up trying to sell you some crappy timeshare.....! p.s....they have a starbuckss if you need some coffee to fuel your gaming

Our trip to Old Vegas was interesting and the Golden Nugget was a great surprise. 

After checking out all of the Fremont Street Experience we got to the Nugget and were immediately impressed. We had heard that the Nugget was coming off a recently completed renovation and it showed. Everything was very new...the slots, the tables, the chips, the carpets, the pool, the restaurants...well some of the drink gals werent exactly new, but it was all very nice. We took a peek at the pool area and were really impressed by the shark tank water slide as well as the pool side tables with the dealers in lifeguard gear. We played some $5 blackjack which is always nice and messed around on the slots. 

Personally, I think that staying and playing here would be a great idea if you're not planning to leave here at all since Downtown is a complete and total shitshow and Im certain that in the near future we'll do just that.

I used to love the golden nugget I was playing there and a man came up to me talking about he needs 15 dollars and will be back . I told security they just look at me and did nothing great property but there is a lot of people from machine to table asking for money I don't know if I will never good back

Some will say "why did you give this place 5 stars: it's downtown and not super nice".


Well 1) it is the ONLY place to stay downtown. This is a classy nice hotel - which is the only thing that fits that description downtown (try the four queens and redefine ghetto). They are sinking billions into it since it's under a new owning company, and the restaurants are unbelievable along with the buffet. 

2)not classy? see above, and stop being uptight. while I would prefer to stay on the strip if i went to vegas, if i had to stay downtown this would be the only place that crossed my mind.

After deciding last minute to add an extra night on our Vegas vacation, we came to find that due to the AVN awards and the electronics show that our original hotel was sold out. We had no other choice than the Golden Nugget or the Stratosphere. "It wont be that bad", my boyfriend said trying to cheer me up, "they just remodeled". Ha! What a joke. We couldn't wait to get the hell out of the place. 

First off, when we made our reservations we were never told that as a "Rush Tower" guest we had our own private entrance and reception desk. So there goes half the fun right out the window. When we arrived in our room I was shocked by how hip and modern the remodel appeared to be, "yea, this isn't so bad" I assured myself. Well in just a few short moments that thought was gone. First our shower head didn't work. At all. A quick call to maintenance and a pot-bellied work horse was attempting to fix our shower head. Sexy huh? Oh I'm in the Vegas mood now! 45 minutes later, he got it working. Next we decided to order a movie to find the speakers were blown out on the TV, so our film sounded like a 3rd grader trying to talk into a microphone where they insist on shoving their mouths into it. A quick call to the front desk and our movie was refunded. On our way out to hit the strip, we walked through the casino and the fake facade of decadence to find that their sushi restaurant smelled of grandpas feet meets back alley fish slaughter house. I cant imagine anyone would have eaten there. They next morning we were awoken at 7am to the lovely tapping of the housekeeper trying to get into our room. 7am, seriously? Finally, ready to leave to go check into a real hotel, we though hey, lets go use our private valet where there is no line! Nope, they very rudely explained to us that since we originally checked in at the main desk, that's where we had to go. 35 minutes later, we had our car and sped away leaving tire marks behind us. Never, ever again.

For a relaxing, old school Vegas adventure, The Golden Nugget is the place to be.  This hotel has been renovated and is as good as any hotel on the strip (just smaller and less expensive).  All the staff were very helpful and friendly, had a room available for me at 9 a.m. when I arrived, I was expecting to have to check my luggage an check-in later.  The Grotto Italian Restaurant is fabulous.  Best amenity is the Shark Tank pool by far.  We rented a cabana for one of the days (Hideout Premium Cabana) and was the best experience.  Highly recommended!  It has it's own pool (16+ and older only), on the 3rd level near the slide entrance.  Just a few things to note:  The chilled towels and fresh fruit amenity are tiny (both can fit in the palm of your hand, seriously), but we received WONDERFUL service and had $75 food and drink credit.  If you get Melinda as your attendant, she is great and makes fabulous recommendations.

Other things to note for the hotel in general: states they do not charge a resort fee, which they do not charge but there is a $5.00 daily downtown fee.  Still way cheaper than what they charge on the strip.  Take your own kcup coffees!  Every room has a single cup coffee maker BUT there is a $10 charge for the little 4pack kcups in the room.  ATM charges a service fee of $3.50 per transaction so be prepared.

Overall, the Golden Nugget is HIGHLY recommended.

Let me preface this with the fact that I hate Vegas.  I think it exemplifies and amplifies the worst things about American culture - greed, excess, overconsumption, etc.

But, at least the Golden Nugget is downtown and not as bad as the strip.  They have a pretty cool shark tank that's in the middle of a swimming pool, and that was kinda nice to walk by.  The casino itself is a casino, and I found out that all of the dealers are unionized and making good money with plenty of breaks.  I found the staff to be the most interesting part of the Hotel experience because they came from all over the world, and had interesting stories to share.  

The rooms themselves were ok, like Holiday Inn ok.

No complaints.  For the money its a deal.  Shower was amazing, they have a cool pool with a shark tank you can take a water slide through.  

Great location for downtown and friendly staff.

Best place to stay in Vegas.  The Hotel\/Casino is completely renovated and is very classy and hip.  Perfect location on Freemont street.  Downtown Vegas with its party\/mardi gras atmosphere is the place to stay these days, the Strip has become such a bore.  The Golden Nugget is the crown jewel of Freemont street.  The only complaint that I have is that "The tank" - the pool area is waaaaaaay too small for the number of people staying in the hotel.  All of the chairs are taken by 11:00, so don't even think about trying to get a lounge chair if you are later getting out to the pool.  They do have another teeny pool on the third floor, but they charge additional for a chair there (and even those were all taken).  That said, the pool is a great atmosphere, especially at night when you can sit outside by the firepit and enjoy a couple of over-priced cocktails...but the view is worth it.

Pay $700+ for a four night stay and told valet is full and to park BLOCKS away!! Then told that parking is not "guaranteed"!! And to boot Ado the "manager" on duty acted as if he didn't give a crap!! How about customer service!!!! Bath tub has rust all over... I get it, it's Thanksgiving and you can gouge!!! But when you act like you don't give a crap, you lost my

As good as it gets. We stayed Tuesday thru Friday and couldn't have asked for a better time. The Rush Tower is wonderful. We have stayed at the Nugget numerous times in the past but never in the Rush Tower, wife and I were blown away. As always the staff went out of thier way to address any issues. HIGHLY reccomend Golden Nugget for any downtown Vegas visitor. Doesn't get any better!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This place used to be so ghetto. I came here for a wedding and it was SO clean. Their loft suites look right over fremont street with an amazing view at night. If you haven't been here in a while give it a chance! That is if you can live with being off the strip! One thing I love about this place is I can walk to my room with minimal casino traversing time. In bigger hotels it seems like it takes forever to get thorough the casino floor.

Absolutely love this hotel, we stay here every year and we wouldn't want to be anywhere else. the pool is awesome, the restaurants in the hotel are great, we always enjoy the buffet. drinks are cheap and the games are fun.

Can I give a no star review!? 

I was so disappointed with this hotel! I've stayed a few places on Fremont street and this was by far the worst! My husband and I are local, we came to Golden Nugget about a month ago to tour their suites because we planned on getting married in one of them. The bellman Paul was awesome and showed them all to us and gave us tons of tips to make our day go smoothly. He can have 5 stars for sure!

We booked the Spa Suite for one night. Paid well over $800.00 for a pool view suite and expected great service which we did not receive at all. We were told when booking that we could try to check in as early as 12pm and would have our room by 3pm for sure. So we made all our wedding arrangements starting at 3:30 knowing we'd be in our room by then. 

We tried checking in at noon and our room wasn't ready, which was okay. They said they'd call us when it was. 3pm came around and we went to the VIP to check in and they said our room still wasn't ready. Confused we said "Isn't 3pm check in time for all rooms?" And the front desk girl said they start check in and 3pm and there was nothing they could do and we'd have to wait until our room was cleaned. Frustrated and starting to panic because we had all sorts of appointments lined up for hair, makeup, officiant, family and friends coming we asked if we can just get into the room and start getting ready and the maids can clean around us since we were on a time crunch and expected and was told our room would be ready by the CHECK IN time. They said no and argued for a bit back and forth about it, finally they agreed to put us in a different room temporarily to start getting ready and then they'd call us when our suite was ready. 

They phoned us at 4:45 that our room was ready. Almost two hours AFTER "check-in" time. We rushed into a room to see the temperature was set at 88 and it was boiling in there. We had to rush to get ready, while sweating and melting in our clothes, and rush to get married. Our day was still great because we got married, but it was way more stressful and we were extremely uncomfortable as well as our guests also from being so hot. It took a few hours to cool the room down, which we wanted to start doing at 3pm when they told us we could check in no matter what. 

We also called for a few extra champagne glasses and ice, since you have to call for ice and there are no ice machines on the spa suite tower floors. It took an hour and half to have those brought to our room. 

We paid extra for a pool view so we could have a better view of the city since we planned on getting married in front of the windows. Once we got into our room, we did not have a pool view, all we could see was the ugly roof the Fremont Street Experience. We asked if we could be reimbursed for some of our room since we didn't even get to be in it the whole time and it was the wrong room, and they said no. So we asked for late checkout , they said we could have one extra hour to check out. 

Overall, I'm not one to complain, but when paying A LOT of money, being told 10 different things from different people, and them doing NOTHING to solve any of their errors or problems, I will never stay there or gamble there again or refer anyone else there. 

We are local, and we love going downtown to hang out with friends and guests, we love staying downtown as well. Golden Nugget just left a sour taste in my mouth. I've paid 40 bucks a night on Fremont and had fantastic customer service. This was by far the worst hotel stay in my entire life. 

We spent two nights after this night at Golden Gate in their suite and had a great time! Golden Gate is my go to place for Fremont Street. They really do go out of their way to make you feel right at home.

Fremont street has gotten trashy. Whores\/ homeless\/ beggars. Overhead show wasn't worth the wait and has gotten worse. Hotel was terrible. Checked into our room( 1\/4 mile walk). Smelled strong odor of bleach. After unpacking could smell vomit. Had to buy a candle for odor. Was woken up with banging of work be done above our room. Called manager. No response back after a hour. Then the blow dryer didn't work. After requesting new one we waited another hour no response. Checked out as quickly as we could to go to different hotel. Wouldn't recommend.

I spend 3 nights in the upgraded "Rush Tower" of the Golden Nugget and it was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on.  The room was also very modernized and gorgeous.  Definitely the best place to stay in Old Vegas.  The pool called "The Tank" was amazing.

Even though this is far off from the heart of Las Vegas (The Strip), the rooms are nice, the lobby is nice, and the pool is amazing! 

I don't like the fact they have sharks in the aquarium in the middle of the pool, but everything else they have is beautiful. The water slide is neat. 

Fitness is included and you're a step away from the Fremont Experience. It's a nice spot if you don't want to be surrounded by too many tourists.

My kids and husband love the swimming pool.  It was uniquely build around this massive salt water aquarium with sharks and lots of big fish.  There was even a water slide that goes thru the the fish tank.. my 7 year old daughter loved it.  We would definitely go there again for the pool..  PLus for a weekday rate of $49\/day it was a great bargain.

Rooms have been recently renovated and are excellent and spacious. However, there is a daily resort fee that doubled the rate that was advertised (which was pretty cheap). Check the bottom line before committing. The coupons they give you are also misleading, most of them require a two-for-one, and if you are traveling alone, that makes them worthless.

The facility was nice. The casino was nice. The shark pool side was closed, so that was a bummer. That was a major attraction for me. The tub had a 'bathfitter' feeling too it. But the room was fine other than that. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is great, because I am tired of the strip and would rather be around Fremont. You could do much worse in that area..

HAD BED BUGS
The room we stayed in had bed bugs.  We did not realize we had been bitten until we got home.  My friend and I came from 2 different states on 2 different planes.  Now I realize this isn't necessesarily an indication of cleanliness however was NOT impressed with how their "RISK" Dept. handled it.  After they verified the room had "bug activity" in both our beds,  it was insinuated we could have brought them.They claim they only found one bug but that's doubtful as my friend and I both had over 100 bites.  Never once did Richard from the RISK Dept. apologize that this happened but even after I called back twice there was never a return call.  At the very least they could have returned our $ from the stay.  We both put out several hundred $$'s in prevention methods ie; bed bug covers ect..... And we still live with the fear we could have brought them home because it's just been a month.  Avoid this place like the plague!  There are plenty of nicer places to stay in Las Vegas.  Have stayed at the MGM Grand twice and can guarantee this would have been handled differently there as that's a classy place unlike the Nugget.

A great casino in downtown Vegas, with all the amenities and then some. A swimming pool with a shark tank slide? Yes, I said it. A larger hotel and casino yet enough excitement to get your into the Vegas vibe.

Their sports betting area is one of the best in downtown so if you are an avid sports watcher, you might as well place a bet. 

The rooms are clean and comfortable. This hotel seems to always have specials on rooms. So instead of paying 100$ a night at a crappier hotel on the strip go downtown and stay in a nice hotel for under 100$ a night.

Stayed at the Golden Nuggett on Sunday thru Wednesday the end of June 2015, for my daughter's wedding, and was lied to by a man behind the desk in the Rush tower.  He told me that my room I reserved wasn't ready yet, but he could give me an upgrade for $40 total. After standing in an hour long taxi line at the airport in 114 degree weather, I agreed just to get into some air conditioning.   I signed the "check in" paper when he put it in front of me and was handed my room keys.  When I checked out on the last day I was charged $85 a day for the upgrade instead of the $40 I was quoted.  After being sent to another tower to talk to a manager, she said you signed the paper that said $85!  I told her what the man quoted me, and she said well, you signed it, so that's what we are charging you.... so my bill was $66 a day + $85 more a day for the upgrade without my knowledge of that amount of money being charged.  There was no apology, just coldness on the part of the manager who seemed to care less that I was lied to.  I read a lot of the yelp reviews on this hotel, and it seems like a lot of people had the same problem with them! Buyer beware... never sign a document that you haven't read every inch of no matter how small the size of the print, or how long it takes you to stand there and read it.  I will never stay at that hotel again.. I will go back to the Strip next time I visit Las Vegas.   They also have huge parking lots for people that don't want to deal with lousy elevators in a parking structure.

Very nice property. It was very busy as there were a lot of people walking around and the pool was packed. We couldn't park in their garage. Only hotel guests with a key could check in. I guess it was very busy, so that is understandable. We had to park at the parking lot in Main Street about 1 block away. $5 to park but the walk was not bad.

I'd say that the place is a very nice place downtown. Worth the millions of dollars of renovation. Not smokey at all. Lots of nice restaurants and bars\/lounges. Plus the pool with the large skate tank was real cool. Supposedly one of the too best pools in America.

Wow!  After years of down economy, the Golden Nugget has decided to start a $5 fee for it's guests to help pay it's share of the Fremont Street Experience show.

Citing what many of the Strip properties get away with, they justify the fee to it's guests.  Without any question, the GN is the nicest property Downtown, and thus the issue.

It's Downtown guys, not the strip....The Fremont Expereince has probably saved many of the properties by getting people to come take in the free show.  What percentage of those guests park, see the show and then immediately leave?  Probably not too many.  Most will drink, shop, oh and maybe gamble while there, dontcha think?

Let me give you my two cents:
You feel you need to be the first to put in a fee?  Think the others will follow?  Do yourself a favor if you are not bringing in enough revenue, just build it into your room rates, not as an additional fee.  Which will be better received?  Hellllloooo?  Duh.

Start with the fee?  You just lost a fan and a guest, out of principle I will never stay, shop, eat or gamble in your house.  Why bother?  Lots of other casinos in the area that are less stuffy, a little more roomy,  and are more affordable in the drinks area.  Whoever thought of this one should be canned.  Be smarter.

This place was very nice! The atmosphere was very happy and friendly! I recently visited the Golden Nugget on Fremont when I visited Vegas in Feb. 2014! For the first time ever! It was very nice clean, would definately go back again soon!

Meh. Just okay. Outdated rooms. $15 WiFi. Really??? Called for a bellhop and waited at least 15 minutes. And although it's not the hotel's fault, there was loud construction outside at 3 in the morning. Not very conducive to sleeping. We only stayed here because we got a good deal, but I wouldn't stay here again.

I LOVE the Golden Nugget. End of story.

Okay, okay. I'll tell you a little more. First of all, I love downtown Vegas because it feels like the LV of Elvis and Priscilla and I'm all about that. Also, if you have access to a car to take you to and from the strip, staying downtown is definitely a more economical choice. Plus, the old school vibe of Fremont Street is hard to beat.

When staying at the Golden Nugget, I recommend the rooms in the Rush Tower. They are newly renovated, modern, spacious and really comfortable. 

Oh, and let's not forget that pool. You see, the Golden Nugget's pool is world famous and is one of the coolest things I've ever seen. A glass water slide that goes right through the shark tank located in the middle of the pool? Yep, they have it. If sharks aren't your thing, the GN now has a new pool for the 16+ crowd upstairs. 

As a self-proclaimed pool gal (who lives in Las Vegas, no less), take my word for it and stay at the Golden Nugget. You can thank me later.

This used to be my favorite hotel but the last two times I have been to Vegas it's been terrible.  The last time the pool and hot tub were closed for scheduled maintenance but the schedule was not communicated to guests before we arrived.  Now they charge a resort fee so internet is free, but the internet is 2MB unless you want to upgrade for $10.  The last few times we have checked in, they have lost the authorization for the credit card that booked the room (we come for work so the client books the Nugget at our request) We have had to put our personal credit card down and then both us AND the client get charged and then we have to sort it out with the credit card company and Nugget customer service after the fact.  This time not only did that happen but I was told there were no more king rooms but I was told I could upgrade, normally for $60 but tonight for half off.  Between the two inconveniences I was so annoyed that I asked to speak with a manager, and suddenly there was a king available.  I ALWAYS stay here when I'm in Las Vegas, but now I'm going to start looking for a new favorite. :\/

2 nights in April. This place is much nicer than the other casinos in Downtown but this place really isn't up to the strip caliber. Rooms are sort of like a Motel 6 feel but with extras like flat screen, special drapery hangings. But they still have cottage cheese ceilings, ugly colored wall paper wraparounds instead of crown molding, weird bathroom fixtures.  Kind of like the fasionista guy that designed the interiors lives in El Paso Texas but is "fabulous" there. When I arrived the first thing I found was a wet used hand towel on the bathroom floor.  Coffee usage is $!0 so not free. Water is $7.00. Parking is $2 per hour compared to free on the strip unless you happen to have a room key.  Front service desk people are on the rude side of helpful and scribble you room number down without explaining that the numbers they give you like 41120 is not actually the 41st floor but a weird room numbering system on the 4th floor.  You can walk around for a half an hour until you can find someone to help with directions. My room was as far away from the front desk as you could get meaning sore feet from walking. The only positive aspect of staying downtown are people watching the bizarro people posing for photography and for money dressed up as the big bobbed hooker, or chippendales dancers, Kiss. etc. Good Hawaiian food in the other hotels nearby.

Love this Freemont Street downtown hotel"

We love this place. The staff is wonderful! It's also easy entertainment downtown, everything is so much closer than on the strip. They have live music on Freemont Street almost every night and you can go in and out of other casinos and restaurants without the cost of cab fare.

The only complaint we had was the room doors close really loud -- you can hear them slamming all day and night, far louder than the Freemont street experience.

Liked -- 2 starbucks on site
Disliked -- doors slamming loudly
Stayed many times, traveled as a couple

I chose to stay here because I was in Las Vegas for a friend's birthday.  He and others chose to get a penthouse apartment on AirB&B, and we stayed a few blocks away.  Now, in the interest of full disclosure, I really don't like vacationing in Las Vegas.  Just not my thing.

On walking in, there was the obligatory forced march through the smoky casino with absent\/worthless signage to find the registration desk, which was in a hot lobby with 50 people in line.  There were two people working the desk.  Note to Hotel Management: If those people are standing in line, they're not spending money at your hotel and they're going to write scathing reviews.

Check-in was painless.  I was prepared for the obligatory $25 "resort" fee.  At least internet is free.  Oh wait, LOL, you want *working* internet?  That's $10\/day.   Really, just charge me the room rate up front and I'll pay it, but the nickling-and-diming is just offensive.

A call to the front desk to ask "where's the gym?"  (Not obvious in materials in-room) had me going to a different tower.  I'm a reasonably serious gym rat and this gym is really sub-par.  There was a tiny weight room with three people in it and that made it far too crowded.  There was no floor space for things like lunges or burpees, let alone skaters or anything involving any movement.  There was also a tiny cardio room with some treadmills, a few pump-type stairmaster, and some exercycles (not even proper spin bikes).  

The bed is comfy, although a Queen comes with two pillows and a pillow roll.  The rooms in the Carson Tower are 1994 chique, but clean and comfortable enough.  Think your generic Marriott or Westin.  

If you like crazy crowd scenes (I personally don't), it is right on the Carson Street Experience, which is roofed in an LED screen vaulted over the street and full of your drunken fellow citizens.  

Frankly, if you're going to spend this kind of money for "The Las Vegas Experience," go to the South Strip.

Stayed here this weekend and have nothing but good things to say about the hotel! Lost power on Saturday (we understand things happen) and James at the front desk adjusted our room rate for the inconvenience. Thanks James! Beds were comfy, room was clean, and the pool\/ water slide was a ton of fun,

My friends from Hawaii stayed at the GN. Suite was nice, food was excellent, gambling was so so(video poker was maybe the worst as far as downtown is concerned, super bad paytables). Gina sent up fruit and chocolate. She has always been the best. Pizza at Grotto's is excellent,  ask for Angela.

This is one of my favorite Hotels in Vegas! Always encourage my friends and family to try it out atleast one\/two nights of their stay! 

The casino is just the right size--not too big and not too small. The poker room isn't the greatest but its not the worst either! If you are gambling, servers are really good about bringing you beverages here at this casino! Rush Lounge, right off of the casino is awesome to just sit relax and have a drink while listening to some live music free! Make sure you get to see "Harry as Elvis" and his band play...They are GREAT!!! 
 
There is an awesome sushi restaurant! Vic and Anthony's is a very yummy steakhouse if you're looking for fine dining! The Habachi Grill isn't bad either! There is a fabulous Chocolate Shoope in the lobby too when youre craving a something sweet! Dont expect anything too crazy awesome from a hotel buffet.... just saying... it is a buffet! 

The pool is very relaxing--lounge chairs you can sit in the pool with while you watch the sharks\/fishy swimming in the tank! The pool area is relatively small considering some of the other hotel's pools, there is plenty of shade or sun if you find the right place. Drink girls are walking arounc constantly with food and drink items for sale--you can play blackjack and watch some ESPN poolside. There are children running around due to the slide that runs through the center of "The Tank" But besides this... it's not a bad pool. 

Located in Downtown "old vegas" on Freemont Street. Freemont street is it's own world! You will see it all here! This is where you will find all of your impersonators, talent acts, show girls, girls dancing on the tables, etc. etc. Here you will see what you expect to see in Vegas!

Every January me and my friend stay at the Golden Nugget for CES, we pick downtown Vegas because it's away from the busy Las Vegas strip traffic. CES tops 150,000 visitors during this week.  The freeway entrance is very close to this hotel.  The LV Convention Center isn't more than a 15 minute drive on the freeway.

The Golden Nugget Hotel in downtown Vegas is small compared to the Las Vegas Strip Hotels. You have less cars and less people, this is the place if you can't deal with that.  I like this hotel because the parking lot (Carson Towers) is closer than any of the strip hotels. The walk from parking lot to room is within 5+ minutes. If you go out (back and forth) a lot than this makes it easy.  I think this is still faster than a valet at a Strip Hotel, which is what I would do if I was on the LV Strip with my family.

If you are looking for glitter and glitz don't go here.  This hotel isn't a Red Rock and not the most romantic hotel, but the rooms are actually nice and maintained.  I don't normally see many kids at this hotel walking around. There isn't any arcade or kid friendly things here.  If you have a family I would pick a different hotel. For business or friends trip this hotel is great for that. 

Also being in downtown is very strategic, meaning easy to get around in a car.  With easy freeway access, we actually can get to hotels like Venetian, MGM, Chinatown pretty quick avoiding congestion. 

Some Tips: 

1) They have a breakfast buffet on the 2nd floor and a restaurant on the first floor.  The breakfast\/brunch is pretty good at both places.  Never had dinner here.  

2) They have a Keurig Coffee maker, make sure you bring your own K-cups. We always stop at the market for a case of 24 bottles of water for coffee and drinking. 

3) They have a beautiful shark aquarium in the middle of their swimming pool. This is a nice place to get a drink and relax, but in January it is cold!  

4) Get on their Email mailing list.  During the month there seems to be a coupon deal, like by get 2 meals for 1, drink coupons, etc. 

I gave it a 4 star for Downtown Las Vegas, but the only place I would stay in downtown Vegas.

The pool was a big hit with my 13 year old...and that is where the positive ends. Sardines have more room to move than taking a lounge at the pool. The only offer bottle beers, no drafts = no value. 

They started charging a resort fee as of the first of the year. They try to sell it as a benefit since you get the pool, two bottles of water a day, and limited internet access. Conveniently they forgot to mention that coffee in the room costs $10 and there is no hairdryer. I just left a hotel in Laughlin that cost $18 per night but it had a blow dryer and a fraction of the people at the pool. 

I am moving to the Fremont across the street tomorrow as the resort fee plus an increased rate on a Wednesday(?) priced me out of here. Cost was almost triple Tuesday night...fine with me.

The pool is insane. It states it doesn't open til 10 but what you need to know is that you need to be down there at 7am to get a chair!!! I went down there at 10am and there were no more chairs or towels. 

The slide is the best. 

The pool is waaayyy to small... if you're planning on spending the dsay at the pool.. go somewhere with a larger pool :) 

The service within the hotel is great. Very friendly staff.

I was very dissapointed with my stay.  I live in California and have been coming to Las Vegas 2 to 3 times per year for the last 15 years and I aways stay at the Golden Nugget.  Since the remodel and additions, it is very noticable that the Carson Tower does not get the same attention as past years.  1) When I made my reservations over the phone, the agent told me about the Downtown Resort Fee.  He also told me that if I gamble with my 24 Carat Club card and eat at a restaraunt in the hotel, that this fee will be comp'd, but it wasn't. Instead the check out agent told me that it doesn't work that way. What ever happended to good customer service. This is only at $15 charge and the hotel would rather stick it to the guests than have a bad review and potentially lose the business of others reading this review.  I know I won't be back  2) I called housekeeping for a blanket. After 3 hours I called them back.  They told me that they would take care of it immediately.  It took 1 hour. 3) The rooms always had refrigerators but now you have to rent them.  The hotel claims that they never had refrigerators in the Carson Tower. I guess I was special.  4) The shower walls and bathroom floors had Mold in the grout all over. 5) Housekeeping never replenished the shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, etc. I had to buy shampoo and conditioner at the ABC store. 6) I tried to use the fitness center but you now have to pay to use it.

For me, it is a lot less expensive to stay at another hotel on Fremont Street and pay the coverage charge to get into the "Tank".

Stayed in rush tower from July 3-8. Ice machine on the floor was broken the whole time. Called many of times and all I got was they were going to contact maintenance.  Just was frustrating going up and down a floor for the trek to get ice when u splurge for an upgrade. Let alone the other patrons on the elevator giving you the evil eye for an extra stop. Besides that irritating detail, good stay in Freemont.

This was our first time staying at the Nugget (June 2013), though we are no stranger to downtown Vegas hotels (RIP Binions...). The rate through Hotels.com was very attractive for an early June weekend, so we jumped on it. Overall it was just fine, superbly located for hanging around downtown, hitting the East Fremont hipsterville, and for shooting down to hot Strip hotels via the Industrial\Frank Sinatra\Dean Martin\Harmon shortcuts that avoid all traffic, even on a Saturday night. The hotel was clean, the room (in the older but cheaper and much quieter Carson Tower) was just fine (old school furnishings but in good shape), the access to the parking structure from the Carson Tower elevators was quick and easy, they had no problem with us bringing in a big cooler, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the atmosphere was laid back and a nice break from Fremont, which can look like a downscale Wal-Mart with slot machines at times. I'll definitely consider the Nugget for our next Vegas getaway

To be honest, we didn't gamble much here, given that other places within a short stroll have lower minimums (El Cortez), better rules (Golden Gate for craps, El Cortez for BJ and looser slots), faster free drinks (Mermaids), and more lively action (The D, Golden Gate). Still, it was nice to have a quiet drink in one of the Nugget's "less smoke" bars and mindlessly play a little video poker now and then.

I would caution you about the pool, however. Even though the Nugget touts its pool as the gem of downtown, the lounge area is way too small for the number of people who use it, even on a Friday or Monday. Lounges fill up even before the pool opens, primarily by people who dump their towels and books to "reserve" a spot for the whole day, even if they've gone elsewhere. There are a lot of kids running around due to the Shark Tank slide, kids I never saw in the hotel at other times so I suspect that they are non-guests, and it's a noisy experience. Alas, bringing outside booze and food are strictly forbidden. A quieter and smaller "adult" pool is available, but you have to pay $20 to get one of the lounges (very lame).
