Both pools are often in the shadow of the Rush Tower, and the lower one gets stuffy because it sits in a hole surrounded by four buildings. I live in the SoCal desert and have my own pool so I didn't need to spend much time at the Nugget's, but when I lived in L.A. and used to come to Vegas primarily for the pleasure of laying out by the water, having a beer, and getting a tan and a nap to recharge before going crazy at night, I would have not enjoyed the Nugget as a pool destination. Even The D's small, spare pool might be a better choice if you want to avoid screaming kids and lounges packed in so close together you can't move them an inch (even if nobody is sitting next to you).

Another problem is weekend parking. The structure is small and barely big enough to handle the guests during the week. Come the weekend though, it fills up quickly with both guests and visitors, so you can return from the Strip on a Friday night to find that there is no place for you to park. Not good. They close off the structure to non-guests in the early evening but that's too late. Be prepared to have to leave your car with the valet or park on a dark street down the block; if you do, go give the manager a piece of your mind. I did. 

Finally, the Golden Nugget, like many Vegas hotels these days, has gotten smart and ditched the mandatory resort fees that have caused so much negative blowback from travelers, but at the same time has maintained their income streams by charging for Internet access.  It's a ridiculous $13 per 24 hours, which is bad enough, but the charge is also **per device**.  If you are the kind of couple who can't live another minute unless both of your iPads are on the network (thankfully we aren't), plan on dropping $26 a day, which is half of what we paid for the room on a Thursday night. 

But other than those three things, it was fine!


Nick in Palm Springs

The Golden Nugget is a good idea inside a bad idea.  The bad idea is staying off the strip.  The good idea is that if you must do that the Golden Nugget would be my number one choice.

Need a bargain?  $50 a night in the Carson Tower with no resort fee is a Vegas STEAL.  If you've done some research, you're nervous about this recommendation.  Isn't the Carson tower older, you ask?  Yes.  But it's not tacky or dirty.  It's just dated.  But TVs are flatscreen, beds cozy, and the plumbing respectable.  Of course you could upgrade to the Rush Tower, but at $80 a night you're paying strip prices -- and so WHY would you pay strip prices but stay at Freemont?  (Or the Red Rock for that matter.)

Now, suppose you intend to stay at the Carson Tower to save money but cab it to the strip once a day.   Add $40ish a day to do that.  Again, sort of a bad idea, right?

So the only way I'd recommend you staying here is if you had your own car that wasn't a rental.  Then it would add -- what -- $6 in gas a day?  That's not so bad.  Of course now you have the inconvenience of not being able to leisurely drink via a designated cab driver, but maybe that's okay by you too.

So if you follow the advice above, how is the hotel itself?  If you're used to strip mega resorts, the Nugget is refreshingly small.  If you forget something in your room at the Nugget, going back to get it won't take 20 minutes round trip the way it does in most resorts.  Similarly, finding what you need downstairs at the Nugget takes seconds instead of minutes.  Although the decor is kind of dated, it's shiny and 'new' looking.

I've heard awful things about the buffet but there's a great 'diner' inside.   Ten dollars buys you any breakfast you want, which beats most strip buffet breakfasts.  The other restaurants looked decent enough that you wouldn't have to ditch the Nugget for the strip every time hunger hit you.  I tried the Grotto, an uneven Italian spot.  Their pizza was paper thin and sugary tomato sauce... which was odd... because the tomato sauce was significantly better in the pasta dish.  I dined at The Chart House, which was only MEH but then that's all the Chart House has ever really been.  Meh.  There was an amazing aquarium inside this restaurant, but you get a feeling that every time something's a little lame at the Nugget somebody adds swimming fish.

The most over-rated feature of the place was the pool.   Sorry, but it's tiny compared to strip hotels.  In 114 degree weather, that matters.  You don't 'swim' in this pool as much as fight for a space to stand in it and cool off.  People rudely yell and splash as if you're not standing right next to them.  It's a loud obnoxious experience that, for this reviewer, is a deal breaker in summer.  Who gives a crap about sharks in a tank or a waterslide when you can't relax a little in the pool?  That's right:  children.  Oh, and did I mention you'd have better luck finding cheap eats in the Bellagio than a place to sit down in the shade at this pool?  Double deal breaker.

So overall, the Nugget is OK for what and where it is.  But there are so many tricks you have to play to have this make any sense it's just easier to hang on the strip.

My first trip to Vegas and we did it up Old School at the Nugget. We got great rates online and upgraded to the new Rush Tower. Super nice!! Living room area with leather sectional.. two flat screens... great views on both sides. Our friends stayed in the older part but that was nice too. I loved just walking out of the casino onto Fremont Street and into other casinos. All the funkiness of downtown rocks. The "shark tank" pool was really cool and lots of seating. Lots of bars and restaurants too. We had a really good fish and chip dinner at the Carson St. Grill. We ventured all around Vegas but always ended up back at the Nugget... friendly waitresses and strong ass drinks! The Strip? Pfffft. They can keep it.

The only reason I'm giving it one star is because the shark slide is kinda cool. The pool area sucks.  Not even chairs to accommodate the amount of people staying at hotel.. Good luck finding a space.  You have to get down to pool by 900am to put your stuff on a lounge chair, and even then, don't put anything valuable, as it most likely will be moved.  
I had an issue with security.  Someone random person was in my room at 4am.  Apparently my hotel door wasnt closed all the way, or at least thats what they told me.  either way, the way security and risk management handled the situation was pathetic. Honestly they were down right rude.  They said things like, What do you want me to do about it?"  They never follwed up with me, I had to call them.  I had to find out if door was left open- not shut all the way- or someone had key.  They were very unprofessional and do not care about their guests.  I will NEVER stay here again.

I stayed at the Golden Nugget in July 2017 with my family and we enjoyed the stay.

The Golden Nugget is at the end of Fremont Street.  Having stayed at numerous downtown hotels, I feel this is the nicest, cleanest, best maintained hotel of all of them.

The staff were all very friendly and helpful.

The hotel has the famous shark tank pool and water slide.  It's small and is does get crowded, but it's an awesome experience.  There is also a jacuzzi, bar and food service.  The second floor pool is adults only and looked very fun.  The resort also had tons of restaurants, bars, gift shops, etc.

As of this writing the parking is free in the garage if you are guest.  Many of the Vegas hotels are starting another trend of nickle and diming their customers by charging them a parking fee, in addition to the resort fee, in additional to the early check in fee, in addition to the late check out fee, in addition to all the Vegas taxes and fees.  Not sure if the Golden Nugget will do the same in the future.  You may want to ask at booking.

We stayed in the Rush Tower Club Level on the 22nd floor.  The room was awesome.  The room was awesome with contemporary decor.  We had excellent views of the strip.  The room also had a large flat screen television with lots of cable channels and PPV, Keurig coffee maker, mini-fring, safe, iron\/board, desk, and large closet.  The beds and pillow were very comfortable.  The room came with free WIFI with low to medium signal.

The Bathroom was very large, with the toilet in a separate room, double sink, large shower with double shower heads, and a tub.  Bathroom rocked!

This is a great resort if you want to stay Downtown Las Vegas.  You'll love everything about it.  Next time I'm staying Downtown, it will be at the Golden Nugget.

Horrible service, the "newly renovated suites" have some of the worst craftsmanship I have seen in a while. Room was clean, but bad fit and finish. We had electrical issues in our room kept tripping the breaker, which resulted in no bathroom lights. They assured us that we could have a late checkout then reneged. The only thing worth it is the pool, which they closed after a minor incident for the rest of the day, 3pm onward. When asking the manager why the pool was remaining closed, he gave me a lame excuse and was flat out rude to me. Really killed the enjoyment for our last day in Vegas. My Advice, spend the extra $ and stay on the strip.

I must admit the tequila & taco party was great. First and foremost Ivan at the ticket booth was extremely knowledgeable, went above and beyond to make sure me and my wife had a good time, as locals our presence is taken for granted...Ivan did not make us feel that way whatsoever, we're sure to make this a regular spot for us from now on.

The beds were so comfy! There was a little wait because of the line checking in late on a Friday night. Our room was a fairly good size. We were on the 3rd floor of Carson tower, no view whatsoever ...but I was ok with that since I only planned on sleeping there. The bathroom was clean,  as was the rest of the room. I had read the Yelp reviews about being charged extra for drinking the coffee or water in the room so I avoided that all together. I brought my own instant coffee & used their coffee maker (which is a k cup kind). Also, everyone is right about the pool with the shark tank being awesome. The pool upstairs is also great to avoid the kids. I would definitely stay there again, the price is right!

The Golden Nugget experience was great.  This is the first time my family and I have stayed at an "expensive" hotel (compared to other hotels in Downtown).  We had a wonderful time at the "shark" pool, especially my daughter.  The room was clean and the bed comfy.  If the price is right again, I will for sure stay at the Golden Nugget the next time I'm here in Vegas.

PS - The only drawback is the parking.  They don't have enough parking spaces for everyone in the hotel.

I didn't stay here just gambled in the casino. I was very surprised on how nice the staff was. This casino had the nicest cocktail waitress, casino floor supervisor, security guards. It really caught me off guard how friendly everyone was. I liked the free black jack and craps lessons they gave in the morning. The craps table was a lot of fun as the dealers have a lot of personality.

Our non-smoking floor was smoky. Even found ash on the floor by our door. Seemed like the air system was bringing some smoke in to the room.  We were in the new, Eastern upgraded tower.  We left a day early- which was hard because the rates were great and the rooms were big and comfortable.

Enjoyed the regular buffet- it was tasty with many options. Rosie's service was general very slow and sometimes mediocre as was the Rosie's food.

We chose this hotel for the Atrium and pool.  The pool was not as warm as we'd like, although it was manageable and a lot of kids were having fun. Kids were NOT allowed in the Jacuzzi and this was a big disappointment for us.

The arcade was fun, but a little smoky too....

One of the best hotels in Vegas, especially if you want to stay on Fremont st. Be sure to book VIP. It's newly renovated. You can enjoy a lovely spa etc. Service is great. You'll find little snacks and coffee for you all around. And VIP floors are VIP only. The aquarium\/pool was so much fun, no wonder why it's world famous. It does get crowded but if you go at the right time it's just fine.

This hotel somehow managed to screw up our entire parties booking. I didn't know that was possible, but when you have 30 people booking months in advance for a wedding, how do you tell someone they're late so you gave their room away? Check in is at a certain time, correct? If you book through Expedia, the room should be honored, yes? Nope. Not these people. I was so upset to find out 6 of the rooms were changed from a king to two queens. Claiming that two queens were more expensive so they were getting a better deal.

Stop booking rooms if you aren't going to honor other booking sites. I wanted a stress free wedding, and couldn't have that thanks to this hotel.

The rooms at the rush hour are beautiful, the rooms in the regular portion look like shit.

We booked under the impression that the pool would be open, very upsetting to find out otherwise. 

Will pick a different place next time. They have hidden fees everywhere so watch out for those. Oh, and they try getting you to upgrade your room for an additional $300. Um, no.

Loved staying in old downtown LV. I stayed in Golden Nuggets Rush Tower. They upgraded me to a suite and it was gorgeous! Beautiful! Super clean! Great view of the pool and the 'hidden pool' below. My suite had 2 huge flat screen TVs, wonderful wrap around couch, great dining area, Cali king to snooze on. The bathroom had a huge walk in closet, shower that fit 4, deep soaking bath, WC and floating double sinks. The lobby bar near the front desk was amazing. Great service, great drinks. Loads of options for places to eat and play! Did I mention super friendly staff?! Will not hesitate to stay here again.

Let's just say...after having stayed in Downtown Las Vegas for the first time, here at the Golden Nugget, for our annual Fantasy Football draft with a group of our amazing friends, we will mos' def' be staying again.

We got an awesome deal for a corner suite in the Rush Tower. Great room that was the perfect size to become Draft HQ and then viewing central for the May v Mac fight that night. Plenty of room, with two tv's and two big windows (we were on the 19th floor) that looked over the pool and into the glittery Las Vegas night...so nice!

Totally loved the showerhead...plenty high enough for the 6'4" hubby! Nice big soaps and shampoo and conditioner, plus the toothbrush and toothpaste. 

Only issues, as others have said, were the lack of power outlets (NEED to have one by bed!) and the high step it takes to get into the shower (makes a difference when you're only 5'2"). But not so drastic that it ruined our stay.

We love the location, since Downtown is just so convenient and full of life (though those freaks do come out, day and night...so Vegas). 

We'll stay again! Give it a try!

Golden nugget would have to be the best hotel out here in las vegas.
Why?;
1. Great Prices, I get a hotel Stay for about $34 a night That's not bad.
2. Have you seen the pool? AMAZING , I love the shark tank.
3. Easy Access to good food, There buffet is AMAZING! (You have to try the bread pudding)

Even thou I live in Las Vegas, Every year we take a "Stay-cation" in the summer, and we stay at Golden Nugget for 2 or 3 nights, Go swimming, have fun, and eat great food!

If only this buffet had a slightly larger selection I'd have given it 5 stars. So don't think I am knocking it, this may now be my favorite buffet - for the money - in Vegas.

$18 a head for dinner gets you new, clean surroundings and a friendly staff. The selection is good, but not outstanding. However everything I tried was at least good if not great. There were a few notable surprises- the BBQ chicken pizza for example was outstanding!

So, head on over to the Golden Nugget, hang out at one of the most awesome pools in Las Vegas, and gorge yourself at the buffet.  You won't regret it.

Best buffet we had during our time in Vegas! The buffet was better than Aria and TI which both cost more. Also, the drinks we had were really good and I believe the cheapest we found. We didn't stay here so I can't speak to the quality of the rooms, but for a place to eat and drink I can't recommend it enough!

Great rooms and very clean.  The most expensive hotel on Fremont Street.  I stayed on a Sat night and it cost $239. Cheapest I've seen a room was 89 bucks for the evening.  It's your call on this one and it's all about the money.

Dirty, inconsiderate and unhappy place
We went there on the day before new years. I could go on how this is not a place to bring kids. People are walking around everywhere with drinks and cigarettes. It is loud in the rooms. A lot of women that are "professionals" seem to be visiting the rooms.
But it gets worse. The first room we were in had popcorn kernels on the floor. We could live with that. But at about midnight sewer water from the floor above starts to drip into our room.
We called the lobby and asked for a new room. A maintenance guy got there in 10 minutes and was aggressive in coming into our room and looking at the damage. But getting us a new room was a very low priority. It took them over an hour to get us a new room, That is only because I called every 10 minutes. We had to move the bags ourselves as the bellhops did not expect a big tip from aggravated people with sewer water all over them.
While walking across the hotel to our new room we stepped over something that was probably puke.
They offered no compensation, and only a half hearted apology.
We ate in their cafe too, My wife had a hair in her food, and later on I got sick from what I ate there (Spinach fritata)
I simply think the 4 Star rating of this hotel is a fraud. It is less quality than Circus Circus and much more expensive.

Was there about 2 weeks ago. Not as nice as the resorts on the strip, but they treat you like a king. I definitely got more bang for the buck here. Food was good (not great) if the food had been better it would be 5 stars, everything else was great.

OK, I'm gonna finish off my Vegas gamut run of reviews with the place I stayed at this past weekend - The Golden Nugget.  Now, this is The classiest place to stay if you are staying in Downtown Las Vegas.

   The servers know how to treat you,  the bartenders are friendly, and the casino and host staff are Very accommodating to your every need!

  The have fun casino games that no other casino in Downtown Vegas has to offer:   ie:  Blackjack Switch and Mini Paigow (only 6 cards dealt.)  

   The Gold Diggers club is Free and alot of fun and the rooms are very comfortable  - nice mattresses and comforters!  Not to mention - large 42" LCD TV's in every room.    

***   check out their 40 million dollar new pool lounge - The Shark Tank.  Lots of fun!  A real live, shark tank in the middle of the pool with a water slide that goes through it!

    I get free comp rooms here in the Golden Nugget because of my player rating - but sadly, as well as they have treated me - I'm going to have to move up to the Strip MGM\/Mirage franchise chain of hotels!   =)     See you there!

I recently stayed at the Golden Nugget on a trip to Vegas with a friend. The Shark Tank pool is rather impressive as is the lobby decor. There was some renovating going on there, so I'm curious to go back and see the finished product. 

The room itself was ok. Nothing too spectacular, but I guess if you're going to Vegas all you need is a place to lay your head! The water temperature and pressure in the shower were awful. I don't know if that was just my room or if it's like that in each one. 

The nice thing about the Nug, as I've taken to calling it, is it's proximity to the Freemont Experience. It's literally right outside the front door. That made for some good people watching in the evenings. The Deuce bus also stops close by, so it's relatively easy to access the Strip.

The next time I go to Vegas, I either want to stay on the Strip or at a resort nearby.

I am very disappointed with The Golden Nugget.  I usually come and stay once a year in Las Vegas.  I also frequent the lake Charles hotel and casino quite often.  I booked a room for my husband and I four months ago for a room with a king size bed.   Upon arrival I was informed my room was not ready and so I stored my luggage at the front desk.   When I was notified that my room was ready, Oliver the assistant manager casually notified us that we were getting a room with two double beds.  I objected because our reservation was for a king size bed.   He unapologetically informed us that there were non available.   When I explained to him I expected compensation for the king size bed that we reserved 4 months ago, he shortly replied, we don't do that.  At this point my husband chimed in because we had witnessed our friends being compensated for a similar situation.   We let him know it was not okay to give us a room with two double beds.  He then said let me see what I can do and he did locate us a king room in a different tower.   For a manager he was very rude and condescending.  I know it is super bowl weekend but we did have reservations.   Also at the bar, the bartender made sure to let us know that you have to bet a minimum of $1 to get comp drinks.   With all that said,  the room is very nice.  Somewhat noisy but very comfortable.  I will think twice about staying here next year.  Not sure if I want to deal with the "your lucky your here" attitude.

Update:  After posting this review, upper management contacted me that evening.  She assured me that the customer service that we received was not their standard way of operating.  She was extremely apologetic and let me know that she immediately addressed this issue.  I will continue to frequent The Golden Nugget since this has been addressed.  The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are clean and very comfortable.  Thank you GN for making a bad situation good

spent a night in the rush tower.  it was fabulous!  clean and everything seemed new.  

our reservation had four adults and three children.  no problems with space.  my uncle decided to sleep on the floor with one of my cousins.  they weren't gonna sleep blanket-less!  my aunt called & the housekeeping department was quick to bring comforters\/sheets as requested.  

i appreciated the fact that ventilation was good & it wasn't smoky at all compared to staying elsewhere in downtown, like at the california hotel.  

i love downtown!  we did the fremont experience for like the 100th time.  my other aunty feels lucky at california or mainstreet so we walked it over.  very close.  in the morning we went to mcdonalds at the D, las vegas club for bagel chips and the beef jerky store.

this is a great place if you're looking to stay in downtown.  i'm not sure about the carson tower, but to be safe go for the rush tower.

The pool is great, gambling, drinking, sun and fun. The water slide is great fun, also. HOWEVER,  we left to go watch football @ 10:50. We came back approx 5. We come back, and the door to the room was still ajar! We had adjoining rooms, and i realized that my room was also open because of the door between the rooms. Security was busy, so it took over 20 mins to see us, and report. Haven't noticed anything taken yet, but 3 girls travelling is no security to have a door open. Somebody could have been hiding in either of the rooms. I said that i don't want to get anybody in trouble, so just affirm a better commitment to maids on closing the doors behind them. So security tells us that they have to remind them all the time talking to them. Oh really? Last year my key had to be reset quite a few times. Now this happens this year? After i made the recommendation, I'm none too happy. Don't think that i will stay there again. Plenty of other places in Vegas. Not impressed.

I'm giving this place 3 stars because overall I love the hotel.  Our most recent stay was a little disappointing.  We have a Landry card and I was told that we would always get a room upgrade as their website even said and still says.   When we went for the upgrade we were told that's not how it works anymore.   Now you need a certain status to get the upgrade.   They did accommodate and upgrade us after a few calls and a manager coming down.....to a room by the elevator with a view of a wall.  Not part of a wall, not a distant wall, but literally if the windows opened I could touch the wall.  If I put my head against the glass and looked left I could see the pool maintenance building.   I guess that's what I get for complaining and getting the upgrade.

Pleasantly surprised! So much better than I thought it was going to be on Fremont Street.  We stayed in the new Rush Tower and the rooms were very nice.  The food options were pretty good.  The Grotto and the grill next to the sports book were yummy.  I didn't make it to the Buffet and I didn't enjoy the cafe.

I didn't see the drink ladies much while I was gambling, so that was kind of a bummer.  And the drinks seemed a little more expensive here than at the other casinos, but then again, this is the nicest casino on Fremont, so I guess that makes sense.  Just pop over to another casino grab a drink and head back.  With every casino being so close to each other, it is easy to do!

The pool was awesome and the casino was just the right size.  Not too big, not too small.  Golden Nugget is the only hotel I would stay at if I were staying downtown.

Terrble experience.  Checked in after 8 hour flight and was told i didn't have a reservation.  This,  despite showing the clerk my confirmation email.  They blamed it on orbitz and made me stand at front desk for 2 hours while they "faxed" orbitz from the back office. 

After all of this hassle and embarrassment,  they offered to add a free buffet to my room to make things right.  When i informed the mgr that i could not use a buffet - he shrugged and offered nothing more. 

Illl never come back and i recommend you go somewhere else.  They do not value your business. Un
If I can give less thsm one star I would. Bags were lost and bell hop took forever to put our bags in our car. Hotel gave me the runaround. Almost missed my flight.

Worst experience ever!!! Went there from the strip just to try it out for my birthday, first we got a small room after we told them we want an upgrade for my bday month before when we made the reservation on the phone. Then they tried to charge $50 per night for the suite cuz they sold out, ehh not my problem, don't guarantee nothing on the phone then!!!!! Second, we play table game, I ordered 1 chivas water and 1 bottles water, they told me no, only one at a time. Seriously?!!!!! I'm a bartender from Hawaii! I have the craziest house rules back home, but not able to have water with my drink? WTF!!!!! This is effin Vegas!!!!!! Third, when my husband left his cigarette butt in the ashtray without killing it completely, this fat ass old bitch literally slammed an empty ashtray on top of the dirty one then she gave it and my husband a mean look, sorry bitch, you deal in downtown, we don't don't need your attitude here when we receive VIP treatment on the strip!!!! We checked in at 2pm and checked out at 9pm the same day. So yeah, completely fail on the experience here. It sucked big time, never come here again, never play here again and we will make sure that all of our friends do the same.  Because this place doesn't deserve any business based in their credibility and hospitality.
We stay at the Golden Nugget every time we go to Vegas now. THe staff is always friendly and the place is great.

Check in at the Golden Nugget front desk was amazing.  Noemi was very fast and professional.  It's the great customer service that makes a memorable experience and I promise to tell all my friends & family to reserve rooms from Golden Nugget.  First impression earn a return customer in me.  The room exceed my expectations, very modern with fresh art and serene spa feel.  Love the clean bathroom.  Thank you Golden Nugget, for hosting me in this grand hotel.

I'm not a fan of smoke filled casinos in the first place, but there's something about the Nugget that just feels dirty and dank. The pool is ok and the Shark Tank is cool but the restaurants are pretty lousy and the food is overpriced. Unless you get the rooms really cheap, there's no reason to stay on Freemont street. The strip is so much nicer in my opinion.

Still in a daze after our bizarre saunter into Mermaid's across the way, we walked into Golden Nugget.

My friend said they have an awesome pool area with a giant aquarium...

We went straight to the pool area...we almost didn't get in because the area is for hotel guests only, but we talked the security lady to let us so we could play at the blackjack tables by the pool.

My friends are avid gamblers, I am not...so I stood behind their chairs as I witnessed them lose about $700 :-(  A couple of times, I was slammed into by kids running on the wet pool deck after they slipped and slid into me...lol Thankfully I had drank their god awful mai tai and didn't flip out too much

The cocktail waitresses are kind of clumsy, one spilled a drink on my friend, but thankfully it was really hot that day and her dress dried pretty fast. The only thing she did was to half heartedly apologize and bring a couple of flimsy kleenex to help...by the way the drink she spilled on my friend was meant for me, the gross mai tai.

This is probably one of the nicer hotel\/casinos on Fremont.

Ok so last year (1-7-12) for my birthday I decided to have a "crazy Downtown" birthday  adventure and I also booked a suite for hubby and I.

We are locals so we love the Vdara, Cosmo feel of a stay-va.
(NO WE WERE NOT EXPECTING THAT QUALITY)

We booked a one bedroom suite that had a living room area. Don't get me wrong it was a huge huge room. For the $250-300 that we paid for that night...they could have given us an upgraded room. Nope. 

I gave it two stars for the size of the room and lots of windows. I wish I could give it a one star.

Embarrassing on top of it another friend couple of ours booked the same "type" of room and theirs was the same dark decor....only cleaner.
I just looked on the website and do not see a similar one now, both of our rooms were dark green and dark navy and lots of black marble.
Maybe ours had not been used in a while?

We were not expecting:
-dark dusty room
-old cigar smelling linens
-a room that looked like it had not been booked in months, possibly years
-leather couches that looked old and were ripped
-carpet that was dark and old looking we never wanted to take our shoes off
-chipped tile and dirty grout in the bathroom 
-the room smelled musty 
-it felt like it had been a crime scene or an old house that someone "aired out" and deemed acceptable 

1992 called and wants their hotel suites back!

We packed our stuff and headed 15 minutes home. 
Did not speak a word. 
Left the key on the table. 
We had enough. 
After a horrible dinner at V&A (another review) at the casino we just wanted to go home. Yep. 

Sorry GN if you had not upgraded these suites yet. But with the experience we all had that night us four locals...I don't know if we will be back :( I don't know if they stayed in their room or complained. I am too embarrassed to ask.

pretty awesome place to be if you are gonna hit Fremont Street. this is the only place i gambled while in Vegas and i won a good sum of money without losing any the whole time. the people that work there are nice and very helpful too. everyone from their security to the janitors to the dealers were professional and had their shit together. im going back here next time im in vegas.

To be honest, I was expecting very little after booking a hotel room Downtown, but the Golden Nugget was amazing. Much nicer than the Flamingo, in my opinion.

We stayed in a two-double bed room in the Gold Tower, which just happened to overlook the gorgeous pool. If you're into pools, you absolutely cannot miss this one. The pool area looks like a huge wedding cake cut in half with semi-circular levels with cabanas above the main pool area. The core - seen from the pool level - is a huge aquarium with sharks and large fish. And there's a waterslide that takes you through the aquarium. The pool area didn't get as crazy-busy as some other Vegas hotel pools I've seen, but on hot days it fills up pretty quickly.

The room was fantastic. The hallways were an interesting hodge-podge of smells, a little bit musty and a little bit strawberry lip gloss. Surprising to me was the lack of an "old hotel" smell. This place has been renovated with the wallpaper and carpet updated, so inside of the hotel it's tough to imagine how many years the rooms have seen. My only complaint is about the soft beds which led to backaches.

The casino was great, offering free craps lessons most mornings and an excellent array of video slot machines.

For our first stay Downtown, this was pretty much the best spot we could have chosen. We'll definitely return to Vegas, and you can bet that we'll book a room at the GN again. Highly recommended!

We only came to the casino but had a great time playing 21. Our dealer was so helpful and gave advice on what to do. She really made us feel welcome and comfortable since we aren't regular gamblers. If you are going to gamble downtown this is the place to go.

by far the best hotel in downtown Las Vegas.
stayed in a Carson Tower room with a few friends and all of my basic necessities for a quality hotel room were met. 
The beds were clean, the bathroom was clean, the HDTV actually worked :), and there was hot water. woot!!!

if your staying near the Carson Tower, there's a Starbucks and the gift shop both located right downstairs near the elevators.

the casino is lot more spacious compared to the rest of the casino's on Fremont Street and is clean and the decor is quite charming. it doesn't look like a dump at all!!! The swimming pool that's wrapped around the fish\/shark tank  is beautiful also.
try the italian restaurant Grotto also. it's fabulous

ONE ISSUE that  bothered me is the whole parking situation at the GN.
When we arrived at the golden nugget, we proceeded to the parking garage. 
guy in suit " I need to see your room key"
us " uh, we haven't checked in yet"
guy in suit " well you need a hotel key for free parking or we are going to charge you for parking"

alas, we ended stopping by the valet temporarily to check in. Afterwards we came back out and entered the parking garage. The guy in the suit just waved us in as we showed him our room keys.

next afternoon as we check out, we proceed to leave the parking garage. 
lady at the exit asked us where our ticket was.
us " uh what ticket? we are hotel guests. we are just leaving"
lady "your supposed to have a ticket stub. I am sorry, I have to charge you for parking in our garage"
us " wait what!!!, the guy in the suit just waved us in as we entered yesterday.
few minutes later, I finally find my hotel check out invoice and prove to her that we were actual guests.
lady " ok, fine, i'll let you guys off the hook this time.

my whole experience at the Golden Nugget was awesome, except for the whole parking situation. just remember to get a ticket stub as you enter the garage or you will be harassed upon leaving.

Pretty mediocre. Room was clean but needs some refurb. I hate places that nickle and dime you and this place charges for everything - $10 for coffee machine use in your room? - outrageous. And a medium bottle of water for $7? And a worthless VIP status for $25.
Don't go to the buffet - food was pretty poor and breakfast buffet was weird  in that it had an egg station surrounded by a roast beef station and a pasta station and some breakfast items were near dessert - oh well, they weren't very good anyways.
I can't imagine this place getting 4 or 5 star - the writers of those reviews must have been some of the drunks we noticed.

We stayed here last weekend and the staff was horribly rude! Everyone from the valet, doorman and bellman were suspicious that we weren't staying there because we didn't have a room key ( we were checking in??) where did they think they were taking our bags?  They were not child friendly- getting impatient while we got our grandson out of his car seat.  The employees are obviously unhappy in their jobs but they shouldn't ruin our stay-cation. We chose to eat and gamble off property so we didn't share another dime with them. This was not our first stay but will definitely be our last!

It's is a good hotel for those on a budget but want to stay on the Strip.  The Carson Tower room was clean and updated, just noisy.  Heard everything outside on the 10th floor.  The hotel and casino are clean, friendly staff.  Would recommend staying there.  The Grotto had excellent food and wine.

The only reason I am giving 2 stars is that the staff here have all been very friendly. This hotel, however, is a disorganized mess. My room which was supposed to be ready for check-in at 3 p.m. wasn't ready until well after 5. The front desk clerk told me they would call me when it was ready.
Wait a second here? The fancy Spa Tower Suite I reserved months ago isn't ready when it's supposed to be, and I'm just supposed to piss off - homeless in the lobby. He didn't offer to check my luggage. He didn't offer a comped drink at the bar. Nothing. I told him that I needed to get some work done, so was there a quiet place where I could sit down with my lap top. He thought about it for a bit, and then said "I can get you into the VIP Lounge."
Come to find out the VIP lounge is where I was supposed to check in in the first place. But this dude didn't tell me that. It's only when I went back 90 minutes later to the front desk that I was told the VIP check-in is separate from the regular check-in. I'm a guest at your hotel, not a mind reader,  people.
So then I went back to the VIP lounge and she told me the same story about my room being cleaned. I would have believed her an hour earlier. I asked why my room wasn't ready and the VIP clerk said"Oh housekeeping is a different department." So every department here is separate and doesn't coordinate with the others? Neat!
After traveling by plane and taxi the last thing I want to be told is that my room isn't ready, but I understand things happen.What I don't understand is the complete lack of customer service.I will certainly not be coming back to this particular hotel again.

Gold Rush Tower Rooms
Have you ever wanted to stay downtown Las Vegas but still have the same luxury hotel accommodations that the strip provides.  Definitely check out the Golden Nugget Hotel but be sure to upgrade to the GOLD RUSH TOWER rooms and you will not be disappointed.  This room does not disappoint it includes an amazing leather sectional, huge comfortable king size bathroom and a bathroom that is down with sliding doors (a separate water closet), special tub\/waterfall head shower combo, beautiful mirror with excellent lighting and a beautiful dark wooden floor.  This room is so tastefully done ad the price is amazzzzing.  So if you want to hang out downtown but want the luxury of uptown check out Golden Nugget.

It is fine. I think Charlie Brown's Christmas tree even looked nice at night with the lights on. That is my review of Vegas.      Best place to stay downtown. Pool is cool with shark tank, small area and no privacy if you don't want to pay for it. If all you want to do is gamble. This place is fine. The casinos look and smell alike, that would be like your grandma's basement who smokes to much. Just remember the money you bring to Vegas stays in Vegas. The room was just like any 2 or 3 three star hotel. It seemed clean and the staff was fine.

Terrible Place to stay. Backed up bathtub. Asked them to fix on Thursday, same issue on Friday morning.  Called front desk again.  They said they would take care of it.  Come back to the room Friday night and bathtub has a foot of water after taking a shower.  Called front desk again.  They said, "Oh you requested to change rooms, didn't anyone tell you?"  No I said.  Now it's 11:30pm.  I just want a place where I can take a shower.  My girlfriend is already asleep.  Asked manager -Jennifer for assistance with no help!  Sorry we are fully booked. You can move or stay in the room.  I say, I just want a clean bathroom to take a shower.  It's 11:30 at night, I don't want to relocate.  She says, Take the other room or we can have some come up and fix your bathtub.  Fine, I say, send someone to fix it.  30 minutes later, no action.  I call again.  She says, they can't fix it, I have to move.  I've been waiting 30 minutes, to take a shower, when were you going to tell me?  She says, I just found out.   Can I just take a shower in the other room because my girl friend is asleep.  No she says.  I can't hold the room for you if you're not going to use it.  Then she gives me a lame excuse like housekeeping has to clean two rooms.  Duh!  And it's not like you're going to be able to rent out a room with a bathtub issue.  How in the world did you get to be a hospitality manager, Jennifer???  
Never stay at this place again. Thanks for nothing Jennifer! F U!

My husband and I just got back from a great time in Vegas for our 1st anniversary! We stayed at Golden Nugget downtown and besides the distance from the strip, the hotel was great! 

We stayed in the Parlor Suite, which was super nice with 2 baths, living room, bar, and super soft king size bed! Everyone was friendly and the hotel seemed very clean. I can't say so much for the rest of the places on Freemont Street. We could really only hang out downtown for just a bit before wanting to venture down to the strip. Luckily we had our own car, so it was just about a 10 minute drive. Whatever you do, take the 15 if you are going from downtown to the strip or you will be sitting in traffic forever!!!

We ate at 1 restaurant and the buffet at Golden Nugget. Lillie's Noodle House was good. I had the pepper beef, which was awesome, and my husband had the pad thai, boring and not that flavorful. But the sushi and drinks were good, and good prices. The buffet was alright, but it was only $12 and had a great view of the pool.

I would recommend to stay at Golden Nugget, but only if you have your own car to hit up the strip when you get bored of Freemont Street. If not, it's about a $30 cab ride.

New Strip vs. Old Strip is a debate that will never be settled. Just depends on what you like and what you're looking for. 
For the wife and I, after staying at both multiple times.....we've finally figured out we are Old Strip people. 
Staying at the Golden Nugget, we find:
- Fast, easy, affordable rooms and check-in. 
- Clean rooms.
- With the affordability of the rooms, you can substantially upgrade to a killer suite and still spend less than a standard room on the New Strip. 
- Really affordable food and drinks. 
- Affordable gaming like $5 craps\/roulette (as low as $3 in some places) instead of the $15\/$20+ minimums you see on the New Strip. 
- The Fremont Street experience is great and there is no shortage of things to do all within a max of a 10 minute walk versus the 2 hours it takes to walk from one end of the New Strip to the other. 

You can go for the New Strip for sure. It has its own Pros and Cons. But that not what this review is about. This is a bout the Golden Nugget and it is for sure a worthy place to stay. It has great value.

Earlier this year, I took my very first trip to Vegas and this was the hotel where we stayed at. I must say, I was very impressed by it. Very nice looking hotel. Their outdoor pool had a cool water slide, which I got on many times, as well as a very nice looking aquarium, which had some big fish as well as some sharks in it!! That was very nice to see. The price for the room was not so bad(I figured rooms at Vegas hotels outside the Strip wouldn't be so pricey anyways!!) The room itself was nice. Small, but very cozy and nice...I mean come, who comes to Vegas to stay the whole time in a small cozy room...the party is outside!! Yes, the casino did reek of cigarettes, but who cares, its Vegas. I personally didn't mind the cigarette stink! The staff was overall friendly with us. Housekeeping was very prompt and well, we got lost trying to find our room, but hey, that is an experience we will always remember. Overall, I loved it here. Highly recommend to anyone looking to pay a cheap price for a nice hotel outside the Strip!!! Rock on dudes!!!

I've stayed in this hotel in various towers for over 10 years. I think the price and location cannot be beat. This was the first year the front desk was nice at check in and I keep coming back. That shows you how much the hotel has to offer. The pool is wonderful and not too big like the mega hotels on the strip. We used Priceline this time and that added a great deal to our savings. Stay and play as a family, couple or girls weekend.

The buffet area is clean and well attended with bountiful amounts of food.  The staff is friendly and very professional and efficient.  Special mention for the Bloody Mary that Dennis makes.  He doesn't use any bloody mary mix; he uses tomato juice.  The eggs were a little runny.  The half and half on the table was a bit disappointing as a couple of them were already curdled.  The service compensated for the average food and selection.  There is bottomless glasses of champagne there.  Thanks to Stephanie and Dennis aka the Dog, two exceptional employees.  They really know how to take care of their guests.

If you want loud, pushy sales and unhelpful stay here. I booked a room and ensured at time of booking I'd have a quite room. When checking in they talked us into an upgrade and once again I confirmed that it'd be a quiet room. Well as soon as the show starts in downtown Vegas you can here and feel everything. The wall even shakes a little.

With the upgrade they took us off our private floor with snacks and said they'd send up snacks. So I'm paying $30 for noise and no snacks. No snacks and when we called down about it they said they don't do that. 

The worst part is the GN staff can't move me to a quiet room. I preferred my previous stays at the LINQ and ARIA. 

Take your business elsewhere.
Love this place! They updated it and it's nicer than most of the hotels in the Vegas strip IMO. Great staff, and plenty to do around the hotel!

Very sleazy business practices.  We booked the room on line for $59 per night.  At checkout they add in a $20 per night resort fee.  I asked to have this removed and they refused.  Upon further review, if I would have scrolled down further on the website when booking and read the fine print, I would have seen the $20 resort fee.  For what reason don't they just put this into the cost of the room and make it $79 per night?  Because they want to appear that they have a lower price as most people will not scroll down and read every bit of the fine print.  Again, a very sleazy business practice.  I called and spoke to a supervisor named Roxanne and explained my dissatisfaction with the $20 resort fee and requested a refund.  She said that they do not refund the $20 resort fee.  We will not stay at the Golden Nugget ever again, or at any other resort owned by the same company.

This was the worst hotel experience I've every had (and I'm a senior so I've stayed at a lot of them). My son reserved me a room as a birthday present, put my name on the room, went down to hotel to make sure everything was in order, I call ahead of time to make sure everything was ok, and when we got there the girl behind the VIP desk said no because my sons name was on it. These people are the rudest, most impolite staff I've every seen. Had to call my son, he called booking.com (where by the way the bill was paid in full) and switched name. I go to check out today and of course its wrong. He paid $187 to booking.com and it said that he paid $167. When I got home I thought I'd better check my bank statement and sure enough there was a $50 extra charge on it after checking out and seeing my bill. I called my bank to dispute it and they said it happens all the time. Businesses charge these little extra fees because they think you won't notice it. All I can say is stay alway from the Golden Nugget!!!!!!!

I wish I could give 0 stars, unfortunately that is not an option!

A group of us (including our 20 month old daughter) arrived Thursday night only to ring out there was an error in their system that was short one room.  Conveniently (for Golden Nugget), they had other rooms available for triple the price paid for other rooms.  When I asked them to match the rate of the other rooms, I was told they could not.

My experience at the Golden Nugget was one I would not wish on my worse enemy.  Also, considering the number of other rooms we had, plus the loyalty my wife's family has shown to this hotel over the years, I was shocked and disappointed by the service we received.

I guess if Golden Nugget feels it's a smarter business move to try and make an extra hundred dollars or so on a room over a few nights at the expense of losing loyal customers, than to do what I think most would consider the ethical\/right move for a business, then that's their prerogative.  With that said, I know that my wife and I, along with my extended family and friends, will never spend a dime at the Golden Nugget, or any of its affiliated properties.

I also have never had such a bad experience, or encountered someone in a supervisory\/managerial position as their front desk manager named Mr.  Barrajas (not sure if I spelled the name correctly).  

I hope your proud of your staff Golden Nugget.

Got a relatively cheap rate of $247 for three nights. But I've gotta remember almost all hotels charge a "Resort" fee on top of the room rate, so an extra $25 per night at the Nugget.

Mr. or Mrs. Golden Nugget please read the reviews of your hotel! I read many of them prior to booking and a common theme appeared; painfully slow check in.

Your hotel is listed as having 2400 rooms, and you had 2 people checking guests in...2! Guess what people waiting in line to check in were complaining about??  This is one of the first impressions a guest has.

Got to the room and had two maintenance issues.  Called the front desk and in less than 15 minutes a maintenance man was knocking on the door. Another 10 minutes or so, and both issues were resolved. Excellent service by the maintenance department!

The room was fine, about what you would expect for the price.  Shower was great, pressure really good and no wait for hot water.

Only ate at two of the  restaurants,  Claim Jumper and Cadillac Mexican Kitchen, both were fine.  The Mexican joint does have a good Happy Hour from 4-7 pm.

Pool - Get to the pool at 8 am when they open the doors to reserve a lounger if you want a specific area or chairs; otherwise, good luck!  

The hotel provides towels, just look for the yellow\/white striped ones in the cart. Put the towel on the lounger you want, with a personal item on it, and it's yours for the day, no charge!

Great service by the waitresses at the pool.  Mixed drinks were $8.50, think beer was $5. Never even get out of your lounger if you don't want to.

Water slide thru the shark tank is free. I did it 3 times and it was a bit of fun.

Pool is great with a large shaded area to get out of the sun for a while. It was 109 degrees the day we were there so the shade came in handy.

Hotel and casino are right on Freemont Street.I enjoy downtown more than The Strip, so The Nugget worked for me.

Didn't play in the  casino but it was very busy every time I walked thru.

Would definitely stay here again, but might ask for a newer section of the hotel.

Checking out of the hotel only took about 5 minutes,  but there were still only 2 people checking guests in, and quite a line of people waiting. Interesting!

Downtown Las Vegas is the historical place to stay and the Golden Nugget is the best all around establishment there. The service & staff were friendly and made us feel like we were at home. The rooms were modern and clean (very comfortable beds) and the hotel\/casino common areas were also clean and well maintained. The food was great and the service was even better. Casino staff were professional and attentive with a well organized floor plan, clean, and by far at the top of the downtown casino list. Keno lounge was like sitting in your living room. Beverage service was exceptional.

The air quality could have been better, but with smoking (and I smoke cigars but not in the casino), this is understandable and probably unavoidable.

The covered street fair and rock bands just outside the casino were great free fun between craps and one armed bandit play.

Pool area also had black jack tables. lounge chairs were somewhat crowded together, but we didnt go the LV to lay in the sun, we're from Southern California!

I would recommend the modestly priced additional fee for VIP checkin. The rates were very reasonable for under $60 a night.

We'll be returning soon and will always stay at the Golden Nugget.

Thirty years ago, this place was a nice hotel to stay. Downtown was a bargain for everything. Well that was then and this is now. Downtown Vegas is a sleazy rundown dump.  Unless of course you like that sort of place, then by all means live it up.

We stayed at the Golden Nugget for four nights and I really enjoyed the experience! We paid a little more to stay in the newer Rush Tower, with a strip view to avoid the noise of Fremont street. Our room had a cool view and we could see part of the G.N.'s pool area. The elevators were always quick. The room was clean, housekeeping did a great job and all of the staff was friendly. It took us about 10-15 minutes to check in on our first night. Room service is from the Claim Jumper, and I thought the food was pretty good. Not much in the way of cable channels, but no one comes to Vegas to watch TV, so I didn't care! Like many other hotels though, they do not have accessible outlets right by the bed, which is interesting\/weird- we called down because we needed to plug in a c-pap machine and a heavy\/huge nightstand had to be moved to access the outlet. Maintenance was there in less than 10 minutes to help. I was charged $10 for something that I'm not sure about, as I did not drink the expensive K-Cups? Overall a really nice hotel, great experience and I loved the Rush Tower. Would definitely spend the extra $ to stay here again over somewhere cheaper. Also a tip if you're not familiar with downtown- there's a walgreens where you can buy just about anything you'd need, and avoid the expensive in-hotel convenience store.

tacky name, nice hotel.  definately didn't know what I was getting but it was cute and I was pleasantly surprised.  It's on fremont a kind of cool area but you won't find as many young people in my opinion.  The pool area is pretty cool they have this slide it's clear and you slide through sharks and fish it's really neat. definately a good budget hotel

Check your billing statement when you check out!! I booked two room and one room had a claim jumper charge and the other had the buffet charge on it but I didn't eat at the hotel during my trip. Manager was nice enough to take it off the bill but he said the restaurant checks ID when they charge to room...... maybe I was sleep walking at 2am and eating at claim jumper?? I don't think so! 
Other than that everything else was great.

GREAT overhaul of the decor. The rooms and the pool were really nice.  The bed was super comfortable.  But the service in the cafe was abysmal!  Not just once, but all three times I ate there.  Absolutely ridiculous.  And so out of character with everything else.  We ate at the tepanyaki spot, and it was awesome.  I will be staying here again.  Downtown is a lot of fun.  But I seriously doubt I will dine in the cafe again.  I'd rather step outside and brave the crowd of 3:00 am zombies to look for snacks at Walgreens.

Golden Nugget is still 1 of the best hotels & casinos in downtown Las Vegas..they keep it up to par the food isn't bad friendly staff..the only thing that isn't so great is the parking. Parking is rather confusing they only let buses taxis & limoa up front...other than that i like golden nugget..if i ever go to downtown (which is not very often) ill more than likely check it out

It had been a small pipe dream of mine to actually stay here. Now that my bro and I discovered the magical Christmas secret of staying Downtown during the holidays, we got a great rate AND got to fulfill one of my greatest Vegas dreams!

Unfortunately, as are most heavily-built-up fantasies are wont to occasionally do, the Nugget was somewhat of a let-down... I like it a lot, and I still consider it to be the utmost Downtown icon, but I'd rather explore other area hotels next time.

The room:
+ Clean, comfortable, and A\/C-Heat system worked perfectly
+ Conveniently located near our parking structure
-- NO "DO NOT DISTURB" SIGN, wth???
-- Our door (as well as all other neighboring doors) slammed HARD
-- The bathroom doesn't come with shampoo\/soap amenities
-- And yes, believe the hype: the Carson Tower is indeed the most rundown of them all.

The casino:
+ Expansive, plenty of space and various 'rooms' or gaming areas
-- Late night tables? The selection is just shady and wrong (i.e. higher limit, variety of games over quantity of dependable games... really, come on now, I am drunk and looking to get my cheap blackjack on... not play an empty $10 Let It Ride table)
+ My brother played some random $1 slot machine and we won a bit of our losses back... yay!
-- Sports book bar make weeeeeak drinks
-- Sports book employees were helllllla slow at this one halftime betting period and as a result pissed off a LOT of people.

I still like the Nugget; I still love Fremont Street. I'm still in love with the shark tank and other parts (a club called GOLD DIGGERS??? Next time, cougars, next time) of the joint. But would I ever stay here again? Eh, probably, especially if there's any special deals for the Gold or Rush Towers. Sayonara, Carson Tower!

first time staying here.  got a Gold Rush Room with two queens.  it's quite amazing for the $$ ($149 for one night).  room is contemporary and spacious.  bathroom HUGE and only missing a soaking tub.  bed is perfect and pillows AMAZING.  Gold Rush Rooms come with free snacks and water in the elevator lobby...pretty handy for a hot day!  the casino floor itself is oddly shaped to say the least, not very welcoming.  good selection of slots though...new and old.  very busy for a weekday.  i never stay downtown (ugh), but staying here is worth it.  i don't mean to be snotty about downtown, but it's not for everyone and it's just not for me.  a guy even freaking TOUCHED me today trying to get me to stop and buy something he was selling along Fremont Street.  WTF is with the people down here i'll never know.

Very very very disappointed!!!!! We were approached by some lady name Kristina at the table close to the Carson towers elevator. She claimed to work for the hotel, and she said that we were entitle to a $150.00 worth of coupons and that shame on the hotel for not telling us when we arrived. Turns out, all she was trying to do was get us to take a tour and listen to a sales pitch similar to other types Of time share gimmicks a lot of us have experienced in Cancun and other resort areas. We were willing to do the tour when she told us we can use the $150.00 that same night and we left directly to go eat. When the bill arrived we tried to use what she gave us and they said they could not honor that until we go to their thing the next day. When I asked the lady why did she lied to us, She threatened me and implied that I was stupid. The worst part  was when I when to explain to management the situation, and he did absolutely nothing. I would never comeback to a place where they allow people to lie to their guests and customer service is so lacking. I give one start because Otherwise it won't let me post my review that is the only reason why. Not even their fish tank and swimming pool, would make up for this.

Was in town for Queen show and wanted to do something different and stay Downtown!!Freemont Street was Great and could not have been happier with 
the Golden Nugget...A Great Value!!!

I am happy overall with this hotel. It has many gorgouse features. Some features I enjoyed the most were the shark tank, the pieces of modern art decorating the place and the gorgouse glass chandeliers. I would have prefered to give this hotel a better rating but my room had an inadequately cleaned bathroom (brown splatter marks on the bath tub next to the toilet, bleh!) So I had to deduct 1 star for that. My other removed star was on the account of there is no refrigerator  in this room. I have stayed at many hotels through my previouse job and my usually ritual is to stock up at Walmart and store my items In the fridge in order to cut down to on eating out expenses. When I went to put my items away I was confused as to where they put the refrigerator. After a few minutes of scouring the room, I realized there is no fridge. Lots of other stuff to do here though, a night club, big pool with water slide,  a few restaurants and bars and of couse gambling... after all its Vegas!

I didn't stay at the Golden Nugget.  I stopped there to drop off a couple of bags with the bell desk that friends from Great BRitain leave with us when they go back to Europe.  They were coming in the day I was leaving, so I called and asked about checking their bags so they were there for them when they arrived.

The bell desk woman was very pleasant on the phone and just as pleasant in person.  They took the bags, stored them, and my friends collected them when they arrived Tuesday night.

Best Hotel in Vegas!!!

OK, well maybe not the best but it is for me.  I am not one for the Las Vegas Strip, everything is expensive and nothing is close together.  But there is Old Town Vegas, and the Fremont Street Experience and let me just say it is certainly one heck of an experience.  

The Golden Nugget is a great Hotel, with plenty of restaurants, bars, slots and table came they even have a night club.  The only thing that can get a little rough here is the smoking, it can get really heavy on the casino floor and it can be a disorienting.  I forgot to mention they also have an amazing pool, and this massive fish tank with large fishes.  

They have a great bar right outside on Fremont Street where they have great pricing, awesome bartenders, and the best people watching you have ever seen.  If you haven't been to Fremont Street and people watched, well you really haven't experienced Vegas the right way.  Loads of pan handlers and amazing drunk people for hours, it is just spectacular.

When ever I come to Vegas this is where I stay, it is my best.

I stopped here recently on my way up north....I thought it would be a cool place for my 7 year old daughter to swim and enjoy herself. True to point, she did in fact have fun, though this hotel leaves much to be desired! Family friendly not quite....for families there are simply better places to stay. Mostly what you find in the pool are a mass amount of drunks spilling their drinks in the pool. Since they are allowed to have their alcohol in the pool, why not spill it in the water. It's so bad that to counter this, the hotel uses a massive amount of chlorine to treat the pool. The water sadly is clouded\/murky and burns the skin and eyes. Is there a shark tank yes there is....can you go to an aquarium and not swim in booze\/urine\/chlorine yes..yes you can! I would not recommend this place for a family.

The rooms are dated and for the price just go to the main strip. They nickel and dime you for every small amenity, even ones that are free at a Motel 6!!!! I will not be staying here again. There is always a learning curve and I wish I had paid better attention to the reviews prior to booking with them. I stayed in the gold tower which is the nicer tower and still not worth the money. They do offer military discount but as I said so does every other hotel on the strip that is newer, nicer, and more competitive. The smoke is overpowering when you come in to the main lobby for check in be prepared. Remember that valet parking is free just tip them on your way out. In the end I was displeased with this hotel.

We stayed at the Golden Nugget for a golf outing in November.  The hotel is in the older, downtown section of Las Vegas, a ways from the strip.  Our room was in the Gold Tower.  These rooms appear to be recently remodeled.  The room was pretty spacious.  The bathroom is a little small, with only one sink.  But overall, this room was very nice.

The pool area features a large shark tank with a water slide that goes through the tank.  They also have live gaming tables in the pool area.  Obviously, in November the pool was not getting much action.  My only problem with the pool is that is surrounded by the hotel towers and does not get much direct sun.  This may be a blessing during the summer, but won't provide much of an opportunity to get some sun.  There is also a smaller party pool near the Rush tower that has multiple cabanas and a small infinity pool.

The casino is somewhat standard for Vegas, but seemed a bit cramped and smoky.  They may have been managing the number of dealers, but it seemed hard to find a blackjack table with many open seats.  

As opposed to the hotels on the strip that have famous chefs anchoring their hotels, the Nugget has brand-name restaurants, including a Chart House and Claim Jumper.  Neither of these were bad, but it wasn't the dining experience you'd get on the strip.  

The hotel opens to the Fremont Street experience.  The street has a cover that allows projection of video and periodic shows. They also have a zip line. But the real show is the street entertainers trying to earn a buck.  It is worth grabbing a drink and walking (which is legal) up and down Fremont just to take it all in.  

While the Golden Nugget may be the best hotel downtown, it really lacks the best stuff of the strip.  Three stars from me.

I have been going to Vegas for years for all kinds of reasons.  You name it, I've gone there for it.  Bachelor party.  Check.  Weekend get-a-way with the wife.  Check.  Vacation with the family.  Check.  Passing through on my way to Ohio in the RV.  Check.  How about going for business.  Check again.  

Going to Vegas as much as I have over the years, I have found the "Old Town" side of Vegas much more fun and interesting.  The hotels are classic with that nostalgic flare and feeling about them.  A "blast from the past" if you will and the Golden Nugget leads the pack.

I love the hotels new and modern renovations like the shark pool and water slide.  And I love the new and improved suites in the main towers.  Their eateries are top notch and the staff at the hotel are personable and eager to help.

Yeah, leave those new fancy hotels on the "New" strip for the youngsters who know nothing about the history of Vegas and leave the "Old" strip to the folks like me.  The folks who remember the smooth sounds of the Dean, Frank and Sammy.

Beautiful pool and amazing slide that kids absolutely LOVE. Free to locals Monday- Thursday, I just wish the were more consistent in the way people are checked in. 
 Some days you can walk in without anyone even looking up, others you are sent to ticketing window by the front desk and wait in line behind people pondering Gordie Brown tickets before you can secure locals wrist bands, which get you in free Monday- Thursday. 
 The downside to the place is huge crowds and little shaded seating. On a Thursday afternoon I had to stalk a seat smack in the blazing sun to put my beach bag on. 
 Bar closes at 5:30, or at least that's what the bar tender told me. 
 All in all- beautiful venue, albeit very crowded. Locals free Mon-Thursday only and I didn't notice a food option. Towels are hiding under one of the lifeguard towers. Small sundries type kiosk for your sunblock needs. 
 Valet parking is free.

Not going to give it 5 stars because my stay was short but after reading some of the other reviews wanted to add my own. Checked in about 4:30 in the afternoon. Yes the Carson Tower desk was closed but the Gold Tower check-in wasn't that far away. After reading other reviews I thought I'd have to weave through the casino and crowds.  Compared to other hotels on the strip, the walk was nothing and did not go through the casino as other reviews implied. My room on the 16th floor in the Carson Tower was away from the elevators had a view of downtown.  It was spacious, clean and the bed very comfortable. I had room service and from order to the delivery was less than 30 minutes. It was hot and very reasonably priced as well. I hope to stay again when I have more time.

Okay. 
Now, I'm a vintagegirl and I prefer the old downtown Vegas to the strip. 
Seems to me though that this is catching on. 
There's more and more people starting to prefer Fremont St. and the charm of vintage Las Vegas. 
Got a good deal online staying at the new Rush Tower. Nice rooms. We came in on a Sunday morning and had the Sunday champagne brunch! Fantastic! 
Comfy bed, quiet and blackout curtains. 
The tv channels leave a bit to be desired. No HBO or special channels. Guess they want you to spend your time in their casino. 
The only noises we heard were the chatty maids in the morning.  If you don't want them coming into your room at 8am, be sure to hang your "Privacy please" sign on your door!!
Toilet paper is bargain brand and not Charmin soft!! Just a warning... 
Don't ask for a fridge. It'll cost you $20 a day.  Tip: Bring an ice chest and have snacks. There's an ice machine on every level. (And it'll save you $ on food and hooch and eating out) ;)
Wanna use the fitness center? Also, $20 a day. Unless, you get a spa treatment, which  I highly recommend. I got a mini massage, facial and pedicure. Cost me $200 and tip is included. I must have spent 4 hours using the gym, facilities and having my treatments. There was cucumber water, snacks, water, juice. The royal treatment!
One more thing: the coffee in your room is not complimentary and neither is the water! A bottle of Dasani water will cost you $7 and the Kuerig coffee pods will cost you $10 if you open the box! 
Tip: buy your coffee pods at Target or bring them from home. 
All in all a nice place and great rooms in the Rush Tower! 
Employees were nice and helpful too!

Long lines at check in on St Patrick's Day with only one host serving non card holding customers for about 15 minutes didn't dampen this experience.  Upgraded room to Gold Tower overlooking pool.  Nice sized clean room, comfortable beds and full size pillows.  All clothes smell of smoke though.  House keeping friendly.  Coffee and Water are available for a fee, which is ridiculous seeing as the Nugget now charges a resort fee.  Includes wifi.  Elevators bring you right out at guest reception and pool area.  Pool side chairs are comfortable.  Waitress service was prompt.  Casino has myriad of games to satisfy. Starbucks is at rear of casino.  Easy drive in and out of location.  Pretty quiet in the room.  Much much better than The D!

Worst customer service in Vegas, vallet damaged rental car. After waiting an hour on getting it out. After two weeks of "investigation" they refused to pay but offered a free stay. Too many options in Vegas for them to screw me again. Nightclub was empty at 1 am. Over priced over rated

I've been staying at the Golden Nugget for a week now for work, and I have to say I'm a bit disaappointed with the rooms.  This hotel is supposed to be a four star hotel, but it's really a three star in my eyes.  The beds are pretty uncomfortable, and the mattress pad they have on my bed doesn't even fit the bed.  Further, they have just a flat sheet on top of the mattress pad rather than a fitted sheet, and when I called housekeeping, I was told they didn't have any fitted sheets.  Sounds really anal, I'm sure, but the sheet kept coming off the bed overnight.

The A\/C is loud, and the plasma TV doesn't have any HDMI inputs so I can hook up my laptop, which seems like a really sad angle to make you buy their movies.  There's also no outlets near the bed, which is really annoying.  Again, just not what I expect from a 4 star hotel.

The rest of the hotel\/casino is great.  It's definitely the nicest one downtown, and  the food in the diner is delicious -- try the open faced turkey sandwich.

The Golden Nugget is the only hotel I would staycation at Downtown. It's the opposite of a dump, but still far from perfect. Overly crowded. 85 yearl old cocktail waitresses, etc. 

The hotel room was big and the bed was comfortable and there was a large, flat screen tv. The bathroom was small and the door was too close to the toilet so if you had to shut the door while you are conducting business or  "dropping the kids off" you have to do a breakdance ass move to shut it resulting in Indian burn on the butt cheeks. Good times:)

The restaurants: I am now a HUGE fan of the Italian restaurant, Grotto. It's not very romantic, but everything I tasted from the bread with a garlic infused oil dip, to the homemade sausage rigatoni to the angel food cake dessert was highly enjoyable. Our waitress with short, blonde hair was on point and knew the menu inside and out.  Also the coffee shop was cool. Decent food, shitty coffee. It still didn't stop me from sucking down four cups a day. The last morning my waitress was a Bee when I told her that we would like to charge it to the room. She said she tried twice and it didn't work. Then she got a huge tude and said she would try a third time. What do ya' know? It effin worked! Of course it did because I have been staying here for two nights! What a Bee.....
 
The Pool- Biggest disappointment I have had in months. My whole life everyone has raved about the GN Pool and I always felt as if I was missing out. NOT. The chairs are pushed together like a mass grave to the point your neighbor's back hair eskimo kisses you when he turns over. The water looks like Jenna Jameson's mouth after one of her movies before they hand her the spit bucket. I'm being serious. Sure there is a slide and a shark tank, but none of which did anything for me. We were both over 21 and for some reason I was never told we could go to the adult pool which I am sure was the exact opposite of this nonsense. FAIL. 

The Spa- Since the pool sucked shlong we ventured to the spa for treatments. Best move. I got quiet, alone time full of rubbing and aroma therapy and soothing music and this turned out to be the absolute highlight. Good job GN. 

Overall I don't think I would stay at the GN again. Well, maybe. If only to get buzzed and watch the Homeless Drug Addict Soul Train Dance Contest outside. If you don't know what I am talking about you need to go Downtown tonight and witness this shit. You will never be more embarrassed for this city. Rubbing elbows with 3 Spidermans, 2 Michael Jacksons, Fat Elvis, Pee Wee Herman while watching crack addicts do the lawnmover can only happen in Vegas. Good freakin' times!!!

Tired of schlepping the strip and paying (praying) to the the dual gods of mgm and harrahs?  Tired of getting ripped off for "resort fees" and $8 beers?  Tired of seeing the same old prepackaged stuff the strip has?  There is a solution.  The Golden Nugget has every amenity offered on the strip without the pretense.  If you want the best, book the Rush Tower.  These rooms rival anything on the strip for a much lower price.  The Gold tower and Carson tower are a nice price break while still providing exceptional lodging.  Add in one of the best pools in all of Las Vegas for the sun seekers.

The Nugget is a solid 2-3 star place if you're looking for a Vegas Strip like experience.  But if you are staying downtown because you want to stay downtown, this is a 5-star experience.

The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly, the casino has a good feel to it....  This is my first stay there in the past few years, and their latest additions are very well done.  Their recent pool remodel has been named one of the top ten pools in the world (I question that, but it is very nice) and they added four blackjack tables in the pool area.  The dealing team out there were super-friendly and fun (even the pit bosses were cool).  Plus, the setting with the pool\/waterfall\/aquarium behind you and TVs to watch in front, not to mention a constant stream of people to watch make it all a great experience.  I was just disappointed that they only keep it open until 1 or 2 am.

My only disappointment was the morning poker tournament.  Entries were so low that we went across the street to Binion's instead, which was excellent.  Being downtown means that you can easily move from place to place with no issues, and the Nugget is a great home base for your stay.

Im usually not the type to venture out of the strip but my friend had a friend that was turning 21 and Golden Nugget was closer to the party.  The pool is very nice and you do have to be a guest to use it.  The thing that sucks and I think most non strip casinos are like this is that you can only park there if you are a guest otherwise you have to pay for parking, lame!  Same with Valet, only if you are staying there.  I wish they had better restaurant.  Overall, its better than Motel 6.

Great hotel, awesome casino, fab room service!  We always book a suite in the gold tower and everything is always wonderful here!  My husband got us a cabana on this months visit and it was the best experience at a pool I ever had, could have been that u have to pay to enter that top level so only a limited amount is allowed and under sixteen not allowed either.  YAY!
Will always love staying here!  Best place to stay downtown.

The Grille is great for.a late night djnjng experience. Had the Philly steak and cheese with potato salad..Husband had buffaLo Wings with fries.  Well worth the price.. only recommendation is they keep it clean (e.g. tables wiped, floor swept, trash bins emptied)..
Same review:  http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/golden-nugget-hotel-and-casino-las-vegas-2#hrid:m3H2-jZzZMgkzYAWqZSC2g

Unhappy people working here.  :( Super expensive for what you get!! Towels smell disgusting! 3 tables of room-service dishes left in hallway over 24 hours, right outside our room.  So nasty.  

It's sad that this could be a great experience (I'm not a snob!), but it's the PEOPLE THAT ARE UNHAPPY AND DON'T CARE that ruin this place.

Love the Fremont street, and will be back there... but not to Golden Nugget.

We were excited to stay at the golden nugget because of all of the reviews on help. However, we were very disappointed. Our stay started when half our party arrived and the system had crashed. The front desk told them they had no reservations saved from this and they were able to check them in because they were there - other reservations could not be held. Thankfully they allowed them to check us into our room, because when we did arrive the hotel was booked and we would not have been given a room. Prior to our trip we called twice to request rooms on the same floor and this did not happen (one on 11 and the other on the 19th). They did tell us we could switch rooms in the AM and to call down and we could move.
