We called down in the AM and the front desk told us the room was empty and needed cleaning but would check us into the room and when we came back into the hotel to pick up keys. We did exactly that and there was no record of our new room and there were no open rooms on the 11th floor. They thankfully never checked us out of our 19th floor room.

Also, wifi was $13 a day and coffee, a bottle of Figi water for $7 and 4 Kcups for $10. What a rip! 

Needless to say the staff just didn't seem happy to be there or want to help the guests. I'm SURE there are nicer and better places to stay in Vegas - and even if it was a good deal for the hotel it is worth a little more money to stay somewhere else!

My wife and I are Vegas locals and enjoy the occasional staycation at the Golden Nugget. We enjoy the pool with the shark tank, truly a unique experience, the quality restaurants, which give us points on our Landry's select card, and the entertainment on Fremont. On this trip we stayed in the Rush Tower on the 20th floor. The room was newly remodeled, clean, and very nice. The only negative on the room is that it faced Fremont St and even on the 20th floor was rather noisy. During the trip we relaxed, had some good meals, and enjoyed a day bed rental at the H2O pool. The negatives of the trip- we were told that our food and booze purchases at the H2O pool would gain us Landry's points and to take our receipts to the front desk.  At the front desk we were told we could not get the points. Disappointing but okay. The resort fees have continued to increase and are higher than many of the resorts on the strip and can easily add 20-40% to the price of your room depending on room selection.  What truly frustrates me though is a $10 dollar charge on my credit card from them and of course no one can explain it to me except account receivables which is only open limited hours during the week. A manager should be able to assist with this instead of the front desk telling a customer to leave a voicemail and someone will get back to you. The Golden Nugget is the nicest hotel downtown and has been trying to compete with the top resorts but this is not quality service.

I loved the Golden Nugget!! For someone that doesn't like the Old School Downtown Vegas feel, you probably wouldn't like it here. Downtown Vegas just has a different cooler feel to it. There's not a bunch of ho\/douche bags walking around and there is tons of stuff to do still. I stayed here for my bachelorette party and we rented a cabana for the day. Best thing we could have done. It was perfect!! It was back in August (scorching hot!!) so we needed the shade. It wasn't cheap but it wasn't that much either considering how much you get. Loved the pool and the slide! Very cool feature. 

We stayed in the gold tower and the rooms are gigantic! Only thing that bugged was no wifi which I seriously don't understand with Vegas...bleh. Club there sucks!! Do not go...you will be disappointed. But, other than that, there is plenty of bars on Fremont Street to go to and plenty of restaurants. They have a Chart House and a steak house. Not too shabby!

 I did get VIP check in but didn't realize where you do that and stood in the normal check out line for 30 minutes before realizing it was in a smaller room hidden on the side...really??  Oh well. Valet parking takes forever too but that's expected with Vegas. I will definitely be coming back with my hubby this time! :)

OH YEAH, almost forgot!! They have an "adult" pool on the top floor (16 and older) that's open til 4am!! That was awesome!!

Worst check in experience of my life. I arrived at 1am and waited in line to check until 2:30 only to be told they made a mistake and I'm not expected until the next day. Total nightmare. If anyone is even considering staying at this hotel, run as far away as you can!

Still our Hotel and Casino of Choice . . . Especially since the wife won a $5,400.00 jackpot this visit . . . Me a $3,700.00 jackpot (oh yeah, mine was out at another casino).

Major problem . . . and it appeared to not just be our room in the Ruch Tower . . . but there was a sewer gas smell in our room all weekend . . . even after housekeeping tried to put something down the drain.

We will be back, since nothing in the area compares . . . but if the smell hasn't been taken care of . . . we might not be back after that . . .

It's aight. I guess they've done a lot of remodeling so you're going to pay for it at the tables n slots. Worst part of my experience here is checking in. Front desk never had enough people to help n it takes forever :\/

The Golden Nugget wasn't our first choice in hotels but chose to try a new Downtown hotel for our stay. They have a prime location in somewhat the middle of the Fremont strip. Majority of the guests are middle aged and retired. I don't think I saw many people in our age group while staying there. I didn't spend much time in the casino because I couldn't stand the smoke smell.

The pool is the best part of the hotel with a shark tank in the middle and multiple bars on multiple floors. They also have a grill on the first floor that serves your standard burgers, fries and nachos. Food was A-OK. It was a shame that the weather was windy and a little rainy (totally mind-blowing for Vegas) so they had to close the pool for a couple of days in the middle of our stay.
 
They also have a couple of restaurants in the hotel, one of which is Claim Jumper. We didn't get to dine there but they prepare the food for room service orders so I did get to try their massive chicken pot pie which was yummy and the crust was nice and buttery.

The fitness center and spa are located in a separate tower on the same floor. Their fitness center is disjointed with weights in one room and cardio machines in another. They offer the standard amenities like towels, fruit and fruit infused water. There are a few retail stores near the lobby and a souvenir shop upstairs. 

Customer service was pretty good. The valet team was quick and friendly. The check-in staff was also quick and friendly and the housekeepers were nice and thorough. However, they have a short driveway so they would get backed up at times, especially at night.

Overall, a decent hotel to stay at but I doubt we'll be back-mainly because of the poor ventilation and outdated facility. However, if you're looking for a great rate this would be one of the hotels to look into. Also, since they have your contact info, you will receive special offers from them in the mail from time to time.

#VegasStrong

I actually had never stayed at the Golden Nugget and I stayed here because I had to do some work not too far from here.  I got the rooms for $41 per night during the weekdays, which is pretty cheap to me.

I was really impressed with the Golden Nugget.  The walkways are very clean and looks newly remodeled.  It doesn't look like the other hotels, like California (piece of shit hotel).  My room was pretty big (I got 2 Queens, but I asked for a King since it was only me staying there so I jumped from 1 bed to the other all night long).  The pool area is also really nice, since it's in the middle of the hotel and there are glass walls surrounding it so a lot of people can see.  In the center of the pool area, there is a shark tank!  There is also a slide that takes you through the shark tank.  Pretty sweet!  I'd definitely come here again

This was my first visit to Las Vegas, and I had no part in the arrangements for this visit, so I decided to check other reviews for Golden Nugget beforehand. YOW!!  What a crap-shoot (pun intended). Then I realized that a stay here is pretty much the equivalent to being on a cruise ship on dry land, and that got me into the right mindset in advance, especially in terms of services, additional charges, etc.. This appears to be one of the better hotels on Fremont St., and that showed in the overall quality and service here. 

The staff here were professional and about what I expected. We did get exceptional help from the bellhops and from the doormen in front when it came time to get transportation back to the airport.

We had rooms in the Carson tower which were reasonable. The beds were comfortable. I had a great view of a boxing match going on next door from my window on Saturday night.

With so many food options along Fremont Street, we only dined in the hotel twice. I recommend the breakfast buffet, especially on weekdays (it's $4 more on weekends). You get your money's worth.

The casinos are among the higher-end in the area as well, and very professional. Unfortunately, that also means higher minimum bets at many tables, if that's important to you. 

The tube slide through the shark (and tuna) shark tank is cool, but you really can't see to much while you're going through it.

One bizarre incident - there was a minor earthquake here during my stay, and I happened to be in an elevator when it occurred. It was not pleasant, the elevator did drop a little before it recovered. We all thought it was the elevator having a severe problem, and we avoided that one the rest of our stay. But in hindsight, it appears the elevator actually recovered well from what could have been a nasty situation.

Stayed at the Golden Nugget for four nights and was really impressed by the modern feel of this hotel. All the other hotels in Downtown felt a little older due to the renovations that took place at the Golden Nugget. Our room was fit for four people but had full size beds, we were expecting the typical queen beds. The bathrooms were nice but the bedroom felt a little older. Service and quality of the hotel was great and would recommend staying here if you're downtown! Also the parking situation was great! Easy and very accessible.
Not a bad hotel for Las Vegas, relatively inexpensive but neighborhood is dicey at night.

The Room

You can get a room here for less than $75 a night (usually), at that rate it would be the choice of downtown.

Nice room but a bit cramped. There was a Flat panel TV for watching football games (when the sportsbooks were too crowded) No ESPN2 though.

The Tank

The pool area "the TANK" was fun, the heavier you are the faster you go down the slide. My daughter tips the scales at 100 pounds came out at about 2 mph, myself at 260 got the lifeguard wet.

The Buffet

Had breakfast on a Monday at the "The buffet", for $9.99 they could of done better. I wouldn't recommend it because it was just ok and the service was terrible. When you pay the cashier they take your drink orders, so the first time you see your waiter, he's bringing out all the drinks for his section on a round tray. He must of had 10 OJ's 6 coffee's and 4 cranberry juices on his tray. I wanted to get some water for my mother in law and he just brushed me off. I got the water about 10 minutes later when he was bringing out more drinks for his section.

The Sportsbook

Very small, there is almost no seats to view the games, however if you bet on the horses you can get your own TV set, a 14 inch LCD with your own controls. Not too shabby.

I ate here last Saturday night at the Seafood and More buffet and was thoroughly impressed!!!  I was skeptical after reading some of the reviews on here but wanted to see for myself.  The sushi and wasabi was great, as was the hot and cold crab legs.  The butterfly shrimp were huge and scrumptious and the prime rib was cooked to perfection!  There were also tons of desserts and the 3 that I had were all fantastic!  I'm never disappointed when I eat here!  It's also one of the best casinos downtown.
Nice, quick locals trip with family from California.  The kids had a good time in the pool.

It's old Vegas class and old Vegas prices with all the excitement of the new casinos. 

I had a great experience all around -- especially since our room was cheap to begin with, and then we got upgraded to the north tower! I love the pool with the water slide, shark tank, and the Dive Bar bar. The casino isn't a cheap-o dump, but it's not the cheapest, either. I love the giant slot machine at the entrance. 

Here's a quick review of the restaurants. 

Red Sushi: Excellent, excellent staff and cool location. The rice was all wrong, though. Too sticky for sushi rice. Aside from that my meal was delightful. Again, great staff. 

The Buffet: One of the better buffets I've been to at this level of casino. It's not five-stars, but it's good for the price. Be sure to use the coupon in the coupon book found in your room! 

Carson Street: The food wasn't that great, but they sat us near the walk way and we got to people watch and we could see the sharks in the pool from our seat, so that was nice. 

I would've given the Golden Nugget five stars except for the fact that at least SEVEN TIMES my boyfriend and I were accosted by staff members trying to get us on one of those God damned time share tours. We politely declined the first three times, but after being hounded by the SAME employees we just changed our refusal to yelling "no timeshares!" while running away covering our face. Whether we were just walking into the hotel\/casino, or if we were asking directions, they were trying to get us to waste 4-5 hours of our day listening to a sales pitch for something we didn't want and couldn't afford. I'm guessing this is how they got the money for the remodeling, but it really cheapened the experience. I felt like I only got a nice deal because I had to deal with this constant salesmen harassment. 

But don't get me wrong. I do love the Golden Nugget and I will stay there again the next time I go to Vegas (I go about every two years).

My boyfriend wanted to stay on Fremont St. and this place was perfect. Great restaurants inside and an amazing pool with this cool slide. Luckily I got a great price on a travel site because I think the normal price is a little high only because it's not on the strip. Also we were near a pool that blasted music starting at 10 am so that was a downer. The employees were so nice and the lady who checked us in made us feel really welcomed.

We were in Vegas for business. When I realized we were staying at the Golden Nugget, I invisioned old smelly Vegas rooms. It was the first time staying on the old side. I was VERY HAPPILY surprised at how nice the hotel was. Amazing pool with fish tank, water slide, nice restaurants & room was nice, clean & updated. A few negatives. No refrigerator or microwave in rooms. We were never told about construction on room down the hall. You could hear drills, hammering etc..... In morning. We were not accomodated at all after it being mentioned at front desk. I really liked staying on the old side. Everything is much closer together, more reasonable prices, compared to newer side. Fremont street experience was defenetly an experience. I would recommend NOT taking kids. Too many naked men & women trying to make a buck. Adult friendly. Overall I would recommend family & friends to stay at Golden Nugget.

Do not stay here. My husband and I booked 2 rooms here and brought our teenage boys.  They are under the age of 21, but we figured they would enjoy the Fremont street activities. First of all, the parking is ridiculous. The parking structure is difficult to access. It's approximately 1 block away and packed with vehicles. Not to mention it's not supervised (no security to be seen anywhere). We decided to valet park. It took us 25 min just to check in. That doesn't include the wait standing in line to check in. At no time during check-in was I told that the pool closed or that the arcade\/game room were closed. Those were the 2 reasons I choose the Golden Nugget. We could have stayed somewhere else on Fremont Street for less! The arcade entrance was taped\/ coned off. The roof was leaking and the ceiling lights were still on! A complete safety hazard not to mention a law suit waiting to happen. Our room was your typical room... Nice. The only issue was the carpet inside our room and hall outside our room looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in weeks. Also, cable channels sucked. One bright spot (the only reason I gave them 1star) was the Asian Cuisine restaurant. The food was delicious and staff was fun, entertaining. We checked out early in the morning and spoke to staff about the pool closing at 7pm on a hot Vegas day. Ridiculous! They could care less. Not surprised. I will NOT be returning.

Room was fine and looked nice, but that night we got to listen to a rock concert from across the street until 11:00pm. Went down to the front desk and was told they were sorry, but they had put ear plugs in the room. 
Next day after returning to our room after it was "cleaned" we found that all they did was through trash and make the bed. No soap, shampoo, towels, etc. 
then the fun continues when the rock concert started back up. This time I called down to the front desk. This conversation was being told there isn't anything they can do. I asked if they knew when the concert would be ending and was told "I don't know, maybe 1-2am. There's a lot going on this weekend and we can't control everything"
Our room is on the 16th floor and it was shaking the walls. I can't image how people got any sleep. I sure didn't for 2 nights. 

Poor insulation\/sound dampening 
Poor customer service
Poor housekeeping 

Don't waste your time or have a bad trip to a fun city. 
Spend 10-20% more on your room elsewhere and get 2x the room and service.

Exceeded expectations. Very clean, hip room that was better than those I've had at much more expensive places on the strip. Nice staff. Great pool area. Didn't try the restaurants. The sports book was a mixed bag. If they could do a better job of running off the vagrants, it would be a very nice alternative to big, impersonal books like Caesars.

Room tip: If you plan to go to bed before 2 a.m., ask for a room NOT facing Fremont. The street noise is loud even on upper floors.

Not terrible, but for the price you can do MUCH better. I live an hour and a half outside of Vegas so I come here often. I've stayed in many hotels in this awesome city and I have to say that Golden Nugget was the biggest disappointment. We splurged for an anniversary and thought that as a 4-star it would be worth it. Our room was very poorly lit, there was no view whatsoever, and the air con did not work. The customer service was blah, and they will charge $10 for you to drink crappy hotel coffee in your room!!! True whole thing felt like a ripoff, and the whole place seriously lacked character. If you want a good place to stay on Fremont, go to the El Cortez! Much better place and 1\/3 the price!

So this is the first hotel I've ever stayed at in Vegas. 

That said, Ive stayed in a lot of hotels globally, so I'm writing from that POV...

To put it simply, if you are going to stay in old Vegas (downtown) then here is really your only choice. Sure you could try the Fitzgerald or one of the other hotels... This is the only one that comes close to having that mix of 21st century Vegas "property" feel you find on the strip mixed with the seediness of old neon on Fremont. Everything else looked kind of tragic and cheap in comparison. 

I found most of the service to be solid, the front desk treated me and mine with respect and courtesy and the room was clean and fresh smelling.

The only real rudeness I found was out at the pool. On Saturday, a bunch of us are chillin in front of a cabana, and none of the hostesses say its a problem... mustve been cuz of the breezy weather. Next day, some little pixie (can pixies be non-white? This one was) rudely tells me to leave "in case this cabana was rented". Insert expletive here. 

Aside from that unpleasantness, everything else about the Nugget was A-OK. I went to the spa twice to get a steam and a workout... very nice for the mens up in there. One very cute guy kept checking on me in the steam room. Had I been single i would've asked him what time he got off...

The buffet blows, but thats to be expected. We only ate there since we were headed out to Hoover Dam and needed a quick fix. Its like Jack Colton says: it seems like someone snuck into the kitchen and sucked out 40% of the flavor at these things. Hence why I don't frequent. And to the big people out there, dont be caught in a buffet its not healthy! 

Overall I found my 5 day stay at the Nugget quite nice, and a good deal. Would I stay again? Perhaps, if the price is right and after I've checked out some of the other "properties".
Loved it! Rush Tower!!! I won't use the valet again, but everything else was stellar.
best hotel in downtown fremont street.

Best spot downtown other than the Fremont, the pool area is nice, the restaurant and bars are good and the overall feel of the place makes your forget you're downtown...until you walk outside and see the homeless vagrants wandering around. Rooms are clean, the toilets are pretty extreme when they flush, beds are comfortable and if you're hungover there's plenty of tv channels to surf through.

I try to avoid downtown hotels at all costs since they're old, icky looking and smell like ashtrays.  I had friends from out of town over the weekend who wanted to see the light show and the shark tank.  I haven't even heard of a shark tank downtown - what shark tank?  We followed the signs to The Tank.  It's pretty neat!  The pool is heated and you can drink there or go down the slide as if you're swimming with the sharks.  A smaller version of the one in Atlantis (Bahamas).

I was amazed how neat the Golden Nugget looks.  They have Chihuly-esque glass sculptures and light fixtures.  I wouldn't know what the rooms are like though since I still don't trust downtown hotels.  This is where old folks party.  LOL.

Checking in can be a little bit of a hassle but after the rooms are awesome I know a lot of people leave bad reviews about the Carson Tower however the room has very nice beds with very nice linen there air conditioner is awesome the bathroom is very clean overall the room is really nice also they do validate parking Wi-Fi is free and the pool looks pretty awesome they also keep the pool open pretty late which is very nice

We stayed in the Rush Tower, Jr. Corner Suite, this past weekend for our anniversary. This is the 2nd time we stayed in one of these suites. The room itself is very comfortable, large, well appointed, and quiet. 

I cannot express how much of a surprise this was the first time we stayed there and we are definitely sold. 

Check in was a snap, Saturday at 12pm we walked in and there was one person being helped at the desk. Another employee came out from a VIP desk and ushered us in and checked us in within 2 minutes. We were given VIP line passes to venues on the property and we were in our room within 5 minutes. 

The location is convenient to the Fremont Stree Experience and adjacent casinos. The food in the Grotto and Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse is excellent.

Have fun.

I have been visiting the golden nugget for about 20 years now. They have made so many changes in that time. All for the better.  I am a creature of habit and once I like something I tend to go there often.  
The golden nugget is a very reasonably priced hotel in old Las Vegas ( downtown ) it is right on Fremont street which adds to the attraction. 
The rooms have been remodeled and towers have been added.  The restaurants are great and the pool is amazing with the shark tank built in to it. 
The only negative thing I can say about the GN is that they have had the same entertainer ( Gordie Brown ) there for years and years. He is horrible. I have seen him three times spread out over about 10 years. The first two times I sat through it because I didn't want to be a jerk but the third time we walked about.  The first time we paid and the other two times were comps ... I'm sorry I went. 
The casino and other staff are always very accommodating. 
I will be back again.  I don't think you will be disappointed.

Four stars because their communication needs to improve.

We stayed in the gold tower, and it was really nice. The bed was comfortable, the room was huge (we even got upgraded for being part of the Landry's Select club, which is $25 to join at any Landry's owned restaurant), and the shower was amazing, if awkward to get into.

 The only complaints we had were a total lack of signage on where to check in, which resulted in us having to go to two different check in lines at 1 AM, and the disconnect between them and the parking garage. They told us we didn't need our parking ticket to leave the garage without paying, only our room key; when we showed our room key, they informed us we would need the parking ticket, or we would have to pay $12. The woman let us go, but also said that the front desk "always" tells people they don't need their tickets. There is obviously some retraining needed here.

All in all, I much preferred it to the over-done glitz and glamour of a strip hotel.

My first time ever in Old Vegas in 2012 and I LOVED IT. I frequent the newer side\/main strip of Vegas, but last year we went for Punk Rock Bowling & stayed at this hotel. I was very impressed with the hotel, polite hotel staff, casino, cafe, and accommodations. Stayed again last month for PRBowling.

This hotel has a lot of old Vegas charm to it, which I loved. Super reasonable hotel rates, clean rooms, pool is on the smaller side but the shark tank is amazing. And the best part is that there is a Starbucks inside the hotel. YES, coffee! I need my Starbucks to keep up with my sleepless nights in Vegas. :)

We were very pleased. The price was fair and included the expected amenities (i.e. Internet access), the hotel is big but not too big, the shark pool is super-cute, the buffet is nice and fairly-priced, the pizza place was pretty good too... I'll be coming back.

This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. I brought my bag to the bell desk and checked in at 10am. I requested my room and my friends room be next each other. They told me it would be ready between 12-3pm. My friends got there at 1 and checked in and their room was ready. I went back and they said housekeeping was in my room cleaning. I went back
 30 mins later and house keeping was still in my room....around 3pm when housekeeping was still in my assigned room, I asked to be assigned to a different room. So they moved me right next to the loud elevator. They said they were sending my bag up. 30 mins later still no bag. I called the front desk 3 times to inquire and got no answer. I went down and they told me the bag was on its way. 30 mins later I was still waiting so I called again, no answer. Went down to the desk again to request check out and move hotels. By then it was 4:30 and I was still dealing with the room\/bag issue. 

My room window was literally a brick wall. No view
The room keys hardly work. 
My friends room next door to them had a party and when calling the front desk to complain no one answered so they had to get up and get dressed at 3am and go down to security. 
The buffet food is horrible. 
We were finished eating before the waitress brought our drinks. 
The showers are poorly designed so I had to burn myself to turn off the hot water. 

I do not recommend anyone ever stay at this terribly ran establishment.

I cant really say I'm a fan because I've only stayed there once and barely. Their parking lot is great, it's multi level and if you stay at the hotel, parking is free. I love their shampoo, conditioner and lotion, it was so light (yes, typical asian) 

6--(o0,)--6

Their rooms are clean and spacious. The only thing I hated about the hotel room was the airconditioner. For some darned reason, it rattled whenever I try to lower the temperature below 70 degrees. Also, whenever I flushed the toilet, it made the same sound as a firetruck. It's just weird.

Got a deal with HW so no issue with the price.

My husband and I have been staying at the Golden Nugget for close to 30 years at least 2-3 times per year. While Mr. Wynn no longer owns it there are still great portions of the hotel\/casino which remain the same. One delightful addition, or so it seemed until recently, was the non-smoking Rush Tower. It is now clear to me that the managerial staff has no clue as to how to look at the anticipated reservations for a given day and project how many members of staff it will take to check them in efficiently. The last few times the lines wrapped around to the gift shop\/elevator. It took 55 minutes just to get to the front of the line. It took another 35 to get checked in (computer glitches). I got pictures to prove it. Life is short, this is neglect. Management must know what's going on, or do they?

Stayed at the Golden Nugget one night and was very disappointed. Paid about $100 for the room, go the Carsten Tower, the old tower. The room was smelly, old, bed was uncomfortable. The bathroom was old, small, tub did not drain properly. Overall service was poor. Front desk staff were unfriendly. The hotel operators were also abrupt and unfriendly.

 Asked the valet to bring my car around so that I did not have to wait in line. That did not work.

Played about 6 hours of Poker, the beverage service was really bad. Only one server was on top of her game the other 3 were useless.

The ONLY thing the place has going for it is pool area and aquariums.

Stay at you own risk! This is no 4 star hotel.

Poor poor poor customer service. It dosen't get much worse for a vegas hotel as far as treatment. The only nice staff were the girls at the 24k club service desk. There were baby roaches in our room but no one to complain to at the front desk. Not enough table games for anyone into those. The craps tables are near pillars and are hard to get into. There are a lot of "working girls" that hang out at the bar nightly. In fact my wife and I played slots fr about an hour, turned around and every other seat was a "working girl" and a "John". The only reason the hotel is getting 2 stars is the pool. The pool was clean and a lot of fun. Overall, don't stay here if you want treated well for your hard earned money.

Well this was the first time we have come to Vegas and not stayed on the strip and it wasn't bad at all.  I decided to go Golden Nugget because we were coming to watch the Pacquaio vs Mayweather fight and those tickets were already $3k each, ie time to save some money on the hotel LOL.

Golden Nugget actually backs Freemont Street so you can just walk out of the casino and bam, you are right in the middle of all the festivities.  Room rates are pretty cheap here, but if you want to stay in the nice updated rooms its going to bump up cost to about what staying at the Luxor would be.  That being said the normal rooms are certainly not fancy, but they get the job done.  

The pool area is probably the highlight of GN with a huge aquarium in the center which includes a see through slide tube that shoots right through the center of the aquarium giving you a horrifying glimpse of sharks and other large fish as you splash on by.  There is also a bar in the pool and table games surrounding the pool area complete with bikini clad dealers.

There are lots of places to eat and drink inside the GN as well as a few shops.  The casino area was nice and we especially enjoyed the "no commission" Fortune Pai Gow tables.  In general all of the downtown casinos are favorable versus casinos on the strip.  There is no resort fee downtown, but there is a small $4 or so downtown renovation fee.  Wifi is not included but it is available for a fee.

Now, if you are planning on traveling to the strip often, you need a rental car.  Taxi rides are around $25 not including tip so if you don't want to rent a car you should probably stay on the strip itself.   If you don't mind the cab fare and want to try something different give GN a try.  GN is definitely the nicest hotel\/casino in the downtown area and Freemont Street is fun free entertainment.

i had no problems with the nugget. im a big fan of clean and inexpensive, and they were both. the pics i saw of the rooms online can be a bit misleading...i was expecting something bigger, esp since we had a double bedroom, but its whatever. 

the pool was the shit! dont get too excited about swimming with the fishes tho, cuz when ur going down that slide you cant even see them. the buffet was on point, the staff was friendly.

on another note, we switched rooms over the weekend and i left 2 bags of weed in the old room. from what i understand, nevada has a no-tolerance attitude towards marijuana (a joint gets you 3 months?) but nothing bad happened. the cleaning ladies kept winking at me the next day

My experience at Golden Nugget began with an almost hour-long wait to check in. There was literally one guy named Daniel working the counter. There were two people at the box office section with no line whereas the huge check-in line had only one person. When we finally got the our room, the first thing I noticed was that it reeked of cigarettes even though the floor we were on was supposed to be a non-smoking floor. At least they change our room for us pretty quickly. The hotel was fine, just their policies are so unaccomodating. I called the front desk to ask for late check out and they told me they had limited space and wouldn't be able to extend the check out time for even one hour. We checked out Sunday so I can't imagine too many people checking in. All in all, a very mediocre experience.
2 weeks after being promised a credit for 1 night, still nothing!!!  Was on the phone over 45 minutes with no results....
Very nice hotel! I enjoyed everything this hotel casino had to offer from slot paybacks to food, and the pool!

This is what I can tell you about our stay at the Golden Nugget last May. We loved it! Our room was amazing and ended up being what I would except from a Vegas Casino. The shark pool was awesome and very one of a kind we ate at one of their onsite restaurants for breakfast 3 times and the service and food were really good. The valet parking was top notch because the Valet remembered my full name each and every time. "It was my tipping"! lol Anyway I had 0 complaints about this place and would def stay again.

The hotel and casino is nice. The staff seemed friendly and they have a good amount of bars to lounge. However, our room (in the Carson towers) was horrible. The "smoke free" room smelled like an ashtray . The shower didn't work. The room looked old and outdated. There wasn't anything nice about it. They did give is a free late check out which was nice. I guess you get what you pay for .

Cheaper rooms, always availability and tried staying Downtown for once. Although they didn't have my room ready when I got there,  I did get VIP check-in.  Wanted to give me a smaller room, with no second bed (there were three of us) and the kill-em-with-kindness act ensued. "Um, you see, Ms. Manager, I think you would agree that that option just won't work for the three of us. Surely there is something you could arrange for our inconvenience. " And they slipped over a little piece of paper face down (like a deal in Scarface or some shit) and said, "I hope that will do. Thank you for your patience" 

CHA CHING, upgraded to the pliggity plush Penthouse suite, with THREE bathrooms and bownchicka bow wow mirrored ceilings. Not much view (except the top of Freemont) but who cares, we weren't looking out the window. Nice bar, steam shower, big ol' bed, def a mix of old school black-n-gold Vegas meets hip, zen accents.  Red Sushi was grub, buffet is aiight, pool is kick ass but small (SHARK TANK, cue the dun na dun na) and waterslide that goes through it. 

QUICK TIP: The VIP lounge offers free juice, cheese, fruit and cool kick it spot to wait. Save money and get a bottle o' booze at the store and free mixers in the VIP lounge. Saved at least $100 from room service to gamble...just a thought.  

Downtown feel is...different from the strip. Old school, but very walkable. Cheaper drinks tho, check out the super thermometer drinks peddled outside the casino on Freemont. Two of those should do the trick for a Rhino.

This is the most disgusting hotel I've been to in my life. I booked a suite here because I wanted to take my son to their pool ...the "suite" is a joke, especially for Vegas standards. It is literally just two regular rooms, adjoined by a door, except one room is missing the bed and they call that a livingroom. No wonder I couldn't find any photos of their suites. Didn't have a choice but to stay here for one night but you can bet I canceled the rest! The lobby is literally riddled with crackheads and degenerates. 

I guess this is why people don't stay in downtown Las Vegas.


The next morning, we decided to make the best of things and still go to the pool...  Well, we got there at 10am and there was NO WHERE to sit, and an obscene amount of people. The pool is tiny, and looked no where as cool as it does online. 

What a disappointment. Oh one good thing though... The hotel next door (walkable distance) had the most amazing buttermilk pancakes I've ever tasted. I would go back for them in a heartbeat.

if only the service matched the facility and amenities... 2nd consecutive visit where I've been disappointed in the service. being placed in a smoking room, due to overbooking. that really sucked, especially after booking reservations months in advance and specifying NON-SMOKING due to allergies.  I 'scored' a comp of one night free, due to another issue a year prior on my last visit (which I won't go into here), but they charged me for it even when I had pre-paid my stay PRIOR to arrival, so I could avoid a situation like that in the first place!!  I had to go back to the front desk, where the agent had to confer with the front desk manager before crediting out the additional charge.  ugh.  service seems to really be going downhill at this place, which is sad.  It is typically the nicest property downtown.  I think next visit I save money and stay at main street instead.  I did in fact write a complaint letter to GN mgmt., and while the response seemed apologetic, they didn't offer me much more than 2 nights' comp'd stay on the next trip...  I think not.  It seems to me if they were seriously apologetic, they'd throw me a bigger 'bone' than 2 nights' stay.  I don't think so.

I understand that Golden Nugget could care less about my business with millions of people visiting every year and spending multi multi millions (billions) at their casino, but I still feel the need to express my dissatisfaction with my recent visit (actually still here).  To not go on and on I did place a few tips for you to read. The most horrible experience happened last night...so here is my warning.

If you are a female and plan on coming here with your girls beware of your surroundings! My friend and I were harassed by homeless? Guys begging us for money while we were playing at a slot machine. When we told him we did not have any money he pointed to our screen and said "you have $80" and proceeded to insist we cash out and give him money. We told him "no", waited and cashed out and left very uncomfortable as we were walking away 2 other guys (possibly with the first) started to follow us. We sprinted to security who was less than helpful.  Unfortunately this is a theme throughout the entire casino staff.   If you are looking for a safe place to stay look elsewhere!

People, People.....this is the old Vegas. You want to pay many dineros extra go to the strip. Golden Nugget!!! One of the better one's on Fremont!!!You are there to gamble!!!! Food is cheap and plenty of it. Can drink for free at the bar if you max out on bets!!!!
This is the 3rd time I have stayed here. I have never had a bad experience here. The staff is super friendly and helpful. I recommend staying in the Rush tower.
Nice renovation to an old hotel. Good rates on room. We rented a cabana at the pool & were way over charged but it was an okay overall experience

Overall we had a very good stay.  I'm not giving them five stars for two reasons. We paid extra to get a room with a view when we booked the room online at their website. Upon arrival on a Thursday evening we were told rooms with a view were sold out. She said it was first come first served. The view from our window was a wall. She said she upgraded us to a mini suite for the inconvenience but the only difference between a regular room and a mini suite is that the tub has jets. Our friends who came with us paid $60 less and had a gorgeous view out their window and they arrived hours after we did. First come first served?  Whatever.  The second reason is the lack of lounge chairs at the pool. If you don't get there right when the pool opens or pay money to reserve a seat in advance you're pretty much out of luck. 

On the bright side everything else was good.  We had good food and good service at the restaurants and the bars.  The pool is definitely incredible. There was no waiting for the elevators which is always nice.

If you are going to stay in downtown Las Vegas, this is the best option. We stayed in the new Rush Tower and it was on par with some of the nicer strip hotels. Here's a summary: 

1) The entire new Rush Tower is Non-Smoking. 
2) The $20 trick worked. If you don't know what that is, google it. 
3) The TVs have HD channels available. Some hotels have these expensive HDTVs and no HD reception. We watched the football game in the room. 

I took off a point because the shower didn't work 100% properly, but it was not unusable. Another point off for housekeeping banging on our door at 3am because they thought we ordered a refrigerator. But, the room was upgraded and comped, so I wasn't too bothered by it. Overall, 3.5 stars.

My review is solely based off the walk through just to get to Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse. This is right on the middle of Fremont Street and man, it looks like it belongs on the center of the iconic strip. 

It has recently gone through a remodel, which left the place looking like a beautiful palace. I almost forgot that I was in the middle of Las Vegas when I was walking through the casino floors. 

The parking isn't too bad. Luckily, the restaurant we dined at gave us complimentary parking so we did get to walk around a bit. We loved looking at the shark tank pool and really can't wait to check that out during the summer.

I was so excited to see this hotel as I have only seen it here on Yelp and Google Images, but man if you live in Las Vegas PLEASE CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!

kelly and Lexi in the VIP lounge are absolutely amazing. On my sisters wedding day they made us feel right at home and special. I could not have asked for a more special day and place for my sister to stay. If I could give them 10 stars I would. These girls are so amazing and they truly did everything they could to make my sisters wedding night so special. Thank you so much!! I will be back for my birthday very soon!!!

The only reason why we stay here from time-to-time.is because of its location in downtown Las Vegas annnnnd their pool! Our kids are dolphins and because we personally don't have a pool in our backyard...we like to play tourist and take the kids on a swimming trip. While I love just hanging around the golden nugget, especially their pool, the last time we stayed there the bed sucked and I kept itching! No bed bug bites...but I was itchy. Usually when I get itchy something must've been dusty or moldy. I'm thinking the bedding wasn't changed but merely dusted off and fixed. How do I know? HAIRS. not haiR, but hairS. I didn't say anything and ended up sleeping on the second layer. The bed gave me bodyaches. 

I was disappointed because that wasn't the norm for our usual golden nugget stays. Then I realized the towers actually had names...I think we stayed in the Carson towers as they are the rooms that have the cheaper rates.

None-the-less, my children love swimming and staring at the fish tank...sliding down their slide...and just being able to swim, period. They have a part of their pool where there are built in lounge chairs where you can just chill partial in the water. This area is best especially if you have toddlers. I also like that I don't have to be around obnoxious woo-hoo we are in Vegas and are children free type of folks. Golden nugget typically attracts middle aged people. Besides, all the wild ones prefer to be ON the strip.

They have ample.parking that isn't connected to the hotel rather adjacent to ot. Elevator ride and a quick walk across and you have arrived. 

I can't say I HIGHLY recommend to stay at the golden nugget considering a lot of hotels in the vicinity have emerged...but, I certainly won't say not to. To each it's own. I believe it's the rush tower that has a beautiful aquarium at its check-in. Overall, we have had positive experiences aside from the last visit.

Enjoy!

Over rated. Good luck getting into the pool, its over crowded. Hallways stink because people leave their food and garbage outside and no one seems to care. The ice machine was a pool of ice cubes it's self with over flow pieces from the machine all over the carpet. I reserved my fees through Orbitz when I checked in at the front desk, they explained to me there would be additional 24$ nightly\/amenities fees for the (poor  quality) water bottles in the room (only 2), Internet WI-FI access (which I was unable to utilize my entire stay, due to computer glitch-error), Gym which I never used and Pool access which was impossible to use comfortably as it was always over crowded. Do your research before booking I'm sure you can get a better deal. This hotel is what you call a place with good resources but poorly managed!

After a few days of researching online to find a nice hotel with a fun pool area and decent pricing, for my upcoming 30th bday Vegas trip, I opted for Golden Nugget. I liked what I saw online (pics and video of the nice rooms and good square footage). I called a few hours ago to make my reservation. I was going to do the basic room (CARSON TOWER DELUXE) which was going to cost me $215 for 3 days in June, pretty good deal! But when I told the rep on the phone that I was celebrating my birthday, she told me about the much nicer and newly remodeled Rush Tower, and thought I might enjoy my stay there better. Much larger rooms, and when I looked at the room online, I loved the modern feel of the place. I agreed, even though it was about $100 more than the first room I was going to stay in. So my new total was going to be (with my AAA discount) $303.30 + tax she quoted me $312.39 (NEW RUSH TOWER DELUXE), figured I'd splurge a little more and waste an extra $100 on something a little nicer to treat myself. (I should have been concerned when she kept asking me to hold on cause she was having "computer problems" when I was confirming pricing with her. Maybe she didnt know how to add.)
A few hours later I get an email confirmation stating I was going to be charged $342.73 (over $30 more than what she quoted me!) What the hell!? So I call back, talk to another rep and tell her I'm being overcharged. She rudely cut me off a few times and told me the lady must have calculated the tax wrong cause they're going to charge me the $342.73. This is almost $130 more than what I originally wanted to spend. For that price I can stay at Luxor (where I usually stay, but wanted to try something different!), AND get the spa suite at that price, with a hot tub in my room and a separate living room area too. So disappointing. Was really excited about staying here. Now I have to wait 1-2 weeks to get my $161 deposit back. 
I used to gamble at Golden Nugget, but now I'm not going to even set foot in that place. Now back to the drawing board!!! :(

They now charge a $22 per day resort fee.  The problem is that my husband and I tried to get into the pool area Friday, Saturday & Sunday, but could not get a place to sit because when people have their towels on the chaise lounge it means its taken, even if they are nowhere to be found.  Three huge towers of hotel guests but not nearly enough pool area.  OK so we decide to come back in the evening thinking it would be less full.  The pool closes at 6pm.  Are you kidding??  The resort fee, we were told also included a gym that did not have enough machines so people either stood around or left.   

People smoke EVERYWHERE and it reeks so if you are a non-smoker and it bothers you, beware.  Our friends asked for a non-smoking room but had to change it due to the heavy smoke smell.   Many of the restaurants are connected to a bar area so smoking is wafting in from cigarettes and cigars.  The ceilings are lower than those in the newer casinos so I could not stay to gamble because the smoke smell was so bad.  No slot areas are designated non-smoking, though I hear they have a non-smoking area for poker tables.

The noise from the street area is ridiculous and goes on well into the night on weekends.  So forget sleeping because in some of the rooms, it sounds like there is a party next to your bed. 

I gave it two stars because the staff is very nice and were sympathetic.  They basically said the pool is a "first come first serve" and only charged us a resort fee for one night.  Also, the rooms are very nice and clean, though we had to call at 4pm to get ours cleaned to find out our maid did not come in that day  : \/        They finally sent someone else.

I guess if you don't care about the smoke, the noise, the lack of amenities for the resort fee  paid, this is the place for you.  For me, saving a few bucks was NOT worth it.

I like the Golden Nugget Casino.  It's much "fresher" and updated than most of Fremont St Casinos.  Great poker room, some nice bars, best downtown pool IMO.  We've had breakfast in The Carson Street Cafe a few times and it's always good.  It's our first choice parking facility for downtown too. 

Stayed in hotel for first time Feb 2014.  Rates were reasonable but higher than comparable downtown properties.  Staff was pleasant and helpful.  Check in\/out was quick.  I had the Gold Tower Deluxe room and it was well appointed with a couch, some nice chairs, great pillowtop bed, big older flatscreen TV & a large bathroom.  My friends had the basic Carson tower rooms for $20.00 less a night.  Rooms were fine, beds were not as good and TV's were old tube ones.

While I liked the Nugget, I'm not compelled to return.  The D is cheaper, nicer rooms, and much better video poker odds,

My fifth time at this hotel. I took a gold tower pool view room thinking I would not get any noise late at night. I was wrong. I don't know if the loud music was from the pool area or Fremont street but it lasted until around 3 am. If I decide to stay here again I will make sure I'm in a room that doesn't have any noise late at night.
One of the big reasons I will consider staying here again is the Hideout Pool.
Great food in the new restaurants.

The VIP rooms are so wonder to the counter service bell hop and just over all thee utmost social service and little things that thee employees helped with our questions. Highly recommend here and will stay again!

Pool area was chill, relatively cool people and attractive yet not overly pretentious crowd.  I had and good time hanging at the pool by the bar thought fully clothed haha.  Friends from Chicago enjoyed as well.  Away from the kiddys and strollers that are all too common on the main strip.  Do old vegas for a change.  Be the party!

Not like it used to be (although what is...) when guests we highly sought and lured downtown with free this and that.

Special GN water in the roomm. $4\/bottle. Single serving coffee maker standard - as are $10 4 packs of coffee pods. At $200\/night?!?!

Are pay toilets next!?

Oh year - the bathtub didn 't drain well...

We stayed in the Rush Tower facing Fremont street.  You could hear the music from there, but just barely.  We had a regular room, nothing fancy.  The bathroom was huge though with a double vanity.  The bed was comfy and the TV worked.  We didn't spend much time in the room, but overall it was pretty nice.  My only complaint is $12.99 per day for internet? 

The Casino was pretty standard with most of the table games.  The dealers were pretty friendly, but the pit bosses weren't.  I had much more fun at other casino's.  We didn't get a car so we took taxis everywhere.  The Valets did an outstanding job in my opinion.  They were extremely helpful and very friendly.  I would definitely stay here again.

This is definitely the gem, in terms of hotels, in downtown (Fremont St.).  Extremely clean and nice, with lots of good restaurant and bar options, along with a huge casino\/sports book.

The pool area is great, too.  There is a giant shark tank in the middle of the pool, as well a slide that goes right through the tank.  

The hotel does have multiple towers where they have hotel rooms, so the rooms are different depending on which tower you stay in, although they are all nice rooms.  The Rush tower was recently renovated, so I would definitely look to stay there.  If you stay on the top few floors, there are even delicious snacks right outside of the elevators.

When staying off of the main strip, I would definitely stay at Golden Nugget every time.

We arrived expecting the other "Fremont Experience" - dingy hotel room, very few amenities, sketchy casino and slow nightlife. We just wanted a place to crash before heading down to the strip for the week. Since this was only my second time in Vegas and first time Downtown, I wasn't sure what to expect. It seems like everyone has something to say about downtown and many people said not to expect much...

And when we arrived our room turned out to be two full beds. I haven't slept in a full bed since high school! For a moment, we were disappointed, but the room upgrades were affordable and WORTH the extra $. For the inconvenience, we were given a much later checkout time and some buffet coupons (that we didn't use, but we appreciated the gesture).

Our upgraded Rush Tower room ended up being the NICEST place we stayed all week. First off, the renovations in the main hotel\/casino areas are really great. Definitely check out the Chart House bar for a soothing view a gigantic aquarium and a cool lounge area. Beautiful glass installations throughout the hotel\/casino and the pool is really great. Have to love the slide that runs through the "shark tank." Unlike many other places, the pool is open late. Such a great bonus! We didn't really check out the "Gold Diggers" club, but the chill pool patio is definitely the place to lounge, relax, and sip on a drink.

Our deluxe room didn't have a great view, but had a comfy lounge area, gigantic bed, flat screen tv, office\/desk area and separate toilet and bath area. We loved being able to charge\/play our iPods on the in-room docking station, and the bathtub shower was perfect! Very clean and very upscale. Not at all what I expected, but we will definitely be back!

Highly recommend this place! Especially for the pool! 

POOL: My boyfriend and I are 23 and we absolutely loved the Golden Nugget's pools, both the shark tank (main pool area), and the Hideout on the third level. The water slide is very fun, and being in the water and watching the fish and sharks in the tank is beyond neat. There seemed to be people of all ages around, families included. I would recommend getting there by 9:30-10AM Friday-Sunday if you want to guarantee your choice of lounge chairs (or get a seat at all). Hint: if you don't want to be around children, hang out in the Adult Sunbathing (topless) area on the third level -- that's where we spent both Friday and Saturday and it couldn't have been more relaxing. The Hideout Pool is right around the corner from that area on the top level and you don't have to buy a $10 lounge chair in order to enjoy the pool. For all of the pools, they do check for room keys upon entering, so make sure you have yours! I would also recommend foregoing the bar in the Golden Nugget's pool area and instead walking to Fremont Street, which is extremely close, for $1 margaritas and cheaper food. Gotta love downtown ;) You can bring the cheaper margs back to the Golden Nugget and sip them by the pool -- they aren't strict about outside food and drinks coming in. REALLY, really enjoyed this pool and am already dying to go back! Go enjoy :)

Freemont Street wouldn't be Freemont Street without the Golden Nugget. Recently the Nugget was renovated, and I have to say it is looking pretty damn good. 

The pool is something that most definitely stands out. Not only because it's one of the few pools in the Old Town, but because it too was renovated and it has some exciting new features. To begin- Poolside Gambling- not a novel concept, but pretty sweet non-the-less; lounge chairs in the shallow waters of the pool- again not novel, but still pretty wonderful; and finally- an aquarium in the middle of the pool. Yep- that's right- I said aquarium. Complete with sharks and large fish the aquarium is seamlessly designed to sit in the center of the pool, and looks to be part of where you are swimming. To top that off- there is a water slide directly through the center of the aquarium that shoots you back out into the pool. Another bonus- if you're not staying in the hotel you can get a day pass for only $20, and it's well worth it. 

I don't necessarily recommend the nightclub, Gold Diggers, though. I did go there once, and it was a pretty shady crowd. Entertaining, but shady.

The Golden Nugget is a terrific downtown hotel destination.  We've been here before so I knew if I didn't want to walk a L-O-N-G way to the casino, Fremont St., pool, buffet, etc., to get a room in the Gold Tower.  We were on the 12th floor with a view of the pool.  The room was very comfortable but the shower doors should be replaced with a curtain.  It is so awkward that opens to the same space that the bathroom door opens.  It's also awkward getting the shower turned on and comfortable.  We had friends\/relatives staying in the Carson tower and their bathrooms did not have the difficult glass enclosure\/door.

We only visited the Carson tower rooms this time but they were fine too and our companions were very happy with them.

The one major complaint I have is their charges for wi-fi of $12.99\/24 hours.  I understand they want you down in the casino and not hanging out in your room but that's exorbitant.  I don't go to Vegas to hang out in my room but I'd still like to get online securely and safely to check on a variety of things.  Maybe they should have a one-hour rate or something available just for that purpose for their Guests.

Overall a terrific hotel.

Beautiful inside
Wreaks of cigarettes (as Vegas does)
Breakfast at Claim Jumper and dinner at Grotto's was good

Pissed bc someone walked in my room twice w\/o my consent while I was inside. First person didn't knock; second did but entered w\/o me having a chance to answer. Guess that's normal?

Bogus ass resort fee of $28 a night includes parking (which is free whether you're a guest or not), two bottles of water, basic Internet access for two devices (just two? really?!), access to the fitness center (but not the pool), and some other nonsense which would all be more than fine if I used any of it. Then have the nerve to charge $10 for coffee (which I don't drink but for $28 a night wld think coffee could be complimentary)? Damn shame.

I love the Golden Nugget it's the comfort of downtown with the elegance  of the strip.We are always treated very well there.Went to the spa twice and was very pleased with the services I received there. And our favorite dealer in the casino is Bicky (she was very sweet)

The Golden Nugget is home to the largest gold nugget ever discovered and guess who found it? A random man who was digging outside his trailer home. I think an elf brought some luck to him one night. Now I wonder where that man is now! 

This casino represents old Vegas amd does a great job protraying it. It reminds me of a casino in Tahoe.  The slot machines are older but work well, the staff is friendly and its a no frills casino meaning that it provises gambling and that is about it! But it's a great spot and definitely worth visiting!

omg. do you want to smell like an ashtray when you get back home?

you do?!

well, here's the perfect place.

all snide remarks aside, i stayed here once and although my initial reaction was that of hatred, i grew to love it once i figured it was the best hotel in that area.

haven't been back to downtown vegas since then.

First the good:  I've spent many, many hours in the GN, mostly in their poker room, which I believe is one of the best-run rooms in town.  Quick shout out to some of the best of the best:  Floor: Vito, Dealers: Marlon, Pete, Toni, and many, many others, and Server: Elizabeth.

And the not-so-good - the hotel itself.  

Day 1:
Check in was nothing unusual for Vegas.  The customer service agent (guy) was not anything I'd consider friendly or overly helpful.  80% businesslike, 20% arrogant douchebag.  

We were in the Carson tower, which is about a mile or so away from Fremont street.  I didn't really care, because I really could use the walking after playing cards all day.  We located our room, which turned out to be the furthest possible room from the elevator, roughly 200 yards away (no exaggeration).  Housekeeping was in the room, and told us they shouldn't have checked us in, and that we'd have to go back downstairs and get another room.  Annoying, given that we had just lugged all of our shit up there.  

The next agent (female) was much friendlier and apologetic, fixed the problem right away, and got us a different room.  The room was nice, but nothing to write home about.  It was dated, the air from the A\/C unit smelled a little musty, and my wife smelled smoke in the room (even though it was a non-smoking room).  I wasn't really in the mood to make yet another trip down, so we just sucked it up.  

Day 2:
My wife was determined to hit the pool.  After all, it is one of the highlights of the hotel, right?  We went down about 9:45, knowing the pool deck was open, but you couldn't swim until 10.  It was going to be another 115-degree or so day, so I was really looking forward to the pool as well.  

There weren't any chairs available.  There were plenty of chairs there with nobody in them, but some article "reserving" them.  One sandal on one chair, its matching sandal on the chair next to it.  A pair of sunglasses.  An empty bottle of water.  

We went up to the security person, who apologized and said that although people aren't supposed to reserve chairs, they just leave stuff there all the time and come back whenever.  She said they try to enforce the policy, and has told management that people abuse it all the time, but they don't listen to her.  With no chairs available, we left disappointed.   
 
When we returned to our room, it was open.  Not open all the way, but it was resting on the latch.  All of our stuff was in there, so I was more than a little concerned.  I walked down the hall and asked the housekeeper if she had been in our room, and she said no.  The housekeeper told me that "lots of people have keys to these rooms" and I should call down to security, so I called security.  They said they'd investigate and get back to me.  That was around 10:30 a.m.   I called back about a half-hour later, and "John" told me that a housekeeping key was used, and they were investigating.  They'd get back to me.  I gave up at around 11:30 and went to eat.  I eventually found out it was someone on the housekeeping staff that had done a room check - only because I kept on it.  If I had waited for the GN staff to call me back, I'd still be waiting.

My wife then told me that she wished we had stayed at the D again.  I agreed.

Day 3:
Pool deck.  Chairs.  Sun.  
And then the pool opened. 
There are around 500 reasons we don't have kids, and they were all there at 10:00.  In addition, the water was cloudy enough that we couldn't see the bottom step, and both my wife and I slammed our toes into it trying to get out of the pool.  Ugh.  

There is an upstairs (16 and over) pool, as we learned.  It has clear water, quiet, and none of the problems above. But since they were sold out of lounge chairs (everything costs money, and you can't go in for free before 5pm), I was stuck in Disneyland hell below. I gave up eventually and went into the casino for some peace and quiet.  

Day 4:
Upstairs pool, nice.  Poker, nice.  Buffet, nice.  Good day!

Day 5:
Check out.
Although they told us we weren't going to be charged the "Fremont Experience Fee," (we checked in under the wire), it showed up anyway.  So, I called down to have it taken off, and they apologized for me misunderstanding the check-in agent (which pissed me off a little bit, since both my wife and I heard him clearly). 

And the coup-de-grace?  
I hand our valet ticket in and wait.  And wait.  And wait.  
Eventually the valet calls me over to the desk and admits that they can't locate our keys.  He asks me if the name is correct, and what color the ticket is.  He dutifully goes through every envelope in the drawer.  Eventually, he locates it and gets our car.  I figured it would have been a fitting ending to our stay if they had lost it or given it to someone else.   

Verdict:
There are many things I love about the GN.  The hotel isn't one of them.

I'll continue to play cards there and eat there.  But stay there?  Probably not anytime soon.

So I'm not one to write reviews but I felt this needed to be said in order to warn people about the staff working there. My girlfriend and I decided to stay here for the music festival, Life Is Beautiful. We're trying to have a relaxing and fun weekend. My girlfriend decides it's best to leave her purse in the hotel room because we figured It would be safer there than carrying it around the festival. That morning we come to find out it's been stolen from our room. Security isn't able to reassure us about what's going to happen and if they're going to take care of this problem with their staff. Ugh. Point is stay away from this place if you value your belongings.

Stayed here for a staycation one night and had a great experience! Had a room in the older tower up on a higher floor so we had a great view of Vegas. The room was clean and neat but the decor was a bit "old". Could have really cared less about the room though since I would be seeing it in a blur later. Beds were super comfy and the room was a decent size as was the bathroom. 

Loved the pool! The shark tank is my favorite part! I've actually come to the Nugget while hanging out on Fremont just to relax and hang out. It's a great little quiet spot at night to just chill and get away from the street noise for a minute. It's crazy to think that there's something like that in the middle of such a busy chaotic area. :)

absolutely beautiful casino but does not take care of locals it used to be when you parked there and spent money in the establishment you got your ticket for parking validated so you did not have to pay for parking now its only for 3 hours they really need to take care of their local players. especially when locals bring tourists there to visit and spend money in the establishment.

If you have been to Vegas and have grown tired of walking the Strip, if you want a change of pace from the crush of peds, then the Golden Nugget is a great place to be for adult visitors.  You can easily use it as a one stop destination and just skip the crowded sidewalks of the Strip.  The Golden Nugget and the Fremont Street nightly party will keep you occupied and coming back for more.

Its the kind of place you have to see when visiting vegas. It feels like... walking the streets of Vegas back in the 70-80's. bright lights and cool signs. I think the all you can eat buffet and interesting staff make this a cool place to visit.

Worst hotel I ever stayed at. Bed bugs and dirty old rooms. Hotel management and security both knew about it and did nothing about it. Rooms were old and smelled. They didnt even want to change my room. Seems like a common problem in the Carson tower. Pool slide was broken which is the only reason why we wanted to stay here. Never again!!

I recently stayed at the golden nugget for the first time and I really loved it. I didn't have one unpleasant experience. The rooms in the gold tower were perfect and very comfortable! Also very nice that there is a claim jumper in the hotel....very convenient! I would absolutely reccommend this hotel and would stay again!

One full hour to check in.  When I mentioned it to the twenty-something clerk he complained he had been working 12 hours.  Blackjack dealers were not very friendly.   Steve Wynn's legacy of quality service is long dead.   Stay away.

The rooms are very comfortable - I'd have to say this was the best hotel bed I've slept on. Not too firm, not too soft. I think the pillowtop makes all the difference. The bathroom is roomy, not as cramped as some others I've been in, but the tub is very utilitarian. Get in, wash up, get out. There's no laying back and relaxing in this one.

The staff is mostly pleasant and attends to needs fairly quickly. The longest I had to wait for anything was when I discovered the drain plug was missing in the tub, and they had to go find a new one. That took about an hour. Otherwise, quick to address issues. The only problem we had was that we were guaranteed a late check-in, but they gave away our smoking room for the first night. We had to switch to a non-smoking room for the first night, and then check-out and check-in again on Day 2.

The hot tub is great, and it wasn't very crowded when I went down in the evenings. The pool, however, could be better. Over the course of my stay, I realized it's best to watch the good chairs. Most people assume a chair is taken when there are towels laid out on it, but I found that half the time, they aren't. Keep an eye out, and you'll find a decent spot. Now, for the pool itself. The slide and shark tank are very cool, and I enjoyed those. But I look for a pool where you can really swim. This one is not very ideal. This is a float around for a few minutes or just stand in the water to cool off pool. The shallow depth doesn't make it very ideal for swimming, and because so many people are just standing around in the water, it can be hard to move around. Another tip: If you want to actively swim, go on the shady side. People over there are mostly just standing close to the tank to see the fish. There's much more room to maneuver.

Also, I have to say, the dealers at the pool-side tables were very friendly and much more patient than in the casino, where it's busier. I played craps for the first time and had a lot of fun winning!

Overall, this was a good place to stay, but some things could have been improved upon.

The place is amazing! The suite was laid out and beautiful. Very roomy with ambient lighting. The Chart House Restaurant is breathtaking! This place use to be the largest casino in Vegas! And now I see why. The outside looks old, but the Rush Tower is absolutely luxurious!! Some of the service people were a little rude so that's why no 5 stars. I am very picky, but was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the suites, the spaciousness and the price was very unexpectedly reasonable.

If you're going to stay on Fremont Street, this def. is the place to stay. The pool alone is reason enough to stay here. I didn't realize there were sharks in with the fishes and actually dropped my toddler into the water when one swam up to us while our faces were pressed to the glass (I have a major shark phobia) After that we opted to chill on the lounge chairs in the shallow area.

Our room was nice, a little worn feeling but the bed was comfy. The Golden Nugget goes for more of the glitzy\/opulent vibe while we are more fans of modern\/clean\/simplistic, but we could appreciate the decorations for what they were. Terrible tv channel offerings, but I suppose most people are out gambling and boozing it up and aren't like boring old us, who were in bed by 10pm. Even walking through the casino, the smoke smell wasn't overpowering which was nice. We hit up the buffet for breakfast and it was good, just standard breakfast fare really. They had a bourbon syrup that was so good I started just eating croissants dipped in that.

I chose the Nugget over all the other Fremont Street casinos because of the water slide. Sliding through the shark tank was on my bucket list! It was definitely worth paying a few dollars extra to stay at the Nugget to experience one of the best water slides ever! 
The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The coffee pot had a sign on it saying it was an additional $10 to use. Ridiculous. Then I went and got a $3 small black cup of coffee at the Starbucks in the Golden Nugget.  Still ridiculous. 
The gambling minimums start at $10\/hand, where as all of the other casinos within walking distance start at $5. 
We didn't eat here during our stay because none of the restaurants looked appetizing. One restaurant was always full of people with empty tables. Every time we walked past, we noted how no one was ever eating, just waiting.
Now that my water slide experience is over, I'm not sure if I would ever stay at the Golden Nugget again.  It was good, but I can pay less to stay at ever other hotel on Fremont Street.

This hotel is awesome. My boyfriends dad bought us two nights in the Rush Tower and I have to say I was very impressed! First off the all the staff members were very friendly and helpful. Our bags came to the room fast and when I called for a wine opener It came to the room very quickly! (I like fast and friendly service). The room was amazing and spotless! even though we were only on the 8th floor we still had a view. The bed was heaven. I loved that there was a huge area for me to get ready and do my makeup at. A big bathroom is always a plus as well! Theres a few places to eat in here so we didnt even really leave the hotel because everything we needed was pretty much in the hotel. 

Every hotel I've stayed in has always had some kind of disturbance in the middle of the night or early in the morning, I was so happy we didnt have to deal with any of those at this hotel! Its hard for me to sleep\/relax with my medical conditions so being woken up in the middle of the night always pisses me off when I stay at hotels. We couldnt hear any noise in our room and it was so peaceful! I love this hotel and will definitely return for any of my future vegas trips. 

The only downside I can mention is the casino did not seem well ventilated compared to others I've been to and I'm very sensitive to cigarette smoke.

Spent a long weekend here during a music festival. The location is great since it's walking distance to the festival. I was a little weary of this hotel since there's some questionable photos of the property that are, quite frankly, downright disgusting.  Some of these reviews really had me worried.  I am happy to say that I did not encounter any of the horrible things I've read about this hotel.

Check in:
Especially during busy seasons, check in early! The lines do get quite long! Luckily, we checked in around 9am before we can get our room. The good thing is, you can leave your luggage at the front desk and they will text or call you as soon as your room is ready. Normal check-in time is 3pm, but our room was ready around 2pm. Front desk was very pleasant and helpful.

Room:
Rush Tower is their most updated tower. I heard the Carson tower isn't upgraded, therefore, it is cheaper. If you booked a different tower, you can always ask the front desk to upgrade you with an upgrade fee. (I've heard you can tip the front desk to get a free upgrade, but I'm not about that life). I'm so glad we upgraded because the room was very nice! Very spacious, comfy bed, big bathroom, and clean. Considering it's one of the older hotels, this room is comparable to other major hotels on the Strip. Rush Tower is the way to go! 

Pool:
I was so excited about the pool here! They have a fish tank in the middle of the pool! And a slide that goes between it! This was the main reason why we booked here this past trip. I'm deducting a star because I was very disappointed once we actually got into the pool area. The main reason being that all the pool chairs are stacked up right next to each other. I do not wish to be that close and personal with other pool goers! I understand they're trying to accommodate as many people as possible, but it was ridiculous. It was very uncomfortable and awkward to be so up close and personal in everyone's business. We didn't end up staying very long at all. Very sad.

Overall, it was a great stay. Maybe next time, I'll actually get to check out the pool when it's not so packed!

The  hubs and I decided to take a 4 night vaca in Vegas and thought we would step it up and stay at the Golden Nugget (we normally stay at the 4 Queens).  

Room - First, let me start out by saying that when we arrived to check in at (4pm)  they didn't have the room type we wanted and said that we would need to change rooms the next day.  They put us in a crappy 3rd floor room with a view of the roof and of the parking garage across the street.  There was some sort of vent on the roof that would whir at intervals that we could hear clearly in the room.  The next day we were moved to the 18th floor to a room that was in the furthest-most-far-away corner from the elevators.  It had a nicer view and a big flatscreen tv (the other room had an older smaller one) and no whirring noise.  However the trade off is that they were doing construction a few floors above us and would start scraping and pounding hammers at 8am.  We got to enjoy that for 2 nights.

Food - We ate at the cafe.  It was totally average.  I had to send my salad back because it was nasty (think of a bagged salad that has started showing signs that it needs to be thrown out).  They did replace it with much better lettuce but it was still just blah.   The breakfast\/lunch buffet (we arrive there right as they were switching for lunch) was good.  It was a decent variety of food and some good desserts.

I can't really rate the casino because we were really not impressed by the GN so we weren't inclined to spend our money there.

Overall, I probably won't be staying there again!

One last thing - what is up with the poor quality tp at all downtown hotels?  I thought that the GN would at least have some decent tp!

Note:  I did not gamble at all.  Not interested.  

Pros:
- Pool!  Terrific pool (the main reason we stayed there) with great music (though the DJ could have given a bit more variety).  The fish are awesome, and the sharks are downright distracting.  You are in the pool, and they go casually swimming by in the tank.  Really impressive.  There are a couple of sharks that have razor-like teeth sticking out, and with their sinister-looking eyes, they grab your attention.    
- Rooms are nice, but need more electrical outlets for all the cell phones, iPads, etc. 
- Free parking
- Starbucks in the lobby (of course you have to pay for it)
- Nice dining area.  All the restaurants are updated, contemporary, modern, and competitive.  If at dinner time you walk down the main corridor where the restaurants are, the terrific smells will make you hungry.  
- Drinks at pool:  Pricing was less than I expected, and less than the awful Serendipity 3.  I think I paid $7 for a bourbon & water.  Not bad considering it was pool-side service.
