Note:  Bring your ID if you want to charge to your room!   You can also get a small bucket of beer 6 for the price of 5, including ice.  This was popular at the pool.  

Cons:
- No in-room free coffee?!  This is the first hotel I have stayed in in more than 15 years that didn't give free coffee in the room.  Wow!  That is very CHEAP of the Golden Nugget.  
- No free WiFi.  If you want to connect it is $13 \/ day.  Seriously?!  
- Lots of smokers walking around and in the casino, too.  Though, that seems to be the same all over the Strip casinos I visited.  I could smell the smoke in my clothes.  
- Clearance in parking deck:  It is LOW!  If you drive a big SUV, then you can't have anything on the roof at all!  
- TV service in the room:  I think the hotel needs to update its wiring.   Our TV suffered from lagging and pixilation.  From past experience this indicates too much content trying to go across old wiring.

If you are driving to Las Vegas, stay off the strip, and if you are staying off the strip, stay here. The room was huge, stylish, clean, comfortable, and most importantly CHEAP! I don't understand why one would pay 3-4 times the price to stay on the strip when you can park in any of the strip's hotel's, visit any of the strip's lobbys\/casinos\/restauratnts, without having to stay in their overpriced rooms.  However the buffet here wasn't that great. Otherwise, excellent room for an excellent price!

Do you ever wish you could rearrange the names of places in Las Vegas?  I'd let the Nugget have "Oasis" because it truly is an oasis in the desert.  
[Once upon a time I might have said "the desert that is downtown" but those days are a fading memory.  DT is on a roll that wont stop until it arrives at a place you no longer recognize.]
The rooms at the Nugget are a prize.  Cant tell you how the food is--we ate off prop every meal, but the staff is one of the most professional in the city--certainly in DT.
Secret tip for you here: the rooms are discounted in the Carson tower but they're just like those in the Gold tower, except that they're further away and thus avoid much of the crowd crush on when the hotel is busy.  Second secret tip for you: the toilets in the Gold tower are short (meaning shallow) and if you're not careful, your junk will hit the water.  You only make that mistake once--er, well, twice if you're a slow learner like me.

Room was comfortable and clean. Two bottles of water were included in our basic room but no coffee. You could pay $10 for 4 k-cups. No fridge. 

A little noisy at night. But not too bad. Remember this is Vegas.

On their website they say that they'll beat any price on hotel.com or other websites like that. But we did have to ask repeatedly about that.

Check out the fish tank in the middle of the hotel. It's pretty impressive to see all the fish and sharks swimming around.   

For the wireless, you could connect two devices.

All in all a decent experience.

Nice plush relaxing room, UNTIL.....
Construction starts every night at midnight!!!  Right outside, sounds like  giant alien robots are tearing the walls down. All night long!!!! 
  We were so exhausted we called down to the front desk and after 30 minutes of recorded overly cheerful advertisements of how you can spend your money in every part of their hotel, casinos and cafe's, someone finally answers and says she will send up some earplugs.  After waiting another 40 minutes in the din of robot construction, a fellow comes to the door and hands me one pair of earplugs, I can see another pair in his hands and say there are two of us here and we need two pair, he wont budge, "sorry these are for another room,I will have to come back and give you some more".  So we wait.
   Hours later, four times on the phone and an attack of hysterics brought on by lack of sleep, overstimulation and NOISE we finally get a second pair of earplugs and get to sleep about three oclock.  By six AM the sound of twenty construction vehicles with their reverse beepers on, cut through the thick earplugs, it was like trying to sleep through twenty alarm clocks going off.
  My eleven hour drive the next day was rough.

 Overall
Room nice, plush , clean,good water pressure,really too dark to put your make up on in, hard pillows (bring your own),  
  Great pool and shark tank, beautiful flowers(real) Beautiful bathrooms in the casino, very nice little wedding chapel, pretty good cafe's (need more vegetarian selections), nice enough staff when you can find them.
  It was so difficult to actually get through to the front desk, I wonder what would happen if there was a big problem, like a security issue.
 Apparently the construction will be going on for some time, this noise probably impacts the other hotels in the downtown area. I am suprised that people can do construction 24 hours a day there.
  The area is getting better,and the Gold Nugget is the nicest in the area, but there is still an element of sleazy people hanging around, so I would probably feel safer on the strip.
 I would review the casino, but i dont really dig gambling, I would much rather spend my 3 dollars on gold 60's shoes with lucite heels,like I did at the local Goodwill.

  I am sure this hotel will be nice when the construction is over, but I had to take stars off for the noise and unavailable staff.

The Golden Nugget was a pretty nice place to stay downtown.  It was my first time ever staying off the Strip.  The Golden Nugget is in the heart of Fremont Street, close to all the stages, street performers, and fun craziness.  We stayed in the newer remodeled Rush tower, as the Yelp reviewers had recommended.  This upgrade in rooms was also a significant upgrade in price. Our room was really very spacious and nicely decorated.  The view from the 20th floor was pretty cool, especially at night.  Also, there was a large tub, nice shower head, and it was very clean.  
I did not like some things about the hotel.  The $28 per night "resort fee" was supposed to include two bottles of water per night, internet, and pool use, but the pool was closed and they didn't bring water.  However, when I called they did arrive right away with the water.
The housekeeping did a good job, but I guess the hotel does not communicate with them too well, as we had housekeepers knocking at our door to ask if we were leaving, despite our request for a late check out.  I  also did not like that they charge $10 for the cups for the Keurig.
As far as amenities, the hotel is not bad.  As I said, the pool was closed (not sure if was due to the season or remodeling), so I cannot comment.  They have a few restaurants and two Starbucks (which is nice when you don't want to pay for the Keurig).  
We spent some time in the Chart house cocktail bar so we could be mesmerized by the amazing fish tank.
Though our room smelled clean, the casino in the hotel was one of the smokier ones I've stayed in.  

All in all, it was a decent hotel, but nothing amazing.

I loved staying here.  Granted I'm a local but it really is the nicest place downtown.  I got the cheapest room for the night and it was still one of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed at.  The beds were comfy and the room beautifully decorated.  The closet contained two bathrobes, luggage rack, extra pillow, iron and board, and an easy to use safe.  I liked that there was a little vanity outside the bedroom so I didn't have to crowd the bathroom to put on my make-up.  

I think the best thing about this place is the pool.  Sure it's small and getting a lounge chair might be a fight to the death when it gets busy, but it is so fun.  Also if you don't know, the free towels are in the retail shop.  I was suprised to find it was a salt water pool.  There is a shark tank smack in the middle of the pool, and in the middle of the tank is an awsome water slide.  I was suprised to find an elevator to the third floor to get on the water slide, so fat asses like myself don't have to huff and puff up three flights of stairs to have a bit of fun.  At the end your going fast enough to go under, so be prepared.  Salt water up your nose, hurts so good.

FYI: They have been going through a re-model and face lift for a while now so if you do go, expect some noise.

This place is fairly cheap, clean and easy to get in and out of. There were definitely a few glitches but nothing devastating

We asked for a king bed and got a room with two small beds, the sink did not drain at all.

But like I said, the parking is easy and the walk from car to room is easy (especially compared to hotels on the strip)..

On Super Bowl weekend 2013 my husband and I stayed at the Golden Nugget in room 19117. The following day, Saturday, we decided to go check out the Red Rock Hotel.  We left our room at approx. 10:00 am and placed the privacy please sign on the door. We were out of the room until approx. 5:00pm. During that time my jewelry box was stolen. When I contacted the security dept. a gentleman came to our room and took a report in a very small piece of paper that didn't appear to be very official. He did explain that Loss Prevention would be in contact with us in 5-7 days. When we contacted the Loss Prevention Dept. later the following week he informed us that according to their records there had been some activity in our room while we were away. I asked why someone would enter our room when the privacy please sign was hanging on the door. The gentleman I spoke with told me that someone could have removed the sign while passing by and we had no proof that the sign was there. I explained that when my husband and I returned to the room that evening the sign was still on the door. He told me that the person who entered the room had a "stellar" reputation and was a long time employee with no complaints. I guess the question is why did they steal my jewelry regardless of weather the sign was on the door or not, which it definitely was. Why would someone enter my room without cleaning it, changing the towels etc. There was no signs that anyone had entered the room other than to take the jewelry box. Since the value of the jewelry was quite expensive they have failed to take any responsibility for the employee responsible... Hopefully LVPD will take some action and find the guilty employee. What a horrible experience!

Recently had a one night stay at the Golden Nugget. What a wonderful experience! Staff was welcoming and accommodating. The room they provided was spectacular. The bar area for the chart house had the most beautiful aquarium I've ever seen. The next time I'm in Vegas I'm definitely coming back. This is a place you have to see to believe. Oh, and the artwork with the blown glass displays everywhere throughout the main lobby: just something you must also see. just gorgeous

Not a bad hotel and decent price for the area, almost everything was fine.  My major problem was the horrible itching from the sheets, bumps all over my legs.  I've never had that reaction before. It wasn't bed bugs, just a reaction to whatever they use to clean them.  Was not a fan of the room heater either, there is no temp setting only able to change it to low cold\/high cold, fan, low heat\/high heat etc which is a pain to change all the time.  Stayed in the Carson tower.

Pros: 
- Fremont street is fun, this is a great location to check it out
- Decent restaurant selection in the hotel
- Nicely decorated for the holidays
- Carson tower rooms are not too run down, mostly up to date some old things mixed in (old lamps, TV, and popcorn texture ceiling for instance)
- Iron and ironing board provided in the room
- nice shower
- good pillows

Cons: 
- Sheets had something in them that made me break out and itch terribly, a quick google revealed other people having this issue
- Heater needs to be managed, no way to set the temp
- No fridge or microwave in the room
- No where to plug in devices next to the bed, there was an available outlet on the other side of the room
- Time share people pouncing every time we went by, we ended up almost shouting "NO" when we passed by, it got old fast
- Fairly smokey in the gambling area compared to other newer Las Vegas hotels

The nugget is GORGEOUS! I stayed here my past Vegas vacation and I was so impressed. 

I went to the pool & I highly recommend if you want to relax to splurge and pay the extra $20 to lounge at the hideout at the pool. No kids, no obnoxious people just sun and calm. It made my vacation perfect.

I didn't do much gambling at the nugget (I prefer cheaper tables) but the service at the bars and restaurants was amazing!  I would easily stay at the Nugget again!

So it's 9pm on New Year's Eve Eve and your flight home gets canceled. Great. You're too much of a princess to sleep at the airport unless you absolutely have to, so you start to weigh the options. Car rental is too much, the Motel 6 and Travelodge are sold out. You call the Stratosphere, hoping they have something...nope. You call the Golden Nugget. They have a room for the night, and will only charge 69 bucks. For a last minute, we need this now hotel room, it's not too shabby.

The room itself was nice, the pillows comfortable, the shower head made it rain. Nice. We didn't experience much of the amenities, but they all seemed nice. The 24\/7 cafe had great soup, also available at room service.

The Golden Nugget is the place to be. Ill never go to the strip again.
From the first moment until the last - total luxury. 
We stayed in the Gold Rush Club level. The room was beautiful, the bed was comfy, the pillows were sublime. Big beautiful double vanity bathroom with a separate toilet and a big deep wonderful bathtub. Even the towels, shampoo, soap, etc was delightful.
The lobby and bars were beautifully designed and very elegant. The happy hour at the Chart House was so good and so inexpensive and the view is a huge aquarium. The fish tacos were only 8$ and they were the best fish tacos I have ever had. I live in Southern Cali - so I have had a lot of Fish Tacos.
The pièce de résistance is the pool. It is listed as one of the most beautiful pools in the WORLD. Where do I start? How about the SHARK TANK - how cool is that - swimming with the sharks. There is also a fun water slide. Firepits and comfy couches, lounge chairs and double seated chairs abound.
I had a day bed in the upstairs ADULT ONLY pool - so cool. Had a DJ and plenty of servers and a nice pool, most importantly - quite.
The nightclub, Gold Diggers was pretty fun, but my favorite was the Rush Lounge - live music is always so fun.
The staff was prompt, helpful and courteous - everywhere from the lobby to casino to the bars to room service. A big shout out to Ramona Thielke and the Front Desk manager Johan - thank you.
By the way, Freemont St. is lively, fun and full of music - including live concerts.

This is not our parents Golden Nugget - you have to check it out.

I enjoyed our recent stay at the Golden Nugget overall. The décor was nice; the bed and pillows were super comfortable, and that pool with the shark tank and waterfalls was heaven. The chocolate shop was pricey but very good. We ate at a couple of places in the hotel that were unremarkable; the Grille (expensive for a mediocre sandwich place), Claim Jumper which was okay, and the buffet for lunch. What I didn't like was one morning, I was playing a slot machine near Starbucks (so near the front door) and a panhandler spotted me from the street and came right up to me to ask for money. The front doors were propped open and no security to stop something like this. Secondly, and this is not the fault of GN, Fremont Street is getting really seedy.  Several women walking around wearing thongs and pasties. One lady had only a thong and help a cowboy hat in front of her breasts.  Several guys walking around with thongs only; one of them was yelling to a group of young women trying to get their attention. TOO many people there dressed up in costumes, wanting tourists to take their photos "for tips". It's just getting to be like a freak show and I felt bad for families with young children with all the near nudity. Time to clean up Fremont Street. And GN, beef up your security.

I keep going back and forth between 2 and 3 stars....this is an affordable hotel, my husband and I paid less than $700 for 4 days, 3 nights + flight from Seattle....I think the hotel portion actually cost us like $30 a night! The room was clean, not overly modern or impressive but the bed was comfy and the water hot. We had a terrible view of a back alley- only good part was we could see a reader bord that displayed the outdoor temperature. The pool is the main attraction at this hotel. The shark tank was beautiful but I was personally disappointed that the pool is in the middle of the hotel. People are walking around all day, playing slots, eating and resturants and watching people sunbathing and swimming- kind of weird. I enjoy the hotel pools that look a little more tropical and so it's a relaxing oasis, not a ton of chairs crammed on a concrete deck inside a glass box for all to see. I spent about 2 hours at the pool every morning and found it filled up fast so I would grab some starbucks, suncreen, a book and head down as soon as it opened (10am if I remember correctly) to grab a seat. We were there in mid-April and I found only one side of the pool had sun in the morning, then the other side in the afternoon...bad set up. The towers shade the pool. 

The hotel (like most in Vegas) was kept very cool. My husband loved it and I was freezing. I also was a bit irritated by the people who stand at a desk near the Gold Tower elevators and try to sell you their timeshare speech EVERY SINGLE TIME you are going back and forth to your room. 

We did quite a bit of walking around in Fremont on this trip and I believe the Golden Nugget is the nicest hotel there. I personally do prefer to stay on the strip so I think a lot of my review comes down to personal preference. 

We also tried two of three resturants in the hotel; The italian place- run the other direction it was disappointing. Their signature steak house - it was delicious but super pricey and the wine list was like a freaking encyclopedia to flip through and finally their Seafood resturant, Chart House, I had the stuffed sole and it was FANTASTIC. My favorite meal the entire time we were in Vegas. I'd definitely go back! 

Overall, good value, I recommend it on a budget (or if you just really love Fremont), but if you have a little cash to spare I'd suggest springing for a nicer hotel on the strip. I personally love MGM but I'll save that for another review :)

My boyfriend and I booked a room here for the shark chute. No where was I able to find that the slide had been closed and the aquarium drained so we were pretty disappointed when we got there. 

I had requested a smoking room when we booked almost 3 months in advance, yet upon arrival, no smoking rooms were available and the lady that checked us on was pretty rude. After a couple days we were able to switch to a smoking room but ended up deciding to get a different hotel down on the Strip for our last two nights. 

My boyfriend called to try and get the last two nights of resort fees refunded because had we known the shark chute was closed, we would have stayed at the 4 Queens next door which was cheaper and didn't have ANY resort fees. The guy he spoke with offered us free passes to, get this, the shark chute (it's closed and we're traveling, why does this make any sense?). When we declined he said he would have the manager give us a call. Which never happened. 

A week went by, still no call, so I emailed guest services on 5\/26\/2017 which says a response is generally received in 24-48 hours. I have yet to receive a response.

We stayed in the rush tower this time. The noise from Fremont st was constant. I love the nugget and hate to give a bad review, but here it is. We've stayed in the gold and Carson tower and not had this experience. Not sure what's happened.

Debating between three and four stars. We stayed in the rush tower and the rooms are recently renovated. They're in a modern design and well done with good furnishings. If your room backs up to Fremont Street you will hear music till 1 AM, the last show. It's an older hotel with a new experience and not too shabby.

Well this casino.... I have good and bad memories here... we went to freemont street and ofcourse we had to go inside this casino which is one of the first ones that was build in vegas... we didnt stay in the hotel, we just went in to see and maybe play... so it was crowded!! it was really nice the casino though, lots of machines and good admosfeer... first on the spin our friend made a few bets and was Lucky a couple times and won a 100 bugs...! then we signed up at the players club and had a free bet on the slots... so we went for it... quarter slots are my favorite so we went there.. me my mom and our friend gordon went to play... gordon is mostly Lucky and was on the winning hand... i, as Always unlucky... i was loosing... and my mom as Always is sharing the machines with us just looking and pushing the button... i was getting frusterated and in one row were 5 different slots... i stayed at 1 machine quit some time using my own money not the free bet, and was just loosing, then i went over to the next one next to it because i was done with it.. then an old lady sits next to me on the machine i just finished on... she pushed the button 1 time and guess what... the machine starts counting and she won 280 dollars on 1 push on my machine!!! i couldnt believe it and felt terrible!!!!! but thats vegas and gambling!! eventually now i was pissed and didnt want to leave that casino with nothing so eventually i walked out with 50 dollars profit haha.. but all and all we had a great time and the casino is really in the old fashion style of my taste... only really bad point i have to put out, in the 2 hours we spend gambling there, not 1 time we got offered a drink, and we were so thursty!!!! i wanted to give 4 stars, but because of this 3 stars....

EEEEHEEEHEHEHHNDHAHAHSJKASKD

The G*Nug is my new favorite spot in Downtown Vegas. At 50 bucks a night we could afford to stay two nights longer than we planned.

The pool was awesome, the video poker bars kept the drinks flowin', and our room was way more than 50 bucks could ever get you on the strip.

Only downside- for some reason the water in the ENTIRE FRIGGIN HOTEL smells like someone pulled out my colon, soaked it in sulfur, and hung in to dry on a humid Florida day.

Bring your own water and then party on!

The hotel isn't that bad, but I had a terrible experience. If you are coming to take a kid to a jacuzzi, it can't be this one. 

My son is 5, and they wouldn't let him in the "hot tub". I get that there are liability issues, but there hot tub was COLD! The actual pool was warmer! My 5 year old wanted to go in a jacuzzi for his birthday. 

And if you agree 5 is too young, they don't let anyone under 16 in. I saw them kick a 12 and 14 year old out of their like warm tub too. Seems harsh. 

They should have a waiver to sign so you won't sue them for whatever they are worried about. Golden Nugget, you suck.

Everything was cool until we got to the pool and the waitress wouldn't wait on us, looking at us checking out the menu then waited on everyone but us, my husband had to go to the bar to order all our food and drinks! All was good but her.

---Review is for the casino only---

Went here for blackjack\/craps\/slots. Nice inexpensive tables and it smelled fine there compared to Treasure Island. Nice dealers for blackjack\/craps. The drinks were strong and the other players were also nice.

Overall, I recommend it...and not just since I actually made some money.
The waitresses don't walk by to serve drinks even if you're gambling. She never came to serve me a drink. Rip ofg

This was my second trip to Vegas and it was for Punk Rock Bowling. I'd say that skews the experience somewhat, but I get the impression that a bunch of punk rockers with awesome hair and tattoos sitting by poolside isn't *too* unusual for a place like this. 

One thing about punk rockers however, they're notorious for being exactly what they are. You'd think this would give the staff headaches. If it did, they didn't show it.

I stayed in the Rush Tower, which was nice enough. Nothing extravagant, and nothing unbelievable. But a nice touch-you can walk in and out of the building, go to the in-casino starbucks, diner, guest services and the pool without having to pass through the casino. That's a big plus to me. 

And the pool-let's talk about that. Like most hotel pools, it's not very deep, but what it lacks in depth it makes up for in a giant shark filled aquarium...WITH A WATER SLIDE. And not just a water slide, but a transparent water slide that passes through said aquarium. It sounds better than it is since you don't have time to even notice the aquarium you're passing through, but still...it's an awesome touch.

My bride and I recently stayed at and were married at the Golden Nugget. 

We have mixed feeling about our stay.

The service was lacking from check-in. Our reservations were screwed up and several individuals in our party, who reserved rooms, were placed in smoking rooms. Even though non-smoking rooms were requested. This was unacceptable considering one of our guests was pregnant. 

We stayed in the Rush tower. The room was ok, but extremely loud at night due to outside music. 

We dined at the Grotto and it appears there were only three people working: hostess, waiter, and a frustrated chef. The waitstaff was nice, but as we sat waiting for service, a chef who was placing chickens on a rotisserie, was dealing with a rotisserie malfunction. It kept making noise. He called maintenance and four men arrived. Amusing that maintenance men out numbered waitstaff . 

More poor service...At check in we received a coupon book. We tried redeeming a dining coupon buy one get one free and a hotel staffer crudely told us it was not valid. 

Highly disappointed internet service had a fee and the hotel actively has staff trying to sell timeshares. 

The wedding chapel was intimate and our wedding was handled professionally. The priest did a wonderful job. Following the ceremony, we went for a drink in the lobby. Unfortunately, my bride was carded which caused a problem since wedding dresses are full of pockets.They would not even comp me a diet coke. Slight disappointed the hotel did not even place a split or small gesture in our room. 

The pool was heated and very nice. It was one of the highlights of our trip.

I will be looking elsewhere next time we travel to Vegas.

By far the WORST hotel i have EVER stayed at!! Horrible horrible customer service! The manager of the hotel is a absolute joke! Nasty rusty tub with broken drain, burn marks on the ceiling from the lights, and to top it all off we got locked out of our room not once but twice due to the card reader be broken. Their way of fixing that was pretty much telling us we just had to stay in our room!!! Again dont stay at this hotel you will NOT be happy!!!!!!!

If you're a local do not drive, park and play here. It's very inconvenient. For example, parking is NOT complimentary. If you sign up with their players club and play you can have free parking but those "qualifying" machine don't actually work in excepting your PIN number (we tried many). So it's all a gimmick to make you stay longer than you want to. 
I play the slots and poker but never here. Never will. There are better casinos here. TOURIST TRAP in my opinion. Not for locals. This will be written about in the Chinese newspaper someday I believe. They have been building a reputation for not being accommodating.
PS Long wait for the poker room as well.

The Nugget is a totally decent option when staying in Vegas, especially, if like me, you've seen enough of the Strip for one lifetime.  I love Fremont Street (the lights!  the colours!  The vintage signs!  The pancakes at Dupars!) 

Rooms at the Nugget can be had for under 75 dollars on low season weekdays. Our rooms were about 50 bucks a night when we stayed in early September, which was fine and dandy for the quality of the rooms.  We stayed in the old Carson Tower:  The room was quite large by Vegas standards with a view of the pool area and Fremont street.  Beds were big and comfy and the air con worked.  Yes, the fixtures were a bit old and we experience some problems with the lamp lighting, but that's to be expected at that price.  We didn't eat at the Nugget because there were plenty of good, affordable options around (pancakes!) Weather wasn't great so we only used the pool twice.  The slide through the shark tank is super fun but in general the pool area is disappointing.  It's overshadowed by buildings most of the day, with the few sunny spots all taken up.  The main pool is cloudy and filled with kids while the hot tup is full of skeevy looking folk necking coronas.  

If you're looking for class, you ain't going to find it at the Nugget, but if you're looking for a cheap, comfortable place to crash, it does the trick.

First had to wait forever to check in, then when we got to room the room they gave us was not even cleaned. The room was a mess by previous occupant. I went to tell manager and he had an attitude n just gave us different room. With this inconvenience you would think they would of upgraded our room our something. Then to top it all off while sleeping housekeeper walks in no knock no nothing then acts surprised and scurries out, complained again. We always wanted to stay here but after all this don't think we will be back. Oh n still no comps or anything for all the inconveniences. Four Queens at least gave me suite one time cause room was not ready at check in. Get it together GN!!!!!

Decided to make my Vegas trip a day longer so I stayed here.. the main reason was the pool\/slide for my two young kids.  The Pool I would rate 3.5 stars as the slide is very cool and the tank is very Very Cool with massaging waterfall to boot. 

The room on the other hand was disappointing, there was rust running slowly down from the tub (overflowing stop.. the round silvery thing) , the air condition works but load thorough the night and the worst was the Queen size beds.. make that tiny.. more like a full size bed.. pillows and mattress were almost as hard as cardboard.. bath towels had that "overused" ivory discoloration color.. But hey, for a room under $50 a night.. it wasn't bad

Such a great hotel! Never stayed on this side of Vegas but would def recommend it. We stayed here New Year's Eve and did the party in the grand ballroom and the Fremont st experience. The band in the ballroom was awesome and the food was great. 4 course meal with seafood and meat and open bar with premium liquor!

The doors don't open until 9 which I think should be a little earlier because I felt that we didn't have enough time to eat, drink, and dance. Would like an extra hour there. 

Right outside of the casino doors, there was a stage set up for Freemont at experience and blues traveler was playing! Great way to spend New Years!!

The pool here is awesome. The Hot tub gets a little crowded and isn't as hot as I'd prefer, but it's open from 7am-2am! Not a bad way to end a night. The slide is worth every bit of shivering after. Even though the pool is heated it still feels pretty cold after getting out. The sharks staring you in the face while sliding down is un like anything I've ever seen. Pretty cool pool!!

If you have never stayed downtown vegas, give it a try! Worth the $6 bus ride to the strip if you need to go.

Downtown has really changed the last 5 years or so.  Cleaned up and way for food options and things todo.  The golden nugget has always been at the higher end,  new room towers and new restaurants.  The basic rooms are in the Carson towers which is the farthest walking from Fremont street. They are older rooms and if your looking  for a clean cheaper options it's not a bad choice.  Because the Carson tower is at the back of the property they are among the quietest rooms with very little ouce ouce from the Fremont street experience.   I've also found the gold tower the next quietest followed by the rush tower.  This is the golden nugget thou and they tend to think of the little things , like ear plugs in the rush tower rooms facing Fremont.     

The gold and rush tower rooms are very nice and I've never had a bad room.  Always large rooms and lots of extras, water, coffee etc.  Onetime we managed somehow to get a free upgrade to a
Gold tower suite, it was 1000 sqft, had a bar, frig, full size living room. It was awesome. 

All this typing and I haven't even got to the pool, spa or the variety of restaurants.  The pool is the nicest downtown and really strip quality.  Well they actually have 2 pools. One for everyone and one for adults only.  The beds are not too expensive and a nice option when your not taking the water slide through the shark tank.  I'm a fish guy and always enjoy the fish tanks at the nugget, whether it's the shark tank at the pool or charter houses tank in the restaurant.  The charter house tank is packed with a nice variety of fish and all of them are spotless.  

To wrap this up, I've stay many times at the nugget and you can't go wrong staying there, lots of options, clean and located off one of the most entertaining streets in Vegas Fremont.

Perhaps I'm biased about the Nugget, given that I won $1000 bucks at a penny machine this weekend!  But really, the best money for hotel stay on Fremont.  Affordable and the classiest on the street if you ask me.  Love everything it had to offer.

The very best hotel downtown and the best pool in vegas that's the good. The bad is you can tell the attitude of the employees comes from the top management.  They simply don't care if you have a problem I have been staying there for years but will not come back. They act like they are doing you a favor by you staying there and if you have a problem they do there best to show phoney concern then do nothing I emailed them after one particular stay in which I dealt with several rude employees and the never even answered so long nugget

Not sure where to even start on this hotel. Run down faculty, dirty carpets, rooms that smell like some one was murdered in them, overcrowded pool, extremely high prices for less than average food. I could go on and on but I think you get the point.  Almost forgot the worst elevator service I have ever encounter and employees who for the most part don't give a damn. You can put a bow on a pig but it is still a pig.

I just called on line to make a very complicated reservation for tonight and Jenn in reservations was extremely helpful and pleasant. I called several other hotels to compare rates and availability and their reservation experiences were unhelpful and frustrating. And I had to do a lot of waiting on hold for assistance. Not at the Golden Nugget. Their reservation staff were very responsive and quick with little time on hold. I went back to Golden Nugget 100% convinced this is where we wanted to stay due to Jenn and her helpful assistance and very pleasant personality. We'll see how our experience is staying there, but I want to give them an excellent review for the quality of their reservation services. I would recommend them to family and friends from this experience.

I only came here for the pool. 
I was watching a show about the world's most fabulous pools, and the Golden Nugget's pool was featured. I am obsessed with sharks and aquariums, so I absolutely had to go see their pool with the shark tank in it! 
The rooms were pretty spacious, a lot bigger than a room on the strip would be, but the bathroom was so tiny!! I never realized how run-down Fremont street was. The Nug was definitely the best looking hotel down there. 
But back to the pool story: It was not worth it. We went down before the pool opened to save a lounge chair, but they were all gone. EVERY SINGLE ONE. Finally we had to put our stuff by a planter. The pool was really small and there were small children everywhere!! What I was stoked for was the slide, but it was super disappointing as well. It went so fast and the area with the sharks was so small that all you saw was a one second white light and it was over. Lame. 
We packed our stuff and got the heck out of the Nugg.

This was our second time staying at the Golden Nugget.  Fremont Street Experience is something fun and unique in Las Vegas and I highly recon end checking it out.  We enjoyed our stay and the price was right, however, we found a bug in our bed that appeared to be a bed bug.  We brought the insect to the attention of staff and had to fill out an incident report.  Unfortunately, because we booked through our airline we were unable to receive any sort of compensation for the issue.

This place does not look impressive from the outside, but give it a chance. It has a GREAT pool, which is a nice place to lounge and have a drink and a chat. I have been to their sushi restaurant and it was good. It was over a year ago, so I can't remember the details. There is also a candy shop with fun caramel apples that make good hostess gifts or souvenirs. I stayed in a room there a little over a year ago and it was a good value, but slightly shabby. Not bad, but not new.

Let me start off by saying we have had pleasant experiences here in past trips. However, this time I am extremely disappointed  with the check in and ammentities. We booked 3 rooms. One was a king sized, smoking room. Upon check in at 3:00 pm none were available. We waited a couple hours for a room that we already paid for. Another room we got did not have a coffee maker, refrigerator, or microwave. The fish\/shark tank and slide is being remodeled and that was our main reason for coming here. No one notified  us of this. There is also a rock concert going on just outside our room for 2 nights-very loud and disruptive. Overall, this is a huge disappointment for such a reputable brand. We will be staying else where on future trips..

What an awesome pool!  

I stayed there for a training, which is kind of silly given that I am local.  The room was pretty decent and I was pleasantly surprised.  My husband and kids came to visit me one of the nights.  We hit the buffet and then the pool.  My daughter loved the fish tank.  She just wanted to hang out by it.  My son was a bit surprised of how fast the slide was.  We were all under the impression that you went a bit slower through the fish tank part, but the slide just shoots you through!  

The food, not so good, in both the training and the buffet.  Yet, the room and the pool make this place worthwhile.

Family get away in July 2015..... Had my vehicle valeted because the self parking lot was full. When I picked up my car I noticed two good size chunks of paint missing from my bumper which was from another vehicles license plate and the golden nugget is not taking responsibility for their actions. I've spent many weekends and spent a lot of money at the golden nugget but not anymore, they lost my business!!!!

Non-hotel guest review:

My favorite property downtown.  They've done a great job renovating it and putting in new restaurants.  For example, the Golden Nugget has the only Charthouse in town - a great seafood chain. 

This property has a couple of terrific fish tanks.  One in the Charthouse and the other at the pool, called The Tank.  Even though I am not a hotel guest, the staff has let me walk out and look at The Tank.  It has sharks in it!  Super cool to just stare at.  I also like staring at the tank in the Charthouse while I eat my lunch there.  Sometimes scuba divers will go in to clean it, which is amusing.

If you self-park in the garage, you have to validate at the casino cashier.  They allow you to self-validate so you don't have to wait in line, but it's a huge pain to find the casino cashier.  Plus the parking garage, like most in Las Vegas, is horribly designed.  I recommend just using the valet - there are two.  One off of Casino Center and another off of Main Street, just in front of the Charthouse.

Worse customer service ever.  Took us 45 minutes to check in.  We booked through Expedia and he was upset and said he couldn't find our reservation.  We tried for over 10 minutes while he typed and worked but had no care or concern for us.  We finally walked out to call Expedia bc he clearly didn't care about us.  It was 1am and he had us wait for 45 minutes, we were exhausted and he was extremely rude.  He finally found our reservation although nothing had changed... he simply was putting in our incorrect name.  He never apologized and didn't even care.  He finally found or reservations and then told us they didn't have any rooms left that we had originally booked, he tried to put us in a smoking room.  We refused and I finally had him call management... who found us our original room... after being told they were totally booked.  What?!?  I am sorry but do you want guest coming back???? I am so confused!

1) Awesome pool (shark pool). Not as small as people make it seem.

2) Even more awesome cabanas! Comes with a ceiling fan, sunblock, cooling wipes, bottled water, fruit & cheese plate. You have the option of hooking your ipod into their system and controlling the volume through a knob on the wall in your cabana. Furniture was super comfy. Drink servers were very efficient and very nice. Ordered food and it came within 15 minutes with the food piping hot.

3) Daybeds lack umbrellas\/shade. Could be updated. The pillow\/cover on mine was torn. 

4) Valet is very quick, friendly, and efficient!

5) Bellhops were really slow and unorganized that weekend (EDC weekend).

6) Service at the buffet was wonderful. Waiters were very nice and friendly as well. Menu could use some updating. Loved their antipasto selection. Good salad bar.

7) I got the cheapest room possible, the Carson Tower room. After reading the yelp reviews, i decided to ask for an upgrade, but when i got there, they were  completely booked and I ended up stuck with my room. Honestly, the rooms are in great condition for what they are. Everything was very clean and spotless. Bathroom was humongous, and so was the room. The bottled fiji water in the room was ridiculously expensive so i used my phone to find a walgreens. Turns out, i'd forgotten to switch it to the "walking" mode, so it instructed me to walk all the way around the block. A very dark, stinky, and decrepit looking block. Save yourself a mugging and walk through the Fremont Street Experience. It's at the end of the road.

All in all, I paid 97.40 on bookit for two nights and also received a $50 cabana credit. The Golden Nugget is a great place to stay if you're checking out downtown with friends or family. There's a spectacular spa that you ABSOLUTELY MUST TRY. Mauro, a masseuse, WORKS MIRACLES!!!! and if you're looking for a spray tan, i got a fantastic one from monique there. she left me looking like i just came from bali and not the queens hotel with a bellyful of chicken fried steak.

=D 

I'd give this place 5 stars if there were more affordable dining options. I found room service and their carson street cafe to be really pricey for the kind of food they're serving.
Newest hotel in downtown area, check out the shark tank.

1st time staying here and we haven't been here for 30 minutes and I'm pissed off.  I paid for 2 rooms in the Golden Tower for 6 adults (the reservation was 1 room for 4 and 1 room for 2).  I was told I'd get 2 rooms with a king bed each.  When I replied that that was unacceptable, (seriously, who books 1 room for four adults in 1 bed?!) I was informed that I'd need to pay $33 extra per night for one room to be switched to include 2 double beds.  The young lady was snooty! I asked for the manager and the clerk walked away.  After a few minutes she returned and informed me that I would be "downgraded", in her snooty attitude, to accommodate the need for 1 room to have double beds and I would need to contact the 3rd party for a refund.  Again, this was unacceptable.  She then had the nerve to tell me there were no rooms in their "Golden Tower".  I demanded the manager again.  I waited an additional 5 to 8 minutes and finally she returned and I was finally able to be in the rooms I'd reserved.  The manager never showed up.

When we finally were in our rooms, we attempted to call for our luggage only to find that the phone and half the room was without power.  

We had to travel back downstairs and fix that.  Maintenance had to he called.  

Seriously, the bellhop has been the nicest, courteous most pleasant employees here.  

I'll yelp another  review at the end of this trip.  So far...they are horrible.

This my third time staying here with my girlfriend and we really like the Golden Nugget. Most recently, we stayed three nights at the newly opened Rush Tower. The staff was pleasant and friendly. The room at the Rush Tower on the 21st floor offered a nice view of the Strip. The bathroom was huge with large sliding doors which divided the bathroom from the hallway. The Golden Nugget buffet was great, offered many selections and everything was fresh and served hot. I would recommend the Nugget to anyone looking to stay downtown. The Golden Nugget  reminds me of the old days in Vegas when Sinatra and the Rat Pack stayed and played. It has a lot of "old school" charm and elegance which seems to be missing from the newer and larger casinos on the Strip.

This place is definitely the class of downtown!

I have always going the nugget for the pool and great service! So I decided to actually get a room for a night because I knew I was going to have a few drinks. The bartenders were friendly and the video poker at the bar near the casino cage gave me a lot of play time, not to mention hitting a few 4 of a kinds helps.

For 54 dollars, the room was great except for the charging for the k cup machine. Glad I brought my own just incase. The view I had from my room of fremont street was great. I went to eat at chart house and the food along with the service was excellent. 

It's very nice, has the feel of a strip hotel but at a way cheaper price, the place is very clean.

I had a wonderful experience at the nugget. It's located downtown, which might turn some people off but we were perfectly ok with that. When we told the lady checking us in that Expedia had misrepresented the room we were getting she spoke to the manager and had us upgraded to the rush tower. Super nice modern rooms. I was a little surprised there wasn't a refrigerator in the room and that's my main reason for only four stars, that and the 10$ charge if you want in room coffee! I didn't find the blow dryer until the day we left. It was in the closet. The pool is pretty nice but over run with kids and it's hard to find a empty chair. You can't tell if they are actually being used or if someone just forgot their towel. The quieter pool upstairs charges you for a chair rental. A bit ridiculous if you ask me. And wifi is an extra 12 $ per day. But staff is very friendly and casino floor is nice. And the beds ate absolutely heaven.  We got a great price during the week. If you do plan on staying downtown this is the place to go!

Ok....I'm very loyal Golden Nuggett.  Been going there for over 20 years.   But here is the problem.    My kids wants to jump in the pool at 10 am. And of course we won't be done by 11 am .  They tell us we have to pay 30 dollars extra due to no late check out if we go pass 11am.  Won't be staying there anymore.

This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in Vegas. DO NOT STAY HERE.  The customer service and security is AWFUL.  Kevin from security needs to take a lesson in dealing with customers.  My boyfriend was not given his debit card back from one of their restaurants and when we went to lost and found in the morning they said they had it and would bring it to the front desk. 6 hours later and they still didn't have his card at the front desk.  We both have work the next day and and just wanted to go home.  I would rather stay anywhere in Vegas but here.

So for many years this has always been my favorite hotel until my last stay there a couple of weeks ago for the 4th of July we were in the club listening to a fantastic band called status the band this was on July 4th almost midnight going into July 5th a drunk couple came in and encountered some harsh words to me and my boyfriend and the woman pushed me the security at the Golden Nugget came in and escorted the people out however they never asked me if I was okay and never asked my side of the story I was very upset at the way the Golden Nugget security behaved I did file a report with the hotel and have since been playing phone tag with the risk management manager to try and get at least two days free hotel stay as of this date no one has gotten back to me I would not stay there again I am still hoping that they will give me a couple of days compensation for what they put me through they weren't even concerned about my well-being after this lady pushed me they just escorted them out and never came back in to talk to me that is very unprofessional
Rude staff including some managers. The buffet restaurant is really nasty. Will not stay at this ever again.
Love this places n this place is awesome love the peps I love them all  they have cute girls there.

I recommend the Gold tower, Carson tower seemed so far away from everything. 
The pool is great, gets crowded but if you can escape to the Hideout and rent s chair for $45 but it's a 21 years or older place!
The casino floor was full of waitresses that were prompt and pleasant.

The Golden Nugget remains the best hotel\/casino in downtown Vegas. I started staying here in the early 1990s right after Steve Wynn acquired and remodeled the place, first in the South Tower, then North and eventually graduating to the largest two story suites in the Spa Tower. 

It is for the Spa Tower suites - particularly the largest, most ostentatious suites located towards the middle of the floor (not every spa tower suite is the same size) that I give the GN five stars. The spa tower suites include a jacuzzi and steam room (a full sized steam room in which several may sit - not just a shower steam). This hotel has everything you need - from among the largest suites available in Vegas to the restaurants, buffet, shows and spa\/gym, pool and amenities that, while on a different scale from the behemoths on the strip, are all first class. 

Service is first class, for all. VIP Services and casino hosts (both for gamblers only) all go out of their way to take care of you. 

The hotel spa includes all amenities with indoor steam jacuzzi and sauna, and adequate weight equipment (no free weights) and cardio. 

Sadly, the casino doesn't offer the best odds that it used to, which peaked during the brief period that Tim Poster and Tom Breitling owned the place, but then I quit gambling some years back, and the casino doesn't mean much to me anymore. In any case, ever since Landry's bought the place the casino table games all clamped down with subtle rules meant to handicap the serious gambler. I never was into slots, but understand that post-Landry's the slots are tighter than they used to be. 

But if you are a gambler at the Nugget, your play will earn you more comps than on the strip. 

The neighboring Glitter Gulch (also known as the Fremont Street Experience) is a nice little draw with all its lights and outdoor festivities at night. A short stroll down the Gulch leads to outdoor displays of classic Vegas neon. But don't stroll too far - go too far east on Fremont and you'll end up in still no man's north east Vegas that contains spots so unsavory, that no hotel limo or even taxi service will service them. When you see the old Las Vegas Metro PD substation, time to turn back - you've ventured too far. 

If you want first class away from the Strip, the Golden Nugget is the place for you.  It's an oasis of beauty in the up and coming but still a little spotty downtown area.

We only came here for a pool party with an event that was in town. I would of gave it more stars, however the shark tank slide was closed and they failed to mention that. We looked over and saw the slide sitting on the side of the pool and the fish tank was empty. It was a real bummer for the event. Was looking forward to taking a swim near the sharks.

I have been coming to this hotel for the better part of a decade and have loved the changes I have seen, but over my last two stays I have noticed a severe drop in service and overall caring that once made this place great. It was my husbands birthday so we went to the Italian restaurant for dinner. The food was good except the waiter was very rude and most of our food came out cold, even had to request that the meatballs be heated up. Our drinks never came so we had to ask a different waiter to get them as ours couldn't be bothered to check on the table, and when my husbands birthday cake came out (complimentary,so I thought) it was good but when we got the bill they charged us for it. If you are going to charge for the cake at least give us the choice of which one we can have. The tables are some of the highest limit tables in Fremont now, comparing to the strip. It has a dirtier feeling than it did before and they are constantly trying to up charge you for everything, including s resort fee that is really crazy. Save yourself the time and trouble, there are much better deals to be had on the strip now.

Me and my girlfriend arrived here at around 7am on the 31st, wanting to spend our new year eve here, after a long drive all we wanted was to take a long nap before we go out, I booked a room via travelocity for 215 it's a queen size bed. I went in to checked in the rep ask if I wanted to upgrade my room for another 250, At first I said what!?! For 250 that's crazy but the lady show me the room it's a 2 stories room with spa and a personal streamer king size bed and a full bar and a living room the room usually go for 2500 a night; so I got it she also gave me a VIP pass and a coupon book, great service my girlfriend and I really enjoyed it. Thank you golden nugget!!!

Due to a flight delay, we didn't get to the front desk until midnight, so i was glad that I had a chance to call ahead to make sure there wasn't a problem with a late check in.

Despite the late hour, and my call, the rooms were not ready, and they had us wait in a lousy restaurant until 3 AM, when they were finally ready. Finally got to the room at 3:30, and the noise from the truck loading dock kept us awake until it was time to check out eight hours later.

No matter how cheap it is, it is still overpriced.

Beware! Resort fee's higher than cost of room!!!.-Coffee makers available for $10.00 coffee $4.00 for 4 pods!!!

Definitely not worth the cost!!!!

The relaunch of this is spectacular.  It shares many characteristics of old Vegas, but the entire Fremont street has been outfitted with modern amenities with Golden Nugget at the helm.  A benefit is that the minimums here are still low.  With so much to explore on the new Fremont street, I think if you haven't checked out the renovations you should make it a point to venture off the strip and come here.

We stayed here one night at the end of a very long trip.  When I checked in they tried to upsell me.  Ugh, I did not want that.  But, the upsell ended up being $5 putting us on a private floor and giving us use of the spa.  The room was really incredible and upscale.  We loved the room!  It had a sitting area, upscale décor, a comfy king bed and a fabulous bathroom.  Ok, not such a bad choice.

The shark tank in the middle of the pool was very fun.  My son loved the slide that went down through the shark tank into the pool.  We had a great time there.

The spa ended up being a bust.  They wouldn't let my son into the spa because he wasn't 18.  The front desk guy clearly knew that information when the sold me the spa package and could have saved my son the embarrassment of being turned away from the spa.  If we had stayed more than one night, I'd have complained but it wasn't worth it.

Very disappointed. I booked a room in the rush towers. It's supposed to have its own private check in services. We got there at 5:15 and was told that the check in desk was closing and we had to go to the main lobby. The main lobby had 50 other guests in front of us. Not an exaggeration. Instead of waiting the usual 10 minutes to check in we now waited for over 40 minutes. What am I paying for if I cant use it? The staff was overwhelmed, and service was way below what I have experienced in the past. Is the Golden Nugget declining.

I admit when I drove up to the Golden Nugget I was worried about what I was going to get for my $89 a night room, but I was pleasantly surprised. It was nice. Really nice. I mean I've stayed at the Hooter's Hotel on the strip for the same amount of money and that hotel DID have the $89 feel to it. Of course, when you're on a budget, you'll stay anywhere and Hooter's is directly across the street from the MGM so you can't go wrong with that.

The Golden Nugget is also in the heart of things, but not the things I'm used to seeing in Vegas. You're not going to see the dancing fountains of the Bellagio , nor will you see the Eiffel Tower at the Paris Hotel. Instead you've got a whole new set of attractions.

There's the waving cowboy - known as Vegas Vic, Binion's horseshoe and the famous lights of the Plaza Hotel. And when you are there, you have to take in the Fremont Street experience. It's crowded, crazy and completely wonderful in a way that is only cool in Vegas. 

Don't worry if you are not sure where this is. If you're in old Vegas, you ARE part of the attraction. That's because it's right outside your hotel. Fremont is a covered street that becomes a canopy of lights after the sun goes down, and they literally rock out to Kiss's "Rock n' Roll All Night Long." 

Nope, you're not going to hear Celine Dion in Old Vegas. It's sex, drugs and...maybe a little bit of whiskey on the rocks - just the way the Rat Pack liked it. 

Then there's the Nugget. Built in 1946, it's one of the oldest casinos in the area. But don't be fooled by its age. It has a four diamond rating and is still classy. When you walk around the lobby, it's not hard to imagine Sean Connery there during the shooting of "Diamonds are Forever."

Attractions in the hotel include the world's largest gold nugget (naturally) and a shark tank, but honestly, I was very impressed with the service and lushness of the hotel. It had the Wynn feel without paying the Wynn price. 

I must say, staying in Old Vegas was a gamble that paid off.

So we were super excited to stay on Fremont St. We're avid Vegas visitors and have always walked down Fremont and gambled many times at Golden Nugget. So far, this has been extremely frustrating. I paid extra money, in advance, two months ago for a preferred check in and guaranteed conjoining rooms. My husband just got back from deployment so we came to spend time with my sister and brother in law. First, our second conjoining room wasn't ready so we checked into the first room and waited for the second... THEN, the second, all of a sudden had a maintenance issue so we had to go back to the room pack back up and move to another room. As we were checking in AGAIN the second room was AGAIN not ready. They said it was "upgraded" but we went from a pool view to a parking garage view, lost the iPod dock stereo, and the bathroom handle immediately fell off. Lastly, and most disappointing, when talking to guest services (Trisha from HI) dismissed us and the things we had to say. We hate to complain- but we only have a few days off and want to make the most of it- so far we've been here three hours and have only seen rooms and hallways. Oh and ps- we went to the ice machine - there was not machine in the ice area. Sheesh! Such a disappointing way to spend so little time in Vegas. NEEVER AGAIN!

Not quite as great as it used to be, especially the casino. Since purchased by some guy named Tilman Fertita, who also owns Landry's Restaurants, the service seems to have been slacking-off a bit. The hotel is fine, especially the upgraded towers, but casino personnel can be very obnoxious. Not all of them, but some get really snotty. The casino manager, Jason Sides (as of June 2013), seems unresponsive to complaints. Be sure to complain anyway, if you are disrespected.

The staff was very rude. after waiting over an hour for my bags to be brought up I went down to complain....and my voice was "to loud" I was told by a employee. the next morning found the bedbug and took a phaoto. I was checking out and when I told an employee about the bug the employee from the day before that said I was too loud, came over and instead of dealing with the bug, he said, "oh, you are the lady from yesterday. I want to advise you that I saw you videotaping me yesterday & that is not allowed on hotel property". Of course I had NO idea what he was talking about. I had not videotaped anyone. I asked him would you like to check my phone? because there is no video, but there are pics of the bedbug. By this time I was IRATE.  Anyway they did nothing, wanted me to file some lengthy time consuming Security report. I just wanted to get out of there. So good luck to the next guest in the Carson Tower room 1559. They did not exterminate the room etc...

stayed in the carson tower april 13 till the 17th. i think it is the older section, but the room was big and clean. all i needed. usually stay and gamble on the strip, but downtown has a much better blackjack game, and they comped us two nights for gambling which is almost unheard of anymore for me on the main drag. the pool here was great. not too cold, and it has a shark tank with a slide going through it which i liked. rented a cabana on saturday, and the hostess went out of her way to make sure we were happy with the server, food etc. she came by at least 6 times on her way through to check up, and i swear it wasn't because we were out of control...
 food was great in the sports book area, the sushi place was good enough, but ate mostly away from casino so can't tell you much about the rest of the restaurants. my buddy took a good chunk of money from them on friday, and when i walked up, the pit boss was cheering him on instead of giving the evil eye ( which is what usually happens).
the cab from the airport was about $36.00 before tip, so not a good place to stay if you plan on sightseeing along the boulevard every day instead of staying on freemont.
overall, i will be sure to stay here next time i want to spend my whole trip downtown.

This review is for the lunch buffet.

The location is nicely located above the renovated pool area.  I enjoyed watching the shark tank while enjoying my meal.  It feels like a strip casino even though it is in the heart of downtown. The waitress was attentive and friendly.  I liked she brought me two sodas so I always had one full as I was drinking the other.

The cost was a little high, $11 for lunch, but not unreasonable.  

I thought the selection was on the sparse side, maybe I am used to larger serving areas.  From the items I selected my favorite were:  smoked salmon, crab salad, cream of mushroom soup, mac & cheese, brisket, fried catfish, and had a cream puff for desert.  The only thing I didn't like were the mozzarella balls.  They were mushy and flavorless.

I was going to give this a 4 star, because I like to reserve the amount of fives i give, but can not think of a reason why it does not deserve a 5.  So five it is.

We made reservation in early January for a late March visit. I called twice over the next two months to confirm a smoking room in the Carson tower with a King bed. When we arrived I was told that all they had available was a room with 2 double beds. I was told that they don't actually "reserve" rooms, you get what is available when you arrive. 
We were charged a $28 a night resort fee that was supposed to cover wifi and the gym which we weren't going to use & bottled water in the room. Wifi if purchased separately was only $13 a day but now the resort fee is required.
We got to our room to discover only 1 bottled water, no robes, electrical outlets that didn't work, 1 coffee cup ($10 fee for 4 mini single serving coffees), a safe so tiny we could barely fit our 13" laptop. The bed was terrible, we are used to a king bed and ended up smashing each other with elbows and knees all night. The air conditioner banged and clanked loudly all night. The room was dark and dingy, the window was partially covered by two sides of the adjoining building. The Carson tower \/ dark tower is a about a 2 block walk to Fremont street. It is the only tower with smoking rooms. 
To be fair they did refund $28 when we complained about the lack of amenities and condition of our room.   
We asked about discount tickets for food or shows and were directed to a desk to sign up for a 2 -1\/2 hour tour in order to receive them. No thanks
The pool was very crowded, no chairs available so we went upstairs to the adults only pool - you have to rent a lounge chair!! $45 a piece a day! If we would have wanted to sit up there for half an hour each day we were there it would have cost us a whopping $270.00.
Everything about the Golden Nugget is a money grab. There's a fee for almost everything. The restaurants are expensive and the machines are tight. 
In the past we have always stayed at Fitzgerald's (now the D) but thought the Golden Nugget would be a little nicer. We were wrong. The D always RESERVES our room, the views are excellent, upon check in we are handed a discount coupon book. 
Bottom line we will not ever stay at the Golden Nugget again.

If you're staying DT, this is the only place to stay. Nice Rooms, Nice Staff, Nice Casino, Nice Pool.

I've stayed here several times on long weekend trips with the boys to do some gambling. The Casino is ok, but when you're Downtown you can Casino hop and find a table with rules that you prefer. 

The room was nice the bathroom was sooo small though, I'm not a big guy but it was hard for me to operate in the shit But, the property is old and if you're just in the room to sleep and shower it's perfect.

If you're staying there, try to get a North Tower Room, they are newer and a lot easier to navigate the hotel. If you get a South Tower Room, Fremont St to the Elevators can be a hike, plus you basically have to jab a timeshare dude out everytime you try to get to your room.

Oh plus if you're in a South Tower room you may have to walk miles, serioulsy I met some people there one weekend and went to there room to chill, and I swear it was a maze to get to their room!! Trust me spend the money on a North Tower Room.

Overall, I'm happy with GN. Not to smokey which is a big thing for me..

I will start by saying that I have been to Vegas 7 or 8 times and have always picked the Golden Nugget for my stay. I have also always recommended them to all my friends and family! Well, not sure what has changed in the past year, but the customer service, booking, and rooms are absolutely HORRIBLE! We booked our room with a king size bed- checked in and there were no more king bed rooms available! So double beds is the best they could do- saying that they would put us in another room for our 2nd night here. So packed all of our stuff at 11 and went down to get the room we booked in the first place! Tons of time and energy wasted! We get to our new room and we are looking at literally at a brick wall! Talk about the most depressing room. I call downstairs and tell them that I want a different room. The lady was rude and said that there was nothing available and then proceeded to tell me that she could move rooms but it would be looking at another wall! I asked, then why would you move us? This has been such a waste of our time on what should be our weekend away- our vacation! I will never recommend them to anyone nor will I be a returning customer!
Great  shrimp  cocktails  great  3 99. 50 style.  Fresh  food. ..24 hours  a day. Friendly  service  highly  recommended. ...when  your  downtown.

We stayed at the Golden Nugget in May of 2009.  We were getting married and excited.  The staff at the front desk was mattter of fact at best.  We were hoping for a possible upgrade as this was going to be our honeymoon, no such luck.  We never had another interaction with the staff, not one member of the staff went out of their way for anything.

The casino was nice and so was the pool, the cafe sucks and the gift shop had some really nice clothes.  The staff at the gift shop was friendly and attentive .

All in all I expected a little more personality from a hotel that at one time was top-notch.

I stayed here for 3 nights in early May. The check in girl was very thorough and asked us about many preferences that I would have never thought of. She gave us a great room close to the elevator in the Carson Tower.
The hotel Buffet was incredible with so many choice st breakfast and lunch. The food was great. We had vouchers because of our convention being held there. It was nice to have VIP service with no need to wait in line to be seated. The view from our breakfast table was lovely.
The only complaints I have is that in your room they have bottles of water but if you open them, they charge you for it! Wanna use the coffee machine in your room, another charge. And room service food was overpriced. Room service charge on top of the food was $5.  And since we were so tired and we forgot to order drinks, it would have been another $5  plus the cost of the soda so we drank tap water with our meal....not cool!!!
The rooms were clean but the tub was weird and concaved in on the sides so you did not feel like you were standing flat while showering. The bathroom sink countertop was installed too high which is a problem for shorter people trying to brush their teeth over the sink.
The shark chute slide was fantastic but closed at 7pm which is way too early. By the time we finished our convention sessions and awards dinners the only time we had to do the slide and enjoy the pool was the morning we checked out before our flight back. This attraction should stay open much later.
I might stay here again but there are so many other hotels with attractions at competitive prices that I pretfer not to be nickled and dimed for bottled water in my room again.

Never really spent time in this casino....recently was just passing through, but I did notice the cool fish tank and that MASSIVE piece of gold! Pretty cool...ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(127\/365) "Nugget of Gold

An old hotel that's on the classic side of downtown Las Vegas. 

It's been renovated several times and it shows. You can tell that sections were built in different years but it doesn't make it look tacky at all. 

Always a good time in their hotel, casino and sports book! 

Parking is a bit difficult unless you valet but it does get very busy. 

Their buffet is delicious and reasonably priced! 

The rooms are older but still luxurious compared to properties in the area. 

Visit this place when in the area. Sign up for their players card and get free play!

The location can't be beat and it's cool to stay in one of the oldest hotels in downtown Vegas. Definitely recommend staying downtown as the vibe is much cooler, more mellow, and more classic. But the Carson Tower, where we were placed, is showing its seams, and we definitely feel like second-class guests out there compared to our friends who stayed in the Gold Tower. 

So it's a long haul to the Carson Tower. The Gold Tower elevators are right by the lobby, but you have to weave through the property to get to the Carson Tower elevators. Once up there, the layout is weird and only a couple of rooms are near the elevator. Our room was down a long, dark hallway and literally as far from the elevator as you could get. I know someone has to stay at the end, but it took 15 minutes every time we had to "run back to the room" for something. If the elevators were busy, it could take even longer. 

We payed the "resort fee" which was supposed to include 2 free water bottles a day, but we had to text a number to get them. We were there for 4 days and we only got the bottles once, after I texted daily. I finally had to call the front desk for them. 

Also, it says on the website, in no uncertain terms, that you can purchase a 2 pm check-out for $35. We asked about it at the desk a couple of times, because we didn't have to leave for the airport till 2:30 so it would have been perfect. The first person we asked didn't know what we were talking about and basically said "not an option". The second person said they could give us a "complimentary" noon check-out but for a later one we'd have to call the morning-of. Still no acknowledgment of the website offer. A friend who was also staying with us asked a different person and they said they knew of the website offer but that it was "subject to availability" which it does NOT say on the website. So on the morning of check-out, we called down and they said "Ma'am, your room is not available for late check-out." Of course not. If they never offered it as an option, it would have been fine. But offering on the website as a guarantee if you're willing to pay extra, then having some people not even know about it and others know but offer it only with impossible conditions (we were checking out on a MONDAY so it's not like were a ton of people waiting around for rooms), is super lame. Do or don't offer it. Don't string us along! 

Most egregiously, there is no coffee and tea service in your room. Even the crappiest motels I've stayed in have had a coffee maker and some cheap tea or coffee. I get that they want you to go to Starbucks but that's why you put crappy coffee in the room. People use that to get up and around and then they go to Starbucks. Of course, since nobody has coffee in their room, the Starbucks line is insane until about noon every day. 

There are some good restaurants in the hotel, the casino is cool, and the pool with the shark tank is cool but the water slide was closed the whole time. We mostly spend time in other casinos though and have our eye on one of the nicer ones for next time. Maybe the Grand or the Plaza. Get it together, Golden Nugget. I know you like your Gold Tower people better, but we're paying customers too.

Anyway, we paid around $90 a night with the resort fee and I've had a better experience at Motel Six, La Quinta, or Days Inn, where at least you get in-room coffee and free breakfast. It sucked to feel like no one on the staff cared about our hotel experience and that if they brought us water, they were doing us a favor. Would not stay here again unless something drastic changed.

Great value! Crazy cheap rooms. Clean and modern rooms that can compete with strip casinos. The pool is pretty cool and the gaming floor is sleek and up to date. It is the best casino\/ hotel in the old strip. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, especially the beds! Clean and good service. They made a mistake on my room and quickly fixed it with a instant room upgrade! Excellent service!!! They have made a dedicated customer, I will be staying with them whenever I get a chance!

2 words: RUSH TOWER!!!!!

The amenities were so modern. Flat screen tvs. Rooms were pretty big! And the bathrooms had tubs, my friends and I could bathe in. SO BIG!

Its great for families especially with that pool of theirs. The kids wanted to go to the pool every-single-day. There's a slide that slides between a shark tank so, that's fun!!!




Attn: Hawaii people ---- YOU ALREADY KNOW WHERE TO STAY IF YOU'RE STAYING IN DOWNTOWN!!!!!!

Love visiting the Golden Nugget when on Fremont! They offer $5 of free play when you sign up for a Players Card, which is always nice, and they have super cheap gambling! The people manning the card tables are really friendly and helpful and they've got beautiful dancers that are entertaining when you are playing games. Love how courteous all the staff are and its a great time, even though its a bit "no frills" compared to the main strip.

I brought my 9-year-old daughter for a 3-night getaway. I'm not a gambler so I can't report on that. However, we have used the pool and water slide A LOT, room service, Starbucks, valet ... and our room in the Rush Tower is excellent. I only gave 4 stars because I don't have more to report on right now, and I haven't found staff to be especially helpful. We wandered around awhile looking for check in because Rush Tower check in was closed. We asked 2 people where to find an ATM and neither one was very specific.

Early this year, I took my first trip to Vegas.  Because I was bringing my kiddo with me, I opted to stay in Fremont, where hopefully, things would be a bit more chill.  I was happy with my decision and we had a lovely time with family for a graduation weekend. 

The price of the room was excellent - purchased on Expedia.com.  The hotel had almost everything I needed and was within walking distance of everything else.  My kiddo's only requirement of any hotel we stay in is that it have a pool, which they do.  The shark tank was a plus as well as the slide!  During the day, get there early to grab a seat.  

Parking was easy in the garage near the tower we were in.  If you like coffee, you should probably figure out what to do.  The line at the Starbucks near the pool is ridiculous.  Absolutely ridiculous at pretty much all hours of the day.  The other Starbucks on the other side of the building is not as busy but has shorter hours.  You can use the Keurig in your room but I'm not sure it's worth the price.  

I only ate once at the buffet at the hotel for a family gathering.  The selection was pretty good but the wait for a big group was very long.  For the rest of my trip, I ate at different places around Fremont because walking around outside was preferably to the casinos at times.  Have I mentioned that I don't gamble?  

Overall, it was a quiet, pleasant stay.  Staff members were nice and the hotel was clean.

We just went to the golden nugget for St Pattys Day and upgraded to the Rush room.  It was a nice room but right outside our window was the stage, with music that gets louder as the night goes on.  I know, your not supposed to stay in your room in Vegas but when you start a pub crawl early, you want to go to bed early.  So, word to the wise, if you want some sleep do not upgrade your room....

Currently staying here, they offer NO shuttle service. It's 20 per person to go to the main strip, a cab to the airport it 52. Our room isn't the cleanest , we are over looking a construction site ( we asked for a room with a view)  they have you up at 6am.  Room  charges 4 fir 16oz water, 4 k cups for the filthy Keurig is 10.  The area is nice, fremont st is great. We will not stay at this hotel again.

BEWARE OF THE DREADED CARSON TOWER: like a scene out of a horror movie, dark, dingy, smells like smoke, dusty and reallly awful. 

I don't care if it's $20 a night, go somewhere else, anywhere else. 

So gross...

Just downtown for the day on St Patty's Day and spent some good time in the Golden Nugget casino.

Another winner!

Love the old-school ambiance and feel.

Definitely a "gotta visit" in downtown Vegas!
