The downside to the hotel itself is because it is not on the strip the air quality is not as fresh.  If you are a smoker this will not be an issue, but if you are a non-smoker this could be a nuisance.

I have been coming to the Golden Nugget for a few years now for my sons football tournament with 20 other families. We have always stayed here at the golden nugget. In the past the kids have had a great time at the pool and the adults have had a great time as well but sadly this will mostly likely be our last time at the Nugget! NOT HAPPY AND GOLDEN NUGGET GOING DOWN HILL! The pool slide was closed and we called 4 times before we left and the Golden Nugget said IT WAS GOING TO BE OPEN, we get there at they said no it wasn't and the kids mad and sad. The hot tub is NEVER HOT!! Also the gym sucks!! It is small and free weight section is a joke and The Golden Nugget has gotten rid of the squat rack so you can't do legs! And the hot tub up at spa was closed , They should not charge a spa fee if they are not going to be provide a spa service!! One of the families ice box had nasty trash in it! Elevator light broken,Will not come back

In my opinion this is the best hotel to stay in Vegas. They're clean with much to offer. In fact, we don't leave here during our stay. We enjoy it all. Customer service is excellent and very friendly. Rooms are great and maids very friendly themselves. Everything you need is done in a timely manner. Now for the food and drinks the Cadillac has a blended lime margarita with patron that is the absolute best along with their great Mexican food. Prices beyond reasonable. The buffet is a must try while you're there. Amazing amazing. I literally sit for a couple hours to enjoy what they have...everything fresh. Then there is there awesome pool with shark aquarium and slide that goes right through the middle.  This is perfect hotel for adult stay and with kids too. You also have Fremont street your own little strip which has everything even zip lining. Alyou need you'll find at the Golden Nugget so why stay anywhere else? Hope you give it a try if you haven't. You won't be disappointed. Cant wait cuz I'm heading there again March 28th. Woohoo!

I spent 3 days at this hotel recently.  The restaurants were very nice.  The valet was quick and easy to deal with.  The rooms were lovely.  I really enjoy being Downtown as there are many fun things to do in the area.

I'm picky so let's just say it met my standards. I would stay here again just for the pool itself. Kids love it. I have OCD when it comes to hotel room cleanliness and they passed so I'd stay here again in the future

Although the hotel was nice, and has a great pool, parking staff and parking was the worst!  Before booking, check to see if they have events planned for the weekend.  If they do, book somewhere else!  They told us they normally don't even have enough parking for a full hotel and with any kind of event not only does self park fill up by 6pm,   valet even stops taking cars.  They give you an envelope with poor instructions to a public parking structure (that smells of urine) with a voucher to pay for it.  When i asked about parking priority for hotel guests they said there was none and was told by the hotel management this parking problem is what we can expect every time there was an event of any kind.  You can tell the parking staff received a lot of complaints about the parking situation because all we got was an an insincere "sorry were full",  shrugs of shoulders and looks of "not my problem".  Not an isolated incident, happened every night of our weekend stay.  So check before booking!

My family and I stopped in to grab some food, see the pool, play a few slots.  The food was food.  Not terrible and not the best thing on the world. The pool was great.  I love seeing the shark tank! The staff was super polite.  One employee noticed my mother in law walking slowly with a cane an offered a wheel chair.  It was nice to see staff that seemed human.  We were unable to get a wheel chair at some of the larger casinos where it was necessary due to the size of the places and the distance. Between exhibits and statues. Golden nugget went above and beyond to please.

As The Strip continues its soul-less spin into the ether, Downtown just keeps gettin' better! RUSH TOWER at the GN is a great place to base yourself for your Vegas adventure.

~ Great value for your $$$.
~ Fantastic, stylish rooms that are holding up well.
~ Dedicated Registration desk
~ Right next to the self parking (easy in\/out)

AND, you're DOWNTOWN!!!! Go for the Rush, Baby!! You won't regret it!

NOTE: Ask for a room facing away from Fremont Street. The bass from the "Experience" can be a little much.

This is a review of the buffet. I loved it. Great quality, great price, and nice a atmosphere. The desserts were superb. Not the huge selection of some other larger buffets, but plenty of delicious food for a satisfying meal. I actually liked that it's smaller. It didn't feel like I was part of a herd going on a feeding frenzy, like at the Strip buffets.

No sense of urgency or recovery of any kind!   The first room they gave us, the restroom was dirty, the second, no housekeeping of any kind.  Then we come back and the door is not working.  Maintenance had to come program the door, and it was our fault!!!!!!!  On top of that we waited in the hallway for 30\/40 minutes.  Called to speak to the hotel manager and for whatever reason, he could not be located!!! Really???????????????????????????

I've stayed at several Vegas hotels and for one in downtown, it really comes to a pleasant surprise in comparison to some of the other downtown versions. I believe since they renovated, everything here is a bit newer and nicer. It really does feel like you're staying in a hotel on the strip. 

The hotel participated in a variety of travel packages so be sure if you want to benefit from a great deal with decent lodging, you take a look at the Golden Nugget. It's also conveniently located next door to the Fremont Experience and a short ride away from the North Las Vegas Premium Outlets.

The "older" side of Vegas can still be fun...  The Golden Nugget has an awesome pool.  It appears to be heated year round.  So even with 70 degree temperatures, the pool can be used.  The water slide and giant fish tank are so much fun.

The casino has lower limits than most of the "strip" casinos.  And, the drink service came quite often.

I've never actually stayed in one of the rooms here, but I'm sure that they are probably just the same as most other casino\/hotels in Vegas.  As long as it's clean and provides a place to sleep, it should be all good.

Booked a trip during March Madness never stayed at the Nugget but that's where my friends were staying!! I also wanted to experience the water slide through the shark tank!! (Closed during my stay) huge disappointment to my autistic daughter as it was the one thing she wanted to do!! Rooms were quite nice in the rush tower where we stayed!! Everything was pretty good until I received my bill!! When I booked the hotel I was quoted a price of 1077 including the resort fees!! I have an email confirmation to the fact!!  But when I opened my credit card statement the billl was for over 1300 dollars!  If you like being charged more than your confirmed rate than Golden Nugget is the place for you!! Tried to reach them by phone and email and they can't seem to explain the difference in the charges!! Double check your bills from them !! Something shady sure going on!!!

It's cheap. Off the strip. Has a shark tank\/ pool\/ waterslide. Comfortable, clean rooms. That's 4 stars. I had no complaints. My friends stayed at the fleabag Fiesta on the outskirts of town for $10 less a night than me. Will definitely be back.
The Nugget was good to play a few games and drink. I think thats where I learned not to play craps and not be the only one there.

Last minute idea to check into a hotel and play tourist for the night and next day.  Check in was simple enough and the staff was very helpful and provided us with a great room.  The room itself was very clean, with fluffy pillows and all the amenities.  The bathroom seemed a bit small for me but it sufficed, it was only one night mind you.  After that it was downstairs to the casino for some drinks.  One thing I didn't like was the smokiness.  It just seemed as if everyone was smoking everywhere.  I've lived in Vegas for four years now and have worked in strip hotels as well as off strip and it just seemed too smoky for the casino floor.  Drinks were strong and decently priced.  

When it came time for room service it was prompt and the food was not bad at all.  My boyfriend had a burger with all the trimmings minus the mayo and I had a delicious chocolate cake.  (Yes, I love pie and cake.)  All in all a great downtown hotel experience and checkout was quick because you could check out via TV.

If it's Old Vegas you're looking for, this is a pretty good home base. It's right in the heart of Fremont Street but was recently redone - kind of like buying an old house in a decaying vintage neighborhood and having it gut rehabbed. 

Like everything in Vegas, the good comes with the bad. On the plus side is the pool which they call The Tank. Cascading water, three levels of deck chairs, and a massive aquarium with a shark tank smack in the middle. Plus a killer water slide that goes right through the shark tank at the end. Don't talk to me about the Golden Nugget until you've tried the slide.

On the minus side, the faucets released what smelled like the scent of hell every time we turned them on. Also, our trash was not emptied when we first checked into our room and there was a pair of white Vans with some sort of blood stain on them sitting under a chair.

For some, that would be a deal-breaker. For me, it just added to the mystery of Old Vegas.

I've been spoiled growing up because my parents always stayed on the strip.  Maybe it's easier to do so when you have kids, because I've seen pictures of their heydays in downtown before I came along (cue in 70s music).

So this was my first time staying away from the strip.  My brother-in-law recommended the Golden Nugget as it is supposedly one of the cleaner and modern looking hotels, so I searched for good deals and decided to book through Vegas.com (booking through this website was easy, but your reservation won't show up until 7 days prior to your stay).  The only contact I had with the actual hotel was when confirming reservation over the phone (which the guy recommended us getting the VIP card that costs an additional $25 + tax to secure the "non-smoking, double beds" in our room) and checking in at the VIP check-in (we couldn't find it initially because it's in an enclosed room) - so I guess I can't say whether we had good customer service or not, but the 2 families who came with us both said service at general check-in sucked.

Hubby, kids, and I stayed on the 21st floor of the Carson Tower (22 floors total), which I guess have the cheapest rooms compared to the standard rooms in the Gold Tower and Rush Tower, and is furthest away from the casino and Fremont Street.  Either way, it was clean and roomy enough for 2 adults and 2 kids.  The beds were surprisingly comfortable and the alarm clock conveniently had an iPhone charger, which helped since we had to charge other technologies with the charger that we brought from home.  Beware: bottled water $7, Keurig $10, internet $12.99\/day, and no fridge (don't bring anything that needs to be cooled).

The highlight of this hotel IMO was the pool.  Hubby and kids went in (I went gambling inside with one of my friends during this wonderful kid-free time), and they had a blast.  We all loved the pretty aquarium\/shark tank and the slide that goes through it.  It does get crowded pretty fast though and people will try to steal your lounge chairs if you're not guarding them.  It is also pretty at night so my friend and I tried to have some drinks at the H2O bar, but unfortunately it was too cold for us even with the heaters on (we ended up drinking at the Grotto bar where we had a great server).  We didn't really eat here as I saw the ratings on Yelp, but we did try the Carson Street Cafe for lunch due to time constriction (will write a separate review for that).

All in all, we had a nice experience here.  Nothing super special, but nothing really negative either.  Would definitely come back here if we decide to stay in downtown again.

This is by far the Best Hotel to stay in when you're downtown. Every time we stay here, it's always a good experience.  The rooms are clean and the décor is nice.  The housekeeping staff is very good at their jobs.  So is the hotel staff at check in and check out.  They do charge for Wi-Fi if you choose to use it.  and they also have bottled water and coffee unit in the rooms available for a fee.

Every time me and my boy visit this place we have a balanced time of fun.  Winning is easy at all tables and slots,  and I'm dying to go back.  BTW, at the end of the night, make sure to order a bowl of Vanilla Bean Ice cream.  They serve it in a melon bowl ; )

Wow! What a great hotel to stay if you're a local! 

Over the summer we decided to plan a Staycation and decided on the Golden Nugget downtown! 

We arrived on a Wednesday afternoon and OMG.

Using the VIP option - was well worth it! 

As soon as my family arrived we checked in the car at Valet, walked in and I B-Lined it to VIP! U should have seen the line just at hotel registration!!! It was cray cray!

I found the VIP check-in .. they were very friendly and there was only one other person in front of me!
I gave them my credit card and ID... they gave me two keys and directed Me to the Gold Rush Tower!

The room was super Clean and had a lot of space, large and comfy bed, separate dining area, comfy L shaped sofa, two TV's and the bathroom was huge!  It had a double shower, separate bath tub and enclosed room just for the toilet. 


Of course the main highlight was the pool, water slide and aquarium u zoom past in the slide. Seeing sharks up close was fascinating!

My kids loved it! We got to relax and unwind...having a few drinks by the pool - it was fun for the whole family!


We will be back for sure!

I have stayed at the Nugget several times. This time I had a problem with the parking. I tried to valet my car and was told it was full. I went to self parking and was told it was also full. I asked where I should park and they told me " you will have to find somewhere else".  If I am a guest at a hotel.... They should have a parking spot for my car.

The pool was foul.  Yes, there is a water slide and a shark tank... but you have to swim through the disgusting, murky water to check out either of them.  There is an adult only pool which should be called the kiddie pool because it's small... but you have to pay to rent a lounge chair just enter that area.  Did i mention there were cigarette butts floating in it?  The bed in our suite gave us neck cramps and the sheets\/pillows smelled like mold.  Never again!

This is a review for the Buffet in the Golden Nugget.

I enjoyed this buffet very much!
We went for the champagne brunch on a Sunday.  it was $17.99 per person. The lady at the register was a pretty rude.  I really didn't appreciate that...
But our waitress was so nice! Very polite and attentive to our needs.
The buffet isn't too big but it has a good selection.  My favorite part of the buffet may be the omelet guy.  That was probably one of the best ones I've had!  
There were so many desert selections.  They also have hand scooped ice cream.

There were also 3 choices of champagne. You could get basic Champagne, Mimosas, or Poinsettias (sp?) which is what I got. It's basically cranberry juice and champagne for those that don't know.

 I would love to come back again!

My husband and I recently spent our 5 year wedding anniversary in Vegas. We frequently visit Vegas, but this was our first time staying at the Golden Nugget. We were given the option to upgrade our room, which I'm glad we did. We stayed in the Rush Tower Jr. Corner Suite, and our room overlooked the pool area. This room was by far the nicest room we've ever stayed in! Also the front lobby gave us a bunch of coupons to use for the restaurants and bars inside the hotel. While we were out and about, we came back to our room, and the hotel had a printed card congratulating us on our anniversary and along with that, fresh cookies and chilled milk. So thoughful! We will definitely we coming back. Thank you for the outstanding service Golden Nugget.

Jen at the front desk is terrible.  If you have a request DO NOT as her. She will give you attitude. Simple request of having house keeping is not ok at the Golden Nugget.  If you do not like your job quit.

They fraudulently charged a "destination fee" of $23 on my credit card. They asked for the card for a security deposit, never mentioned these charges. I paid for my reservation through Orbitz.

They get one star, because any business that commits fraud does not deserve to be patronized. I had stayed with them three times previously, but no more.

I've been to the Golden Nugget many times for drinks, gambling and whenever we are showing tourist friends around downtown.  This is without a doubt my favorite hotel downtown.  It's got an old school feel but it's been updated very well.   Very classy, yet affordable.  I love everything...the chandeliers and decorations around the hotel, the shark tank, the pool, the cocktail waitresses' outfits, the Grotto, the steakhouse-Vic and Anthony's, the gaming, the lobby and the easy in and out parking garage.  Although I've never stayed here, eventually I will.  My dad had high school friends come to visit.  They all raved about the nice rooms and extra comfortable beds!  I've never had bad service in any area of the casino.  Very locals and tourist friendly...will be back, for sure!
Beautiful hotel, spacious and luxurious rooms.  I love the location on Fremont St and had a blast in The Tank!  Would definitely stay here again.

I sure did have a well-rounded experience at the Golden Nugget. On night number one I got to snag a room in the outdated tower, which wasn't too awful, but after switching to the newer "rush tower" it's quick to realize the more expensive rate. 

My only gripes about the rush tower room are the lack of electrical outlets the fact that I was staying on the fifth floor. I love having my phone next to me when I go to sleep like I assume most of us do. It serves as a clock, my internet access and a speaker to listen to some tunes. A dead phone is useless, (which usually happens in Vegas) and not having a place to charge it bedside was a killer. The biggest gripe though? THE SHARK TANK WATERSLIDE IS CLOSED! For those who know, this is an absolute deal killer as it's a main attraction for Golden Nugget. Oh well...

Thank god for blackout curtains because if you're staying on the fifth floor, it's day time all of the time. The enormous lights that illuminate the entire hotel sit on the same level and with the blinds open you'll swear you're in the Kenny Rogers Roasters episode of Seinfeld. Other than that, the room was beautiful, full of amenities and well worth the rate.

They renovated and the customer service is awful. There are specific places within that have great customer service but the security and the people working at the casino bars are miserable and do not make you feel welcome: it's also not cheap to gamble anymore.

If you are on a budget, and you don't mind a drive, this is not a bad choice. It's pretty far north, past a bunch of little wedding chapels. I liked how our room was nice and spacious, and they have a water slide that goes through a shark tank! I'm not really sure how humane it really is to have all those sharks there, but it was impressive. The casino itself is not bad, with a nice atmosphere. Checking in was a breeze. Parking here is not free unless you are a hotel guest. It's not all that obvious where the self parking is, and then the exact route to enter is a little ambiguous as well. The first time we drove in, we kinda went against traffic (luckily no one else was there!)

The best deal in the Downtown Las Vegas area! The rooms are modern and clean. The pool is spectacular with the water falls, water slide, and the SHARK tank!!

This place has good restaurants and a great cafe that stays open 24hrs!! Great non pretentious gambling. A short cab ride to the strip. You just can't go wrong here. The most bag for your buck!

After staying at the golden nugget many times over the past ten years I will no longer stay there. 
We incurred a clogged sink after a few mornings and reported this to the desk. Upon returning to the room prior to dinner the sink was half filled with sludge after what appeared an engineer attempted to fix it. After again calling a manager engineering again came up to the room and while we went to dinner he attempted to fix the mess. When returning to our room we found the sink still clogged and sludge within inches our toiletries kits. We don't know if some it splattered on them. A note was left to have us change rooms. 
All we were offered was a credit for one night out of our four after our health and welfare were compromised.  

The quality of this hotel in service has continued to go down. We ate at the buffet for dinner on Sunday night and for $24 wasn't acceptable. The main coffee shop on the first floor has been closed for over six months and the hotel has limited places to eat.

Hotel review:

The beds were SO nice and comfortable.  Our room was very, very clean and the shower was nice.  The A\/C was great.  

The pool was a little dirty and murky and made me wonder if people had spilled their drinks in it.  There was a ton of kids and very few pool chairs available.  The pool may be heated but it isn't heated very well - it was pretty cold even though we went at 5 p.m. on a 100 degree day.  The waterslide is a neat idea but nothing to write home about.

Checking in was a nightmare.  We walked to Carson Tower only to find that that registration desk was closed and we had to go all the way back to the front of the hotel.  (This would not have bothered me, but I was saddled with an autistic 4 year old and our luggage all by myself.)  

It was a fun experience and I would go back, mostly just for the nice beds and to show my husband the pool.  I just hope it's a little cleaner in the water next time we go.  The employees were all very nice and very helpful.  If you buy anything from the Golden Nugget store, you will be price gouged ($9.69 for a 3 oz bottle of contact cleaner, ouch!)  

Also if your kid is crying for some water, don't open the bottle of Fiji water on the table because if you break that tab, it costs you $8.  For bottled water.  Seems like there should have been a golden nugget in the waterbottle, for that much money.

We stayed here for my wedding weekend in Vegas and I was pleased at everything.
Service was great, the rooms were good.  We first checked in to our suite and it looked beautiful but smelled like smoke so bad.  So I went downstairs and asked to switch rooms, almost instantly the lady was able to switch us and was very kind.  
The food here is good.  Must eat at Charthouse.  
I enjoy downtown almost better than the strip because you can just relax.
Would recommend anyone staying in Downtown or wanting to, to stay here.

Please avoid this hotel if you still have a palse . the hotel is for old people .  the  hotel screwed up my reservation and blame me for the mistake. The manager was very mean and impatient with my inquiries .  I had bugs in my room,  old chips on the floor and cigarette butts behind the doors.  I can remember using the bathroom and smelling  a foul  smell coming from the sink .  The water had a foul odor and seem hard. Not worth a second visit . the manager's do not think one customer's respect and satisfaction matters . this hotel is more like a two star hotel . this place also has the nerve to charge for there slow internet. They offer  two bottles of water per day as away to make for the resort fees.  Its too much for me when I think about the damn coffee in the room not being name brand but, they charge 10 dollars . what stupid person would pay for that coffee when star bucks down stairs . they're money hungry and have nothing to offer . lastly their pool is not great and often over crowded.

This is the hotel that was picked for me for my first visit to Las Vegas.  My accommodations were plush, and it was located in a great area of Vegas.  No, it is not in the famed "Strip" of Vegas, but there was plenty around to see and do within the hotel, as well as outside the hotel.

If you stay here, bring your swimming trunks and do the fish tank slide.  That was my first time ever going on a slide that let you go through the middle of aquatic life.  Sharks and other swim type creatures don't even mind you gawking at them as your body goes unnaturally fast past them!

There was a nice light show on the ceiling of the walk way that night, which was a treat among itself.  The hotel is located by huge hot dogs, fried Oreos and Twinkies places and several buffets, so you can enjoy yourself here without being on the strip.

Oh yeah, the room was nice as well!

First off, we won these rooms in a 70 days of summer contest, we were pleasantly surprised on the accommodations.Rooms were tidy and spacious,parking valet was easy and convenient, check in very close to tower elevators.(that's a big one for me) but best of all, the pools are awesome! Adult pool upstairs, all ages downstairs. Cool fish aquarium. Bartenders service was excellent,water slide a must, we will be back!
I love you Golden Nugget!! I played Craps here for the very first time and won 300 bucks!! I cannot wait to go back again!! See you in April!!

Golden Nugget Downtown (9.24.2017)

Our experience here started out amazing. The valet, then the front desk...the most friendly and inviting people in Vegas, and that is not an exaggeration. We have been loyal to another(downtown) hotel\/casino for years, but the service sent us away, and that is when we decided on the Golden Nugget for this trip, and hopefully for all of our (monthly)Vegas trips. 

After arriving to our Carson Tower room, we were exhausted from the drive, and decided to rest. 
Unfortunately, in the middle of the nap, our door was opened abruptly by housekeeping, with no knock or anything. Before we could wake enough to figure out what was going on, they were gone. No big deal, as we understand mistakes happen. Probably the wrong room for cleaning. 
After a quick nap, it was time to shower and to get ready for a Vegas night! But to our surprise, the shower was FILTHY with dirty wash towels, soap stains and the like. We thought something is not right about this, so we called down to the front desk. Our concerns were met with an attitude of not caring. We were told that house keeping would be up within 15 minutes...25 minutes passes, so we call back and ask for another room, not an upgrade, but just another room, to which we were told that there are no other rooms and that they are 100% booked. (Did I mention that we have reservations and need to shower?) Well, that turned out to be false, as we were able to go on to Hotels.com and book the same exact room, in the same tower, without an issue, for the same price as we paid for this room that wasn't ready to sell! After another 15 minutes, an extremely nice lady knocked on the door and then proceeded to properly clean the bathroom. 

We are all about second chances, however, the people on the phone at the desk did not meet an expectation of quality service. We want to love the Golden Nugget, but this experience has left us beyond disappointed.

always  have a fun time here and usually would stay here when having fun downtown and can't drive home. The pool is great- wish it was a little bigger- and last time I won a royal at one of the casino bars while waiting on my sister!

Go downtown! You'll love it. That's what I heard from those who proceeded me to Vegas. So I did.

Cluttered place but decent selection of gaming, very attentive waitresses and much less pressure than the tables on the Strip. Seemed to be a good place to hang my hat for a bit.

Feeling a little like Jack Burton I spent some quality time at the craps table, and had a fairly successful time until the boxman starting yelling at me in a very thick accent (one would gather it Chinese in origin) about a five dollar minimum, which I was clearly well above on that roll.  

Becoming a bit flustered by this confusion, I felt what little mojo I had leave the room. And then like Lo Pan flying through that alley, Duke's money disappeared into thin air. I don't blame this gent for my loss, but I just wondered why he couldn't count my chips on the table.

As I dragged my sorry ass out of the door onto Fremont Street to the strains of some cover band, all I heard was someone yelling out, "Have ya paid your dues, Duke?".

This night, I most certainly felt as if I did...

My husband and I decided to stay at the Golden Nugget mainly for the outside hot tub which is open all year around. He has been here before and had stayed at the new "Rush Tower" and he had a very nice stay at that time. So he wanted to come back any enjoy the hot tub again (which the other hotels don't have them open this time of the year) When we step in to registration at the front desk, it was very beautiful, but we noticed there was only one person checking in customers and there was a line all the way to the door! The hotel staff didn't seem to be bothered that people were getting annoyed waiting in line for a 1\/2 hour. Plus, the overhead music was far too loud for a hotel. It should be backgound music, not a concert.
Well, we finally get checked in...they upgraded up to the 23rd floor and yes we were very pleased by that. (we paid 60 dollars extra for that) The room was beautiful!!!
So we go downstairs and started drinking and playing. Everything was pretty cool until bedtime..OMG!!! the walls are paperthin. Fremont street was IN OUR ROOM!!!!
WTF!!!! We could hear everything and could NOT sleep at all!!! It was so bad my husband had to call downstairs and ask them to move us to a room away from Fremont street. They did, the NEXT day. Anyway...we decided to use the hot tub. We got out suits on and found out they only had one robe for two people in a suite???
So the hubby calls housekeeping, they don't answer. He calls the front desk and tells them whats going on. They said they would take care of it. Half an hour later, hubby calls again, not in a good mood. Housekeeping finally shows up with two robes!
Then we go downstairs in our robes, but we have to parade ourselfs though the whole freaking casino in spa robes just to get to the hot tub (we look stupid, but there was no other way to get there) What kind of morons run this place????
Okay, relax now we are down to the hot tub and we take off our robes and I put my feet in, the water is ICE COLD!!!!!!!  My Hubby is PISSED now!!!
This whole trip was based on this, oh man he's NOT happy. The so-call express check out was a joke too. All it is "Leave a message" You don't get an itemized bill or anything. If you want that, go stand in line with the one guy they have at the front desk in the "Rush Tower". And last but not least...here is the kick in the pants. So, we didn't have a nice stay and we figured "ok we just won't ever stay there again",
I got a phone call this afternoon, ( mine you I have secured cellphone line) I don't ever get spam or telemarker calls because of the type of work I do. Golden Nugget sold my phone number to a telemarker firm this morning and they they called.
So, be warned that Golden Nugget DOES SELL YOUR PRIVATE INFORMATION.
I would NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN.

Maybe it's my "Old Soul ways"  or the fact that when I am in Vegas I just long to get back to the days when Frank, Dino, Sammy and Joey were performing in the Copa Room. But I have to say, I love me some Golden Nugget.

Don't get me wrong, I am a part-time Diva I enjoy shopping and I spend the day where all the Glam and ostentatious buildings are settled.  But when the Sun sets in Vegas you can always find me where a favorite haunt of the Frank Sinatra was "The Nostalgic Freemont",  and you can really experience it at  the Golden Nugget.  

The "Shark Tank" is F$%&ing Fantastic.  an enclosed three-story water slide allows you to practically swim with the sharks.  

You have the option to rent a cabana or just plant yourself on a cozy bed or sofa poolside and a gorgeous cocktail waitress will be at your call.  
Gambling is available outside as well!


I have always been lucky both in the Casino and Hotel Room Wink, Wink,
The Golden Nugget conveniently has the best Restaurant Vic and Anthony's Steakhouse.  

 Thank you Tilman J. Fertitta and I must add per my yelp review.  Please bring Vic and Anthony's to Galleria Dallas like you originally planned.

Since we are getting a lil too "matured" for the Vegas Strip scene, we have found that downtown Vegas is sometimes more our pace! LOL! The food, the black jack tables, and esp the alcoholic beverages are a little cheaper :) However, we still enjoy decent accommodations and have found Golden Nugget to be the closest thing to our strip hotel away from the strip. 

The rooms have all been renovated with comfortable beds and flat screen TVs. Their standard rooms are fairly large with more than enough walking space...it's not cramped and compact. Unlike, their neighboring casinos, the Golden Nugget is very clean...clean like they vacuum their floors and dust the slot machines. And also unlike their neighboring casinos, their cocktail waitresses don't look like they just got paroled or was pulled out of a mail order bride catalogue to pass out mardi gra beads!!! LOL! 

The rooms are very affordable, esp if you stay mid week (Sun-Thurs)...about $60 a night. I believe weekend rates can go up to $150 for a standard room, but still more reasonable than the $250 and up they offer at the strip hotels. The most appealing aspect of the hotel is their swimming pool, which they call the Tank. It's a nice sized pool that surrounds a shark tank...it's great. There's also a slide tube that takes you in through the shark tank and empties into the pool area, too. There's plenty of lounge chairs to catch some sun...and if you've got the dinero, you can rent a private cabana for about $75 for a half day. 

And if you get a craving for the strip life, you can always take the bus straight through Las Vegas Blvd or there's always the trusty old taxi cabs!

Spent a weeklong trip out west visiting parks, but started and ended in Vegas.  Since none of us had been to 'Old Vegas'  we decided to spend our first night at the Golden Nugget.  The decor in the lobby is great and they have a fantastic shark\/slide pool.  However, the check-in time was horrendous!  There was a long line which contained both people checking in and those looking to book shows.  That slowed down the line tremendously - they really need to separate these two lines and bring extra people onto the desk when there's that long of a line waiting.  Once we got to our rooms, we found that our safes had been left locked and could not be used.  We called and were told someone would come up to open them - that never happened before we had to check out the next day.  In fact most things that we needed to call down for either took forever to arrive, or just never showed up.

It was nice to experience this part of town, but now that we've done it once, we would not return.
This hotel gets 3-stars for the area. But the hotel is great! Fremont street is (if you're from California) like Venice beach on crack.

I do not recommend this hotel unless you're going to get heavily induced with alcohol  and you smoke constantly and like it blowing in your face and have no recovery of any non-smoking areas anywhere in the hotel. The first room that I got was musty and smoky and it was supposed to be a non-smoking section. Although AJ it was very nice and trying to compensate me and move me to a different area the hotel which was a little better but by the time I left there, as being a non-smoker I felt sick by just walking to the lobby to go in and out. We were there for a soccer tournament with teenage girls Who had to witness middle-age women doing lap dances on 20-year-old boys out by the pool. I could not sleep at night because a DJ was playing loud banging music out by the pool area which had closed at 7 PM and there was absolutely nobody out there. Although I tried ear plugs, pillows over my head, my bed was vibrating with the bass of the music. Definitely not a family atmosphere or even a teenage soccer team environment!

Wow, I have to break this review down into three categories, customer service, the room, and the gambling. 

First, the service. 2\/5, service here started on a bad note. after exiting the cab the handle snapped off of our baggage. Being a wheelchair user trying to get my bag just to the curb was a chore, no less than three bellman walked by, one guy three times.  we commandeered a cart and after entering the hotel were quickly noticed and chastised for taking it, after an explanation we were finally assisted. On another service related note, you are provided two bottles of water per day for your room but it must be requested. Really? This should be replenished daily without question. 

The gambling: 3\/5 I purposely came to old vegas for good drinks and better odds.....neither exist while gambling here. I brought 5k in "mad money" expecting not to bring it home. Blackjack pays 2:1 here, disappointing to say the least. At the table I requested Knob Creek, my go to drink. "we don't serve that here", ok, Makers mark? nope, not that either. Ok, what do you have? Well, just bring me the best you have and make it a double. "we don't serve doubles here" WTF! What happened to LAS VEGAS! After winning a couple hundred at blackjack even with the poor odds, I proceeded to the crap table where I won several hundred more.  Fortunately for me the headache from the crappy booze kicked in before the buzz and I left with my winnings. Sure I won, but I felt so miserable it lacked enjoyment. 

The room: 4\/5, props here. I have stayed at probably a dozen different places in Vegas and this was by far the best wheelchair accessible room with a properly arranged roll in shower (room 15216). The toilet wasn't exactly ideal and the bed was maybe 2 inches too high for flawless transfers, but it was the best I have found in Vegas including the MGM, Mirage, Flamingo, Monte Carlo, etc.

Side notes: The pool is definitely one of the best in town. Dining was just average for Vegas, the bright moment was our waiter (Michael?) at the chart house. Although I came home with more money than I left with (a RARE occurrence) I would only return for the room. Come on Golden Nugget, bring back quality booze while gambling everywhere with "old Vegas" odds and you would have a winning combination. Change that and I will give you a chance at getting some money back.
The jewel of downtown Las Vegas hotels by far. We stayed in the older Carson Tower, but it's still way above any other hotel in this area. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

I've stayed at many hotels. So many that I can't even count. Golden Nugget used to be a standard in excellence. What happened? I requested a late check out of 12 and I have already had 3 different maids knock on my door. There is no complimentary coffee offered in the room either! 10 dollars to drink a cup of coffee!!! Next time, I will spend less money and stay at The Grand. There they appreciate you as a guest, don't wake you up and provide complimentary coffee and water. Shame on you Golden Nugget your glory days are gone. Do yourself a favor and don't stay here...this place is no better than a motel. The motels in the area are nicer then this place. Don't let the downstairs fool you!

I stayed here for two nights when visiting Vegas a couple weeks ago. It overall was a great stay here. I stayed in the Carson Tower which are the cheapest rooms in the hotel. It only cost me $100 out the door since I booked it through Expedia while it was on sale and the Golden Nugget is the highest rated hotel on Fremont Street so I couldn't pass it up. The pool here is just amazing!! The fish\/shark tank in the middle of the pool with the waterside is awesome!! The only things that were bad about my stay was in my room, the room was nice but there were like 2 or 3 little rips on the walls and when I left a note to housekeeping to change a sheet that was ripped, they didn't do it which annoyed me but I called them and they took care of it right away which was nice. I would be willing to stay here again when I decide to stay on Fremont St if I can get a room cheap enough, hopefully I will get some hotel discounts from them since I signed up for their players card and I gambled like $55 away here so I would think they would want me to come back by offering me room discounts.

Terrible service and total lack of hospitality.
We were sitting in the Ice Bar when the Bar Back knocked my drink over. He informed the Bartender. We then went up to the bar to order another drink and was told that we were sh*t outta luck because we didn't purchase the drink from her.
As a local we will never return and will make sure to let our friends know what terrible service we received

Priceline gave me a $69\/night room in Vegas.  I did not expect $69\/night to get me the level of luxury that I got here.

This is as close to a 5-star hotel as you'll get.  You have bars, shopping, and entertainment.  Plus there's the casino, if you feel lucky.

The rooms were spacious and luxurious.  It gets cold in Vegas at night, so come prepared.  The beds were massive and really comfortable.  Parking is bad here - especially when there are fireworks going off.

I've been in $130\/night Hampton Suites, and while they didn't nickle-and-dime you for breakfast or anything else like at the Golden Nugget; however, not much can compare to the value and luxury (I've said that word too many times now) of the Golden Nugget.
Worst Sports book in Vegas. Small, Smokey, dark and rude management. There is very limited seating. The management asks you to leave if you're not a hotel guest.

Eh.

The hotel\/casino are ok.   The newer tower where we stayed was nice.   The room was pretty decent.   The buffet was pretty nasty, although the pasta man was super nice.  Great guy.

My issue was the customer service.   Seems like everyone we talked to there hated their jobs and were therefore unprofessional.    One of the valets simply stole the baggage cart we'd planned on using when we notified him that we'd be taking our own luggage in.   The desk people generally sucked and were short with us.

Love staying in old town, won't be staying at the Golden Nugget again though.    Great location - I will give 'em that at least.

EDIT** -- I forgot to say that even though I was up late every night gambling and enjoying adult activities ;^) , the music was super loud outside in the Fremont area, and the room was loud too.   Had to wear earplugs to sleep even when it was late.   That sucked.

We booked a Spa Tower Suite for 4 nights with the plan to invite our wedding guests to our suite for a reception after our wedding. In addition, we got a block of rooms at the GN for our wedding guests.

A year before our wedding, we booked our suite online and then contacted the hotel to arrange the block of rooms. It was an absolute nightmare dealing with the GN. Supposedly the contract was mailed to us. Never got it, so I called and emailed our contact person, Barbara, multiple times over a 3 month period, but she'd never return calls or emails. Nobody else in her office would assist us. Finally I had to get very stern with someone else in her office to finally get the contract emailed.

My other issue with the GN was that the max # on our room block was booked, but when one or two guests cancelled their reservation prior to the deadline, the GN kept the rooms, keeping other wedding guests from being able to book the rooms at the price we'd locked in with the block. The month before the wedding they were also unwilling to give us an update on the number of rooms that had been booked or were still available.

Upon arrival at the GN's "VIP Check-In," we were treated indifferently, despite knowing we were there for our wedding, that we were spending $2000 on our suite, and that more than 16 rooms had been booked at their hotel by our wedding guests. 

In short do not recommend the Golden Nugget for your special event.

Positives: we did love our huge suite--it worked out well for our reception--and the pool. The Bellhops were friendly and very helpful.

I have never considered staying off the Strip before, but after our "stay" at the Golden Nugget, I might have to reconsider.

After hearing about the Nugget's awesome water slide (that GOES THROUGH A SHARK TANK), we booked a room in the middle of our stay elsewhere. First impression: this place in general is a lot nicer than I'd expected. While the casino does show some signs of its age, the lobby could have fit in perfectly with the fanciest resorts on the Strip. Our room, while a little dark, was still much nicer than expected.

Now, onto the pool. As I mentioned before, the draw here was SHARK TANK WATER SLIDE, and it did not disappoint. Not only can you slide through a tube that goes through a tank full of big toothy sharks, but the rest of the pool surrounds said tank and makes for great observation. There is tons of lounging space around the pool, including couches and what were essentially big round "beds" (you know, in case you want to play Vitruvian Man). A couple of ice buckets of beer ($20 for 5 beers, not too bad), a swim in close proximity to man-eating fish, and you've got a recipe for a fantastic afternoon.

Like I said, now that I've tried it, I would actually consider coming back for a longer stay. The Golden Nugget has the glitz of new Vegas (at least as much as I can handle), but still retains the more laid-back, non-ultralounge vibe of old Vegas.

We came here for a friends wedding and it was really nice , the suits were awesome \/  and beautiful !!! We loved the pool \/ fish tank  in the pool area . We definitely will come back and try it out for a family day at the pool

We love Fremont and staying at the Golden Nugget, but I am disappointed with the lost and found.  After checking out and returning home I realized I had left an item in my room. I called and left a message with the lost and found department with the information the recording required. I waited two days and called again with the same information . Still no response ! Even if the item hasn't been turned in from house keeping it's still requires a return phone call! Shame on you Golden Nugget!

i can't wait until my next vegas trip because i'm for sure going to stay here again!! my bf and i are big fremont st. fans. the strip is great, but it's a lot more casual, less crowded, and just more fun overall in downtown. we live in SoCal but every time we come to vegas, we always go to the bars\/casinos here. 

I know the hotels here are a lot older than average, but i was pleasantly surprised by how modern and chic looking it is inside. right when i saw the aquarium behind the check in counter i was like, whoa okay i like this place. it was a fast and easy process and up our room we went. Booked a standard carson tower room but it's pretty spacious! the room looked renovated and clean, no complaints here! topped off the night with dinner at the grotto and was off to get wasted in dtlv.

I've been staying at this hotel now the past 2 years. Since we opened our showroom at World Market.
My boss pays for Carson tower and I always upgrade to the Rush tower for 50 dollars more a night . My Husband and I really loved suite. 
Well when I asked to upgrade Ms Joy said they could not upgrade me that day. But that they could the next. All I had to do was to bring my things down to bell desk in the morning. And when I got back from my day working I could move to the Rush tower., with key access and VIP card. 
So that's when the trouble started. So after long day moving showroom around etc. I come to desk and ask for my key to the room. And bellmen was to bring my bag 
I was shocked the room was right off the elevator and not bigger than Carson Tower. Not a suite at all.  So I called down said this is not what I had stayed in prior plus the fact it was 60 more a night to upgrade.  Came back down. Saw my bag coming grabbed him. Went back to desk said someone made a mistake I explained what I was promised. So I changed rooms again. This time no key access and on the 11 floor. Room was great but the whole time the noise level from outside was HORRIBLE  unreal.  I wasn't about to change rooms again after all of that. I learned my lesson Never stay on the Fremont side. I will make sure I'm set before I get there with NO surprises. 
I love the place. But the noice was very bad.

Stayed at this hotel for a work trip because of the location and for the price. It looked like a pretty nice place, however, once I checked in and walked up to my room, I realized I was very wrong. Upon pulling down the sheets to jump into bed after a long day, I noticed that there was a giant blood stain all over my sheets. I called down to housekeeping to see if they could change it, and they laughed and said  "oh it's probably just a rust stain, but would have someone come up and look." Even if it was just rust..disgusting. After the woman came in to the room she noticed too that it was indeed not rust. How the person cleaning the room didn't notice this when changing the sheets will forever be a mystery to me. Who knows what else is not actually cleaned in this room. Highly suggest you think about staying somewhere else.

IF YOU WANT TOO GET ROBBED, stay at the golden Nugget. I guess it was a inside Job, because they had a key. During our pool stay they robbed everything, sunglass, powerbank, boom Musik Box and my passport and many more. That was really bad. After calling the Security, they was like. Ah you don't need to call the Police. It really sucked. I mean they don't even offerd us a new safe room. We really felt alone with this Situation. After Research i saw that it Happen regulary at this Hotel. I talked too the Manager and he was as arrogant and useless as the Security. Never ever again. Thanks for nothing. The Staff of the golden Nugget is 100% involved in this Crime!!!!!

We only stayed one night but it was amazing. Upon check in ( which did take a little time) we were upgraded to a spa two story suite. This place was so awesome and beautiful. Everything was clean and looked amazing. Will definitely come back.

At first look the Golden Nugget looks nice but my experience on October 29, 2017 was less than perfect. 
1. It took 15 minutes for a Valet to check our car - each time.
2. It took 1\/2 hour to have the bell hop bring up our bags.
3. This was the icing on the cake. I paid an extra $40.00 for a late check out. check out is at 11am and late checkout is at 2pm. Housekeeping opened our door 3 times to try to clean our room, each time I explained we had late check out. Then my husbands room key didn't work and he was stuck downstairs, (a key is needed to get to the 23rd floor) he spoke to the guest services person who told him our check out was at 11am and she wasn't allowing him back up, she even threatened to call security. I had to come down from the 23rd floor to show my printed reservations that we had a late check out. I spoke with the manager, I was livid! So I spent my last 3 hours where I wanted to enjoy my Junior Suite but instead spent it fighting with the hotel!! Awful!!!

i played poker at golden nugget today. and i can say that they have the best 1\/2 nlh poker in a of las vegas. action is very good. and alot of people are deep stack because of their no cap buy in. very awesome game. i know alot of people from hawaii play their because they stay at the california hotel. i recomend to all u other people visisting from around the world to give downtown nugger a try. i would not leas u wrong. short stack buy in players to try ur luck at the nugget.

First we were in the furthest tower from the lobby we get all the way to our room and the keys don't work. On the last morning we were there I called the front desk at 5am letting them know I wanted late check out. They said I'd have to call at 11am (why?!) I call them at 11 and they set it up. At noon someone comes and knocks on the door wondering why we didn't check out, we told her we had already set up late check out. 20 minutes later WHEN I'M ABOUT TO FINALLY FALL BACK ASLEEP THEY CALL THE ROOM! At that point I was sooooo angry I got up and left, told them I'm not paying for late check out I'm getting the hell out of the room. TERRIBLE. I went to the front desk to check out and they didn't even apologize. Wouldn't you assume if I want late check out I don't want to be distributed! !!! Why do I have to call at 11am to get a frigging late checkout and then be bugged several times about it wtf kind of hotel are you operating!

We loved it here! Our first time downtown. We were there 3\/21-3\/24 2016. We got the Jr corner rush tower suite. We had no problems with check in. She upgraded us to a corner suite. The elevators up to the room were right around the corner. I do not have one complaint! Okay....they charge you for K-cups. I just brought my own after reading about that. No big deal. I've read some reviews of hotels that don't even have a coffee maker in the room! They don't have a mini fridge. No big deal for us. The grille has awesome late night food inexpensive food. We got a club sandwich w\/fries, s\/o onion rings and chicken quesadilla to go for less $30. Happy hour at Chart House is awesome!! Kim Chi Calamari, some kind of tempura shrimp and an artichoke dip for $18! And it was all amazing!! Already booked our next trip to Golden Nugget!!

Our first and last time staying here.. HORRIBLE service and honesty doesn't live in his hotel.

I had booked for our room on Bookit.com (for dates 05\/12-05\/15\/2016) a few days prior to us coming out to Vegas. We should have received a king size bed, instead we got something else...

We arrived on Thursday and instead of getting our king size bed we had paid for, we were placed into what seems like 2 double twin size bed. We were given an option to upgrade our room and it would cost us $30 more per night, which I opted not to because I know what I booked for and what I paid for.  When I asked, the lady told me, "we are out of King size beds right now, we can place you in one tomorrow after it becomes available, we will call you." 

The lady who checked us in took down my phone number down and never once did we received a call that day. We waited ALL day on Friday.

 Saturday comes, my fiance walks down to talk to them, the tall white guy manager tells him, we can move you to another room now - at this point we were done, we spent 2 nights out of our 3 nights in the room we did not want already... So my fiance told the manager no, the manager then offers us what sounded like a great way to make it up to customers. He said, they will remove the daily resort fee off ($28\/day).. So we agreed to it.. Please explain to me how me and my fiance who's a little over six feet tall and weighs 205 pounds is supposed to fit in a little bed that seems to be the size of a twin size bed?? We're not overweight people. And we're not ones to complain, and if honesty was given to us, we would've been okay with it.

 Sunday comes around for check out, we were still charged a resort fee of $56.00 for 2 days. When I asked why, the guy (after speaking to his Manager (same manager as Saturday) who didn't even have the audacity to come speak to his customers after telling my fiance something different) told us that they only waived one of the resort fee of $28.00 and that I was still responsible for the $56.00 resort fee. 

Wished our experience could've been better, but it wasnt. I'll be taking my business elsewhere. 

Thanks,

Hotel Guest Room # 1281

One of my favorite places in downtown Vegas. Really big hotel and casino and has newly renovated rooms. Good option of restaurants to dine in. Really enjoyed my stay here over the summer. Reservations were easy to make here! great deals!

A nice casino to play some slots. I didn't win much, but I wasn't winning anywhere this week. I did not get a chance to stay in their hotel. I gave it a 4 star because the bartender really took care of us and looked out for us when a couple shady people came up to try and scam us. We felt safe here.

Disappointing all around. I had high hopes given the history of the hotel and many of the reviews I read online. The rooms were decent with the exception of the incredibly noisy air conditioner, but the distance from the hotel lobby to our hotel room was a little annoying especially since the elevators we either not working or way too slow. Just to get down and out to Fremont was a 15 minute ordeal. There are other hotels on Fremont that much easier to navigate. 

The hotel staff were not very welcoming or helpful. I felt as if me checking in was a problem for them. We had issues with our room safe. From all the times we have travelled with room safe issues, we can usually call and then leave if there is nothing in the safe and they will come when they can. However, we did not know this is not the policy at the Nugget. It took almost a full day to get them coordinated enough to replace the battery of our open safe. 

All in all, I wouldn't recommend anyone to stay here. We gave it a shot for the sake of the pool, but with the lack of chairs available and slow staff service, I wouldn't do it again. If I want to go I will just pay to get in. I will just go back to the hotel I prefer on Fremont.

Right in the middle of downtown on Fremont Street, the Golden Nugget is a piece of classic Las Vegas!

Staying here during a weekend-long event, the hotel and it's casino, pool, and buffet areas were 'home base' and 'ground zero' for a huge group of party-goers-- and since we had booked our room through the group's room block months in advance, the rates were pretty reasonable, too (not so reasonable outside of the room block, though: it seems that the Nugget was charging quite a bit more for whatever rooms were still available on the weekend we were there due to a festival going on at the same time).  Our room was clean, spacious, and comfortable, and the staff were great.

The hotel pool here has been featured in magazines and television shows: it features a huge shark tank with a waterslide running through it!  A pretty amazing piece of work, and a blast to ride. :)  The buffet wasn't anything to get too excited about, but not a bad deal, either: all you can eat with a few cook-to-order stations for $13 on weekdays or with mimosas for $19 on weekends.  Of course, there are plenty of slot machines and table games in the casino here, too.  Fun place!

Let's start from the beginning contacted Golden Nugget property in regards to upgrade to spa room. Was contacted by property or told it would not be a problem when getting to the actual Hotel I was told there were no Spa rooms that none of the rooms had spas. I was also told that this jacuzzi we're located next to the pool and we're open till 1. Get to the room and was pleasantly surprised it was big and beautiful than i began to start using amenities I began to realize the room was not very clean stains on the robe old dirty fork underneath the sink in the bathroom. When I went to grab a tissue from the tissue box was gross. Are safe did not work continue to read error. The windows were filthy covered with dirt so the view wasn't as beautiful as it should have been. We're not really complainers so too us these were minor issues. Woke up the next morning realize there were no coffee cups for the coffee maker kind of a bummer for a coffee drinker.
So my husband and I planned our day out and decided we would visit the jacuzzi later that night it was a little windy during the day so we didn't go then. When grabbing dinner to go up to our room my husband stopped at the pool to ask about jacuzzi and was notified that it was going to be closing early because no one was gambling. My husband was very upset this was one of the main reasons why we wanted this hotel for a spa tub or jacuzzi. My husband then went to a manager who shrug their shoulders and basically said get over it. The next morning my husband talk to another manager at the end of the day we got nowhere. So if you believe an old-school customer service where the customers taking care of do not go here. Please look at the following pictures.

The worst place ever!!!!!!  Disgusting rooms and everything is beat up.  Linens are dingy, furniture is shabby and banged up and walls are paper thin.  This was the rush tower so you'd think it would be a little better-Nope!!!  Disgusting!!!!   Negative stars ...will never come back.  Don't waste your money.

Well let me say this was my first stay at the Golden Nugget. I had always heard such great things about it, so I figured I was in for a treat. When I made the reservation I asked all the questions - and especially since I would be arriving on a late flight, I wanted to make sure that there would not be any problems. The lady that took the reservation said she would make note, and we would be fine when we checked in so late. I also asked about how much their hold per night was for amenities, and was told $100, but it could be waived if I asked - she said she would also note that on the reservation. 

So just before taking off I make a last minute call to make sure that all is fine, and we will have a room when we arrive. Good thing - nothing was noted on the reservation about our late arrival!! So by the time we get to the hotel is almost midnight, and we go to check in and of course there is drama.......they don't have a clean room where we are supposed to have it, so we end up in the very back of the Carson Tower facing a wall. Not so pleased - but the room seems clean and comfortable. 

Now at the desk while checking in I ask again about the hold on the credit card, and tell the gentleman about the whole conversation - and that I wanted it waived because I don't use any amenities. He tells me not to worry because they are not holding it - and we head to the room. 
So unfortunately this time money is a bit tight, and I had only 1 card to use for the whole trip - well we go to eat, and present the card for payment.......and what happens, it is declined!! They had put a $400 hold on my card!!! 

I was terribly upset, and had to go back down to the desk - since you can't ever get a representative on the phone. For some reason they never answer!! So I go downstairs to speak with the Manager, and he says all the right words, and the I'm sorry's - and says he can have it credited back in the morning. He then also offers to upgrade our room to the Gold Tower - which I take him up on. Turned out to be a better view - more comfortable beds, and such. 

The next morning the hold money is still not back on the card - and after several calls it is finally resolved. Now we head up to the buffet, held up with all of that, and we still have about 20 minutes before breakfast is over. We head to the food stations, and they already have lunch items out. We see a few things, eggs, bacon, biscuits & gravy and grab a plate. As we get to that station - they guy behind the counter grabs the stuff and starts changing them trays to lunch. I see the biscuits & gravy sitting there, and I say "can I have one of those"?......and you will not believe what he does.....he takes the tray of biscuits and throws them away and says "breakfast is over - it's lunchtime"!!! I was furious - there was still 15 minutes of breakfast left, and he had nerve to do that. Then I hear another woman behind the counter yell the same thing at me. I got no resolution with the manager, and was completely disgusted that I had even spent my money there!! 

We did try the Cafe one night - food was tasty, service great. 
Never went to the pool - it was like a meat market!! Cute little girls serving drinks, guys staring and drunk, etc. Looked nice though! 

The beds in the Gold Tower were extremely comfortable!! Slept well in them! 

Did notice the hotel is kept very clean - they shampoo the rugs at night, and clean all the lights, good maintenance. Also the rooms are serviced well. 

Used the bus system to get to the Strip - there is a bus stop across Freemont St, so it was very convenient. 

Overall it was ok - not horrible, and not great - but would stay there again.

Sweet Jesus.... 

I think I've discovered another layer of hell in what is Las Vegas. Thy name is Golden Nugget. Seriously, this place is what trashy ass people think may be fancy. Oh, where do I start.... Well, lets start with check-in.

I wanted to stay at this hotel because it was the main hotel used for Punk Rock Bowling. I figured that it must be okay if the event locks in rooms there, plus it was close to where my friends were staying at The D. So I walk in and boom- GAG! COUGH! COUGH! Is this 1995 or 2015? WHO STILL ALLOWS SMOKING INDOORS?! Are you kidding me?! Gross. Also, why is there such a late check-in? So, after an eye-spraining eye-roll, we make it in the maze that is the hotel\/casino and enter into our room. At first glance it seems okay and an upgrade from The D, but not by much. What I do notice is that the room is not as cool as it should be for such a hot day. At first I think, no problem, I will just turn the system down. NOPE. Turns out that there is a controlled thermostat and limits how cold you can make your room. Now, picture me coming from Texas to this weather (we hadn't gotten fully hot yet) and I am dying and slow, painful death. After calling to get the unit serviced, I figured out what was going on because it is the same crap I've encountered before. Anywho, I get over the heat and cool down a bit and finally decide to explore the room. For a place that charges you a "resort fee", I don't feel like I'm getting any perks. The internet is so slow that I opt to just use the LTE system from my phone company. The two bottles of water they provide you a day has to be tap from California. The pool was really small for what I would think a "resort" would have. Also, I didn't want to swim in there after looking at a few crusty punks floating around in there. I know those kids have more money than I do, but funk knows no socioeconomic bounds. No thanks. Whatever else the "resort fee" is supposed to cover is beyond me because I just see it as $20\/night wasted. I guess the free parking is cool, but I did not get a rental car (big mistake) so I dunno. 

I looked around the room and found the room safe that was meh at best. I prayed that I would be able to get my medication out of it. But you know, it did not matter if I had it in there or not. I don't want to mess up anyone's false sense of security or anything, but if you look at the directions on there, you can see that anyone can still get into your safe. Booo. I look in the closet and see that they had two decent looking robes in there. I guess people get excited about their robes because they left a note on there stating that if the robe was missing that they would charge you $65. I mean, they said it nicer than that but that was the gist. To my surprise though is that the robes had the texture of burlap. WHO WANTS BURLAP BRUSHING THEIR BUTT CHEEKS?! There's not enough booze in the world to make that okay. So fine, no robe, janky safe, iPhone 4 and under compatible alarm clock, and cheap pillows. Oh jeez, we are batting for 100 here. It's a sad moment when you realize that you would have done better at a Holiday Inn. A HOLIDAY INN, PEOPLE! Let that marinate. I would go into what all I felt about the bathroom, but this review is already way too long. All I will say on that is my towels smelled burnt and full of cigarette smoke. It is not the look to feel dirtier AFTER your shower than before. 

Now, I know someone is saying, "damn she's a princess", Well, kinda, but I expect more at these prices. If they would have done $65 a night, we could talk, but they want much more for f-all in return. I would say stay somewhere else, but my vote is for you not to go to Vegas at all unless you have a darn good reason for great friends that live there. But if you must, don't stay here unless you want a hot scratchy ass, and if you do, don't forget the bread crumbs so you can find you way back to your room. Also, work on your dodging skills because people will try to get you to book a room in advance for next year. No thanks. 

I guess I should leave on a good note. The customer service was pretty good. There ya go. Yay for you.

So disappointed! I thought I would love this place based on the reviews, but it totally let me down.

I stayed in a room in the North Tower, which is the oldest section of the hotel (first mistake?). The room was small for the price, smelled like mothballs, and looked like it belonged in a retirement home. Stains on the carpet, a mouse in the hall. I tried to upgrade my room to see if that would make me like this place a little better, but the front desk told me they were totally booked. 

The bartender at the casino gave me a cracked glass that I almost cut my lip on. The buffet was cheap, but also greasy, tasteless, and barely edible, and the security guard at the pool was a total douche. Overall the whole place felt dated, tacky, and depressing. The spa was very nice and the staff there were great, but that was pretty much the only aspect of the hotel that I enjoyed at all. Not what I was hoping for!

As a not too frequent visitor to Vegas but going with those who know the area, we were urged to stay at Golden Nugget.
I love the look, the staff for the most part, the features like restaurants and cafe, and the location.  The rooms are great and the beds are awesome and you get a really clean sense from the rooms and housekeeping is super.
As a non-smoker, I did not love the smokiness in the casino.
I liked the design of the pool area and that I could go outside easily to look for fresh air.  Operative word: look for fresh air.  What the heck: everyone in the Fremont Street area under that overhang smokes, I swear.  There were parents with little children and even young preteen children bringing them into this smoky area, which I would never do.
It is really fun and really cool but the bottom line is that I saw kids coughing, and I was coughing and it seemed so many more smokers were whooping it up in here than in other places.
Having just got over bronchitis it was rather touchy and I cannot say I would look forward to the experience again, which is mainly affected by my relationship with smoke.

Staying at the Carson Tower is great and cheap. The Spa Suite is also beautiful. But their reservations\/managers\/staff in general are a bunch of A-Holes. I just got off the phone with a manager and she refuses to waive a fee that was just ridiculous. I brought around 50 plus people into that hotel for my wedding and everyone had issues with their staff and even things breaking in their rooms. It is embarrassing that I gave this place my wedding business and they are not even respectful of that fact.

I have stayed at the Golden Nugget with my family for March Madness every year for the past 8 years but I will be definitely be changing venue next year based on how rude their workers are. 

With that said, the wedding planner Silke is absolutely the best and I am glad that she is so organized and great at customer service. The rest of them can learn a thing or two from her.

My girlfriend and I recently stay here and we had a horrible experience. Pretty much we had bedbugs, my girlfriend had bites all over and even her arms started swell. I would never recommend for anyone to stay at this hotel.

The only good thing to say about this hotel is there pool was pretty awesome.

8 out the 10  days I have stayed here on business when I go to use my key card I'd does not work. Have to wait outside my room for up to 30 minutes for security to let me in after going through the riot act then once in waiting up to 1 hour to have front desk to bring up new card keys. Very embarrassing, frustrating and disappointing. Double check before staying here.

Had an OK time until the housekeeper robbed me. She asked me if I was leaving...  I know it was my fault for not putting my purse in the safe while I helped my friends load up their car with suitcases, but who would have guessed in less than 30 min. my $ would be gone. That was an expensive lesson to learn.

stayed here for the first time a couple weeks ago. In vegas I'm hardly in the room so I lean towrds the cheaper hotel chains. I could have stayed at a motel 6 for half the price but the awesome pool convinced me to pick the GN. I got a AAA discount which was great! check in was quick and easy and when I asked the young woman to direct me to the nearest place where I could get some juices or drinks she told me to help myself and pointed at a refrigerator they had near checkout with OJ, apple juice, cranberry juice, peanuts and candy! THANKS! the room was very nice and roomy. Our view sucked but hey i dont care too much for those things. We really enjoyed the pool except for the fact that its waaaaaaaay to packed and i learned you have to get there EARLY if you want a chair. however lucky for us some girls nearby left and we jumped on some lounge chairs that were in the pool about 10 minutes after we got there. tube slide is great not too many kids when we were there. I liked that they didnt let locals in as they ask for room key at the door. allows for more room for people who actually pay $$ to stay there since the pool is not that big. We enjoyed being away from the commotion of the strip for a night since freemont street is a bit less hectic. not very many other places i enjoyed going to outside the GN though. gambling is okay a few 24 hr shops and restaurants so that was good. starbucks is convenient too and room service was great! Pricey but hey its the experience right? Wouldn't mind going back again. Just wish the pool was a little bigger :\/

This place is a dump. The worst customer service we've ever experienced. First we get welcomed with the news that there s a $5.00 a day "Fremont Experience" fee.  We could care less about $5.00, but this was not disclosed at the time of reservation.  We were told that the fee was to cover the Fremont Experience out the front door, which We might add, is the street in front of the hotel, a PUBLIC street!!  Get to our dark and extremely dated room in the Carson Tower, which hasn't received a renovation since Sinatra headlined here. In room water: $7.00, in room coffee $10.00.  Really?  The hotel pool was closed on Saturday, due to a haz-mat problem.  We were disappointed as we had planned to spend the day by the pool. Called the "assistant general manager" Julio, who explained the problem, and we were only offered late check out the next day. Not much, considering we had a 815am flight Sunday morning. Obviously declined.  Called back to ask for some sort of compensation, still waiting........
Julio finally called back after over an hour, and said there was NOTHING he would do to compensate us for ruining our day. The uncaring and apathetic staff here are unbelievable! 
Final slap in the face, I go down to run boarding passes for flight, find out there is a $5.00 charge...to run a boarding pass???!!!  There are no comment cards in rooms, I wonder why????
Like I sad, a DUMP, and an absolutely insulting experience.

We only stayed here because my husband had to for work. It's not a place I would've picked myself. It's old and needs updating and even the Rush Tower which has been updated needs updating! The tub was nice and the bed was alright for a hotel bed but I wouldn't stay here again. The staff was not very helpful. The valet is THE WORST! They never have enough valet staff and even when they do they are all just standing around. One night we drove up and there was a line outside the valet. Cars were just parked in the valet line with no one moving them and my husband waited 20-30 mins for someone just to show up. The pool was always over crowded so we didn't even attempt that! The only thing good about this hotel was Lillie's restaurant. The hibachi was very good. Unfortunately this is probably the best hotel on Freemont Street and that's not saying a lot.

I called and asked if the slide would be open since the website states its under construction. They advised me that it would be open the day i checked in. Well it was not and i asked the lifeguard if it would be open the next day and she rudely said she doesnt know. She should have more information or asked somone. I drove 5 hours from Cali just for the slide to be closed. Gave it 2 stars for the suite I stayed in. It was Ok for the amount I paid.

I was really disappointed in this hotel. We booked our hotel for 5 days for the festival Life is Beautiful 6 months in advance. When we arrived I had been trouble with my credit card because I had used the $1,000 max limit for the day. All I needed to do was call the bank and get the limit increased for the day. The man that was checking us into the hotel began to look at us funny and assumed that we just couldn't afford the room. 

I stepped away called the bank and had it resolved in less than 5 minutes. When I got back to the check in line the man helping us, appeared to look flustered with me. So he ran the card and it worked fine and with a rude remark by him "It went through" with an attitude. I didn't mind because I was just excited to be there. So we get our and get told we have a pool view .... on the 5th floor. 

We get to the room it's practically sitting on air conditioners. We have a prefect view of the air conditioning units for the hotel through the smallest window ever made. 

Wow. I couldn't believe this .... I was upset with the mans attitude towards me. I was upset that they had put us on such a low floor. 

We booked it way in advance. I will never stay at the Golden Nugget and will definitely be telling others that it is NOT WORTH it. 

Checked in on Thursday 9\/21 around 5:05pm. 

Rude check in staff.

Second time staying here in the past 6 months and we have learned a few things that make the stay at the Nugget a bit more affordable and enjoyable for us. This is the nicest property on Freemont street by far in my opinion. The staff are extremely nice and helpful and seem to want to do good by you if you give them the chance. There are plenty of gaming tables and machines and the casino is very clean. The rooms are really nothing fancy, but given the cheaper price I wont complain. All of the meals we had were very good and we appreciated that we could walk from casino to casino on Freemont within a short period of time. The bad part of Freemont street is don't be surprised if your bum rushed by someone looking for a handout or trying to get you to listen to their sales pitch. Simply say no and walk away and perhaps they will stop doing it.
