The number one complaint we have with the casino floor is their comp policy that they have recently put in place regarding free drinks at the bar. They have an indicator on the bartender side of the screen that tells them if you are playing enough to deserve a free beer or drink. Although I understand a lot of folks take advantage of this perk and simply play a nickle through the machine to get a freebie It just seems seedy and tacky to me. I play plenty and have no problem with them giving me whatever I want, but it just don't like it. Regarding the high drink prices and coffee being $20 for 4 Kuereg cups be advised there is a Walgreens two blocks down on Freemont street. There you can get 12 Kuereg cups for $15 and, yes, they work in the coffee maker in the room. Also pick yourself up a Styrofoam, cooler there for a few bucks. You can chill your beer in it plus creamer if you get some thus no paying $5 for a bottle of beer there if you don't gamble much. They have clear plastic cups at all of the doorways for pouring your drink into before venturing out on Freemont so grab a few and take them to your room. There are liquor stores on both sides of the property on Freemont as well. Get your fruit juice and liquor there for your room and your clear cups to save money as well. Lastly be sure to get a players card when you get there for the casino as they usually give you some free play on it for joining. Use this card while you play and see the casino host before you check out to apply your credit to the room costs. It took me the second trip to get it down but we had a great time there and didn't break the bank. We are going back again soon!

We stayed at the Golden Nugget for one night -- and this review is expressly about our Gold Club Room.  These are nice rooms, nicely appointed and much better than the normal room.  They're on a floor only accessed on the elevator by a Gold Club key.  Some of the perqs are coffee in the morning and great snacks like nuts and chocolate covered raisins in the afternoon\/evening.  
And there lies the problem.  We checked in at 4, got to our room, checked the snacks and discovered that of the 4 bowls, three had been cleaned out (like someone with a big plastic bag had come by and taken everything).  Plus their complimentary water bottles were gone.
We couldn't go to sleep that early since our room overlooked the Fremont St. Experience and "Born To Be Wild" was blasting away during the midnight show right  below us.  So when I went to get the morning coffee -- nothing.  No coffee, no juice, no bottles of water.  I went down to the VIP office where the woman said they put it out at 6 (it was now 8:30).  Great!  They eventually did bring some more coffee and water -- but if they are trying to run a nice upgrade properly, they need to work at this in a big way.  We'll probably never stay here again (since there are so many hotels in Vegas who actually know what they're doing).

I stayed at The Nug for a few days this week. It was my first time staying here, and it was an overall good experience. Check-in was a breeze. We got there around 10am and expected to have to check our bags and wait for our room to be ready, but it was good to go right away. We stayed in the Carson Tower, which is a bit of a haul from the casino but you're in Vegas. You expect to put miles on your soles, right? The only time I was annoyed by it was when we got back after walking the strip all day. I was about to steal someone's Rascal scooter and make a break for it. The room was nothing spectacular. The mattress was surprisingly comfortable and the pillows were nice & squishy just how I like them. Don't expect free coffee in these rooms. They give you a Keurig and a box of 4 K-cups (2 caffeinated, 2 decaf -if you consider that coffee) that will set you back $10. Ridiculous. After a night of shenanigans and questionable decisions, a girl needs some caffeine, but dude. I had breakfast at the buffet, which was excellent. Food was good, decent selection of eats. I also had lunch at Claim Jumpers. It was...Ehh. Not terrible, but not great. The casino is pretty decent. The property is clean, staff is really friendly & helpful. There is a nice seating area just outside of the Starbucks where you can relax and do some great people watching. One warning - The pigeons love to chill in this area. They will stroll right up to you and mean mug you. It's weird, most of them have missing feet and trot around on stumps. What's going on with that? Yeah, so if you don't like birds you may want to pass. Overall experience was pretty dope. I would definitely stay here again.

this yelp is for the faboulous cocktail waitress bella who does a fantastic job...within a few minutes of my family and i having a seat at some machines (they paid out as well) bella arrives to save the night, she had the drinks coming one right after another ---of course we also tipped her everytime (huge reminder to those who do not tip---always tip the waitress\/server) need less to say we all walked out winners and bella had me feeling tipsy.. thanks again bella ur the best !!

The sharks!...that was amazing, they have a shark tank where they throw their none paying clients.....no I am kidding!!!

you can sit by the patio\/pull and watch the aquarium...very soothing and relaxing.

The best part if you like noise and traffic, next to the hotel is the largest screen anywhere in a form of a curved ceiling, where they show this fantastic acid videos with loud music...

I love the Golden Nugget! My parents decided to surprise my brother and I with a trip to Vegas last year. They told us that we were going to Flaming Gorge Wyoming to stay with some friends for the weekend, and we totally believed them. I should have suspected that something was up when they told us that Wyoming was the exit before Vegas, but I didn't. We pulled into Vegas and my parents told us that we would be spending the weekend there instead, and I was floored! I consider Vegas to be my second home, so this was the perfect surprise. 
We checked in at the Golden Nugget and our room was pretty nice. We stayed in the old tower because my parents are cheap, but I have no complaints. The beds were nice, and everything seemed to be clean. We spent two nights there, and spent a ton of time in their amazing swimming pool. They have a huge water slide that goes through a shark tank! The only thing I have an issue with is how freaking cold the water is. The cold water is what made this review only 4 stars. You can rent out a cabana, or if you are 21 or older, you gain access to a special "adults only" pool. Hopefully that one is warmer!

I don't know if it was just my night, but I dropped 2k into a $5.00 slot without a substantial win. I'm saying my biggest with was $100.00 which is par to course for a machine that's taking $20.00 per pull on max bet which is all I do. Guess Freemont has them thinking they can lock shit down.

The Golden Nugget is good and just inches away from being great.

The Good:
I stayed in the Rush Tower, which the GN site calls "new". It was either just built or renovated because the rooms were very up to date, very nice, and very big. The bathroom was awesome and now my wife wants one like it. The bed was comfortable and the rest of the room was very clean.
Vic and Anthony's is a high end steak & lobster restaurant with incredible food and an impressive stock of top shelf Scotches. Just be sure to have deep pockets. Dinner for 2 plus drinks came to about $120.
The Grotto is a mid range Italian restaurant with a good menu, a good wine list and a view of the pool. Moderate price, good food.
Red Sushi located next to the casino floor is a good place to get some hand crafted sushi and roles while people watching. Comfortable but a little loud because it is open to the casino.
Both pools were clean, well maintained although neither had a view of anything except the hotel.
The hotel\/casino complex is small when compared to monsters like the MGM, which I like since it is easier to navigate, quicker to get to my room if I need something without having to walk past a dozen overpriced shops no one buys anything at, and it has very quick access to Fremont Street from the casino. 

The Bad:
No free wifi. Its 2014 people, get over it! I can get free wifi on a freak'n airplane I think I should be able to get some wifi at a mid-level Las Vegas casino.
I wouldn't have known it was there if I hadn't asked, but there is one bar near Fremont street in the casino that has been designated the International Beer Bar. It isn't on the maps or website, only has a moderate selection and the staff wasn't knowledgeable enough. If you have that name and say you have 40 beers but include terrible domestic beers or super common imports like Becks, you aren't really doing anyone any favors. If the IBB doesn't stock a German Doppelbock they should at least know what it is (not that uncommon) and if they stock Belgian Trappist beers like Chimay Blue and I ask for a Quad, you should know that will work.
I also had mixed luck with the bars. The Rush Bar made me a Godfather cocktail no problem. The H2O bar at the pool had no idea what it was, called someone to find out, and still got it wrong.
Speaking of which the H20 bar is at the pool that closes @ 8pm. The Hideaway Pool on the third floor for adults is open to 2am, but doesn't have a bartender after 8pm. Kinda lame. So your options are to get out dripping wet and go down two levels to get a drink, or hope that a girl collecting towels comes around every 30 minutes and is willing to take a drink order (which they then get wrong.)

The Golden Nugget feels like it might be in transition. They want to go upscale, and offer a whole lot of bang for a pretty good price, with some nice amenities, but fall just short of getting it perfect. If they offer the right services when they should be offered and get their barmen up to speed, I'd say the place was perfect.

YOU MAY NOT HAVE ROOM ACCESS!!! and DO NOT pay $25 VIP Access!! We just waited  almost 3 hours to get into our room. We tried to get into our room after dinner and show at 12ish and could not get into our room.... We waited in line for an hour and had was given a new key. Once the new key did not work, we called security and when no one showed up 30 minutes later, we went to the front desk. When I asked about the poor service, the front receptionist said "you must have demagniized your card.... and I don't think that I was one that helped you".....It was bad enough that we checked in we walked in on people that had not checked out yet but being held hostage to get into our room was something else. I will never stay her again. Not only did we feel like like no one would help us, we were even patronized for wanting them to be responsible when we could not get into our room for two hours.
Classic downtown Vegas!  Great action on the casino floor late night if you play lower limits.

The nugget is probably the nicest hotel on Freemont Street. It's definitely not as "sticky" as some the others (i.e.; The Golden Gate, 4 Queens, etc)
I recommend the Rush Tower. It's newer, super clean,
Trying to be stylish... the rooms are all decorated in shades of brown (we called it Burt Reynolds Chic)
The bed was super comfy and the staff was really nice. 

Now I love Downtown Vegas over the Strip. I am not a millionaire, a Kardashian, an Orange County Housewife, or any other kind of B celebrity, nor am I delusional to think that if I hang out at the Cosmo I might become one of those. Plus it smells like Drakar in there, which makes me what to punch people in the face.

I like the idea of old school Vegas...Down town...kind of seedy, free drinks, $5 crap tables.... People with missing digits, missing limbs, really bad outfits, 80's hair and eye patches....
It's AMAZING... 

Freemont Street is so wrong it's right!
It's as if Disneyland and San Francisco's Tenderloin had a baby...
It's dingy, sparkly, fascinating and horrifying all at the same time.
The Bon Jovi light show can only be toped by the Queen light show.
And if you are lucky, you can ZIP LINE the length of 
Freemont St., during it!  WHAT??!!

Definitely pay the extra $ for the ADULT only pool. 
Don't eat at the barffet \/ buffet ( I saw a bug)
Do have cocktails snacks in the Chart House and definitely stay in the Rush Towers. It's worth saving the money on a room on the strip, so you can have more drinks, more food, and more gambling everywhere else.

Best place to stay downtown Vegas.  They have a little bit of everything - good restaurants, bars, entertainment, gambling.  Perfectly located downtown in the middle of the action.! Lots of fun free concerts outside and people watching.  Red Sushi is awesome and the brunch is a good value.  The steak house is worth it!!

This casino is tighter than a virgin......afraid to pay out on single denomination bets......cause they might run themselves out of business if they actually paid out anything.  Hotel rooms ......really poorly maintained and they don't really care at all.  My tub wouldn't drain.  But doesn't phase them.    We will send maintenence .......2 hours later.  Not recommended at all.    Go to any other casino......you will be far better off.

Just when I thought finally  arrived to be told the two beds room I paid for was gone and I should of read the fine print, so I asked for a manager, ten min later she comes with a bad attitude and presided to tell me you should of been here sooner so I got loud at the point a room became available she offered me nothing even when I told here I walked a long ways in the cold wind to find a parking and it took me over an hour all I wanted is a little simpathy  thx for nothing Roxane. You should be hidden in the back not running  the front disk.

Check in was fast and easy. Besides the room which I already paid for, they added a resort fee when we checked in for another hundred dollars which I was disappointed in. That's really my only complaint.  The room was nice and spacious. Queen bed with a nice day couch. No small refrigerator fyi. The bathroom was awesome. Double doors with a big shower. His and hers sinks and the toilet had its own room with a door. It also had a decent sized closet.  We stayed in the Rush Tower in a queen room. 

The pool is nice. They give you towels there so you don't have to worry about that.  I expected the pool to be bigger but it was cool. The slide was fun! You can gamble in the pool area and they do serve drinks.

You are close to everything on Fremont Street at this hotel and I really think it's the best one. The other hotels seemed dirty\/run down. You do get free parking when staying here as well which was nice.  When I come back I'll stay here again.

Spent seven days here and had a wonderful time.  All personnel were helpful and friendly.  Stayed in a Rush Tower room last year and it was very nice, however this time we were upgraded (without asking) to a corner suite.  Oh wow was that a surprise!.  Housekeeping service was top notch, great views, full bath and 1\/2 bath, 2 refrigerators and 4 TV's.  I felt like a queen!

Only complaint was that our key\/room cards shut down several times.  Since we needed that card for the elevator it was a big problem and embarassing to have to get out of the elevator and find a desk person to re-activate the cards.  Also card worked in the elevator, then not at the room.  Twenty floors back down to get that card re-activated.  This is a problem that really needs to be fixed.

I am so excited to see the downtown energy of "Old Las Vegas" come to life over the past couple years. I'm a "rare"  local who loves The Strip, but I really love what looks like is happening down in the Fremont area too. 

Last night we attended a poker tournament (play money, but real prizes) at the Golden Nugget and I was pleasantly surprised by the remodel. I only got as far as the main lobby with the surrounding lounges and bars, and poker room, but I was quite impressed with how cleaned up and modern it was.

We could see the multi-tier pool area from the 6th floor of the parking garage and it looked quite fun too.

I don't know how the actual rooms are, but from what I saw I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this as a spot to take out of town guests.

If you're going stay in downtown Vegas, the clear and only choice is the Golden Nugget. Traveling alone on personal business (summer 2011) I stayed in the Rush Tower and was impressed with the room for such a reasonable price. The Nugget's recent remodeling was evident in the casino's fresh decor and updated look, the room was comfortable, quiet and offered a nice view. The bathroom and shower weren't gross. 

Service from the hotel staff and front desk was mixed on my stay. I guess they can't read the 'Do Not Disturb' sign. Don't attempt to call the front desk they don't pickup. The internet service was wired and getting logged on was a bit of a mystery. Room service was good but food was outrageously expensive. Don't look for a coffee pot in the room, there is none, so expect to wait in long lines at the Starbucks in the lobby or hit downtown on foot. Finally, my late check out was not communicated to maid service. 

Regarding location, the free parking garage is convenient to the hotel but located on the wrong side of the building, the GPS got lost and so did I. Downtown Vegas doesn't bring the allure and attraction of the Strip, but the Nugget is very convenient to Fremont street's 'experience'. Several bars and clubs have opened downtown so there's bit more to do than just sit in a casino. The neighboring casino's, however, are pretty much garbage and not recommended.

The Nugget's huge pool, shark tank, restaurant are cool attractions, the property and amenities are impressive. The attached upscale steakhouse gets good reviews but I didn't hit on my brief stay. Gaming tables were fine, signage and directions around the casino and hotel are weak - meaning you really have to look for them. Minimums are lower downtown and I know the slots are cheaper and known to payoff more than the Strip.

If you're looking for that Old Vegas feel while not having to compromise on luxury at a reasonable price, the Nugget is worth checking out.

This hotel was great. Its not on the strip though. Its actually downtown. It has a old charm to it sort of reminds me of old Hollywood. The pool THE TANK is amazing. This hotel is filled with elderly people though. I'm only 25 but the older people didn't bother me at all. As a matter of fact I'd rather be around them at the end of the night then a bunch of young and loud kids. This hotel is truly like home away from home. When your all worn out from the excitement from the strip hop in a cab, pay about $20 to get back to your hotel oasis! This was my first time in Vegas. The buffet was GREAT as well! The valet service was impeccable. So helpful!!

It is the little things!!! OK I may not be little but I am short!! We stayed in a jr. suite in the Rush Tower for New Years Weekend. Beautiful suite facing Fremont St. Was a little concerned about the noise level but since the noise stayed at the same level it wasn't an issue. I loved the bed and pillows. The food at the Grotto was excellent!!!! So were the desserts!  
Here is where the short part comes in!!! The shower and the bathtub are made for much taller people!! I am 5'2" and the shower was at least 12" to high. I had bought some amazing bath salts at Daily's General Store (Container Area) and couldn't wait to have a nice deep tub relaxing soak!! Nope! Kept slipping in the tub,,, it too was about 12" to long!! The hubby took a couple of soaks cause it fit his 6' frame perfectly!! 

The other issue that I had is that there was not a decent mirror location to put my make- up on. Not only am I vertically challenged but I also can't see the big "E" without my glasses.  THere was a lighted mirror at the vanity but that didn't help because I had to have it so close that there was not even space between me and the mirror. 

We had a wonderful New Year's week-end and are thinking about doing it again this year.

Stayed here years ago....in the Carson Street tower.  Before the Rush tower existed.  We had a Rush Tower room (room 5216) this time, and I must say that the Nugget did it right with those rooms.  5216 is a suite, but it was an above average room, with the only negative being outdoor ambient noise, mostly during the day.  It was pretty quiet at night.  The bathroom in our room was tremendous, with the huge shower being the highlight!  We'll definitely stay at the GN, in the Rush tower rooms when we want to stay downtown.  Well done Golden Nugget!

It was alright kinda overated the lifeguards at the pools all had a i hate my job look to there face. The claim jumper inside sucked and took forever to order, food was descent id go again maybe but there are better places out there and cheaper.  Place just felt so   negative inside i mean come on golden nugget people be happy!.

The hotel, casino and restaurants were nice enough to have earned 5 stars if only the customer service has not been lacking.

First vacation for my wife and I in over two years, we had a couples massage booked for the morning of my birthday that Golden Nugget cancelled due to the couples massage room betting flooded (or the ceiling having caved in depending on who we talked to). We understand these thing happen, so no biggie. Asked the front desk what they could do to make things right, seeing as how this had all been planned and paid for over two months in advance and we got 3 days notice on the cancellation, we were given the extension number for the spa director (who was half-way across the country in Biloxi) and told to leave her a voice mail. When we complained on the Golden Nugget Facebook page we were given an email address for the same individual. Shameful customer service making the customer call\/email somebody who isn't on-site to help at the time. 

Just a tip for any Golden Nugget representatives who read these reviews, a customer who feels they've been wronged generally won't complain unless they feel really strongly about it. If they do go to the trouble of complaining, please listen to and address their concerns rather than giving them a phone number or email address of somebody else so they can handle it. The only time you should give a complaining customer a name, phone number and email for somebody else is if they ask for it. Otherwise, take care of their concerns and they may be a customer for life rather than go to the trouble of writing bad reviews of your hotel on Facebook, Yelp, Yahoo, etc.

***UPDATE***

I received an email reply from Ms. Taylor, the spa director. She handled my issue with the concern and empathy that I'd expect from a customer service professional and offered a resolution that my wife and I agree is more than fair and gave us reason to give Golden Nugget a second chance to make us a customer for life.

Ewww.  I feel dirty even thinking about our trip down to the Golden Nugget (and the rest of Fremont street).    It's dirty, smelly, and about as trashy as you can imagine.  Why is this place still open---and for that matter, any place downtown?

This could be real hit or miss.
Stayed once for 4 days and was happy as hell. No problems at all. The shark tank in the pool is killer. The Chart House restaurant is amazing. We also picked up the 24 Hoyt's Landry's restaurant several times and took it to the room instead of ordering room service. Being on Fremont street was cool and avoiding the hustle of the Strip was nice. We also like the 24 hour Starbucks, though is quite a hike from the Towers.

Next time we stayed, totally different experience. Same rooms but it was filthy this time right from the beginning. There was literally poo in the restroom, trash in the room, drink stains on the night stand, a used band aid, hasn't been vacuumed, etc. They gave us crap about cleaning it AND security came up to wander the hall outside while they were in there. 
Then we were  overcharged for getting a cabana at the pool, which was later compensated by the pool manager. But while we were there there was a guy with a GoPro taking footage of the girls and the water was gross. Also another guy and a woman were about to get to some action right there in the pool area - I know this because his hand was wiggling in her swimsuit. No one cared about that at all either.
I wouldn't go back. The second trip just took over the good memories of the first. No good.
Fun pool next to shark tank but when it's busy your swimming in liquid lotion. Lots of bars and casino games, they have a very good steak house as well. Rooms were not that bad average I would say.

We decided to give the GN another try and while things were far from perfect there were a lot of positive changes.

First and foremost check in.  Last year was an awful experience.  This year Jacob was so pleasant, informative and seemingly happy to be dealing with us.  He easily and without pressure sold us an upgraded room, to which we became very appreciative as time went on. An A for Jacob!

Our room was on the 23rd floor.  Nice view, which we were hoping the upgrade would give us.  The room was as spacious, well decorated and impressive as we remembered it.  It probably isn't as nice, nor as big overall as the rooms at Encore (where we went after our GN stay) but it is the same class all the way! It gets an A!

The Hotel as well as all of Downtown seem to be improving rapidly!

One of my big concerns last year was the pool and while 
I still have issues it was better.

It appears they are addressing the raiders from the other hotels downtown by checking keys.  But it still seems they are offering local families incentives or something as the families and couples were everywhere.  Now I didn't check everyone of course, lol.  But I did strike up enough conversations from which I form my opinion.  Further, the big, unsmiling and intimidating bouncer checking the room keys ALWAYS checked my key but I noticed two groups of folks about his age go through  ahead of me with very 'familiar' conversation taking place.  Hmmm.  Also, there is an unguarded door by one of the restaurants that was used quite extensively by folks.

The pool is still very dirty by the end of the day but is clean by the next morning.  All of than sun tan lotion and in and out to the slide is hopefully the culprit.

Lastly the adult pool seemed like a bad joke.  They charge 16.00 a chair, needing reservations.  Fair enough.  But the place looked MORE crowded than the regular pool, lol!  The only difference was the lack of kids.  Seems like a better idea to make it more exclusive even if that means charging more.

In closing, the staff still has it's share of grumpy Gus's - the attendant at the spa who didn't even care a little about discussing massage options for my wife with me and he even argued with me aggressively about some meaningless point (???) -but there were more than a few really pleasant staff members (like Jacob) and that attitude goes a long way.  I hope the Nugget continue the trend.

5 Stars because this is the best damn hotel off the strip. 
We stayed here when i turned 21 and it was the best place for guys to get drunk, bar hop, gamble, and walk aimlessly on a street. 
The light show on the canopy was awesome and we never had to worry about getting hit by cars.
Though this is way off the strip, it has a different feel than all the MEGA RESORTS. The hotels here are smaller and have more charm. 
The service here is a lot better. One night we ordered room service and the waiter was so nice and stayed with us to answer our 21 questions!
If your jaded by the strip stay at this hotel- oh yea and they have a new pool that lets everyone see you swimming and lounging with an aquarium all around it. BUT PLEASE! BE HOT if you are going to use this pool. GOD...I only have 1 pair of eyes.
Stayed and played. Rooms soooper clean. Front desk staff very helpful.  Pit bosses were also pleasant.  Buffet was great as usual.

The rooms are great. We stayed in the Carson tower and for $200(tax included) for 3 nights we could not have asked for more. The hotel is fabulous and the pool is amazing. It gets pretty crowded during the day but is a blast. We went down the slide and that is really cool too. 

The restaurants are pretty pricey and table games can get expected later into the day\/night but all of the casinos downtown(at least the ones in the general vicinity of the Nugget) seem to be that way these days. 

We took craps lessons and really enjoyed that too. The tables are fun(when they aren't too pricey) and the ambiance is good. 

Overall, my group is excited for our next trip to Vegas and we can't wait to stay at the Nugget again!

I was SO surprised by how updated and beautiful our room was! That is not what I was expecting at all! 

Perfect access to Fremont street! Really good restaurant inside and a Starbucks! Easy check in! I just took down a star because the pool (which is one of the coolest in Vegas!) was entirely kids! I didn't realize so many families went to Vegas in the summer! Oh and there was no fridge, you had to pay 30$. We just filled one of our pretty sinks with ice and kept some drinks in that just fine! 

I would SO stay here again!

Hotel is clean and tidy. It is really cheap too, well worth the price.

I love the swimming pool and jacuzzi. The pool has a fish tank filled with sharks and other fish. The sliding tube can take you right through the fishes, really cool!

With buffet coupon, buy one and get the 2nd one for free, makes it a steal for the food with good selections.

Down side of it is its location, if you take the Deuce free bus to go to the strip, it could take 1 hour. Really a pain.

The location is perfect for those who like Downtown. We have stayed here many many times. Almost too many to count. We've stayed in all 3 towers over the years. We prefer the Gold Tower. We've stayed in regular rooms and we've stayed in suites. The first suite we ever stayed in was awesome so we opted for a suite the next time. It was quite different, not nearly as nice and quite disappointing. We gamble here quite often, we have players cards etc. Not once were we ever offered a "perk".  We recently signed up for the players card at the Fremont and we have already been offered free rooms. We've stayed at several places downtown. We have never stayed at the Fremont but we are going to give it a shot. We just don't feel appreciated by The Golden Nugget.

Not bad at all!  We all know that there are a ton of hotel\/casinos to choose from in Vegas, on and off the Strip.  In general, the more you pay, the better the quality.  If you're looking for a comparatively inexpensive but decent hotel and casino in Vegas, look no further than the Golden Nugget.  The rooms are certainly a little worn, but quite well maintained.

The floor has quite a lot of space, and a good number of slots, tables, and places to sink your $$$ in style.  I had pretty good luck with the 25 cent machines this time. The buffets here aren't cheap, but the food selection, especially for the Sunday Brunch, was impressive.  They also have a pool with a multi-story water slide, a vending machine that dispenses gold, and no matter where you are in the hotel, you're never far from a drink.

Minuses?  It's smoky, although that's de rigueur in all the casinos around.  Now really though guys, THREE DOLLARS for a bottle of Dasani water out of the vending machine?  Stupid!  You can get a deck of used playing cards for a dollar, but a 20 oz bottle for water for three?  Sheesh.

I could go around quibbling about a dozen things, but what I really need to be focusing on in this review is how GOOD the Golden Nugget really is--and there's a lot if awesome here.  Looking for a spot in Vegas that won't break the bank (unless you let it)?  Want to bring the kids too?  Try the Golden Nugget.

I am going to let you in on a little secret:  You need not go to the strip to get the very most out of your Vegas vacation.  That is just a myth.  [Vegas vacations are too short to spend three hours of them walking up and down the strip and convincing yourself that that is entertainment.  Ugh!]

Instead, what you need to do is to come over to the Golden Nugget on Fremont Street.  You'll be glad you did.  

The pros:

The pool ~ really liked it.  The Hideout ~ quit grumbling when the host tells you that there is a cost to this place.  It is worth it!  Very casual, exclusive, much quieter than the pool, with excellent poolside service.  Note to GN:  promote that cute and friendly waitress Cindy!  The slide ~ free, fast and fun.  The shark tank ~ very cool.  The loose slots ~ I had to do a few victory laps around them.  Note to GN casino manager:  Please never ever ever take away those older penny slot Progressive Blazing Sevens with the symbols that take over the machine if you get three or more with the max bet of $1.25  Those are my FAVORITE SLOTS.   Plus, the cocktail waitress came around with plenty of free drinks.  The spa ~ expensive, but let me tell you, Sally can do your hair in style! The hotel room was fine, clean and pretty much what we requested.  

The cons:  The entrances aren't electric so you have to touch the germy door handle to enter.  I forgave them because, well, I mean, you know, I slowed down and made Ed open the door for me, plus I figured less rennovations = kinder slots.  And it did ~ woot!  There was no ramp to get into the lobby from the outside at our entrance.  This would make it difficult for somebody in a scooter or wheelchair.  Once in the lobby, there was a ramp into the hotel \/ casino area.  The carpet is very loud everywhere.  After a few hours, or shall I say a few too many from the aforementioned friendly cocktail servers, this pallet of never ending color can become problematic.   The spa ~ we thought Ed was going to get a female masseuse but they pulled the bait and switch on us, and he got a male masseur instead.  Ewwww.  

I'm sure we'll stay at the strip again sometime, but if we do, I doubt that we'll have as much fun as we had this time staying at the Golden Nugget.  I can't wait to go back.  

Just need to save a little bit more dinero ...

The cheaper black jack tables here have the worst, rudest and most inexperienced dealers ever. Ours was so slow and the fact that $5 min table require an additional $1 for pair square is dumb. She was rude and snobby. The bartenders there said our credit card wasn't going through and kept swiping it. When we got our cc bill there were 3 charges on there for the same amount. They were no help in fixing it. Not going back.

Honestly, I have to say I'm a fan of the GN. I have had to stay here twice now for a competition and have been very happy with both stays. You would be completely entertained for several days without needing a car to go to the strip.

Pros:
- large rooms, ice machines, big bathrooms and closet
- elevators are quick and convenient, not crowded
- tons of food options, the buffet is very reasonably priced
- the ballroom for events is convenient and large
- parking for guests is free
- walkability along Fremont St. is great and entertaining

Cons:
- no easy, cheap way to get off of Fremont St.
- the pool was slammed in the summer; wall-to-wall people
- no free coffee (machine) in the room

We stayed here recently and when we got to our room we saw feces on the toilet and throw up on the floor.  They did upgrade us to the gold tower but didn't get much sincerity after that.  Tried contacting their customer service department several times and they have yet to email me back. The one redeeming factor was the pool ...loved the slide and the fish tank. The room was cheap so I probably shouldn't be picky but at least I wanted a clean room to go to. I have pictures but don't worry I won't gross you out and post them

A very gracious lady Martha Sanchez called my wife tonight and apologized for the error. She offered to buy us breakfast in the morning and wanted to make sure we were happy. We appreciate her attention to this matter and felt she did give us excellent customer service. We have stayed her numerous times and will come back.

Oh how I love the Golden Nugget! We stayed here a few years ago and fell in love. My husband and I do not really like the strip to much anyway and truly like the ambiance that downtown has to offer in general.

Explosive vomit and diarrhea!

Really wanted to like this hotel as it is a favorite of my parents.  Not sure how it got a 4 diamond review with worn carpet, tired room decorations (and we were in one of the 'upgraded' pool view rooms) - and one of the best - pay $10 for the pod coffee in your room.....Skip the $25 VIP check in too.  On the phone, we were told it included not waiting in line to check in or the buffet and access to the spa for basic things like the sauna - but upon arrival, that was not the case.  Front desk and check in people both on the phone and in person seem to be a bit flippant - not at all the customer service you usually receive at a '4 diamond' location.

We had been together as a group of 8 people eating at all sorts of restaurants on the strip - then down to 4, having stayed downtown at Bally's and then our last 3 nights at Golden Nugget.  We all ate together at the buffet - nothing fancy but great service and great selection of food based on the price - also had a really great meal at the Italian restaurant inside of the Golden Nugget.  On Tuesday night, my girlfriend and I ate at Lilly's the Asian restaurant and had fantastic service and great food.  On Wednesday night, when we returned and got our vegetable rolls and Pad Thai to go, it was also great at 10:30 pm, but at 2:30am, that's when the trouble started.  My girlfriend was hit first with vomiting and diarrhea then it hit me 30 minutes later.  Lots of fun with only 1 bathroom.  I thought we were going to die - and this went on for hours.  When I could finally pick up the phone and report this to the front desk, I let them know what was happening, because we certainly wouldn't want anyone else to go through this.  I asked if someone could send up ice, water and 7 up which I thought might help with the constant and non-stop vomiting and diarrhea.  They acted like we were drunk or hung over (I think we each had a beer that day) which I'm sure they get a lot - but explosive vomit and diarrhea.  About 40 minutes later, room service showed up with a $38 charge for 3 small bottles of water and 7up in a carafe watered down with ice.  I signed the slip in desperation for some relief and thought we would deal with it later.  

Front desk had told us we would need to do an incident report, but the thought of looking or talking to anyone was too much until  finally by Thursday night, we thought we could keep it together long enough to have security up in the room to do the report.  He apologized profusely and was wonderful, and when we told him about the room service charge, he said that was definitely something that should not have happened.  He said he would turn in the report and because it was the weekend, we probably wouldn't hear from anyone until Monday.

Monday, Tuesday - finally on Wednesday we called and here is the response we received from Richard Smith, claiming to be the manger of risk management of all Golden Nuggets.

By the way, we were only asking to have the room charge reversed.  As a courtesy, they should also have reversed at least one of the room nights.  Nothing doing  - without proof - just our word against his.  We calmly mentioned we owned a restaurant and knew the importance of safe food handling and that given the rapid onset of these symptoms and that NO ONE ELSE in our group had these symptoms, it was from something that was contaminated, cross contaminated and \/ or someone didn't wash their hands.  Without a doctor's report, nothing he could do.  I mentioned we were basically trapped in our room and couldn't leave, we missed two shows we had paid for on Thursday  night, and reversing room service charge seemed like a reasonable request as did reversing one room night.  Nope.  Not without a fecal sample.  So while I am finally feeling back to usual as of yesterday - nearly 7 complete days later - my girlfriend is still not feeling well.  I asked if I could speak with someone else as I really could not believe this was his stance and he said no - he was it.   He actually said that we should have gotten the water, ice and 7up ourselves, which I replied we had thought was a really bad idea since we couldn't stop the bodily fluids from coming out both ends and thought that would be bad going up and down the hallways.   I calmly told him I would definitely be escalating this and writing on line reviews warning others about this horrific customer service and I was told to be careful, they take liable very seriously.......

Nice pool, the best part of this hotel.  Check in was a joke.  Upon checking in we were asked what kind of room we wanted.  There were downtown views and strip views available.  After pondering on this a bit, we chose the downtown view, eighth floor, great.  We arrive in our room, look out the window, and see THE PARKING GARAGE.  Call the front desk, and we are told "oh those are the more expensive rooms.  Okay so why were we offered a room with a view????  Not too happy.

We have been going to this hotel for 10 years now and LOVE it!  We have stayed at the fancy strip hotels from time-to-time and we always return to the Nugget.

You don't have to walk a mile to find a restroom, or the elevators and everything is so affordable so you can spend your money on something else.

We recently stayed at the new Rush Tower and it was FAB!  The rooms are so beautiful and bathroom is complete with a soaking tub built for two.  The pool is amazing and so is the Pool Manager Cally, get a cabana, you'll love it!

We highly recommend this hotel and the whole Freemont Experience!

This is Vegas's hidden gem for sure. We've always been weary about staying off the strip but decided to give it a whirl mainly because my fiancé wanted to do the water slide through the shark tank. We had a room in the Carson tower and our room was SUPER nice!!! We had a king bed and there was so much extra space in the room we could have had a couch and another bed. Dead quiet as well. I always worry in Vegas about the noise levels in hotels because we all know it's the city that never sleeps. I never heard anything all night and I'm typically a very light sleeper. Super plush towels which was a bonus for once. And the bed was so comfortable. I didn't want to get up in the morning. Lots of amenities. You'd get lost in this hotel if you didn't have a map. Will definitely stay here again.

Room has a kinda old look and feel. $12 for 4 K Cups?  Really?   

Probably the nicest hotel downtown, but that's like saying you are the tallest midget. (pardon my non-pc terminology).

I was going to the life is beautiful festival in downtown Las Vegas and needed a place to stay after a night of drinking. I thought that the Golden Nugget is the nicest hotel downtown based on the gorgeous pool area and what I could see walking around the casino. unfortunately my room in the Carson tower was disgusting, ugly and old. The whole room looks like it was built in the 1950s and never remodeled or updated since. The carpet alone was filled with a thousand stains. it's the grossest room I've ever stayed at. motel 6 is a few steps above this room. I give the room a 1 or zero stars but the rest of the hotel is still the nicest downtown. I assume that the other tower called the gold tower is remodeled. if you stay here, ask for the gold tower.
be sure to check out the cool shark tank at the pool.

Smack dab in the middle of downtown with direct access to fremont street.  I came here on a work visit one time.  Stayed in the Rush tower and was pretty impressed.  Room was very nice, modern, and updated.  The pool was awesome with a Shark Tank and a water slide that goes through the shark tank.  Fremont street is awesome with the ziplining, awesome lit up ceiling, street performers, and a number of live band stages.  The clientele is less 'douchy' and its generally cheaper than the strip.  

So with that great experience, I bring the family.  This time we stay in the Carson tower.  NIGHT AND DAY difference than the Rush tower.  Old and outdated.  Popcorn ceiling.  Wood framing around the curtains.  Dingy carpet.  Just very dated.  Much different feel.  Everything else was the same though.  Kids LOVED the pool as expected.  Basically, don't spend too much time in the carson tower and everything is good!  Either that or lower your room standards to, say, 1985.

The crown jewel of downtown Las Vegas, this is my favorite property in this area.  Here's why:

- They remodeled the property a few years ago and upgraded their swimming pool area.   There's a water slide and multi level area to the pool....very cool to hang out during the Summer months.

- The dining options are some of the best in the downtown area.

- The casino is the cleanest, most well kept casino in downtown.  It's almost as nice as some of the Strip properties.

- It's classy.  Despite being in downtown, the Golden Nugget has remained a classy joint.

Will I return?  I meet friends and colleagues here for lunch on occasion, so I'm here 4 to 5 times a year....so you can count on it.

They damaged my car in valet (nothing major, but obvious).  They had a security camera that they said shows that the damage was already there.  I knew it wasn't so I asked them to show me the video.  They refused to show me (said I'd need to trust them).  I didn't make a big stink because it wasn't that big of a deal, but I will never go back to a place that says they have proof they didn't do it, but refuse to show that proof.

I was 86ed here (kicked out) last year because I had to call the police on a guy who was harassing me. I stayed in the rush tower at an upgraded room where there was only cheap products and gross towels. No room service came to clean or anything. Hotel smells bad. The pool is cool if you like swimming with 1000 kids who want to see the sharks. Been in Vegas 7 years now and this is the only hotel and casino I've ever had a problem with.

Nice older hotel in the heart of downtown. Signs on the outside doors by the self parking area would have been helpful to avoid much excessive walking (I'm disabled) to the wrong towers. Staff from front desk, valet, bellhop, etc., all very helpful. Buffet surprisingly good.

I'll give this a 4 and I didn't even stay there.  Old school fancy cool.  Cool fish tank with slide that goes through it.  Fremont street is hopping at night with live music and a light show every hour.  I
Think this might have been one of my better stops because all hotel and casinos seem the same after while.  Not this one!
I love it here ! I stayed for a week, rooms are big and  clean, plenty restaurants to choose from if you're hungry. There's also the night club to check out also.

The hotel was a lovely venue for a conference. Loved the water slide, the many restaurants, the whole downtown atmosphere. Didn't like that my room on a nonsmoking floor was permeated with smoke smell in my bedding and towels. Tip: put a towel against the door crack, turn on the A\/C, and the bathroom fan, then use the spare pillow from the closet that isn't stinky. Then put it back during the day. My room was gorgeous in the Gold Tower, desk staff was friendly and efficient. I had a very nice stay.

I love downtown Vegas, and this is the perfect hotel. Very friendly staff. Clean modern rooms. Great food selections. Gratto is my favorite. The best people watching and the best gambling in Vegas. Tip the front desk to be upgraded to a suite.

So we went to old Vegas to see Fremont street. We ended up at the Golden Nugget which was to my surprise was just as nice as many of the casinos in the strip. Playing was cheap and fun. Older crowd with was refreshing as well.

It was my first time staying downtown and let me tell you was Im impressed. The golden nugget is the best hotel to stay in downtow, it was clean room was updated and tastefully decorated I was expecting less but was surprised...overall had a great experience and would stay again

A stay at Golden Nugget is always a pleasure and first class experience. Although it is located in the downtown area, this hotel is a gem. Excellent service, wonderfully staffed hotel with an awesome pool that is heated to my liking (82 - 87 degrees depending). The front desk upgraded us and all employees I have come in contact with have been welcoming, positive and love customer service. This is one well-managed establishment. Thank you Golden Nugget and we will be back soon!

Once in  a while I'll stay here as well when I'm in Downtown LV. This one is the high class of all the hotels in Downtown LV. Very dress to impress type casino kinda like a strip casino hotel. Lots to see here they recently expanded the place so now there's a sushi place and additional Starbucks so now there are two Starbucks in this Casino\/Hotel. If you want the more higher class feel in Downtown LV this is the place to go.

Most of the locals I know talk about how the Golden Nugget is one of the best hotels in Downtown. I have to agree, mainly because I've never felt any sketchy vibes radiating from this place. That or it was the bright lighting or the large fish tank by the check-in desk at the Rush Tower. I don't know, but I didn't have my, "I feel like I'm going to get kidnapped and sold into a circus" feeling.

ROOM
Checked into the Rush Tower King and was pleased with the contemporary decor in both bathroom and bedroom areas. I think what excited me the most was the fact that my room actually had a couch, which I didn't even sit on. There's a DVD player and flat panel television with hardly any channels worth watching. Interesting to note how each time I turned on my television, the first thing I saw were advertisements for ordering the naughty channels. Nice try, Golden Nugget, but I don't think so. Maybe on someone else's credit card.  It was a challenge trying to find the electrical outlets because they're hidden throughout the room and just difficult to get to if you have short arms. There is a row that's hidden in the writing desk that I was lucky to find. As for the view, well, I kept my curtains shut for the most part. My room, which was located on the 25th floor, overlooked the eastern part of the Vegas valley and the beautiful dirt-stained rooftops of several surrounding buildings.

The bed was nice and comfy and free of any questionable stains, which is always a plus. Bathtub's slippery, but fortunately the bathroom is equipped with one of those rubber mats with the suction cups that you can place on the floor of the tub. 

One of my biggest complaints about this room is its lighting fixtures. Whoever was the interior decorator tried too hard in attempting to create a "sexy" ambiance by omitting as much lighting as possible, that or GN needs to change the light bulbs. 

ROOM SERVICE
For the first and perhaps the last time in my life, I ordered room service since I was in a rush trying to get ready for a party. I ordered the All-American BLT with a side of fries. If you order room service, you will be charged a $5 service fee with state tax. This doesn't include gratuity, so heads up on that. The sandwich was OK, and it could've been easily shared with another person. But truthfully, I think that the cafe inside of Fry's Electronics makes a better version.

POOL
Didn't go swimming due to qualms I have about swimming in community pools, and also the possibility of getting hit by lightning on the evening I visited. If anything, check out The Tank -- a large aquarium with several sharks and schools of fish. Be sure to visit during the evening hours, because just like everything in Vegas: it looks better at night. 

OTHER
Unfortunately, I didn't  witness the Homeless Drug Addict Soul Train Dance Contest that Jaime W. was fortunate enough to have seen, but I did briefly observe other characters like Ass-Less Chaps Cowboy -- he was wearing red manties or just had a really bad sunburn --  pose for photos with Asian tourists.

I wanted to check out The Grotto, but I wasn't able to during my visit. Instead, I did hit up Carson Street Cafe which was just meh (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/carson-street-cafe-las-vegas#hrid:O2AUGCo8T2YTO1GGJqneKg).

OVERALL
Checking into a room at GN, especially at the Rush Tower, is worth the price in comparison to hotels on The Strip and in Downtown. It's one of the better ones to stay in, and it's easily accessible to Fremont Street and other tourist attractions. Just be sure to bring a couple of flashlights.

So my sisters getting married so we are all supposed to stay at this place. I didnt expect anything crazy amazing but I did expect to get a non-smoking queen-sized bed room, as I asked for. Well, I called a week before arrival to double check the reservation and the woman told me thats what I have reserved. Great, right. So I just got here and I am in a 2 double bed, smoking room. She said its the only room they have available. I made the reservation months ago and was told I was to be in the room. At this point it was 1AM and I couldnt just find another hotel. Anyway, oh well, the woman at the counter was kind.
 So then I was venting to my mom that I was a little bummed about the smoking room situation. And she told me she waited in line to check in for over an hour, they too were put in a different room, there was no hair dryer, mold in the shower. 3 out of 4 elevators are broken. Also, side note, as we reserved more than 30 rooms for the wedding guests, we expected to be kind of close but we are all scattered. Its just the small things adding up and we have only been here 10 hours. Staff have been friendly, except for one rude woman at the desk.

It was my first time staying downtown, and I was very happy with the place. If you are going to stay downtown , this is the only place to stay out. It seemed so much cleaner and classy then the other Fremont street casinos. The food at claim jumpers was good, and the dealers are all very nice. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfy.

My husband and I stayed at the rush tower suite and had a perfect time together. The bathroom was beautiful with a standing shower and huge tub. The beds were super comfy. The staff were very friendly and the casino was tons of fun. They also have a shark tank which was neat. Can't wait to plan my trip back.

I had my doubts about the Golden Nugget (GN) particularly after some of their cafes were caught with bug infestations. However, Yelpers steered me toward making reservations for GN's new Gold Rush rooms and I was not at all disappointed! 

From the moment we stepped foot onto the 24th floor (using keycards only given to those staying in Gold Rush rooms), I felt at home. In the elevator foyer, there are snacks waiting for you -- peanut m&ms, nuts, raisins, apples, and bottled water, a luxury in the desert. In the AM, there are fruit, nuts and plenty of bottled water. 

The rooms were simply put, amazing. You could tell that a lot of thought went into the design. The bathrooms featured double sinks, a shower with a double shower head and partially opened designed, separate toilet room, and gorgeous sliding doors. There were complimentary robes in the closet as well as the standard complimentary items -- iron, board, toiletries (found in the bathroom). Also, complimentary wi-fi that worked well. 

Our room featured a king size bed that was a dream to sleep on. The sheets were crisp and white and nicely tucked. The room came with a view of the strip that was stunning at night -- it really felt like we were on top of the Vegas world!

Spa access is included with the Gold Rush rooms. The spa area is older but clean for the most part and attended by courteous staff. 

Didn't get to gamble but did try a couple of the restaurants. Highly recommend getting lunch (it's cheaper!) at Chart House, which features a larger than life fish tank. If you're lucky, you'll get to see the divers cleaning out the tank. 

The buffet is a MUST. Go for breakast, brunch, lunch, dinner whatever. An absolute steal for the delicious food they serve. 

All in all, I felt at home here and consider it the absolute best place to stay for the price in Vegas.

We had a few hours to kill on Saturday night so headed over to the Sportsbook at the Golden Nugget to watch basketball. I expected something decent - the casino itself is quite nice for being an older property downtown. This was the most crowded uncomfortable sportsbook! The rows of seats are two deep and start just a few feet from the wall so your neck is cranked so badly looking up to see the screens - it's like the front row at the movie theater. The seat backs are so low you can't rest your head on them to lean back either. Every time someone needed to get by you they were tripping over your feet.

And the center section the walls are so high on the booths that is was hard to see over them and those chairs were not very comfy either. There were restaurant style booths in the back of the room near the bar - maybe they were ok, but they were filled up so I could say. The screens were all small too!

No waitress ever came over to ask if we wanted drinks. Had an obnoxious group behind us who kept literally yelling out "grab her by the pussy" and "F....You". In some places they would have been asked to leave - but not here. Miserable experience.

https:\/\/www.tripadvisor.com\/ShowUserReviews-g45963-d91826-r457648566-Golden_Gate_Hotel_Casino-Las_Vegas_Nevada.html#

The least that you expect from a hotel room it's that they don't change the bed.
I pay a package all include flight and hotel room and it wasn't ship but the download it's finding a dirty bed.
Common an paying you for a service it's not like it's for free.
They say it will take 5 min from the service room and I'm waiting and sleeping because somebody decided no to do their job....,
Not that I'm planing to change my review for better but for worse if I could give them minus 5 stars I would.
Today they miss the cleaning room which it's fine everyone makes a bubu once in a while but to call them and the receptionist Nicky assured me they would come and fixed right away and not happening and have to call them once again at 1:30am it's ridiculous.
Shame on you Golden Nuggets and make sure every time somebody ask me about your service it's going to be a bad review.
And if you know statistics each happy customer would tell nobody about a good service but an angry one would tell everybody they know.

Since the BF had never been to Vegas and declared the strip "not like what I've seen in the movies" I took him to Freemont street to roam the old Vegas.  We stopped into Golden Nugget to get out of the heat and into some delicious drinks.

This place seems to have undergone a makeover a bit since the last time I was here.  The dealers weren't wearing cowboy hats and western shirts anymore (perhaps that was somewhere else though..my memory of Vegas visit is hazy at best).  The place was nice yet not overwhelmingly posh like some of the other casinos.

We ended up in the bar Rush which turned out to be super fun with a live band, guest singers like the Elvis guy, and drunk tourists dancing.  It was a good unexpected time and I wished I could have stayed longer instead of going to bed early for a work conference.  Why companies think having conferences in Vegas is a good idea I will never know...no one is awake during the meeting, everyone is bleary eyed hungover and falling asleep while sitting up.  I digress.

Definitely a legendary place on Freemont.  You must visit the Golden Nugget casino at least once on a trip to Vegas.

Needed an economical place in Las Vegas for a couple of nights.  The Golden Nugget stood up and filled this need in a very good way.  Think about it . . . $47\/night  (Priceline). . . a clean room and hotel, an amazing comfortable bed, good, I mean really good restaurants . . . read those reviews and a friendly and attentive staff  . . . and I tell you this . . . even if it is not on the Strip, well, Fremont street is just outside and this hotel has value.  I will be trying out some other hotels but I know that I am returning here after I try some other place and have hard experience to return me to the truth . . . this place delivers on value.  If I want the Strip . . . well it is just down the street.  Call me simple but sometimes I just want simple.  Enough said.

My family and I went to LV this year for Spring Break.  We spent two nights at the Golden Nugget Rush Tower.  This place is fantastic.  When you enter the check-in area you can readily see how nice the place is maintained; the cleanliness and decor are on point.  They have a big fish tank that sets a good mood too! The hotel room is amazing.  The architecture of the room is beautiful.  You honestly feel like you're at home.  Room service was great.  Our order arrived very promptly, the hotel employee was friendly and the food was both great in taste and in price.  Oh, may I add the hotel room itself has very good pricing.  The Rush Tower offers great space in its rooms.  The bathroom is huge and so is the sleeping area where it has a lounge area within it.  Short and sweet: Save money without compromising luxury and get a great experience.

Really wasn't impressed. I was there for business and stayed in the Carson Tower. The tub would randomly back up and leave a black ring around the drain. It also drained very slowly. The walls are so thin that you can hear the TV in the other rooms. The carpet was gross. It has tons of stains and it looked like whenever there was a problem in the carpet they would cut out a square and glue in a new piece. 
No refrigerator in room you can rent one for $10 a day. You have to pay for wifi (I guess now there is a $20 a day resort fee to get the privilege of wifi on two devices and the use of the gym)
Called housekeeping and requested a robe because when my room was cleaned they didn't put a new one in. I was questioned and asked if I had taken it! Really.  When they came in it was basically thrown at me. 
My class was going to finish early so when I called to check out before the end of my set registration I was told there would be a $50 fee. I called two days before my expected check-out date. 
I accidentally left something in the room. I called to get it sent back and agreed to pay for the price of shipping. I was charged $30 for them to put it in a USPS flat rate box. 
Be prepared to pay a $5 downtown fee and now a $20 resort fee on top of room tax and sales tax. 
Parking was free and the pool is beautiful. The dining was great. I just wasn't impressed by the customer service of the housekeeping staff and the "extras" that they charge you.

The hotel was recently remodeled and looks great inside. The reason for the three stars is because the hotel it's self looked awesome with the pool\/shark tank\/water slide thing going on but the rooms slaked a bit. The rooms are not bad at all just not equally aesthetic as I had expected from the main floor and lobby. I would enjoy returning in the summer months to enjoy the built in floating\/waiting lounge chairs.

Time for an update to this old review.

My job sometimes requires me to travel to Vegas, and the Nugget is the closest hotel to our facility, so that's where I usually stay.  Our CFO likes the prices, too.

First of all, I must say that "The Tank" (aka the shark pool and slide) are pretty cool, and despite the problems they had during the first week, there's no signs of water leaking out anymore.

The water slide is pretty darn awesome.  I was amazed at how fast you get going, with acceleration happening both forward and laterally.

One of my old complaints, that the lobby and everywhere was smoky, seems to have been addressed.  They either upgraded the ventilation system, or then the recent laws on smoking in public places have had some effect.  Either way, it's not as stinky or smelly as it used to be, but it's clearly not the Wynn either.

The Starbucks are (they have two now) overpriced - I've never paid $2.50 for a tall coffee in Manhattan, so what's their excuse?  The buffet was decent, but nothing to write home about.  Their other eateries are pretty average as well.

If you're coming to Vegas and want to stay in downtown Las Vegas for a night or two, or want a 4 star (though I would argue it's more like 3) hotel for under $100\/night, give the Nugget a try.  It's clearly the best hotel in the downtown area, but far below the best that the Strip has to offer.

Stayed in their Rush Tower for the first time. It's like our cruising experience in that once we were upgraded to a balcony cabin, we could never settle for less. Yes, you will hear bands, etc. but fortunately we are night owls and believe one would hear street noise anywhere downtown. Suite was very clean and nicely appointed. Use caution climbing into the extra deep\/high side soaking tub\/shower combo after a night of partying.

Vegas local here. 4 hours prior to check in I called to request an early check in. I was told that check in would be available at 1:00. It is 2:50 and I am standing waiting for my room to be ready and was just told it would be another 40 minutes. We booked a suite for my sisters bday weekend in the amount of $800. This is just not the way you handle business. First time staying here and we will not be staying here again.

Our group stayed here for our anniversary which is Halloween. The check in was swift and easy. Our room was in the Carson tower. The room was clean and nice it was room 18112. The bed was really comfortable, it was hard to leave it. Room service was fast and easy. The only thing, is the Go Green, you need to call, don't text for your $15. The hotel experience was great, no negative experience. Fremont on Halloween was crazy crowded and unbelievably fun to people watch. 
I would stay here again.

First time here. have stayed at 5 or 6 Vegas hotels, and this is our favourite. It's position, nice décor, and that fact that it aint too big. Love it here. got a great last minute deal on a lovely 4 star room. Downers wifi $12.99 for 24 hrs. In this day and age you really can't justify that cost. Walk 2 blocks to the Bank of America building and get wi fi for free while sitting in Starbucks!!!!! Laundry was expensive but very good quality. The best bit (don't tell anyone) the Rush Lounge Bar...it's awesome.

I remember when The Nug was a classy joint out of my price range.  Alas, the hotel along with Fremont Street itself, has deteriorated to where I can't stand it.  I got a great price for a midweek stay... But I didn't know and they didn't tell me that if you want to use the pool it's another $20 a day.  Want coffee in your room? $10 more.  On the street, it is impossible to avoid the noise, the pounding thump of 'music', the panhandlers, the trash drummers (pounding on 5-gallon plastic buckets), and worst of all the vendors hustling skin treatments who will not take NO for an answer. I have always preferred Fremont to the Strip.... From now on I'm going to Laughlin.

this hotel is supposed to be a 4 star hotel, in that respect it's terrible. Places on the strip such as MGM Grand, MGM Signature, Paris, NYNY are waaaaaaay better. compare to normal 4 star such as the westin chain, grand HYATT, Fairmont, this place still sux. nothing exciting happens on Fremont St.

here are the run downs:
* valet is super slow and it was 100 degree out there.
* the fish tank pool sounds cool, but the lady at the gate was mean about the fact I didn't have a key because my roomate took my key and went in there early. when hanging at the pool, there were so many kids kept splashing water at us. when we moved, they followed us.
* the room is small, small bath room, small bed (smaller than a full in the double room, not sure what size are those). 
* no frig. 
* lighting in the room was dim, which made it hard for a group of us girls to get ready.
* the TV remote didn't work half of the time, I couldn't check out using that stupid TV remote. 
* if you call front desk, expect a long wait.
* food is like Danny's at the general cafe, there are restaurants that look nicer, but we rather go eat elsewhere.
* our sink was plugged up and they never came to fix it. when we complained to the front desk, they offered us another room, but didn't offer to help us move or anything.  
* the general ambiance of the place just reminds me of Reno, nothing Vegas about it.
* the crowd here isn't older, the crowd here is mid-aged to re-tired ppl. 

so my advice is, the place is clean and what not. but don't expect it to be nice, the double tree is nicer. maybe it's nicer than a best western. you really do get what you pay for, so don't be fooled by the nice reviews. I will not stay here again, not even when I'm old.

It was just ok we waited 23 mins just for elevator from floor 15- could only imagine the other floors, Seem to shut down players card section early not a lot of perks for non-new members. Room was ok t.v remote didn't work not a big deal the pay for your coffee 10.00 yikes and bottle water 7.00 in your room really. First and last time there too many others with more perks and less waiting.

I had never stayed downtown before, but have been to Vegas many times being from Los Angeles. 

The location is great if you want some party. I know people love the big flashystrip, but the party on Freemont street is really amazing. A complete scene. If you don't like to drink I don't know if you'd feel the same way, but I thought it was a blast.

I loved this hotel.  Each time we do go to Vegas, we stay on Fremont ( for the breakfast buffet at Golden Nugget ).  We have stayed at the Plaza, Horseshoe, Four Queens, and now Golden Nugget.  I am a picky person, so trust me when I say that this was a very nice stay. 
We were in South Tower, room 1159, and it was very clean and the bathrooms were nice for the size room we had.  Plasma TV if I remember correctly.  (*hiccup*)  Nice linens and pillows.   The room looked "new".  It was also nonsmoking.. Best hotel on Fremont in my opinion.  Staff was very helpful and check in ( no problem checking in early ) and check out was easy.  
The only thing that happened was upon checkout, we had an 80.00 charge to our room from the "Tank" bar. ( The pool \/ aquarium area)
I brought it to the attention of staff, and they immidiately removed the charge.. no questions asked.  I got the impression from the desk clerk that this wasnt the first time this has happened and when I asked her if it happens alot, her reply was " Uh. Im so over them.. if you didnt make this charge, you wont pay for it.  "  Sure enough, I wasnt charged for it .
Right outside of the doors exiting onto Fremont is a bandstand where there are always some great band playing ...its just a fun environment to chill in.

Golden Nugget is the largest Casino\/Hotel complex in downtown Las Vegas. It's also a more upscale property. For this year NAB I had a good deal to stay here through Orbitz so I decided to try it. It turned out to be a bit more an adventure than I was expecting. Arriving late Saturday\/early Sunday a the airport, it was about 2 am when I came to check-in. The attendant did look up my reservation and seemed a bit embarrassed. She asked me to wait a bit and disappeared in an office for about 10 minutes. She then came back apologizing saying that they were overbooked and had no room available despite my confirmed and prepaid reservation. They proposed me to send me (at their expenses) to the Bellagio (a much more upscale hotel on the strip) for the night, pay me back my night and upgrade me for the remaining nights. The arrangement was good, I think they did well in face of a bad situation. Off course it was annoying to have to go to another hotel that late and then to move hotel again the next day but it was appreciated that they did put me in such a nice hotel for that night.

The room that I got for the remaining days is in the "Golden Tower" and is actually quite nice with full amenities. It's comfortable and allows for a good night sleep. The room decor seems a bit dated, not sure if it's on purpose and targets a different audience. The only thing that annoyed me a bit was the heating\/cooling unit which is the autonomous kind without a real temperature control.

A very good value overall and the best downtown experience I had for sure.
I had a Penthouse Presidential Suite! I will never forget this trip. It was THE best stay i have ever had with luxurious accomadations. Thank you Golden Nugget, i will be back!

Decided to spend the 350 for 1 night stay. Thought hmm golden nugget should be very nice
Have a long flight and a meeting that day.  Woke up to no hot water  front desk said 30.00 refund is all i can do.   Told me i know ur upset but so r alot of other people are too.  She told me to go to spa to shower. Very rude. Only nice people in hotel work at claim jumper.    Never again

This is the diamond in the rough of Downtown Las Vegas. A true gem! Value is off the charts! We stayed in the two-bedroom penthouse, aka Chairman's Chamber, and was a sprawling suite with Sinatra old Vegas feel with a grand piano and an outdoor spa on the patio! Meant for entertaining, the suite is amazing. And the cheapest suite of that caliber I've ever seen! Our friends stayed in the Spa Tower Suite which was a modern themed decor totally over the top! Two story panoramic views and was just AWESOME! The Chart House dinner was great, and the pool is fun. Valet was wonderful and the bellman were too! Overall, wonderful place to stay Downtown!!

Reserved a king bed non smoking. Got here checked in sorry king only smoking. They put us in a double bed room. Get in there there's a crusty dirty towel hanging in the bathroom. Bottle caps at the foot of the bed. And it smells like cigs 

We call complain about smoke smell. Resolution spray the room gtfo out here.....really 

This is the last time I pay to stay here 

Horrendous customer service

If I could give a 0 I would

Room change update. Apparently they don't sanitize or clean very well. First room dirty towel hanging on the rail. 

Second room dirty plastic golden nugget cup in the corner

The hotel was nice, food was pretty good but it was very disappointing the extra fees we got charged. So we paid the resort fee 2x and they lady at the front desk said there was nothing she could do. I booked online thru Expedia ( and maybe this is there issue ) but our room was $67 plus $25 resort fee. When we showed up they charged us an additional resort fee of $20. The room was nice, pillows are god awful too soft .. They charge for coffee in the room, they have a keurig but you have to pay for the coffee pods . Hmm really I just paid $45 in resorts and I can't enjoy a cup of coffee in my room? Yikes. Valet service was great on a positive note !

First time in Vegas but loved this place! Right in the middle of Fremont Street so you are close to everything. The room was nice for a decent price. We stayed in the gold tower which is older than the rush tower but still loved it! :)

This place is s JOKE I am talking about there Poker Room and there rules what a fuckin joke ,they say it's ok to miss there blind and stay in your chair and play with your cell phone ,I never heard of such BULLSHIT,they say every casino allows that BULLSHIT ,I have been playing poker for a very long time and I play in tournaments at least once a week and I have seen the dealers and pit boss tell players to put there phone away ,FUCK The Golden Nuggets POKER ROOM

We've been to LV enough times that walking along the strip just really isn't all that interesting anymore.  Downtown's pretty entertaining, safe from traffic and everything's close by.  We like playing at the "older casinos" so staying @ the GN allows us to stay at a nice place with nice rooms and walk across the way if we want the old fashioned quarter slots.  

The pool area is neat with the shark aquarium & water slide.  There are concerts downtown on the weekends that are fun and the amazing light show.

I stayed here for my 30th b-day 2 years ago, and again this weekend, and loved both times. I know what you are thinking, "eww, Fremont St?" But Yes. This hotel is the best one downtown and has been fully renovated. It's lovely inside, has a warm interior, plenty of restaurants and lounges and doesn't feel old school at all. 

Our king size bed was SO comfy, and we even jumped on it a little. :) I love how all the hotels are going Euro style now with plush white linens and duvet covers, no more tacky flowered bedspreads, hooray! 

Only bummer was that our room was close to the ice machine, so we kept hearing this weird noise. It was a little annoying, but we survived. 

Blackout curtains, flat screen TV (which we didn't turn on once, but I just wanted to let y'all know), spacious, ipod dock in the alarm clock, it was all very nice, just as nice as anything on the strip. The pool area was cool and apparently you can swim with sharks. (It is February though, so no swimming for us.) 

We went to the resident club at the hotel, Gold Diggers, and while it's a little low on the quality of people quotient, it was good music to dance to and very low key, no pretentious people. :) I dug it!

Not only were we not impressed with our room, the customer service sucked, we will not be back! Not to mention our friends that traveled with us got their $100 cologne jacked when forced to change rooms cause their toilet flooded their room. And they basically just shrugged their shoulders... Horrible will never go back there!

I had booked a room for two nights on July 22-23. We arrived early due to our flight coming in earlier in the day. I had barely slept the night before due to menopausal hot flashes (which is new to me) and again the night before our flight. I must have had a total of 2-3 hours of sleep in 2 nights and it did not fare well for me! I went to the desk about 11:30 a.m. and the person there told me that it probably wouldn't be too long before they could have a room ready for my husband, daughter and I. I was waiting for awhile and asked about 1:00 pm if the room might be ready soon. The person who worked there said that it wasn't yet. I went to go sit down and wait down the hall and I honestly did not feel well! I walked up to the counter and calmly stated that I did not know what to do because I was very tired and explained why. I thought that they might have a suggestion for me because I truly did not know what to do. I was not trying to push for a room or to get one due to impatience, I truly felt unwell and confused of what to do! I asked the person then what would happen if I accidentally fell asleep and he said that security would come and take me away!!! I could not believe it! His manager and everybody just stood there and said nothing! None of them had any compassion or suggestions in my time of need! Due to the fact that I had severe sleep deprivation I could not think for myself to come up with a reasonable solution! I even explained that my phone had no charge and my husband and daughter were walking around and I could not locate them! I would hate to see what they would do if An elderly person with dementia came to ask for assistance!
