Room was very nice. No complaints! Stayed in the gold tower. Beds are very comfy . Will be returning next year.

The Golden Nugget is a good value... The Rush Tower is worth the little extra money. I go for business and the internet upload speed is very important to me.  I don't know if it was an accident, but on the 16th floor of the Rush Tower I got 20 Mbps upload... which is unheard of super-fast.   So the next time I traveled to Las Vegas I tried to get the same room without  success... I got a room on the 12 floor, my speed was 9 Mbps... which is still super fast. 

Note: I've been to many Hotels in Las Vegas, and I haven't found another one that offers speeds of over 1.3 Mbps upload.

The buffet is okay if you are tired and do not want to go out, but if you have the time, for about $3 more, you can have an experience at the M hotel.  One of the best, and I have tried a few.  I would rate the buffets this way

1. The M, The Wynn, Caesar's Places, The Cosmopolitan... 
1A. The Aria, 
2. The Bellagio, The Mandalay Bay

The Cheapest with good food
1. The Red Rock
2 Palace Station, Sunset Station

SMALL BUT NICE!!!

We are regulars to Las Vegas strip so I was kinda nervous to stay downtown. We found this place to be "The Place" to stay down on Freemont Street. This place was by far the cleanliest and most trendy on freemont. 

PROS:
We really enjoyed the freemont experience and tried some new things while staying there. Just watch your wallets and be aware of your surroundings. Gold Diggers at the nugget is neat if you sit outside. 

We thought our room was nice and clean and the pool is small but neat.

CONS: 
We had to pay for Wifi??? Wifi should be free now days!
casino is very small and the bar service is slow and at times very grumpy! 

OVERALL: 
Worth staying at if you need to be downtown.......

The kids enjoyed the pool in the morning.  It wasn't too crowded at that time.  That was the best time to play in the water in the wading area for young kids. 
Took the kids in the arcade.  The room is very small with very few interesting games.  We were disappointed.
The hotel room was fine and housekeeping staff is great.
My complaint is with security.  My family has a family reunion in Las Vegas every year.  We had gathered in front of the area, which is called "The Grand" to take a group photo.  One machine operator told my son-in law to move to a benched area, which he did.  More of us gathered about 25 and then security arrived. The officer asked loudly, "Does anyone here speak English?!"  We were shocked.  Most of us are Japanese-American and are not use to that kind of  treatment.  A larger, taller framed officer arrived and asked us to move to the other side of the gaming machines.  He also was NOT polite and asked us why were we wearing the same t-shirts.  I told him we gathered for a family reunion and most of us are staying at the hotel.  He just said keep moving.  I was very offended.  We felt like we were doing something very wrong.  Most of us were guests of the hotel and didn't appreciate this treatment!  We took our picture quickly and left the hotel.

Stayed in the Carson Tower on the 19th floor. The hotel overall was very modern the rooms were very clean and did not smell like smoke. The sink had poor drainage as well as the shower. There is nothing worse for me then to be standing shin high in my shower water. The AC made a horrible noise and maybe just needed to be serviced but u don't think its my responsibility to be checking on these minor and quick fixes. Overall I would stay back in here again.

I've always related better to older people.  When I was 8, I would abandon the boring, daft kids table to talk politics and play texas hold 'em with the adults.  When i was 12, I drafted a series of novels that were based on the life of coked out, wall street bonds trader and when I was in my teens, i dated a 30 year old.  I guess the last one is less charming than it is creepy but my point is, I'm great with the oldies but goodies.  I love talking to them, being surrounded by them and generally soaking in their lived-ed-ness. 

And this, my friends, is why I love me the Golden Nugget.  Not located on the glossy main strip, the GN is part of old vegas.  It's not shiny and new like the Bitchllagio or the Trampicanna (I know the Tropicana isn't new it just worked so well with word, Tramp!) and the likes but it has ten times the charm.  Okay, 5 times the charm...it's still Vegas after all and the words "charm" and "vegas" go together like "kevin spacey" and "straight".  The GN is where you can see Tony Bennett perform (yes, he's still alive.  and even he's surprised.  THAT SHOULD BE HIS NEW ALBUM TITLE!) and for all of you Swingers' fans, first of all, may god have mercy on your soul and second of all, this is the area where the movie was shot.  Downtown.  Not on the strip.  So every time you call something "money" (again, may god have mercy on your soul), you need to pour one for your homies over here on Fremont st.  Also, if you walk around this area late at night and you are a single lady, you might get raped and\/or shot.  The Fremont Street Experience keeps it real.  THAT'S vegas, baby.  

I've been to the Golden Nugget quite a few times in my day and well, I don't mean to brag but, all of the delightful older gentlemen craps' dealers know me by name.  Or um, they know me by, "Dog Girl" because I am very unattractive and\/or love to talk about dogs!   That's right.  I know Erich, Little John, Big John, Slow Hand John and Ed.  Plus, pit bosses Larry and Gail (she's my girl!  Holla!).  Man, I love the craps so much that if I were going to have a first born, I would name him or her, "BIG MONEY, NO WHAMMY!" or "High Low Yo!"  or "Swing batter batter, SWING!"  I like to mix my metaphors to play head games with my competitors.  And by competitors, I mean the other young tramps who set up camp at the craps' tables.  These are my older men, ladies.  The nickel sluts I mean slots are THAT WAY.  Bu-bye.

Please see my review of Binions to better understand my love of the game and also some super handy craps' playing tips.  Don't say I never gave you anything.  Signed, Laura "Useful" B.:  http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/Zzl4ffV9kFY3yOSSgyRUBQ?fsid=lK8DbTa3qaTHbq7_npkKQg

Cheap Drinks in the Vegas Wasteland: If you've never stayed in downtown Las Vegas, do yourself a favor and do. I bunked down in the Golden Nugget for a few nights to celebrate a friend's 40th. His wife reserved him a suite on the upper floors on the casino and we reserved a couple of normal rooms a few floors below. 

When I breezed into the room--the last to arrive--my friend M. and six others were seated in the 90s upscale living room, already charging through a dozen bottles of alcohol, arranged nicely on the bar. M. made me a clamato, one of the worst cocktails I've ever tasted. Clam and tomato juice don't mix with vodka or each other. An ominous start to the weekend. 

Once I switched to Jack and Coke I realized that the Nugget was a lot nicer than I'd expected. Renovation work was obvious, and although there was a decided absence of uptown chic in the furnishings, they were nice enough to make you feel you were living in some luxury. M.'s room was huge with I believe a queen-size bed and plenty of mahogany furniture. All in all, it's a good place to affect Sinatra-like sophistication as you slowly get blitzed into a more primitive state... 

Speaking of which, once you've descended the evolutionary ladder, stepping foot outside the casino provides ample opportunities for personal debauchery, from the infamous Glitter Gulch to any variety of lingerie and strip clubs further out into the gritty ambiance of Old Vegas. If you're tired of gazing at wheezing octogenarians shoveling their social security checks into slot machines, stick around for the nine o'clock "light show" along Freemont Street. The electronic ceiling is a big draw, and you can observe the jaw-dropping masses of humanity as they move through the street like packs of pale wildebeasts shuffling across the desolate plateau. It's astonishing neglect on a vast scale. The light show itself is an exercise in animated drivel, as a cartoon female falls through the clouds to a teenage soundtrack, entertaining none but the massively intoxicated. 

But then again, that's the appeal of downtown--it's nothing like the glamour of the strip. There's no pretension or false bravura. Old Vegas is too old to pose; it happily admits its tawdry state but continues to wear its faded sequins without giving a damn. Some of the local hotels, like the California, look like gutted gold digs from a hundred years ago, but that's the thing--you get to see what happens when glamour gets old. And the Nugget wears its age better than most.

We booked a room a few days before our trip on 8\/30\/2014and this was one of the only hotels that did not want a two night stay. After reading some of the reviews on yelp and a few other sites I have to admit I was a little scared. When we arrived we were met by the valet and just let them park the car.  It's 2:00am and we just want to get to sleep after driving in from Williams AZ.  We checked in and things went fast the whole process took less then 5 min's  (unlike the Flamingo that took 2hrs) we were given a room in the rush tower Room # 22219. As I got off the elevator and walked to the room I was reliving the reviews that I had read online and thinking of how I would explain this hotel choice to my wife. As I opened the door and walked in I swear the room looked like something out of a luxury spa. over sized bathtub marble countertops and sleek modern fixtures.  We booked at the price of $79.00 a night but I think I would have been pleased to have paid double that.  Great room Great service, Great casino Won $500.00 on a $1.00 Slot   If were ever go back we'll be right here at the golden nugget! If I could give it more then 5 stars I would.

i love this place. i give it 2 stars because of all of the KIDS running around. Last time i checked vegas was an adult place. why bring your kids to vegas? well this place is horrible because its run down by kids everywhere! obnoxious annoying ones...so if u want a weekend getaway i would not reccommend this place to anyone! freaking kids and vegas wtffff.

I really did not enjoy our stay at this casino. We went because my cousin decided to get married in a chapel on the strip and everyone stayed in the Nugget. Having my family there made the stay bearable - everything else was difficult to deal with.

It's impossible to go anywhere in the hotel without being assailed by cigarette smoke. Even the elevators. And - about those elevators!! There's a constant sales pitch during the entire elevator ride. God help you if you're on the top floor - I imagine the mono-toned woman they hired to do the voice over would try to sell you the bed sheets by the time you get to the top floor. 

Others might think the shark tank in the middle of the pool is cool, but I can't help but feel sorry for the animals. They're in a tiny space, forced to swim round and round and round with half-drunk guests banging on the glass. Didn't make me proud of my species in any way shape or form. 

There was a torrential rain while we were there and there were leaks everywhere in the common areas. Also, my aunt's room was on the top floor and the rain on the roof was like a drum - the roofing must have been paper!

All in all, not great.

after the Hell Cortez would not honor our reservation, we went to the Golden Nugget the inside was really nice, it looked like they expanded or renovated but there was a pool area , and a Shark tank .They also have a spa. Really friendly  staff checked us in. we went upstairs to drop off our bags. Room was nicer and more spacious than expected. very comfy! but my only complaint and very minor is the coffee situation. usually the in room coffee is free, but theirs was $10 for 4 K cups, but other that no complaints. very nice full service place. Very convenient to enjoy Fremont St.

They used to let you go up and see the shark tanks but they started getting strict & made it only for hotel guests, it ruined the experience. I bought chicken strips at the Deli near the sportsbook & it was clearly under prepared. And they have ridiculously low limits in the sportsbook when they try to come off as an upscale casino. The workers are incompetent, HR should do a better job staffing the place. It does look nice for downtown though & the food at the cafe was pricy but good so it's the only reason I didn't give it 1 star lol.

This was our first time staying here and we were really excited about it. We checked in to Carson Tower on a Thursday and the check in process was fine, no major lines, the employee were nice and courteous. After that it all fell apart. The first room we were in had broken AC so they switched our room. We had booked one king bed but we got switched to a room with 2 queens. The second room we were given was fine until we went to shower and discovered that there was no water pressure. At 9 a.m. we were offered free buffet passes and told maintenance would come up and check it out, at 11:30 a.m.we were again told they would be right up, at 1 p.m. we were told we were the very next room and we were given complimentary spa passes and told by a manager that they were lots of showers I could use in the spa. At 5 p.m. I was told yet again that maintenance would be right up. This time, after 8 hours, he finally came only to tell me that there was nothing he could do. So they end up.switching us to a THIRD room. This one in the Rush Tower. The room was much nicer and everything worked properly so that was cool. BUT the room faced Fremont Street and the noise level was so incredibly loud that it was difficult to sleep. We didn't complain about it, we just dealt it with it for the last 2 nights of our trip. Maybe we were just there on a bad weekend....I just really feel like for the amount of money we paid to stay there, we shouldn't have had to deal with these kinds of issues. It was a very disappointing experience.
Favorite place to stay in las vegas when i bring my kids. Pool area is very nice and clean! Has an aquarium and a water slide. Rooms are clean and decent priced.

This hotel is good for what it is. It's feels like an older hotel. Everyone is nice and it is cool going out to the strip on the way to life is beautiful festival. The best thing about it is the price. If you book early enough you can get a decent price especially if you split the room. Overall it was a pleasurable experience but not the caliber of the big hotels.

Never again! Terrible hotel. I wonder how they have got 4 stars. We came there to find dirty bath tub with the water that does not drain. Called maintenance but no one came so we asked the front desk to get another room. The manager at the front desk said "it happens". What happens? They don't clean the room before new guests arrive? Also, they do not have a fitness center, nor enough room in the garage for their guests. They told me to park somewhere else and they will validate the ticket. Additionally, they charged me for services I did not use so I had to call them and insist to remove that charge. I would give them zero stars.

Oh Golden Nugget... I was expecting much more from you. It was my boyfriend's first time to Las Vegas so I thought, what better way of introducing you to Las Vegas than staying down in Fremont District. I mean, it was the epitome of Las Vegas with all the flashy neon lights, the history, and less "popular" with the young folk so more space to move around and the bus is constantly going to The Strip so I figured, why not stay down here? Well, for the price I paid at booking, I thought it was ok. But then came the resort fee debacle. We checked in, no problem there, but then the agent at the counter told us that we had to put a $50 hold for damages and a resort fee on the way out, saying the balance would be $42. Ok, no big deal, that's normal. Then, what blew my mind and my boyfriend's was they contacted us the next day in our room, stating that the card on file was declining. My boyfriend spoke to the agent, and told him that did not put a hold, but instead started (continually) charging my boyfriend's card to the point where his bank put out a fraud alert causing his account to be come frozen. The agent then told him that the resort fee was actually $92, none of which would have been an issue if they had communicated better when we checked in. What I don't understand is why isn't that just part of my fee when booking???? I get holding a card for damages, and that would be reimbursed if nothing was damaged (which I never deal with because I'm the kind of person who likes to leave things better than I found it). But, having someone who clearly doesn't know what they are doing, charging my boyfriend's card without his knowledge the day AFTER checking in. When my boyfriend went down to clear up the multiple charges, the male agent was flabbergasted at the lack of communication and improper procedures, that had to get the manager involved. It would have been nice if they had gone an extra mile to make it up to us, because charging a card without notifying or getting consent from the consumer is totally NOT ok. That totally put a damper on our impression of the Golden Nugget. 

The resort fee was a complete joke by the way... The pool was pretty pathetic, a circular pool with an aquarium in the middle. The water slide was alright, but riddled with kids. I guess that's what you get for staying at a kid friendly place. I don't know if there are non-kid friendly hotels in Vegas, if so, let me know.  All the sun chairs squished together so no way of really spreading out. Apparently, the doors open at 8am so you can grab a seat so you and your "squad" can chill together. We ended up going two hours before closing, as we are not fond of being elbow to elbow with strangers. 

Don't get me started on the Internet. 2MB???????? WTF???? If you're going to charge your hotel guests a resort fee PER DAY on top of the booking the room, you should go up on the internet speed because that is a total JOKE! OH, and some people don't gamble, some people just want to chill in their room so maybe add a few more entertaining channels as well. One more thing, it would be nice if you could also let guests access all the football games on hotel TV's because your sports book room was completely over crowded, on top of every public area with a tv that a fire marshal would have a heart attack seeing... 

The only pluses are that the bed and pillows were comfy, and besides having a wonderful view of the wall, and the D hotel, I did manage to see a bit of the Sierras which was beautiful at sunrise and sunset. 

Overall, I will not be staying here ever again. Overpriced for so so rooms, packed and sardine like pool area and a ridiculous resort fee. Unless they change their horrible communication and the quality of everything included in the resort fee. Please train your agents to communicate well, not just some, and if you're going to charge our card, please actually tell that to our face rather than behind our backs then calling us in our room to tell us the card on file is declining.

Nice room...avoid Freemont side of hotel.   The annoyance are the extra charges.   Resort fees are expected, but $10.00 for in room coffee is a ripoff.  They advertise low room charges and stick you for every little thing.

We stayed at a cheaper room in the Gold Tower.  It was very nice.  Really I am surprised is hell th at I have no complaints.  This place was pretty damn decent.

Oh yeah here is the complaint.  You see on hotels.com that the room price is $68 but with all of the stupid fees the room ended up costing just over a hundie.  Everyone in Vegas seems to do that though.  It is a complete frigging scam and should be disclosed as part of the price.

I was very disappointed with my stay at the hotel, we checked in on thursday August 11,2016 for our anniversary and we where offered an upgrade for a better room so i took it.  i was so disappointed we got to our room and the bathroom was filthy there was poop on the rim of the toilet seat and also in the tub and the tub wall. we called front desk and we where directed to call housekeeping we where told that a manager would be coming up. finally someone came i dont think it was a manager she was very nice and she cleaned it up the best she could, We just ended up going to walmart and buying bathroom cleaning supplies and cleaned it ourselves,,   no one even called to see if our room was okay. I also sent a email to the hotel and never heard back from them... very disappointed :( :(

Stayed here for 1 night on a wednesday to try the hotel.Its a good hotel to stay away from all the chaos from the strip. Parking was easy its a parking structure with 4 floors. There was a check in line had to wait for about 10 min to check-in. If you have Rush Tower there is a seperate check-in desk at the tower. Didnt mind the wait because only payed for a 2 person stay didnt want to pay the 3rd eprson charge. The room is big and smeel clean. The bed was very comfortable. What i didnt like is that our window had a view to the generator on the roof of the 5th floor should of tried to switch room. The pool was a good experience to see the fish and sharks so close. My daughter was a bit scared at first and didnt want to swim and try the water slide. After a couple of minutes she had the best time in vegas. Loved the Water Slide and the pool. Didnt want to leave the pool. After the pool she took a bubble bath on the big tub. There is a strip next to the hotel with a nice view at night from lots of lights. Check out was easy and there was no line in rush tower. We check out 1 hour later for free because we stayed at rush tower. There is abit of a drive from the strip to the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to familys. Kids loved the water slide. (TIP)Go early to the pool to reserve your chairs to get a good spot.

Stayed at the Carson Tower with my wife and 6 year old daughter during her spring break ( Tuesday - Friday in mid April).

Arrived Tuesday around 4pm and the check in counter at the Carson Tower was closed so we had to check in at the Rush Tower which is about a 2 minute walk.  Apparently, this is pretty common so don't be surprised.
The check in areas featured self check in Kiosks, but I did not use them.  Check in took about 3 minutes after a 10 minute wait.

Our room in the Carson Tower was clean, fresh smelling and definitely no-frills.  There was no microwave, refrigerator or Wi-fi available in our Carson Tower room.  The room includes a wired Ethernet port that requires payment as well as a coffee maker that also requires payment if you use the provided coffee pods.  The room size is standard and everything worked fine (air conditioner, shower, sink, TV, etc.).

The donut shaped pool is very nice with a shark tank in the middle and waterfalls spaced out around the pool that you can swim under or walk through.  However, the pool is small for the occupancy of the hotel so it will get crowded during holidays.

There is a small Arcade room near the Carson Tower elevators that feature an Air Hockey table and some video games.  The Air Hockey cost $1 per game.

Overall, a nice hotel that was reasonably priced ($60\/night for weekdays in mid April).  Most hotels on the strip costed about 2.5 to 3 times that amount.  The Golden Nugget is a hybrid between a cheap downtown hotel and fancy strip hotel.  We will likely come back.

Just wrapping up my 5th stay at the Nugget. My husband and I travel to Vegas about once a year. We have stayed at several properties on the Strip, but once we discovered downtown, we never looked back. The Nugget is by far the nicest hotel downtown with very reasonable priced, compared to the Strip. We have always stayed in the cheapest tower, Carson. The rooms are clean, spacious but not super fancy. The bathroom is a decent size and the beds are comfy. We don't spend much time in our room, so a lux room isn't that important to us. The hotel and casino was renovated a while back and is still in very good shape, with new features added once in a while. The pool is the best downtown. The lower level pool has an incredible shark tank but overall on the small side. On the weekends, you will need to get down and reserve a spot with more than just a towel by 8 or 9 am. The adult pool is very small and pricey, but a nice getaway from the kids. The downside to the Nugget is that the pool attracts families. I personally do not feel downtown Vegas is child appropriate, and do not enjoy having them present at the pool (I go to Vegas to get away from my own kids lol). I would say that is the biggest con of this hotel, so if you want a more adult like atmosphere you will spend $25 to escape. We like the new Cadillac Mexican restaurant located near the pool. It's relatively inexpensive and quick. As for gambling, we never gamble here. It's expensive, the dealers aren't very friendly and we never win. We gamble at the Golden Gate, where they have $5 tables and most of the evening dealers are fun, friendly and helpful. I could say a lot more about downtown in general, but I'll stick to the Nugget this time.

This was my first stay at Golden Nugget. 
Pros:
Good rates
No resort fee
Good size room and bathroom, pretty well maintained for a downtown hotel
Located on Fremont Street (if you want to stay away from the Strip)
Good restaurants on the property
Holiday decorations were good
Gordie Brown show was great
Many other casinos and places to eat on Fremont Street

Cons:
No free Wi-Fi
No mini refrigerator. 
Time-share people bugging you 
Getting used to the configuration of Carson Tower hotel rooms floor plan. Seems like there were two towers linked together but only one set of elevators 
Since we stayed in the Carson Tower, it was a good distance to the casino but closer to the parking garage.

I stayed Aug. 4-7, Friday morning I found a bed bug in my room at the Carson tower.  My daughter woke up with bites.  They took my clothes to the dry cleaner & I did not get them back until Saturday afternoon.  My kids were not able to enjoy the beautiful pool.  Assistant manger said he would waive all fees and only waived the resort fees.  The 2nd room was dusty.

Family and I stayed here for about 4 days and loved it. I personally love the craps dealers not giving anyone a hard time when rolling the dice about every little pointless rule, as all the other casinos do. This made my craps experience awesome!! and I will recommend that if you want a more enjoyable experience without being hassled about how to throw the dice, then give GN a try!! My daughter really enjoyed the pool and shark tank!! she was mesmerized by it. My wife and I really appreciated the friendliness of the pool staff and how excellent they are about keeping the deck free of trash and constantly kept everything tidy and politely offered to take rubbish off your hands and dispose of it for you. We stayed at Mirage this summer and were disappointed of how the pool staff did the opposite!! There was empty cups, pineapple rhines, cherry stems etc. in the pool and all over the place. Wont be going back there!! Golden Nugget, I think is the best downtown hotel!!! The rooms are a little dated but you do have the option to upgrade to a higher end tower. I was disappointed in the quality of the T.V reception and options (HD??), but didn't watch much T.V,  so didn't care much. For the price, GN is a great option, I will not think twice to stay there again!!! Will be doing a review on the Claim Jumper in the GN soon!! Thank-you Golden Nugget for a great experience, hope to be back soon!!!

If it weren't for the great location right on Fremont Street we likely would look elsewhere, but for the price you can't beat being this close to the action.

Room was clean and updated.  Pool was over-crowded.  The walk to the check-in desk then to the tower was longer than desired, especially with a lot of luggage, but there's only so much that can be done.

Chose not to gamble there.  Too many better places to do that.  And standing in a smoke filled room didn't sound like fun.

I thought this was a fine place to stay. The room was totally adequate. 

To us, the biggest draw was the cool aquarium in the hotel, with a water slide that goes inside it! We also liked the location off the strip and in the Fremont area. There is also a small "upper" pool area that is adults only and less crowded. It had a more relaxed feel. You do have to pay for cabanas, though.

We did wish there were more electrical outlets in the room, but that's the only complaint.

As good as it gets in Vegas imho.  Rooms are comfy, even in the South Tower (the older section) and the employees are friendly with quick check in.  

Atmosphere is nice with a great pool area.  The crowd isn't your typical yippie act like a millionaire with bluetooth in ear sporting a popped collar every 3 feet that you encounter on the strip.  If you're looking for a laid back decently nice hotel that is near some good spots to eat and gamble then this is the place.

Rooms can be had for 33\/night on off peak times or 50 on weekends if you hunt around enough.  Defiantly worth the extra 10-15 bucks a night extra over other properties near by.

PS, don't gamble in house, they have "strip odds" on most table games.

Celebrating the tail end of me and my wife's 10year anniversary and this!  Just checked in and Very Disappointed, waited 20 minutes in line just to check in, which I can live with.  Offered to upgrade to a suite for an additional charge which I declined.  Jaqueline at the front desk was pleasant and efficient - if it were just her it would be 5 stars.  Here's why it's a one star.  Got to our room in the non-smoking gold tower and our room immediately had the odor of smoke when we entered the room door.  There were two ashtrays in the supposedly cleaned, non-smoking room.  Went to talk to the front desk to ask for a move to another room, they said the tower is completely sold out ..... Even though Jaqueline offered a suite earlier, and there were at least 20 other parties waiting to check in, not to mention two people right next to me.  They said they are going to clean the room or I can have a room in the lower quality Carson tower or pay more for the rush tower.  SMH.  I guess because they don't have to sleep in a smoke filled room they just don't care.

Hotel was nice but the daily $28 resort fee (including tax) did not even include in room coffee! They had a Keurig in the room and were charging 2.50 per cup or you can go down to the lobby for Starbucks, definitely no happy with that!
Thanks to Scott at the front desk Saturday night for helping us out Jim Carmichael

I recently stayed here for a little Labor Day Staycation and I was really impressed! The Rush Tower King room was HUGE! Much bigger than any other King room that I've stayed in here in Vegas. (See photos). 

The décor had to have been newly remodeled as everything seemed very updated and fresh. I really appreciated having ample space in the bathroom to get ready for a night out. No bump ins at all! 

The reasons why I did not give the Golden Nugget 5 stars are due to the shower issues that I encountered... seems like a showerhead went unfixed, BUT they sent someone up quickly to fix it. The other reason was the check in line. I experienced a much longer wait checking into the Golden Nugget than I have anywhere else (at much larger properties, even). I'm unsure why the Rush Tower check in was closed... but they should consider keeping it open. ESPECIALLY on busy holiday weekends.

The property outside of the rooms is nice as well. Everything appears to be much more updated than you would expect an off Fremont hotel to have. I really enjoyed the pool area and being able to swim around a shark tank. The waterslide is the greatest! I'm pretty sure that we will be booking another staycation here just to enjoy the pool again!

The Golden Nugget has always been my favorite Downtown casino, before and after its remodel.  It still has the glitzy neon facade from yesteryear, but it now has a modern decor inside.  There are interesting furnishings and lighting and the color palate is aesthetically pleasing.  Oh, and did I mention there's a water slide that goes through a shark tank?

The only downside to this landmark is that it gets so, so, so crowded.  Any efforts they may have put into a ventilation system to filter the cigarette smoke gets thrown out the window with the wall-to-wall tourists packed in the place.

Fourth time.  Well, we are here now thru Saturday  and have been privy to a bait and switch.   Upon making reservations we were told room was over 750 sq ft.  It is not.  Told the desk, they said more $$$ please.  Feel ripped.   This will be our last stay here. .

This place is dirty, way too crowded for the little space there is inside the building and they close  the pool at 7 pm(6pm for the H2O pool)what the heck its Vegas baby, nothing closes at 7pm . I was first offered a room with 2 queens bed , even tho i booked a king size bed , explained to the receptionnist that it was my wedding soon and that i really wanted a king size bed or only one bed in the room, got send to the dirtiest room ever , rust in the bath , dirty windows and we had a view on....their giant Ac system , the sound it made was bothering both me and my wife we ended up leaving with only a 25$ voucher to drink our deception.

Never again this hotel is for grandpa and grandma and even there , everybody deserve better.

I would not stay even if i was paid to do so!!!

Keep doing what your doing GN. We have been there twice and both times have been an enjoyable and lovely stay. Our room in the Rush tower was so nice we didn't want to leave it, but had to because, well, it's Vegas. I love your pool and big fish tanks. Your restaurants, bars, and staff are all fantastic.

I attended the Tommy James Concert on 7.31 in the Gordie Brown showroom. Tommy was Brilliant ! Sang all his Numerous Hits and his interaction with the Audience was 1st class. The Sound Quality is good and there is not a bad seat in the showroom ( probably holds 500 ). So I would recommend it. 
The parking is sub standard. Only 1 elevator was working. It was Hot with No AC ??? It's Summer Folks !  The GN does have some more name Groups on Fri nites. For those who enjoy REAL Music, it is Great. Just fix the Elevator PLEASE

Free Craps Lessons learn how to play in under 20 minutes

I have never stayed here but I did go and learn how to play craps, and it is now by far my favorite game to play, great staff at the gaming tables and the person who taught us how to play Craps was wonderful and patient

then I got lucky and he was on the Craps table I went to try my hand at so I got more pointers from him

I went back and played slots and Craps a few times here

Oh, the Golden Nugget! 

I was placed at the Golden Nugget for a business trip to World Market Center. I was disappointed my client chose this hotel, since my sister was tagging along for the stay. The Nugget, as we named it, does not offer the glam of the Vegas strip, but rather the retro feel of old Vegas. However, maybe from the excessive gold detailing or maybe from the amazing people watching, the Golden Nugget worked its way into both of our hearts. 

The hotel room was decently clean (the kind of clean where you just choose not to look too closely at the bathroom tiles or peak behind the furniture) and the beds were decently comfortable. The decor was very dated, but somehow charming. 

There weren't many great dining options at the hotel or nearby, which was probably one of the biggest downfalls of staying in old Vegas. While there are options, they just aren't welcoming. As for entertainment, we didn't see any nearby shows, but there is no need to pay for entertainment on Fremont. The "street people" are plentiful, drunk, and usually dancing. Oh, and if you want to meet Elvis, this is the place! We spent most of our nights taxiing to the strip. Transportation was not cheap (about $25 one-way) but we ran out of Fremont-fun. 

I would not come back to the Golden Nugget on my own, but we do talk fondly of our time here! Overall, it was a decent stay... and since we are both Karat Club members now (why not?) we get email deals for $40 stays. You can't beat that.

Alerted them of a Facebook post where their employee was threatening to assassinate the president. Their response was to block me from their page. Now, because they employ trigger happy employees, I will no longer stay here. Besides, your entire hotel sucks anyway.

46 bar- out door sofas were very comfortable.  Cool (air conditioning blowing on you)  area out side to people watch on Fremont.  Alexis was great to service all patrons on a busy Friday night!

Very entertaining people watching!

Restrooms were clean and well maintained!

FUN!!

Great hotel! Love the Golden Nugget. Would rather stay on Fremont St then the Strip. The bed was very comfortable. The room is spacious. Love the pool and the water slide. Made a sizable donation to the casino, hope they use my money well!
This place is great but they have one place to charge phones in the entire room and it's a little inconvenient. I didn't even see a charger in the bathroom. Love the shark tank. That was fun.

My kids and I love this place. If you're looking to do Vegas, but don't want the headache or prices of the strip, it doesn't get better than the Nugget. We stay here at least once a year since they've opened the new pool. The pool is incredible. Small enough where you can actually watch you preteen kids, but incredible enough that they have fun. 

We've always had good luck with the dealers. Doesn't mean we always win, but the losses aren't so bad if you have a fun and social dealer. Real drinks here, not the water downed drinks you get across the street. This is my favorite place to stay in Vegas, but I'm tired of the strip.


The downsides, no kids menu at the cafe ( I know its Vegas, but come on) and the food there is far below average, rude staff and high prices for junky cafe food. Pretty good buffet upstairs and well worth a couple bucks more. WiFi was over $10 per night which is a rip off, but there is no resort fee which I love.

If you want to spend the money and go to the strip, then stay at the Venetian, if you want to have a really good time for a weekend and actually be able to walk from casino to casino, this is your place.

I have always wanted to stay at the Golden Nugget..and I FINALLY have!!  I have always had a fondness for the place because, 1. I have been a winner here a few times (and this trip was no different!! Yippee) and because as a child my parents always stayed here..it was ritzy..( Yes..I AM that old!!)
I stayed and got a KILLER deal..$39.00 a night with one night free.
I was here for my birthday and have to say I really have NO complaints.

The room was pretty standard, in the South Tower (I think) with a very nice strip view.  I was in a smoking room..for reasons that I hate to say are true..I can't HELP smoking in Vegas, and perhaps my roommate may have smoked in there as well..(I am a reformed smoker) anyway, the rooms were not that smelly and didn't reek like other smoking rooms I have encountered in Downtown.

Next time, I would stay in the other tower if possible as it is a bit of a walk to the elevators.

The room is standard and has a nice big flat screen that my friend had turned to CNBC for our entire stay..and that is a story for another time.

I would have liked to eaten at the buffet but it was closed for renovations..I did eat at the 24 hour place and it was reasonable and good edible food.

The pool is AMAZING and I dreamed of swimming in it the entire time but the 52 degree weather stopped me, although I did dip my foot in and I must say it was very warm.

I have stayed downtown MANY times and I must say that the Nugget is the best place there..however the appeal of this part of Vegas for me is what I call the "Old Slutty" casinos located here..nothing beats Binions and the Lady Luck..I won at every casino I played at so all and all it was a good trip and the Nugget just made it better.

Here is a tip, join the '24 Karat" players club..I know it is worth it as they will keep you apprised of great deals here.

The economy may be in  the dumper but as the front desk guy told me.."the economy maybe bad but it's good for you.." and he was right..on our last night I got a letter offering another night for free, which fell on the Friday of Superbowl weekend..I know they offered  it to everyone but when I called on it they really meant it!!"  Wish I could have stayed but thought better of getting out of Sin City with my winnings!!  

Next time I will for sure!!
This hotel is amazing I am a local and I still love visiting golden nugget for a get away....  the rooms are amazing and its such a clean hotel!!  Will deffinately stay comming here!!!
The Golden Nugget hotel was a lot of fun. The Charter House restaurant had great food. The pool was great because you can view the fish and sharks in the tank while you swim.  We had a good time.

Booked a vacation package through Southwest Airlines and was put in the Gold Tower along with our friends. We got a view of a wall 2' away from our window and the bathtub had rust and mold. Our friends had mold as well. Complete disappointment.  Gold Tower is well past its prime and an embarrassment. After showing the pics to the front desk Suzanne upgraded us both to a Jr. Suite in the Rush tower.. That was night and day from the Gold. Bottom line, avoid the Gold tower like the plague, you may just catch it there.

Nice staff, very standard, clean, no major issues. You are directly off Fremont street so there is plenty to do in walking distance. The parking garage doesn't connect with the hotel so you have to go to the first level each time. Elevators are fairly slow though there are at least 6. The room I had had very little power outlet availability. As a electronic junkie- having more outlets would have been nice. View from the 22 floor was petty nice. Lastly, the a\/c was a bit noisy but nothing terrible.

Not bad for an old hotel. Street noise was an issue all night even on top floors.
Two other issues:
1. Frequent internal computer calls to the room spamming events. Hotel operator says complaints were frequent but not even God could stop them.
2. Calls to the front desk not answered even though several clerks were standing around and messages left for manager were not returned.

Check-In: 

Resort fees are common for hotels (I get that). However, I had made reservations online and paid an additional resort fee online ALREADY. Checking in, the gentlemen almost charged me another resort fee ! Having explained to him that I paid it already and how there is no disclaimer online of any resort fee, he had waived it. The hotel did not grant me wifi or even water because of that waive. How does that make any sense ? I had already paid the resort fee online and just because I was not willing to pay another fee upon checking in, I have those basic amenities taken away. My purchase was through my work vendor so the check in desk should really look into details before giving out information.

Sanitation: 

It is disgusting ! Our bedsheets had dried out blood from god knows who. The shower curtains and tub is filthy. Despite calling for housekeeping to clean it, they did not fix it for us ! Whomever is picking up the calls in the cleaning department is rude and has no regard for our concerns. You are better off staying elsewhere .

Just don't. 

The casino itself is kind of gross. Outside is the Old Las Vegas which also isn't all that fun. Mostly just drunk people stumbling around and littering. We stayed in the Rush Tower of the hotel which had a nice room but it wasn't anything great for what we paid. Parking was full and we had to park quite a ways away from the hotel.

Worst part is the customer service. It's terrible. I had an issue with my room that caused me to change nights. The woman at the front desk really had no idea how to handle the situation and all that needed to be done was to cancel and refund the room I had booked and book me a different one. Eventually that happened and I was told the amount for the first room would be put back on my credit card. 

They never put it back. 

I've been calling them for weeks about this and each time it's like starting from scratch.

What can I say? I was pleasantly surprised with my stay at the Nugget. 

Really it was better than the last 2 times I stayed on the strip. Even the suites are better (than the Luxor). They changed my perception of Fremont street for the better.

Our family loved the pool and the slide with the sharks.  The room was nice and comfortable.  The staff was helpful and we had a relaxing time lounging around the pool.  

We loved having the Starbucks close to us and we enjoyed the Freemont show.  

A must for families with kids.
Our room\/Suite was perfect. We had the best time there, and the hospitality was on point. Can hardly wait to visit the Golden Nugget again.

** THIS REVIEW IS ABOUT THE BUFFET ONLY **  

I was there over the weekend, I took my bf to see "Old Vegas" and we wanted breakfast buffet, turns out Golden Nugget was the only place on Fremont St that had a buffet, it was spendy !! $50 for 2 people and their selection sucked. I don't eat a lot anyway so buffets are always overpriced to me, but this one was pretty thin. But I will say the English guy, I want to say his name was "Clinton" did an amazing job with customer service, constantly cleaning our table off and he was friendly, without being overly chatty or pushy.  His customer service skills are being grossly underutilized there.

This place is horrible.. The employees are especially rude. I called ahead of time making sure we would be able to go in the pool we had no issues they assured us. We traveled long ways to get here and the old man said very rudely and mockingly ha this is only for guests and closed on weekends (and just to let you know Friday is not considered a weekend) so we were super upset and to top it all off who told you that we were open to public the concierge? He said you shouldn't listen to them! What it's your hotel not mine!!!! If you know this is happening why don't you change they way your people say things that are not accurate! Horrible horrible horrible... I will never return again oh btw this was for my bachelorette with a lot of girls so they missed on a lot of customers.

The hotel is really flashy and sets the tone as far as class is concerned on Fremont Street. The casino and the hotel is immaculately clean, the restaurants are all above average to top notch (I tried them all). The pool is beautiful but small and packed with families\/children from open to close. My major beef w\/ the estb being the poor customer service administered by the GN staff (not the 3rd part operators within. The various restaurant staffs were great). I checked in at 1am w\/ 6 ppl ahead of me and it took 50 mins (my personal check in was done in 5 mins). A majority of the staff lacks charisma and general friendliness. Moreover the comps are weak and far between (despite the machine spec listing "comp drinks for playing playing XYZ). The GN is worth a shot if you prefer Fremont street to the strip (I do), but don't expect warm service.

I stayed there during the summer.  They have the absolute worst customer service I've ever experienced in any thing I've ever participated in in my life.  Our room got broken into, our stuff got stolen, they refused to take care of us, treated us poorly, did an inspection, even though the lock had been tampered with they still said that they weren't responsible for any of the situation, and treated us like trash.  The acquarium pool was barely open.  I was there for a week and never got to use it.  The staff was rude and short tempered, I lost $2000 worth of items in the robbery (laptop, ipod, etc...), and several of my friends lost more.  According to them, they have no security cameras in the hotel, and couldn't even help us find out when we were robbed.

The policy and services at the golden nugget are garbage, they are a horrible business, and I would personally turn anyone and everyone I could ever get to listen to me away from going there.

On the plus, their black jack tables were very nice, and the casino staff was friendly.  The drinks were watered down, but I wouldn't ever complain about drinks at the cost of tips.

The rest of freemont was a lot of fun, and other than my experience and vacation being drastically harmed by the horrible HORRIBLE choice to stay at the golden nugget, vegas was a fun place to visit.

Love this place and stay here often. I've stayed in all the towers and most of the room types from standard , one bedroom, Spa Suite and they are all clean and spacious. Rush tower is my preference because of the deep tubs, love a bubble bath every night. Carson rooms are great for the price, but a long way from the casino. My second choice is the Gold tower because of the proximity to the casino. I've gotten to know several bartenders here so it makes it easy to get my comped drinks when it's busy, that didn't use to be the case. The pool is open 365 days a year, which is a must for me and the pool hours are longer than at most casino hotels. They have 2 pools to boot , wish they wouldn't allow other hotel's guests use the pool for a fee because it can get really crowded. Spa is great, nice gym and wonderful masseurs. Table games minimums are on the lower side compared to the strip and dealers are friendly. VP schedules aren't great, look for the El Cortez or some of the Boyd properties for that, maybe the D too. Heading back March 24 for Nightclub and Bar convention .

We came here to eat at the seafood restaurant and that was amazing. I would love to eat there again.

The Golden Nugget though, at night, is pretty scuzzy. It's open to Fremont Street and there were many a homeless person just shuffling through with their bags and their odors. It is also narrow to walk through the casino so you are physically close to dirty strangers. Even after the remodel it's still gross.

If you are a non smoker pass this one by. Smokers everywhere including common areas. My nonsmoking floor has smokers. Upon checking out, the desk clerk double billed for the room, so myself and my friend were charged extra for the crummy experience. Watch your bill!  I won't be back.

went to their lunch buffet because it was in the top then of a magazine, at first wasn't very impressed with their variaty, there wasn't a lot to choose from but decided for the meatloaf, which was realllllly nice and juicy and for desset went for the bread pudding that was said their number one, and can't dissagree, it was the best, really looking forward  going back.

The casino area is well kept up,the hotel is very nice this one of the best looking hotel in this area, they have an Starbuck in the lobby I tried to used my starbuck card ..do you know they said that I could not used it at that starbuck inside the Golden Nugget,I was not in the mood for an argument I just walk away.

A little disappointed in the gold tower room. It cost more,  was smoke free (really only good thing),  view was not good at all, & it was noisy as hell ass evening. The Fremont st experience is so annoying! If you care to relax or take a nap before a night out on the town, DO NOT stay in the gold tower. The room was clean though,  they did a nice job with the upgrades. Just really sad about the noise level & I used to win at this casino all the time...guess times have changed.  Lol no luck this time & I've been playing here happily for 10 years.

I booked a room for my anniversary with the Golden Nugget with no expectations. The plus was the pool. Let me tell you that this is a great hotel!! Our room was big and comparable to other big budget hotels. Very clean in many cases modern and contemporary. The service is exceptional. And did I mention the worlds most awesomest pool!! Did I just say awesomest!! Lol! Would definitely recommend!!

We have came here for many years. This year was a disappointment. Dingy halls and room. Room was outdated in decor for sure! Irritated that when I made reservations 6 weeks prior I booked a room with a King bed but when we checked in was told there were none available. Seriously? When that reservation was made that king room should be considered booked and not given away. Or due to the hundreds of rooms you have I am sure others were available. Annoying that my husband and I had to sleep in seperate beds for a week. Staff overall were friendky. Waitresses in casino floor not very prompt in serving drinks. Very annoyed with vendors trying to get your time selling time shares and other products while in the hotel. They should be required to be outside not in lobbies.  I will not be staying here again. They have declined in hospitality.  And their resort fees are a scam. For the extremely low price of about $25 a day we got to bottled water. Their quality decreased but their prices have increased. New strip here we come...

Sharks in the swimming pool! That was all the info I need to book a couple of nights there while we were into for my husband's show.

It's pretty. As Raquel C. below me mentioned, it has a killer Monopoly game. It's clean. It's less hectic and overwhelming than the Strip.

Cons.... It smelled. Seriously. Not in the casino, but in our bathroom up in the hotel. It smelled when we came in. It smelled when we left. And the cleaning staff--I don't mean to generalize, let me specify: the employee who cleaned our room--did a crappy job. It had an old drink with straw on the vanity when we walked in. And like the smell in the bathroom, it was there when we left: It wasn't taken away when our room was cleaned. I asked for extra blankets. Didn't happen. Nothing was straighted up. The beds looked like they were made by a five year old. And on top of that, we left her a great tip, hoping our empty wine bottles and slight request would be taken care of.
Didn't happen...

Got married here May 27th and it could not have been better! Everything from our suite, the salons work, service, reception in the suite, and everything in  between was spot on a perfect. It's a beautiful hotel and every one of our guests had a great time.

In my opinion this is the best hotel downtown, the rooms
are reasonably priced and they have a decent buffet, I 
stay here every year and it's always well kept, I think it
is nicer than many hotels on the strip and are always
up to date on their decor.

 I would recommend this hotel to anyone but will tell 
you if you are a gambler you would be better off going 
elsewhere, I have been going here for the last 6 years 
and have not witnessed anyone winning anything, they 
have the tightest slots I have ever seen, I went to the 
Fremont hotel and a lady had won and I had won a little 
myself, I know it's gambling but if I go somewhere for 
several years I would expect to see someone jumping 
for joy at least once then go next door for 30 minutes 
and someone wins.

 IN CONCLUSION I THINK IT IS THE NICEST HOTEL 
DOWNTOWN AND WOULD ALWAYS RETURN BEC-
AUSE THEY ARE TOP NOTCH BUT WOULD 
RECOMMEND PLAYING ELSEWHERE.

What a let down on this trip!  I have stayed here several times before and have bragged to all my friends and family about it!  I bring my Brother in law and his wife for their first visit to LV for their 40th Anniversary and it has been a nightmare!  Reservations were different than what was agreed to on the phone when they were made!  After finally getting it right, so I thought,  they yanked us around in getting the upgraded room!  I am embarrassed and am done with the Golden Nugget!!!  Get it together!!!!

Golden nugget its the best looking hotel in downtown..its market is the budget tight! Rooms are from cheap to not so cheap depending in the tower you are staying at.their pool is loved by the locals who often are the majority there!restaurants are cheap.depending on the brand you choose..downside..its on freemont. Which is a very raunchy,disgusting place! No free parking,unless you are staying in the hotel..parking lot gets full when there is events like concerts etc.they dont guarantee you parking in those cases even if you are staying..also your car is not safe in the parking lot!theres a lot of break ins into cars and the hotel holds no liability when something happens to your car while you are staying there! In the back of your parking ticket there you will see the disclaimer. Cars are often robbed and there is no way they will reimburse you! The pool is also a hotspot for robbed items that often they call are "missing"..so if you go to the pool keep your items close..also there is a lot of intoxicated people..bartenders are supposed to stop serving guests if they look intoxicated but they dont!they usually care more about their tips than local laws..if you got kids its a really bad place to stay with them.since they cant be at the gaming areas..downtown is not exactly disneyland and the only are for kids in the hotel is an arcade room with maybe 6 or seven videogame machines and they are not free..

I have stayed at the GN for the past 10 years, before Fremont St. was hip and cool. I prefer downtown because it's quieter, well at least a few years ago it was. Last year, I had a noise issue because my room was near a concert venue in back of the hotel. I couldn't sleep because music was blasting way past 1:00 in the morning. I complained and received a complimentary room for one night. I used the comp when I visited last week. The room was clean and spacious but I'm not sure what the folks on the 10th floor were doing at 5:00 a.m., a lot of banging. I called the front desk and relayed my complaint and never heard back from anyone, the banging continued throughout my stay. 

The food was particularly good at the Chart House and the lemon layer cake and service at the Claim Jumper restaurant was exceptional (thanks Mari). Those are the only positive experiences of my trip. One of the servers at the Cadillac Bar was very weird and standoffish. Upon check out, I was told that the 4 long distance phone calls I made were over $10 each, and was stuck with a $40+ tab. Are you serious? $10 for a phone call in the age of unlimited long distance calls. And, the $28 per night resort fee is a sham. Apparently, the fee is for two bottles of water per day, access to the pool (which I visited only once during my stay), access to the fitness center (which I didn't visit at all during my stay) and internet service, parking and printing boarding passes (which should be FREE). I found out that the fee also includes daily newspapers, downtown discount coupons and discounted tickets to the Gordie Brown show, which nobody told me about. When I travel to LV next year, I'm heading to the strip and hopefully, I'll get more bang for my buck.

I give the Golden Nugget 5 stars cause of the AMAZING new host Jessica Bartolome! 

She is awesome! Best thing at Golden Nugget! Give her a call, you will never want anyone else. :-) :-) 

And she is beautiful too. :-) :-) 

If you want to try something new and get off the strip, Golden Nugget and the Fremont strip is perfect to try!

You feel like you're in a different world. I saw kids on Saturday. But I wouldn't recommend it. 

Vic's Steakhouse was awesome! A great hidden gem inside the Golden Nugget. 

Have a great day everyone! Win lots of money. Haha

This is my first review that I didn't give five stars too..BooHoo. Well the problem is consistency...I love to stay at the Rush Towers when I need a day to myself to escape. However, I never know quite what I'm going to get. The first stay was impeccable, Next stay was okay. Please never stay in a room that faces the North...Meaning towards the downtown area...Very Noisy with the Freemont Street Experience. The room is decorated in a dark brown theme which I find quite relaxing..To conclude the reason for three stars is when I asked for no smoking room for one of my stays the room reeked of smoke.

It's right where the action is so that's a definite plus. My bed was comfortable. But my room window A\/C was noisy. I could hear all the noise in the hallway. The only usable outlets for my phone and laptop where @ the bathroom sink.

Golden Nugget exceeded our expectations.  We got a really great price for our room and guest services was really helpful and polite.  It isn't on the strip, it's downtown but has lots to offer and has a lot of entertainment.  There is zip lining right outside the hotel along with many food places, shops and entertainers.  The restaurants and bars are really great!  The Chart House has amazing fresh fish and a really cool aquarium inside; they also have really tasty signature drinks.  We also ate at the Red Sushi Bar.. yummy;)  They also have a really cool pool area with a slide that goes through an aquarium that's filled with fish and sharks.  The pool closes at 5pm but the hot tub and the heated upstairs pool stays open until 2am.  I think this is a great hotel for adults and children, especially if you're looking for something more casual but still Vegas fun.

we stayed here on 4th of July weeekend!!! we are a super satisfied guest!!!this place went beyond my expectation (being on a "downtown" hotel)...the hotel is clean, the staff are so friendly, the amenities are great!!! the pool is congested but its expected since it's their "come on" gem=)...there's a lot of resto nearby...and its just perfect for us=))) 

Plus...their accounting dept is so patience and nice in answering all your questions with all the charges=))

we will come back for the shark tank pool=))) making me say that "its good for kids" if your kids love swimming=)

Other than the pool there was nothing that really makes this hotel stand out, the prices are like prices you would pay to stay on the actual strip, but your not. I understand its an older hotel, but hotels are really supposed to be about hospitality. So how hospitable is it to charge $4 for a bottle of water, when you know people are in a casino drinking all night or even just walking around in the cigarette smoke, you wake up dry and it's going to cost $4 for a bottle of water, Crystal Geyser at that, it could at least be Fiji or Smartwater or something actually worth it. I can buy a case of Crystal Geyser for $4 at the Walgreens two blocks away. And, there are no vending machines, so unless you bring your own your stuck, and seriously $10 for coffee in a $200+ a night room with a rusty bathtub, these things are usually complimentary. Other than that the room was clean, and maid service came in a timely manner, they just need to stop nickel and diming patrons of their hotel, not a good look.

Just another Vegas boiler room casino.
All the great  classy improvements Wynn did are gone.
The scams and sham offers are in full supply here at the Golden Nugget.

The "Free Buffets" in the deal we booked is a Golden Nugget based scam that cost us an additional $20 when we arrived at the buffet and presented the coupons.
Lots of angry guests complaining on indifferent deaf ears so beware, this scam is big.
Same with everything else in the offer. All rip-offs, don't believe a thing in their offers and deals.

Casino-employed slick hawkers hassling and harassing guests for timeshares mid-casino and also at the entrance off Fremont Street.
Cheesy and annoying and low class for a once class-act operation.

The buffet, once the best downtown, is now just pre-frozen, thaw and serve Sysco Restaurant supply, yellow school cafeteria stuff.
It really sux. No question,, the worst downtown.

The Cafe no better, other restaurants an expensive joke too.
(Walk a few steps next door to DuPars and get real fresh cooked food.)

The head chef dressed in his bib shirt and Jack Ass pants was bragging to guests at the table next to us how they plan to expand to more restaurants. We listened while munching on tasteless pre-frozen steak fry's.

Water slide at pool is a 30 minute wait min. everyday. Unheated and freezing.

Check-in is archaic, and takes forever. Even if you are pre-registered and the only person waiting in line,, expect a long, long, complicated process to get booked in to your room.

No more Downtown rules (aka Northern Nevada rules) at the gaming tables. Bad odds, bad rules, bad limits on all their gaming. Beware of the 6:5 Black Jack trap.

The Golden Nugget was once the premier place to gamble. No more.

Beware of fake 4 and 5 star reviews from vendors and suppliers glossing the place up.
Nothing here unique at all anymore.
Sad and pathetic. It really was great at one time.

Very clean nice casino. Pretty lights everywhere. Best casino on Fremont street. Pool is real cool with slide going through shark fish tank. And waterfalls. 
Great Landry restaurants.

This hotel is just fine.  Nothing spectacular, and priced accordingly.  Most of the staff was friendly.  Downtown Vegas is great place to visit. I'm just not sure I would stay in this area again.  In the future I think I''ll just bite the bullet and stay up-town at one of the many luxury hotels, and cab-it to Fremont section for one evening.  Not trying to be a snob, but the crowd is a little on the rough side. This is a smokers paradise.  It gives you a flavor of what it must have been like 20 years ago in society. Unfortunately, we're not smokers so it was a little bothering. Again, it was good value, but as the saying goes, you get what you pay for.

I didnt realize that the hallways and pool allows smoking. I didnt like that. The rooms are non-smoking, thank goodness. This is my first time staying in Las Vegas, I was so excited about cheap price but I realized that it's not really cheap, it comes out even with other hotels that includes free stuff, this one charges pretty much for everything, $10 for coffee in room, $7 for bottle water in room, $12.99 for wi-fi. -_- The rooms were very clean (We stayed in Carson Tower) and I have to say this, I love their toilet, I feel like Tim Taylor from Tool Time was there with the "Binford 4000" septic tank. The flush is so powerful, I had to step back! LOL

Quoted 3 different room rates...
Get to room it's got to be on the noisiest part of the hotel, not the original pool view we were quoted, nor the second tower we were quoted, but the third and most dilapidated, Hallways from "The Shining " tower...The tub is rusted, the shower head is face height so I'm crouching to shower,  enough soap supplied for only  1 individual(booked the room for 3) .. And tub is clogged so I'm ankle deep in cloudy (ewwww) water and I'm paying an additional $20\/night... Their pet fees are like $60\/night too... Worst part? The front desk charged me an additional stack of cash -upon arrival everyone plays dumb-Was told I'd have a credit on my account.. Everybody still plays dumb. Then I'm told oh it'll go towards your fees (but my fees aren't $100)!? And no late check out.. For the roughly $200\/night I should've hit the strip for a MONDAY IN SEPTEMBER... You win this time nugget...Never again nugget.... Fool me once...

I recently stayed at this hotel on Memorial Day weekend May 26-28. I stayed in the Spa Suite with 4 people. I arrived and had paid for early check and the Vip check was fast and amazing! So we were able to go in the room. There was noise most of the day since they were working on that floor. Where the problems start is here. I ordered a bottle of Hennessy and they charged my card even though I paid cash, that was strike one. Second, I had some guest\/friends of mines too come see my room and have a couple drinks before a show that day. Then all of a sudden I get a knock from security. Saying that I had to many people staying in there and I need to tell them to get a room. I told them they have rooms here and are just here having a quick drink. They did not care and kicked them out as well as threatening and warning me, strike two. All and all this was not worth paying all that money for getting sub-par treatment. We ended up cleaning up and I've been waiting a month for my deposit back with no luck. Strike 3.

On August 6, 2013, our laptop and iPad3 were stolen from our hotel room at the Golden Nugget, Las Vegas. We are still waiting for a response from the hotel regarding how they will address this situation. Yesterday, we left a message for them to call us, but they have not returned our call. We have been long term customers, and are very disappointed in their lack of concern as well as servicing issues that we encountered during this visit.

The Legendary Golden Nugget is not only my favorite place to stay in downtown, but really the only place to stay in my opinion! Located right on Fremont St, if you're looking to stay on Fremont, you'll be able to walk right off the casino floor onto Fremont! The minute you walk into the main lobby you're hit with nostalgia as you see the gaudy chandeliers before you! As you walk the main corridor to the elevators serving the towers, the brass railings and gaudy gold lighting takes you back a bit to when Vegas was Vegas! The rooms in each of the two older towers have been remodeled in recent years, and we're done quite well! A more contemporary feel in their rooms brings this old lady up to modern Vegas times! The legendary pool, that is small, has a tubed water slide going through a shark tank dumping you out at the far end of the pool! The buffet here is small by Vegas standards, but a bit classier than the other smorgasbords you'll find! The casino floor is certainly smaller than those on the strip, but I find that attractive for what little gambling I'll do. I do find most of their dining options besides the buffet to be a bit pricey, but you have a ton of other dining options on Fremont from which to choose. A lot of those will have the "old school" Vegas dining deals that are quickly becoming scarce! Though we have brought our entire family here numerous times, you'll want to be conscious of your kids anywhere down around the Fremont St Experience!

If they comp you a room after dropping tons of $$$$ they treat you like a second class citizen.  I am no longer staying with this hotel... Way to go!  Treat your loyal customers like crap and have your host give us attitude for trying to put us in a smoking double when we specifically asked for a non-smoking king when we booked TWO MONTHS ago!

I have been staying at Golden Nugget for 10+ years. My past stays have been 5 stars. This time 1 star. When we checked in they ask if we wanted an upgraded renovated room for $15 more a night. Sounds nice right?  wrong!  Our 1st room SMOKY. Our 2nd room SMOKY. And these rooms did NOT look renovated to me. I stay here every year. We specifically paid and reserved a NON- SMOKING room. Finally the 3rd room was non-smoking. Checkin rep, Isabel, was not friendly or helpful. She was condescending to my husband like it was our problem for wanting what we paid for. I won't be staying at Golden Nugget again.

NEVER AGAIN!!! Very disappointed!  Stayed in the Rush Tower and was told this was the newest tower.  Room was dirty and not well kept.  (See a couple of attached photos I took in our room.). Not to mention the lack of security and the homeless people walking around in the casino harassing me.  This hotel has gone down the tubes!

Golden Nugget is the gem of Downtown LAS Vegas!

I stay there for a few nights every couple months.  I'm pretty cheap and like to get more bang for my buck.  I stay in the Gold Tower, which is VERY nice, and is right off the casino floor.

As I noted, I'm pretty cheap, instead of wasting my money on room service etc., I go to the ABC market that's just a few steps on Fremont.  I buy my food and drinks there.  The money I save goes to partying.

The Gold Tower rooms are reasonably priced and luxurious (comparatively speaking).

I should remove a star for the crappy "band" they now have at the Rush Lounge.  The entertainment was 100Xs better before.  

The past seven years I've been staying there (on the regular) has been a wonderful experience.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.

Update 12\/12\/14:  Golden Nugget brought back the great classic rock\/rock & roll band to the Rush Lounge.   The name is *Rock This Town*.  Thank you Golden Nugget for bringing them back :-)

Granted we stayed in the old tower - but there were kinda gross stains on the sheets, and they took 30 minutes to bring us new sheets when we wanted to get to sleep. And you can hear the guy in the room above you peeing like he's peeing into a bucket right inside your room. Like, really, really loud urinating, as if they mic it and broadcast it through a speaker next to the bed.

We decided to get away for Thanksgivng weekend so with the weather always dicey driving to Reno we decided to drive to Las Vegas and stay downtown. My wife wanted the Golden Nugget and I went on line and made a reservation for the V.I.P. floors of the Gold Tower. The room rate was the same as for a regular room on the Strip! We are now in love with these rooms, the Golden Nugget, Fremont Street and Las Vegas!!! From the time we handed the keys to the valet, we checked in, in the wonderful V.I.P. Lounge, got to our beautiful room, our luggage arrived, was all of 20 minutes!!!! My wife adored, just adored the Spa. We both loved the Jelly Bellys, fruit, trail mix, bottled water as you get off the elevator on the V.I.P. Floors so we are now spoiled so much so, we have the same reservations for my 50th birthday bin April with the addition of a cabana @ The Hideaway pool! Also, a big shout out to The Starbucks...I was going to p\/u a city mug(I collect them) but forgot, my wife called they shipped it free of charge and included a bunch of Via coffees for my Xmas present!!! We are both counting the days until my birthday trip!!!

I never thought I would be giving the Golden Nugget 5 stars! But if you stay in the new tower, Rush Tower, it is deserving.  I have never stayed in any of the other towers but the Rush Tower is clean, comfortable and easy to access.  We travel to Vegas often and stayed last time at the four seasons for an entire week.  Coming back for a shorter trip we decided the nugget was the best option.  The gambling is reasonably priced, the cocktail waitresses come around often, and you never have to wait for an elevator.  

The only negative and it was a huge negative was the Rush Tower Valet.  We came in late Saturday night and they tried telling us valet was full.  My husband did not take that as an answer and they eventually found a spot for us.  The customer service and timeliness of valet was disappointing but didn't take away from our overall experience.

Stayed here three times - always in the Rush Tower - which is a newer built part of the hotel - which I heard is the best place to stay.  Rooms are great and we always has  a view. The rooms appear to be clean - but founds some debris under the couch as well as a light cheap perfume odor from the previous guest on one occasion.  This time around - the room was spotless. The bed is super comfy with high end sheets and bedding.  For the price - this place can not be beat.  The hotel offers several pretty good dining options - we always had a good meal.  Good table games and slots.  Two pools - the big shark tank - which was OVER RUN by TONS of kids. There was no place to sit or put stuff down.  They do have a small adult pool - but get this - you have to have a reservation for chaise lounge or cabana to use it before 5pm everyday - which is not cool.  The staff was amazing - always friendly, helpful and nice. If you want to enjoy a nice pool - this is not the place.  Other than that - I love this hotel and look forward to returning.

Being a local I don't stay at hotel casinos often. However when work calls, it's a nice way to experience living in a hotel & see what it has to offer. The Golden Nugget is located in the heart of Fremont St. in 'Old Vegas' as some call it. This place is great because it's near everything you need and want especially when it comes to weekend festivities.
The hotel casino area is ok. It feels crowded at times simply because the table areas are close to one another. Their slot machines are a mixture of new & old. However you won't find or hear the coins falling from the machines. I did notice that table games, namely craps, increase their table minimum, not by the time of day, but by the amount of players joining the game. They do offer the 'make em all' bet on craps which some casinos have done away with. 
The hotel does offer a gym that is included in the resort fee, which is something I believe all casinos are now doing. The gym is located on the Spa level in the Spa tower. The gym is located in the spa separated by cardio equipment & a weight room. The gym has free weights up to 60lbs, medicine balls, a smith machine, 2 benches & a dozen machines. It's pretty cramped in there w\/ just about 4-5 people in there. No air circulating so you're gonna work up a sweat.
The hotel has plenty of restaurants to choose from along w\/ a couple Starbucks. It also has a club to enjoy music.
The rooms are broken up into 3 towers. I was placed in the Carson tower. The room I would compare to a Motel 6 type of look & feel. Everything is outdated. Depending where your room is facing it's going to be hot in there even when the air conditioning is at 60. The bed though is comfy. No refrigerator, but if you want one it's $30 a night! They do offer the traditional shampoo, conditioner & lotion. Also apart of your resort fee you get 2 bottles of water a day, free internet for 2 users, gym access & a couple other perks. 
If you're here just to have fun, it doesn't matter what your hotel room looks like. Come have fun! But if you're looking for plush items & more amenities the Golden Nugget isn't for you.

This was my 1st time ever staying downtown and boy has my opinion changed! The nugget is MUCH nicer than I ever remembered! The Charthouse restaurant inside had a lovely lunch menu with a floor to ceiling aquarium. The pool area has been completely redone with a slide, shark tanks and outdoor black jack tables. I stayed in the Rush tower with newer rooms that were beautifully done... Leather sectional and very chic modern decor. I'm going back in June and staying here again... Can't beat the price!!

Bad service, 

noisy room, 

ridiculous items for charge

Really terrible experience here

I've stayed here several times over the years, but this is the first time I've left unhappy.  We payed triple the going rate for a 'Gold Tower Suite', the room was less than desirable.  It had one tiny window that barely let ANY light in, it had a nice coffee maker sitting by the TV but NO outlet within 15 feet of it, and it had a rainforest shower built into a spa tub.  You had to be a gymnast just to get in the damn thing, ridiculous.  The pool area has 200 people fighting for 50 chairs.  The Golden Nugget LV is not ready for prime time.

My sister and I did a quick weekend Vegas trip and decided to stay here because we like downtown and got a good rate. Parking was very crazy as is to be expected on a Friday night. The valet was full, but a very helpful bellman helped me to maneuver around all the cars after taking care of our luggage.
