We stayed in an upgraded room in the Gold Tower, and it was plenty big for two people. The amenities are decent, and I loved the huge, soft bed. My sister has stayed at the Golden Nugget before, so she knew to bring some cups for the Keurig machine. That helped us avoid wasting time and money at Starbucks. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants since there are plenty of better choices within easy walking distance. 

The pool area is a big draw, and it's pretty chaotic. Luckily, there's another pool on the second level that is smaller and a little more serene. You do have to pay an entry fee, but you get assigned your own giant chaise lounge. Plus, no kids running and screaming around the pool! 

The service at the Golden Nugget was exceptionally good. You can tell they really train their staff well. Every employee greeted us when we walked down the halls, and they would always hold the elevator for us. I would happily return on my next Vegas trip.

Got an offer over the mailing list for rooms for $80 a night.. not bad..  The hotel seems to be newly renovated: don't know when but i like it!  and the addition of the new Rush Tower; newer and more luxury?  I wouldn't know, i was cheap and stayed in the old side.  The rooms were spacious, high pressure showers with piping hot water a definite plus!  Black out curtains a must in Vegas.  What i appreciated the most was the bathroom sink was about 6 inches higher than normal height, so i didnt have to bend over to wash my hands or brush my teath..  I'm always complaining that sinks are too low (even at home), hurts my back!  and im not that tall 5'9" 
The only place I know of to play MINI Pai Gow, like regular Pai Gow but 6 cards; 1 on top and 5 on the bottom.. the kicker.... NO COMMISSION on your wins!  and your Joker played on the top beats the Houses Ace. (but not vice versa).

Pros:  The pool with cool fish tank during the summer time, Hot tub open from 11pm - 2 am.  Alarm clock has an i pod docking station to charge and play your own music.  good to see  them keeping up with the times.

Cons:  The shower curtain seems a bit short and some water got on to the bathroom floor but nothing that an extra towel thrown on the floor couldn't fix.

Tips:
1.  See the worlds largest gold nugget "The hand of faith"on display next to Vic and Anthony's Steak house.  61 pound gold nugget found 6 inches under the surface!!  Lets see... 61 pounds, $1100 per oz, 16 oz in a pound...... Man, I'm going to start kicking rocks around!
Pics of the monstrosity:
http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/BIBWGO_r_1znnlmLbp4Nxg?select=MXg4d9p936Npiq6SsSGmOg
http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/BIBWGO_r_1znnlmLbp4Nxg?select=qWL0ekfJ8Cna9Wrv22vNkQ

2.  Bring a few clothes pins to clip the black out curtains together where they meet in the middle to keep the sun out when you are trying to sleep in after a late night of staying out!

Yah it's nice and all, but forget any type of early check in. I feel like I'm being black balled   Treasure island gives you early check in without charge. any who rooms are big pool is small but awesome. Love downtown

We decided to go to Vegas to celebrate some milestone birthdays.  We chose the Golden Nugget because the reviews were fairly good and the price was great.  The hotel has a great location in Downtown Las Vegas (about 5 miles from the glitzy part of the strip) and attaches to Freemont Street so the nightlife and people watching were awesome which is the one and only redeeming quality.
The hotel charges you a $28\/day resort fee which the front desk person told us covered parking, wifi, and two bottled waters every day in our room.  As we were walking to the elevators to our room after checking in, a large patron of he hotel passed us on the left, projectile vomiting down the main hall.  It was at that point, we decided to skip the buffets.  However, we understand that a crazy patron is beyond the control of the hotel.  We arrived in our room on a nonsmoking floor to find that the floor reeked of cigarettes.  The room appeared clean but there was a musty, smoked out smell.  Some of the outlets in our room didn't work but we decided we could make due with minor inconvenience with the ones that did.  The air conditioners in the room worked, but in order to reach the desired temperature, 70 degrees, it ran all the time.  This would not have been an issue if the unit didn't sound like a foghorn.  I wasn't going to say that the beds were uncomfortable, because I thought that it may be subjective, but when the couple that we were traveling with also complained that they felt that someone was sneaking into their room and kicking the crap out of them while they slept, I feel that it is fair to say that the beds aren't comfortable.  The television reception was sketchy at best so lucky for us, we spend $28\/day for painfully slow wifi.  We visited the casino but due to the poor ventilation and massive amount of second hand smoke, we weren't able to stay long before our eyes started to burn and our throats started to hurt.  I can say with a certainty that if you fall asleep in the uncomfortable beds, listening to the deafening foghorn air conditioning, it is either from exhaustion or lack of oxygen after being in the casino.
The final straw came on the second day, when after a long day of sightseeing, we arrived at the hotel only to find that there were no longer any parking spaces at the casino due to the casino giving people who weren't staying at the hotel.  We complained to the front desk but apparently, the company's motto is "At the Golden Nugget, we don't give a crap."  Upon hearing that we couldn't find parking space without a 5 mile walk through the scorching desert, he explained that the $28\/day resort fee didn't actually ensure that we would be able to park at the hotel, but if we were unhappy with that, we could pay to park at another hotel and he would refund that money.  When I explained to him that a long trek through the desert to get back to our hotel was not an acceptable compromise, and that I wanted a refund of that day's resort fee, he refused and when I asked for his boss, he informed me that he had no boss (apparently he owns the hotel).  At that point, we decided that every dollar that we brought to lose in Vegas would be spend elsewhere whether that was for food or gambling.  In the end, it cost the casino far more than the refund that I was asking for.
There are far better ways to spend $300 in Vegas.  I wouldn't stay in this hotel again unless someone was holding my children hostage and they would only release them if I stayed at the Golden Nugget.

THIS IS MY SECOND HOME!!!!!!!!

We come to vegas once a month, sometimes more, and this is the ONLY place we stay, unless we get an offer to stay at one of the MGM properties for free. 

The newest tower they have, the RUSH Tower, is SOOOOOO NICE! FIVE STAR HOTEL QUALITY FOR SURE!

We have stayed in there other rooms and not been nearly as happy so we try very hard to avoid the other towers. This hotel is old so its understandable that their older towers have older rooms with outdated decor but because we were lucky enough to discover the Rush Tower we will keep coming bak again and again!!!

The pool is the best in downtown! They have a water slide that goes through their shark tank!!! The only downfall....there are A LOT of kids!

Bottom line, overall I love this place! I can't wait to go back!

I stayed at the Golden Nugget in September. I stayed on Friday and Saturday nights for about $59 per night (for a 4-star hotel). The price for hotels (like Treasure Island, MGM, New York New York, etc) on the strip were going for around $150-200 per night. Anyways, I heard about the great pool at the Golden Nugget and decided to give it a try.

The hotel seemed to be completely renovated. The room was completely renovated and better than I would have expected at any hotel in the old downtown. The room was probably as good as the standard rooms in Treasure Island, MGM, and New York New York (The last times I stayed at TI or MGM were about 3-5 years ago). 

The Golden Nugget swimming pool was awesome! It was featured on the Travel Channel show, "Extreme Pools" around the world! The aquarium was right in the middle of the pool and was filled with about 12 sharks and a bunch of different kinds fish. It was really cool being able to watch sharks swim right by my face! Within a couple of inches! The slide was pretty cool too! It twists and turns a few times before you shoot through the middle of the shark tank\/aquarium! I had to ride it a few times. The pool was not crowded when I went.

The Golden Nugget buffet was very good for the price. It was only $21 and they had pretty much everything. It was not as big as the Wynn or Bellagio buffets, but it is much less expensive. I had crab, fish, chicken, turkey, Chinese food, Indian food, pizza, desserts, and much more.

If you want to stay downtown, then I recommend the Golden Nugget. If you want to hang out on the strip, then you might want to stay...on the strip. The drive to the strip is only about 10 minutes or so.

Took my wife and parents here in Early May and it was awful this time. I was shocked.  Smelly crab legs, and overall quality had gone downhill. I'd rather pay 10-20 more on a meal and leave happy and satisfied than save a little cash. Too bad as I really liked this place the year before.

First time staying here... I must say it was a pleasant experience.  I'm giving 5 star for great customer service -  after checking out I realized I had forgotten my ring and to my surprised, housekeeping had turned it in.  Any hotel with honest employees deserves 5 stars! Thank you golden nugget; we will definitely be back!
Couldn't even park at the hotel parking lot because gentleman man directing traffic said we could only park there if we were booking a room what a bummer
Much better trip! Stayed in the new Rush tower which was very nice and had it's own Valet and front desk with competent staff. Restaurants and casino are great!

It started as a "Pool Day" and ended up being a nice little family "Staycation".

The Golden Nugget had a $39\/night special on hotel rooms.  We decided to upgrade to the brand new (opened November 2009) Rush Tower for a total of $69 on a Tuesday.  The room was pretty and clean; King Size bed, L-shaped sectional with ottoman, nice tv, raining shower head.

Our day started at the 3-story pool.  OK. So it's not really three stories.  The 2nd story is lounge chairs you can rent for $20 and awesome cabanas for who knows how much. The 3rd floor has an adult (16 and up ... haha) pool with a bar and lounge chairs. Our 2-year old liked the very shallow area with the lounge chairs...unfortunately she thought they were slides and kept trying to climb them.  The pool is small, but there's an awesome shark tank feature dead center and  slide that slides through the shark tank.  I didn't get to ride it because I don't think they would have let my little girl on and the line was pretty long.  

There's a snack bar and cocktail service but I don't think I would recommend it because it took FOR-EV-ER for us to get our food (2 chicken Caesar salads [soggy and they skimp on the chicken...maybe found the equivalent of 1\/2 of one breast and at least 40 croutons], a hot dog and chicken fingers).  We retired to our cute room shortly thereafter.

Our one-day staycation included dinner at Chart House in the Rush Tower and the Fremont Street Experience (both of which I will review separately)

Bottom Line: 
If you want to do Vegas on a budget, try staying at the Golden Nugget downtown.  The hotel rooms are clean, the pool is decent and the strip is a short cab ride away...you may not even have to leave Fremont Street.

My girlfriend and I and 2 other couples stayed there 4th of july weekend.  This place rocks.  The pool area is straight out party time.  We wanted to get the sofa section but it said "one drink minimum".  My buddy and I looked at each other and laughed.   We each had about 8 drinks each while chillen by the pool all day.
Good prices: a bucket 5 of 16 oz bud lites $20.00, killer chicken nachos by the pool $10.00.  one bad thing there is a lotta kids running around the pool.  Just don't walk around dwntown vegas at night.  It's whitetrash-ville lol

The look of the casino was really nice and about the same as every other casino that I entered. PRO- the buffet was decent and cheap ($12). CON- for your 'free drinks while gambling' they don't let you do sugar-free (or regular) redbull (I don't drink pop or alcohol [very often] so for me that was a bummer!)

For the price, this hotel is nice.  Pillows did kind of suck.  I had to bundle 3 together to get 1 good pillow.

Elevators are fast but hot.

You can always stay here and drive to the strip and park at one of the casino's parking lot.

Free access to the parking lot for guests.  $13 for wi fi is a bit crappy.

Love all the renovations they did. Best hotel in downtown. Rooms are a little on the old side and very simple, no luxury here.

They have two pools that are amazing. Beautiful shark tank right inside the downstairs pool. Tons of pool lounge chairs and fresh beach towels available. There's one hidden away upstairs that stays open until 2 or 3 am, which is later than most other pools at other hotels. 

Food - sushi at the smaller sushi restaurant was not good...something you could get premade at 7-11. Lobster Bisque at the Grotto gets a 5 star rating. Vic & Anthony's pretty good depending on what you order.

This is for the ballers on a budget who don't mind staying off the strip.

Got a room here tonight and it is beautiful. It is a little more expensive than the other downtown hotels. If you're just a local looking for a place to crash, it might not be the best choice, but if you're looking for a quality place, do it.
Found the biggest golden nugget. On the first floor take a right from the reception check in and down the hall and it'll be on the left on display.

This was my first time coming to vegas, and several people recommended the Golden Nugget. Compared to the other hotel and casinos on Freemont Street I'd say the GN is superior. The hotel is gigantic with several restaurants to choose from, and endless tables and slot machines. The pool area is pretty nice, but don't get your hopes up for the slide. It was definitely fun, but you can't see the shark tank as well as they advertise. The rooms were okay, pretty standard except there was no hair dryer in our room. Throughout our stay almost every staff member we came in contact with was unfriendly... not a deal breaker but also worth noting. On our second day we had items stolen from our room, and so did our next door neighbors. The hotel security was no help and I feel they could\/should have done more than what they did, which was absolutely nothing. Beware if you stay here.

Stayed at the Golden Nugget in Las Vegas for 4 nights in the Gold Tower. For convenience I would recommend the Gold Tower. Not too far from Fremont Street and just a few steps from the Casino floor. Stayed in a room on the 11th floor facing the pool with 2 double-size beds. Wished the beds were Queen size but worked out great. Didn't have any issues with noise.

Ended up having a Casino Host for my stay. VIP Check-in and the VIP Line Pass were terrific! The Casino Host was able to comp several entertainment and general costs. Made me feel really welcome.

I had dinner at the Chart House and lunch at the Claim Jumper. See my comments on these 2 restaurants in my other reviews.

The room was very nice and modern in style. The bathroom was small, but during the refurbish I am sure they didn't have the option to expand it. So it is probably the same size when the Hotel was built but now looks really great.

The casino in the Golden Nugget is the best casino in Downtown Las Vegas \/ Fremont Street. Great slot games, casino is clean and well kept, and a fun atmosphere.

I can't wait until my next trip back!

From spiral staircase
Watch sun-bathers down below
The Golden Nugget
_____

I stayed in the Tower Suite--a 1500 sq foot colossus of a hotel room--for $301.  Unfortunately for me I was in that room a total of 6.5 hours, but the fault for that is all my own.

They gave me a matchplay coupon and $60 for $50 in the poker room, plus two free drink coupons, all of which I used gladly.  I'm really impressed with the downtown area for cleaning up its act.  My first impression years ago was that it was really run-down and past its time, but now it is clean and semi-refined, and better than a handful of on-strip locations.

I still think it's essential though, if you stay downtown, to have a car.  Sometimes you just gotta get outta there.

We stayed at the Rush Tower Jr Corner Suite this past Sunday and it was sexy and pretty! Loved the room soooooo much!! 

The shark tank was fun! The pool was a but cloudy and kinda grossed me out because of that but there were tons of kids and adults in it all day so it makes sense i guess. But then again there was also tons of ppl in the Mandalay Bay pools but it was crystal clear. Thats the only reason I didnt give five stars. The service was great!

Old school casino fun with cheap tables along the Fremont Strip. But smoky, smoky, smoky.

Bottom line: Classic Vegas. But I think I lost a year or two of my life breathing in all that second hand smoke. 2 stars for shortening my life.

First of all, Downtown Las Vegas is NOT dead. It is under "cultural reconstruction." Golden Nugget is a Las Vegas gem. I know my papa hung down here in his day and I feel a bit nostalgic hanging in the same spots. The fixtures I am sure have changed a bit, but they still feel a bit old school, and the rooms have that old Vegas feel as well. The suites are awesome. Actually, I have never seen the regular rooms, so maybe the entire hotel is suites. I like the poker crowd here as well...they all seem to be better players than on the strip. I've seen a few pros at the big table, and a few big shot athletes too! Unfortunately, they were playing at the big boys table and I was at the kiddie's. The location is great for downtown bars, and I suggest getting a room on First Friday's. You can party all night then crash at a hotel room as opposed to crashing on the freeway at four am. Just a safety suggestion. The Golden Nugget is a classic visit downtown and worth checking out if you are in the area.

This hotel has no customer service. None.  On check in - which was a tremendously (unnecessarily) long process on a Wednesday at noon - we asked the representative about who we should talk to regarding which restaurants in the hotel accommodated food allergies. Her answer: no such person existed and we'd have to ask each restaurant individually. This kind of set the tone for our hotel experience; it's really all up to you and they're not going to help. 

On our first night there, in the middle of the night, our floor (and a handful of others) were evacuated due to a fire. There was no one helping the evacuees, no one providing information, no one directing us where to sit. In fact, no one seemed to know anything at all. It took hours before we were relocated to another room, and even then it was only due to our persistence. 

There are no accessible outlets near the beds in order to plug phones in, even in the newly remodeled tower. Do they understand how people live? Do they care? Due to our phones being on the other side of the room, we missed our alarm on the final day, and requested a slightly later check out. We were told no. Never had that happen before. Thanks. 

In addition, the much-lauded pool was closed anytime we could've used it, as it's apparently really poorly architected and acts as a funnel for wind, even though it's completely enclosed on all sides. Nice. I appreciate that my "resort fee" (scam) goes to such good use as paying lifeguards to keep things from blowing away. 

I'll never come back here. I wouldn't recommend others stay here either. Unless you appreciate an "on your own" mentality toward guests.

It's a 4 star hotel for a buck.  Rooms are huge and very clean. And the rates they offer are usually outstanding. The shark tank is overrated so don't care about that but the Pokerroom is one of the nicest in Las Vegas with ok tournaments. As always the smoke makes me sick like in all other Las Vegas casinos. Come it's 2013 why is it not banned like in the rest of the Western world?

I guess it depends on what your style is...Cancun all inclusive versus Maui pool side. If you like less expensive and can deal with the poor ventilation and average customer service this place is decent. The pool up top was nice and is worth the $20. RESERVE EARLY BECAUSE IT WILL SELL OUT AND YOU WILL BE PISSED THAT YOU didn't. The strip is just so much cleaner and the restaurants are so much better and by the time you take a cab over there you might as well as paid the extra $ to stay at Caesars. I've stayed at Caesars, Palazzo, Venetian and the Wynn. My recommendation is to stay at one of those! Enjoy your vacation.

Golden Nugget was phenomenal as it was my first time in Las Vegas - I chose the hotel as I'm a Landry's LSC member and wanted to experience their other restaurants not available in my city. I was not disappointed and was extremely pleased with the service and food. 
Being a 'non gambler'; it was a great place to stay and will visit again as their customer service and great attitude was appreciated.
Just one note - Do NOT accept the link for the 'transportation to and from airport' as the Airline Shuttle company has a 'deal' with the hotels and I experienced the worst customer service from them and the hotel will not help you.  Get anyone else other than Airline Shuttle.
Love this place. We have been looking for awesome and "different" local places in Vegas. This is definitely a good place for Sunday Funday!

The golden nugget is just ok, They have many things they need to work on.  First issue is the check in lines take forever. We arrived early and checked in, but our room wasn't ready. So we hung out waiting for them to call to let us know the room was ready. We get the call and ended up waiting in the check in line just to get our key. Second issue, the Internet is just awful and so slow. I ended up paying the extra 10 for the "faster" internet and that was slow as well. The tv channels they offer you are very limited as well. Now I don't mind paying a resort fee, I understand almost anywhere you stay in Vegas they are going to hit you with that fee, but I don't like paying when the cable and net are so bad. 
  The room we stayed in was pretty dusty, and the shower door had water stains on it. When I say in a hotel I would like it to be cleaner than my home and it wasn't. 
 Check out also takes forever here! Every single hotel offers express check out! Why not the nugget?  They seem like they like money wouldn't it save them in labor costs to offer something like that? 
  The golden nugget seems like they try to squeeze every nickel and dime they can out of you.  No wonder their machines are so tight! Don't go here in hopes of winning, head across to the Fremont for that.

We had a king room in the Gold Tower and we were well pleased. Comfortable bed, clean, very nice. I like not having to pay a "resort fee". Yes, the wifi is an extra charge, but if you don't use it, you don't have to pay for it. At other establishments, the resort fee covers things like the wifi and fitness rooms. The pool is well described in other reviews, but it gets my vote for interesting. The meals we had in the hotel were good and reasonably priced. A medical urgency took up most of our time there, so I cannot speak to other amenities at the hotel. I hope to come back to enjoy more of The Golden Nugget and Las Vegas (this was my first time. )

If you are staying downtown Vegas this is one of the best places on Fremont street. Very nice hotel and has everything you want in one hotel. The rooms are a little out dated in the tower we stayed in. The other tower is new so stay there. But the rest of the hotel from lobby to casino is very nice! The tables definitely go up as it gets crowded. And it gets very crowded cause it is the nicest place. The pool area is cool cause they have tables outside. Even a craps table. It was mini but still a lot of fun. They have a great amount of restaurants with a great mix of food. From Vic and Anthony's for steaks to claim jumpers for a burger or comfort food. Then they have Tex Mex at Cadillac bar. It smells awesome every time we walked by but we never tried it cause we have Tex
Mex in Houston. Overall if you want to stay downtown Vegas this is the place to stay!

This hotel should have been much nicer for the exorbitant price we paid. We booked a king room and received a room with 2 double beds. Thus I was not able to sleep with my husband. I had to complain 3 times to find anyone who cared enough to switch our room the next day. There wasn't even in room coffee for the $200+ per night. The water slide was out of order. I would not go back.

I've been coming here for business for over 15 years. Used to like it and think it was pretty decent for old downtown. Stayed in Rush Tower a couple times even though very expensive and was put on Fremont Street once which was horrible and crazy loud. 

I'm back again for another week of business and this time there is a huge crazy tent that has music thumping like mad!! Makes Fremont Street seem quiet!!! WHAT THE HELL?  My Dad called downstairs (we work together) and staff is practically like what's your problem it's a Friday night in Vegas. 

Besides the out control noise. The room has huge crack\/whole in tile floor and there is rust all over the bathtub. Gross. I know they tried to upgrade rooms but not so great. Also it smells like cigarettes UGH. Only saving grace is bed is comfortable outside of smelling like smoke :(

I'm pretty sure after 17 years it looks like this will be last time we will stay here. I'd rather get an Airbnb away from all this nonsense!!

This hotel could care less about you and they don't hide that fact either. They basically gave me ear plugs.

We are locals that booked a night so our granddaughter could enjoy the pool. There was a distinct smell of sulphur that was a turn off, and the clarity in the pool was worse than in the shark tank. On the up side, service was great in hotel, restaurants and poolside. Rooms were great and clean. There was no noise from outside at all. We would stay there again.

Stayed mid week in Gold Tower. The room had been beautifully remodeled with upgraded finishes.  No view really out window but price was right.  Only surprise was resort fee of $20 per night which was disclosed when we checked in.  They were not really clear about what was included in resort fee except the $4 water in room; we could have 2 bottles per day.  Found out on our own that gym (located in spa, Spa Tower) was included as well.  Loved the large fish\/shark tank at the pool area and at Chart House.  Overall very pleased with restaurants and amenities at the Golden Nugget, by far the nicest and safest part of the Fremont Street area.

Honestly when my sister said "I made reservations at the Golden Nugget"! I automatically imagined myself in a scene from the movie Casino...smoking a cigarette in a dimly lit room! Thank goodness it was nothing like that.....

My parents wanted to celebrate their 60th wedding anniversary at Vegas with their kids and grandchildren and great grandchildren! It was about 20 of us that made it! We all checked in at different times and it all went smoothly! All but one: My parents room: my mom wanted a handicap access room! So the parents had to wait for a couple of hours which made my mother upset, so they let her have a late check out time on the day they were leaving! Did this make my mama happy? No, but that's a whole other story!!! 

We got our key cards and went up to our room, we got a bit confused but the employees helped us right away and lead us to the correct tower! There was no stench of closed up cigarette smoke in the elevator! Finally we get to our room!

I think these rooms were just recently remodeled because the bathroom was very modern looking, dark furniture,  and flat screen TVs, huge beds with fluffy pillows! Oh those pillows! All of the rooms we got were very nice and spacious! 

The minus one star is for the 10 dollar Keurig coffee they have that you have to purchase where other hotels is complimentary and the 4 dollar price tag on a small water bottle! Crazy!

Internet fee is included in the resort fee which is $22 a day! It's in the cost of the room, not an additional fee so basically it's already paid for! You also need your key card for parking, gym and the pool that closes at 9 pm and opens at 9am! Btw, the pool has a slide that goes right through a shark tank! Aaahhh! Plenty of eateries! Two, yes two Starbucks are located in here! 

Parking is easily accessible. They have the Valet option or the self parking! We did both and found that just walking to our car was way faster than waiting around for our car! 

Four stars!!! We all had a great time!!

As a hotel, this was a great experience. I was nervous about not being on The Strip but the price was right. My room was $60 compared to $250 at hotels like The Mirage.

Likes:
-My room was huge. King-size bed with enough room to easily fit two more in the room. It was also very clean and looked updated.
-The pool. This was one of the main reasons I picked this hotel. 

Dislikes:
-$12.99 for 24 hours of wi-fi is ridiculous! 
-There's a Keurig in the room that you're charged $6 to use. Skip it and use the Starbucks downstairs.
-Security seems weak. Anyone can go upstairs to where the hotel rooms are.

Okay so I really thought I would enjoy this hotel by the reviews and perks but I absolutely don't! The employees are very rude even the managers. Mind you I did pay close to 100 a night and it's a Monday, I got stuck in a horrible room with the ice Machine directly out side my door then I look out the window to see a wall almost blocking the window, so I called to ask for a room change it seemed to be a big deal she ended up changing and she was suppose to cancel the bell man from bringing our bags she didn't we ending up passing him in the hallway he had no idea we were switch and didn't even know where to bring our bags, he literately had us wait with him for pushing 15 mins in a hallway! Mind you we did just drive 4 hours so yeah we would like to get settled in and enjoy our day but they been giving us the run around for nearly 1 hour, we are finally in another crappy room where the Ac keeps turning on and off and still no bags. I won't ever visit this hotel again. I honestly only give them 1 star because the pool is pretty AWESOME.

Okay I have to write this review on Golden Nugget cause I was upset on my last night there. I've been staying at Golden Nugget LV for the last 4 trips to LV.. I always stay in the Gold key luxury rooms on the 16th and 17th floors I like the place.. Rooms are nice and the Café is good.. I stayed 3 night this last trip and on the last night (Thurs) Golden Nugget decides to book an outdoor party for the new D's hotel for the next 3 nights (thurs fri and Sat nights) at there upstairs pool. Music was blasting extremely loud after 12am on Friday morning that I don't think anyone in the hotel could sleep through.. I called twice to the manager of the hotel from my room to file a complaint. Even after the music was turned down you could still hear the party going on till 2am.. I dropped the rating on my review 2 stars cause what hotel books an outdoor party with loud music and lets it go to 2am.. Come on GN you guys need to think before you book parties..
has anyone else slipped in the room bathroom???
Pretty good Hotel, but be aware, The Carson Tower (lowest priced) DOES NOT HAVE EITHER MICROWAVE OR FRIDGE. (Fridge for an extra 20 bucks per night!)

We did four days in a Great Room at the Mandalay Bay before moving downtown to an upgraded Rush Tower room and were expecting it to be a big letdown and it was just fine. Nowhere near as quiet as the SouthEnd but we wanted to try Downtown and the Fremont Street Xxperience and let me tell you that you will definitely HEAR the Fremont St. Experience starting at about 7pm LOUDLY in your room yet, until 10 and then gets quieter. Internet is NOT included and they would have actually charged us $13 A PIECE for 24 hours for EACH of our laptops, it is not a room rate; we are cheap enuf to just fire up one. What a racket. On the other hand NO $25 resort fee PLUS TAX like at the Mandalay Bay, only a $5 resort fee. We figure we saved at least $100 a night over the Mandalay Bay pricey weekend rate.

The Room was very nice, housekeeping was less obtrusive than the Mandalay Bay who think they run that property. Much smaller than the Mandalay Bay complex but everything is there. We never smelled a hint of smoke in the Rush Tower and your walk anywhere, including outside to get to the front desk or a Walgreens, is MUCH shorter than the Mandalay Bay. Can't comment on the casino, we put our usual $2 into a slot machine and quit ahead. Food was ok, the coffee shop which we have enjoyed on previous trips, was closed so had to eat breakfast in the Grotto which was not a plus. GET their coupon book at checkin for 2 for one deals on meals, drinks, etc.
Fremont Street is fun but will get old fast, there are some interesting sights around the downtown and diverse less pricey food than The Strip, like the Kabob Corner (not on a corner). The Golden Nugget breakfast buffet particularly on a 2 for 1 deal is just fine, and if you get there just around 10:30 you'll get some lunch too. Parking is free and very easy. Don't miss the 3 level slide through the shark tank.

I would say that the regular Golden Nugget rooms are just fine particularly if you are smokers, they have all been upgraded. If you detest cigarette smoke as much as we do, you want the Rush Tower.

I normally stay at the Golden Nugget when I go to Vegas.  My family always stays there from Hawaii so I stay there as well.  I usually get the rooms that require a key to get to the floor.  You pay a premium but most of the fees are inclusive to your room rate.  Unfortunately, the last two times I stayed there my reservations were screwed up.  Last time, I requested the Gold Tower and they said I booked the Rush Tower.  This time it was the opposite.  Last time, they were able to accommodate my request. This time, they could not and the gentlemen checking me in was arguing that I had always chosen the Gold Tower.  The room had some problems.  When you showered water kept running out of the faucet, which means they need to fix the plumbing.  The sliding shelf in front of the TV kept sliding out. I called maintenance to show them it was a safety issue, the previous person had a piece of paper wedged in there to prevent it from slipping out.  They no longer left waters out by the elevator, they had pretzels instead. It seems that they are losing money and have focused on cutting costs. You are paying premium money for an average room.  They've lost their attention to detail.  They are no longer special and cannot command a premium price until they get back to their attention to detail.  I hope management wakes up or is replaced.

My review is on the spa and more specifically the massage treatment. The company I work for has a bi-annual trip and we always stay at the Golden Nugget. Stephanie\/Anie is hands down the best massage I have ever had. She has signature moves that precisely worked my problem area's....

I am going back to Vegas in August and staying on the strip but will go out of my way to make an appointment at the GN Spa with a massage from "Anie"!
